30 minutes 6 Easy Appetizers May 18, 2020 796- Tuna Quiche https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/CWA-Quiche-13.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the crust:?&#?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) all-purpose white flour?&#?&#125 grams (4.4 oz) butter?&#?&#1 egg?&#?&#1 teaspoon garlic powder?&#?&#1 pinch of salt?&#?&# ?&#?&#For the filling:?&#?&#120 grams (4.2 oz) canned tuna, drained?&#?&#2 medium zucchinis, cut into fine slices?&#?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#?&#1 medium onion, chopped?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#200 grams (4.2 oz) spinach?&#?&#80 grams (2.8 oz)mozzarella cheese, cut into slices?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#4 eggs?&#?&#200 millilitres (4.2 oz) heavy cream?&#?&#1 tablespoon milk Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the crust?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, add the flour, butter, and mix with hands until the mixture texture becomes crumbly and very well combined.?&#?&#2- Add the egg, garlic powder, salt, and continue mixing until a smooth dough ball is formed. ?&#?&#3- Cover the dough with a plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.?&#?&#4- Dust some flour on your working surface. And roll the dough out using a rolling pin to a medium thickness (1 cm).?&#?&#5- Place the dough in a round tart mould (20 cm x 3 cm) greased with some butter, or covered with parchment paper. Remove the excess of the dough from the mould edges using a knife.?&#?&#6- Prick the base of the dough all over with a fork and bake it in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 10 minutes. Set aside.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the filling?&#?&#7- In a large pan, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and heat over medium heat. Add the zucchini slices, grated garlic, salt, pepper, and cook for 5 minutes until they become slightly brown. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.?&#?&#8- In the same pan over medium heat, add 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes stirring from time to time using a wooden spoon until soft.?&#?&#9- Stir in the spinach, salt, pepper, and continue cooking for 2 minutes until soft and tender. Place the spinach and onion mixture in a bowl and allow to cool.?&#?&#10- Fill the crust base with spinach mixture, roasted zucchini, tuna, and mozzarella cheese slices.?&#?&#11- Whisk the eggs, heavy cream, and milk in a medium bowl until smooth. Season with salt, pepper, Italian spices mix, and pour the mixture over the filling. ?&#?&#12- Place the tuna quiche in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) and bake for 35 minutes, or until golden brown on top. Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/796-tuna-quiche/ 35 minutes
30 minutes 500 grams Easy Appetizers Apr 29, 2020 784- Labneh Cheese https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CWA-Labneh-11.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (8.8 oz.) milk powder?&#?&#125 grams (1/2 cup) unsweetened firm plain yogurt?&#?&#1 litre (4 cups) water?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon salt Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pan, mix the powdered milk and water with a whisk until smooth. Then add the salt.?&#?&#2- Place the pan over medium heat and stir using a wooden spoon from time to time for 10 minutes until the milk is warm.?&#?&#3- Remove the pan from the heat. Add the unsweetened plain yogurt to the milk and mix with a wooden spoon until well combined.?&#?&#4- Cover the pan with a plastic wrap and a clean kitchen towel, then place it in a warm area. Set aside and leave it to rest overnight until the mixture becomes a little bit thick.?&#?&#5- Place the pan once again over low heat, and heat the milk mixture for 1 minute. When the milk will be slightly curdled, remove it frome heat and allow it to cool for 5 minutes without touching it.?&#?&#6- Line a large sieve with a fine cheesecloth and place it over a large bowl to catch the excess water from the milk mixture.?&#?&#7- Gently pour the solidified milk mixture into the cheesecloth and let drain for 8 hours in the fridge to have a creamy texture.?&#?&#8- Place the Labneh cheese in a plate, garnish with olive oil, olives, dried thyme (or any aromatic herbs of your choice) just before serving.?&#?&#9- Put the Labneh cheese in a tight-fitting glass container and store for up to 5 days.?&#?&# ?&#?&#Tip:?&#?&#– Make mini balls from labneh cheese, place them in a tight-fitting glass container. Add garlic cloves, aromatic herbs of your choice, and cover with olive oil. This version can be stored in the fridge up to 10 days.?&#?&#– Use Labneh cheese for many other preparations like pizza,… https://www.cookingwithalia.com/784-labneh-cheese-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%84%d8%a8%d9%86%d8%a9/ 10 minutes
15 minutes 15 Easy Appetizers Apr 29, 2020 783- Falafel https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CWA-Falafel-06-2.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#450 grams (15.8 oz) drained chickpeas?&#?&#3 garlic cloves, grated?&#?&#1 small onion, coarsely chopped?&#?&#3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#?&#2 tablespoons tahini?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#2 tablespoons cornstarch?&#?&#1 teaspoon baking powder Directions :?&#?&#1- In a food processor, place the drained chickpeas, chopped onion, garlic cloves, parsley, olive oil, tahini, lemon juice, ground cumin, salt, pepper, and coarsely mix all the ingredients together until an homogeneous paste is obtained. Note: Make sure to scrape down the sides using a spatula from time to time to ensure an even mixture.?&#?&#2- Add the cornstarch, baking powder, and continue mixing until well combined. Make sure to not over mix the chickpeas mixture or you will get a puree.?&#?&#3- Place the chickpeas mixture in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.?&#?&#4- Start shaping the chickpeas mixture into medium falafel balls using the palms of your hands.?&#?&#5- Place the falafel on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper and brush them with olive oil.?&#?&#6- Bake the falafel in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes, or until they turn golden.?&#?&#7- Serve the falafel warm white yogurt sauce and salad. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/783-falafel-%d9%81%d9%84%d8%a7%d9%81%d9%84/ 30 minutes
20 minutes 12 small patties Easy Appetizers Apr 18, 2020 781- Veggie Chickpea Burgers https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/2020-04-ChickpeaPatties-09.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the burgers:?&#?&#400 grams (14 oz.) canned chickpeas?&#?&#1 medium carrot, peeled and grated?&#?&#1 zucchini, grated?&#?&#1 garlic clove, grated?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#?&#1 teaspoon coriander powder (optional)?&#?&#2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley?&#?&#1 tablespoon whole wheat flour?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Olive oil for cooking?&#?&# ?&#?&#For the yogurt sauce:?&#?&#125 grams (1/2 cup) unsweetened plain yogurt?&#?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice, freshly squeezed?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the chickpeas burgers?&#?&#1- Drain and rinse well the canned chickpeas. Make sure to keep the chickpea water for other recipes.?&#?&#2- Place the chickpeas in a food processor, add the grated garlic, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, coriander powder, and mix coarsely all the ingredients. ?&#?&#3- Using an absorbing cooking paper, squeeze the grated zucchini to remove the excess of water. ?&#?&#4- Put the chickpeas mixture in a large bowl. Add the carrot, zucchini, fresh parsely, the whole wheat flour, and mix using a spatula until the mixture is well combined.?&#?&#5- Divide the chickpea mixture into 12 equal portions and shape into small patties. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.?&#?&#6- In a large pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil, and cook the chickpeas patties for 3 minutes on each side.?&#?&#7- Remove the chickpeas burgers from the pan and place them on a piece of an absorbing cooking paper to remove the excess of oil. ?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the yogurt sauce?&#?&#8- In a small bowl, add the unsweetened plain yogurt, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, and mix well with a spatula until well combined.?&#?&#9- Serve the veggie chickpeas burgers warm with the yogurt sauce and a salad. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/781-veggie-chickpea-burgers/ 3 minutes

Easy Appetizers Feb 21, 2020 771- Vegetable Cigars https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/435-2020-02-CWA-VegSigars-015.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams (17.64 OZ) warka dough (Phyllo dough or spring roll wrappers)?&#?&#3 medium leeks, chopped?&#?&#3 medium carrots, peeled and grated?&#?&#3 medium zucchinis, grated?&#?&#100 grams (0.2 pound) black mushrooms, soaked in hot water then roughly chopped?&#?&#1/2 preserved lemon, finely chopped?&#?&#80 grams (0.2 pound) pitted green olives, chopped?&#?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley and cilantro?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#?&#100 grams (0.2 pound) grated cheese?&#?&#2 tablespoons all purpose flour?&#?&#3 tablespoons water?&#?&#50 grams (0.1 pound) melted butter Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the filling?&#?&#1- Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook for 3 minutes while stirring regularly with a spatula.?&#?&#2- While stirring the mixture, add one by one: black mushrooms, carrots, zucchini, green olives, lemon, parsley and cilantro, and all the spices. Cook for 5 minutes until the vegetables are done. ?&#?&#3- Turn off the heat, then add the cheese and mix. Let the filling cool down.?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 2: Shape the cigars?&#?&#4- Using scissors, remove the edges of the warka sheets.?&#?&#5- On top of one warka sheet, place about a tablespoon of the filling onto the edge closest to you, leaving about 0.5 cm (1/4-inch) border along the sides.?&#?&#6- Fold in the warka dough edge closest to you over the filling.?&#?&#7- Fold in the left and right sides of the warka towards the center.?&#?&#8- Roll up the edge tightly, as if you were rolling a carpet.?&#?&#9- In a bowl, mix together the flour and water then use the mixture to brush the tip of the warka and secure the cigar.?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 3: Cook the cigars?&#?&#10- Place the cigars in a baking pan covered with parchment paper, then brush them with melted butter.?&#?&#11- Bake the cigars in a preheated oven at 180°C/356 F for 30 minutes until they become deep golden brown. Serve right away. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/771-vegetable-cigars/ 10 minutes
1 hour 10 Medium Appetizers Dec 23, 2019 761- Royal Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/435-DSC03315.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Artichokes With Cream Cheese:?&#200 grams (7 oz) cream cheese?&#4 artichokes heart, boiled?&#1 teaspoon garlic powder?&#1 tablespoon chopped chives?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Rice With Vegetables:?&#245 grams (1 cup) plain yogurt?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#400 grams (2 cups) cooked rice?&#1 cup boiled green peas?&#1 cup boiled carrots, cut into small cubes?&#1/2 cup small cubes of red bell pepper?&#?&#Avocado With Shrimp:?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) peeled shrimp?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#2 avocados?&#1 lemon, for lemon juice and zest?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#A handful of chopped chives?&#?&#Fruit Salad In Pineapple Halves:?&#Pineapple?&#Different fruits to make a fruit salad?&#?&#Other:?&#Slices of smoked meat, turkey, etc.?&#Chive branches?&#Cherry tomatoes?&#Small mozarella balls?&#Lettuce?&#Cubes of cheese?&#Cooked crayfish or full prawns?&#Marinated anchovies Directions :?&#?&#Artichokes With Cream Cheese?&#1- In a bowl, place the cream cheese and work it with a spatula until it becomes creamy.?&#2- Add salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chives. Mix.?&#3- Pipe the cream cheese mixture in the center of the cooked artichoke hearts.?&#?&#Rice With Vegetables?&#1- To make the sauce, in a bowl, place the plain yogurt. Add the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Mix and adjust to taste.?&#2- In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, green peas, carrots, and red bell pepper. Mix with a spoon.?&#3- Add the sauce to the rice mixture and mix well.?&#?&#Avocado And Shrimp?&#1- Cut the avocados in half and remove the pits. Squeeze some fresh lemon on the avocado so it does not darken. Season with salt and pepper.?&#2- On medium heat, in a pan, heat some olive oil. Cook the shrimp. Season with salt and pepper. Add some lemon zest for more flavor.?&#3- Scoop the cooked shrimp in the center of each avocado half. Top with chopped chives.?&#?&#Fruit Salad In Pineapple Halves?&#1- Cut the pineapple in half and empty the center of each half.?&#2- Make fruits salad with different fruits (grapes, pomegranate, persimmon, pineapple, raspberries, etc.). Fill the pineapple halves with the fruit salad.?&#?&#Other?&#1- Roll smoked meat slices like a carpet and tie chive around in the center.?&#2- Make mini-skewers alternating cherry tomatoes and small mozzarella balls.?&#?&#Assembly?&#1- In a large plate, place all the lettuce leaves.?&#2- In the center, place a circle and fill it with the rice salad. Remove the circle.?&#3- On each side of the plate, place the pineapple halves filled with the fruit salad.?&#4- Place around the edges the artichoke hearts and avocado halves.?&#5- Decorate with the mozzarella skewers, smoked meat, cheese cubes, crayfish, anchovies, etc. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/761-royal-salad/
20 minutes 2 Buddha Bowls Easy Appetizers Oct 6, 2019 748- Chicken Buddha Bowl https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/435-2019-10-CWA-ChickenBowl-011.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Bowl Ingredients:?&#1/2 cup cooked rice?&#1 bundle of spinach, roughly chopped?&#1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced?&#1 chicken breast, roasted and sliced?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 small sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Chickpeas Ingredients:?&#240 grams (8.5 oz.) chickpeas can, drained?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon chili powder?&#3/4 teaspoon garlic powder?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Dressing Ingredients:?&#1 cup plain yogurt?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon chili powder?&#3/4 teaspoon garlic powder?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making The Dressing?&#1- Combine all the ingredients of the dressing in a bowl. Using a fork, mix well until all ingredients are well combined. Place in the fridge until ready to serve.?&#?&#Step 2: Making The Chickpeas?&#1- In a medium bowl, place the drained canned chickpeas and toss with the seasoning and olive oil.?&#2- Heat a large skillet over medium heat and sauté the chickpeas for 5 minutes while stirring frequently.?&#3- Once the chickpeas are browned and fragrant, remove from heat and set aside.?&#?&#Step 3: Making The Buddah Bowl?&#1- In a large skillet on medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add the red onion and sauté for about 2 minutes, until it becomes tender. Set aside.?&#2- In the same skillet, add the spinach. Cook on medium heat for 3 minutes until they are completely wilted.?&#3- Arrange the sweet potatoes in an oven pan covered with parchment paper. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil.?&#4- Bake the sweet potatoes for 30 minutes in a preheated oven to 180 C / 356 F then set aside.?&#5- In a large bowl (or take away box for an office lunch), first place the cooked rice. Top the rice with the chicken breast, spinach, onions, chickpeas, and sweet potatoes.?&#6- When ready to eat, add the sauce, mix, and enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/748-chicken-buddha-bowl/ 40 minutes
30 minutes 9 wraps Easy Appetizers May 10, 2019 718- Shrimp Lettuce Wraps https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-04-srimpWrap-010.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the filling:?&#?&#250 g (8.6 oz.) shrimp?&#?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#?&#Zest of 1/2 lemon?&#?&#50 grams (1.7 oz.) chinese vermicelli ?&#?&#1 tablespoon nuoc mam sauce Carrefour?&#?&#1 tablespoon fresh mint, chopped?&#?&#1 carotte?&#?&#1 cucumber?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&# ?&#?&#For the sauce:?&#?&#3 tablespoons sesame oil Carrefour?&#?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#?&#1 tablespoon sauce nuoc mam Carrefour?&#?&#1 tablespoon brown sugar?&#?&#1 garlic clove, minced?&#?&# ?&#?&#For preparing the wrap:?&#?&#Lettuce leaves?&#?&#Fresh mint leaves?&#?&#Parsley leaves?&#?&#Roasted unsalted peanuts, chopped Directions :?&#?&#1- In a pan, over medium heat, melt the butter. Sauté the shrimp with salt, pepper, and lemon zest?&#?&#2- Place the vermicelli in a large bowl. Pour boiling water over the vermicelli and let it sit for 10 minutes until it becomes soft and translucent?&#?&#3- Drain the vermicelli from the water. Using a pair of scissors, cut the vermicelli into bite size threads. Season with 1 teaspoon nuoc mam sauce?&#?&#4- Add the shrimp and the chopped mint to the vermicelli and mix?&#?&#5- Cut the carrot and cucumber into julienne (thin sticks)?&#?&#6- Prepare the sauce by mixing together all the ingredients of the sauce?&#?&#7- Serve all the ingredients separated: lettuce and herbs, carrot sticks, cucumber sticks, and vermicelli shrimp mix. Place the sauce in a bowl and serve it as well?&#?&#8- In a lettuce leaf, place the shrimp and vermicelli mixture, add the cut veggies, add a sprinkle of chopped peanuts, and decorate with a leaf of mint or parsley?&#?&#9- To eat the shrimp lettuce wrap, roll it then dip it in the sauce https://www.cookingwithalia.com/718-shrimp-lettuce-wraps/ 10 minutes
30 minutes 4 people Easy Appetizers May 5, 2019 717- Rainbow Pizza https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-05-04-Alia-Rainbow-Pizza00488-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Precooked Pizza Dough (4 medium sized disks or 1 large)?&#?&# ?&#?&#Pizza Sauce:?&#?&#3 large tomatoes, grated and skin discarded?&#?&#1 small onion, finely chopped?&#?&#1 garlic clove, grated?&#?&#1 tablespoon tomato paste?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 tablespoon dried oregano?&#?&#1 tablespoon sugar?&#?&#1 tablespoon paprika?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon pepper?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#1 teaspoon onion powder?&#?&# ?&#?&#Toppings:?&#?&#1/2 cup of grated cheese?&#?&#1 cup broccoli?&#?&#1 cup green pepper, cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup yellow pepper cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup red pepper cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup cherry tomatoes cut in half?&#?&#1 cup red onion cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup canned corn?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: The Pizza Sauce?&#?&#1- On medium heat, heat olive oil in a pan. Add the chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes until it get a golden color.?&#?&#2- Add the grated garlic and tomato paste. Mix and cook for a few minutes.?&#?&#3- Add the grated tomatoes and spices. Mix and cook for 15 minutes until the sauce thickens. Stir from time to time.?&#?&#Step 2: The Pizza?&#?&#1- Spread the pizza sauce on the pre-cooked pizza circles. Avoid adding the sauce to the edges of the crust or it would burn when baking the pizza.?&#?&#2- Add the grated cheese on top evenly.?&#?&#3- Arrange the veggies in a rainbow look and in a circular formation.?&#?&#4- Drizzle some olive oil on top of the veggies and on the edges of the crust.?&#?&#5- Bake the pizza in a preheated oven at 200 C / 400 F for about 20 minutes. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/717-rainbow-pizza/ 20 minutes
30 minutes 8 mini quiches Easy Appetizers May 4, 2019 716- Crustless Quiche https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2019-04-crustlessQuiche-013.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#125 grams (4.5 oz.) chicken breast?&#?&#1 onion, chopped?&#?&#115 grams (4 oz.) mushroom, canned?&#?&#30 grams (1/4 cup) flour?&#?&#1 egg?&#?&#140 ml (1/2 cup and 2 tablespoon) milk?&#?&#4 grams (1/2 teaspoon) baking powder?&#?&#70 grams (2.5 oz.) edam cheese, shredded?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#A pinch of nutmeg?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- Preheat your oven to 440°F (225°C)?&#?&#2- Cut the chicken breast into small cubes?&#?&#3- In a pan, over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil, add the chicken cubes and cook. Remove from the pan and set aside?&#?&#4- Cut the onion into thin stripes, add to the same pan and cook until it becomes soft and translucent?&#?&#5- Add the mushroom. Season with salt and pepper and cook until it’s well cooked through. Set aside?&#?&#6- In a mixing bowl, combine together the milk, egg, a pinch of nutmeg, salt, and pepper and mix. Add the flour and mix again?&#?&#7- Coat the muffin pan with a thin layer of butter then coat with flour?&#?&#8- Start with a layer of chicken cubes followed by a layer of onion and mushroom. Pour the milk mixture over the two layers and sprinkle with shredded edam cheese?&#?&#9- Place the quiches in the preheated oven for 5 minutes, decrease the heat to 390°F (200°C) and continue cooking for 15 minutes?&#?&#10- Let the quiches cool down for 20 minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm or at room temperature https://www.cookingwithalia.com/716-crustless-quiche/ 20 minutes
15 minutes 4 people Easy Appetizers Sep 27, 2018 689- Eggplant Zaalouk (Moroccan Dip) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/IMG_0856-e-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 eggplants?&#2 tomatoes, cut in half, pulp grated, and skin discarded?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#1 teaspoon ground chili pepper?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon vinegar (or lemon juice) Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the eggplants over the stove at medium heat or a grill. Grill the eggplants for 10 to 15 minutes while turning them from time to time until they are charred entirely.?&#2- Remove the eggplants from the stove and let them cool down.?&#3- In a pan over medium heat, place the grated tomatoes, olive oil, grated garlic cloves, chili pepper, paprika, cumin, salt, and cilantro. Using a wooden spoon, mix until all the ingredients are combined and cook for 5 minutes.?&#4- Once the eggplants are a bit cooler, remove the charred skin by scraping it gently. Cut off the eggplant tail.?&#5- Slice the eggplants into small cubes.?&#6- Add the eggplants to the pan, mix, and cook for about 15 minutes while stirring regularly until the mixture thickens.?&#7- Add the vinegar, mix, and cook for 2 minutes.?&#8- Plate Zaalouk and decorate with fried eggplant slices and finely chopped cilantro. Serve hot or cold with crusty bread! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/689-eggplant-zaalouk/ 30 minutes

Add onion and cook for 3 minutes while stirring with a spatula.?&#2- Add carrots, eggplants, green bell pepper, salt, and pepper and continue cooking for 15 minutes until tender.?&#3- Remove from the heat and place the mixture in a food processor, add tomato sauce, pizza sauce, and water.?&#4- Mix until you have a smooth texture.?&#You can use the sauce for quiche, pizza, or pasta, etc. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/688-veggies-tomato-sauce/ 25 minutes
15 minutes 6 people Easy Appetizers Jun 6, 2018 671- Crunchy Dip of Cheese with Peppers https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/IMG_8773-title.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 Carrefour spread cheese?&#1/2 Carrefour goat buche?&#50 grams Cocktail Mix Intersection, chopped?&#1/2 green pepper, cut into small cubes?&#1/2 red pepper, cut into small cubes?&#1 tablespoon chopped parsley?&#A pinch of ground paprika?&#Zest of a lemon Directions :?&#?&#1- In a bowl, place the Carrefour cheese spread and the Carrefour Goat Bûche, and mix using a spatula until you have a creamy texture.?&#2- Add peppers, parsley, paprika and lemon zest.?&#3- Mix until you have a homogeneous mixture. 20 minutes 12 trays Medium Appetizers May 23, 2018 669- Candied Eggplants Trays https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/IMG_1535-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the candied eggplant:?&#1 teaspoon Chili Paste Carrefour?&#5 Dried Tomatoes Carrefour?&#2 eggplants, cut into cubes?&#1 tomato, grated?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 garlic cloves?&#1/2 teaspoon salt, according to taste?&#1 teaspoon cumin?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#?&#For the trays:?&#250 grams (8.82 oz) pastilla sheets Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the candied eggplant?&#1- In a frying pan over medium heat, heat the oil and add the eggplant.?&#2- Cook for 5 minutes, stirring regularly until the eggplant cubes are golden brown.?&#3- Add garlic and salt and cook, crushing everything for 3 minutes.?&#4- Add the grated tomato, mix and add the cumin, paprika and Chili Paste Carrefour .?&#5- Cook for about 5 minutes until it reduces.?&#6- Remove from the heat, cut the Dried Tomatoes Carrefour into small cubes, then add them to the candied eggplant and mix.?&#?&#Step 2: Form the trays?&#7- Using a cutter of 8 cm in diameter, cut discs in the pastilla sheets.?&#8- In the cavities of a muffin pan, place two discs of pastilla sheets, then bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for about 10 minutes until the trays are golden brown.?&#9- Once out of the oven, let cool a little, then remove the trays from the mold and garnish with the candied eggplant. Sprinkle with chopped coriander and serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/669-candied-eggplants-trays/ 35 minutes

Cuisez 2 minutes de chaque coté jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient tendres.?&#5- Place the vegetables on the toasts and sprinkle with the chives. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/611-canapes/ 5 minutes
1 hour 12 maakouda Medium Appetizers Oct 19, 2017 599- Maakouda https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Maakouda-FINAL.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 medium potatoes (800 grams / 1.8 pounds)?&#Salt, to taste?&#1 garlic clove, grated?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley?&#1/2 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1/4 teaspoon chilli powder?&#Water?&#?&#Frying Ingredients?&#2 eggs?&#60 grams (1/2 cup) white all-purpose flour?&#Vegetable oil?&#?&#Sandwich Ingredients (optional)?&#Half a baguette?&#Ketchup or spicy harissa sauce?&#Some lettuce?&#Tomato slices Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 : Prepare and Shape Potato Patties?&#1- Peel the potatoes, slice them, and cut them into small chunks.?&#2- Place the potatoes in a pot, cover them with cold water, and add a pinch of salt. Place the pot over medium-high heat, cover it, and bring the water to a boiling point. Reduce the heat to medium and cook the potatoes for around 20 minutes until they become soft.?&#3- Drain the potatoes in a strainer and place them in a bowl. Using a wooden spoon, mash the potatoes until smooth.?&#4- Add the garlic, parsley, paprika, and chili powder. Mix until well combined.?&#5- Taste the potato mix and adjust the spices accordingly, including salt.?&#6- Shape the potato mix into small patties of 5 centimeter / 2 inches in diametre.?&#?&#Step 2 : Fry Potato Patties?&#7- In a bowl, beat the eggs using a fork.?&#8- Place a skillet over medium heat and pour some oil on it to deep fry the Maakouda.?&#9- Dip the potato patties in the beaten eggs, then lightly cover the patties with flour, from both sides.?&#10- Once the oil is hot, add the potato patties and fry on a medium heat for a few minutes on each side until they become deep golden brown. Be gentle when turning the patties.?&#11- Once done, remove the Maakouda from the oil and place them on a plate with paper towel to absorb excess oil.?&#?&#Step 3 : Make the Maakouda Sandwich (optional)?&#12- Use half a baguette, spread with some ketchup or spicy harissa sauce, and garnish with lettuce, maakouda, and tomato slices. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/599-maakouda/
30 minutes 4 people Easy Appetizers May 5, 2019 717- Rainbow Pizza https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-05-04-Alia-Rainbow-Pizza00488-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Precooked Pizza Dough (4 medium sized disks or 1 large)?&#?&# ?&#?&#Pizza Sauce:?&#?&#3 large tomatoes, grated and skin discarded?&#?&#1 small onion, finely chopped?&#?&#1 garlic clove, grated?&#?&#1 tablespoon tomato paste?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 tablespoon dried oregano?&#?&#1 tablespoon sugar?&#?&#1 tablespoon paprika?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon pepper?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#1 teaspoon onion powder?&#?&# ?&#?&#Toppings:?&#?&#1/2 cup of grated cheese?&#?&#1 cup broccoli?&#?&#1 cup green pepper, cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup yellow pepper cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup red pepper cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup cherry tomatoes cut in half?&#?&#1 cup red onion cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup canned corn?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: The Pizza Sauce?&#?&#1- On medium heat, heat olive oil in a pan. Add the chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes until it get a golden color.?&#?&#2- Add the grated garlic and tomato paste. Mix and cook for a few minutes.?&#?&#3- Add the grated tomatoes and spices. Mix and cook for 15 minutes until the sauce thickens. Stir from time to time.?&#?&#Step 2: The Pizza?&#?&#1- Spread the pizza sauce on the pre-cooked pizza circles. Avoid adding the sauce to the edges of the crust or it would burn when baking the pizza.?&#?&#2- Add the grated cheese on top evenly.?&#?&#3- Arrange the veggies in a rainbow look and in a circular formation.?&#?&#4- Drizzle some olive oil on top of the veggies and on the edges of the crust.?&#?&#5- Bake the pizza in a preheated oven at 200 C / 400 F for about 20 minutes. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/717-rainbow-pizza/ 20 minutes
30 minutes 8 mini quiches Easy Appetizers May 4, 2019 716- Crustless Quiche https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2019-04-crustlessQuiche-013.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#125 grams (4.5 oz.) chicken breast?&#?&#1 onion, chopped?&#?&#115 grams (4 oz.) mushroom, canned?&#?&#30 grams (1/4 cup) flour?&#?&#1 egg?&#?&#140 ml (1/2 cup and 2 tablespoon) milk?&#?&#4 grams (1/2 teaspoon) baking powder?&#?&#70 grams (2.5 oz.) edam cheese, shredded?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#A pinch of nutmeg?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- Preheat your oven to 440°F (225°C)?&#?&#2- Cut the chicken breast into small cubes?&#?&#3- In a pan, over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil, add the chicken cubes and cook. Remove from the pan and set aside?&#?&#4- Cut the onion into thin stripes, add to the same pan and cook until it becomes soft and translucent?&#?&#5- Add the mushroom. Season with salt and pepper and cook until it’s well cooked through. Set aside?&#?&#6- In a mixing bowl, combine together the milk, egg, a pinch of nutmeg, salt, and pepper and mix. Add the flour and mix again?&#?&#7- Coat the muffin pan with a thin layer of butter then coat with flour?&#?&#8- Start with a layer of chicken cubes followed by a layer of onion and mushroom. Pour the milk mixture over the two layers and sprinkle with shredded edam cheese?&#?&#9- Place the quiches in the preheated oven for 5 minutes, decrease the heat to 390°F (200°C) and continue cooking for 15 minutes?&#?&#10- Let the quiches cool down for 20 minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm or at room temperature https://www.cookingwithalia.com/716-crustless-quiche/ 20 minutes
15 minutes 4 people Easy Appetizers Sep 27, 2018 689- Eggplant Zaalouk (Moroccan Dip) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/IMG_0856-e-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 eggplants?&#2 tomatoes, cut in half, pulp grated, and skin discarded?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#1 teaspoon ground chili pepper?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon vinegar (or lemon juice) Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the eggplants over the stove at medium heat or a grill. Grill the eggplants for 10 to 15 minutes while turning them from time to time until they are charred entirely.?&#2- Remove the eggplants from the stove and let them cool down.?&#3- In a pan over medium heat, place the grated tomatoes, olive oil, grated garlic cloves, chili pepper, paprika, cumin, salt, and cilantro. Using a wooden spoon, mix until all the ingredients are combined and cook for 5 minutes.?&#4- Once the eggplants are a bit cooler, remove the charred skin by scraping it gently. Cut off the eggplant tail.?&#5- Slice the eggplants into small cubes.?&#6- Add the eggplants to the pan, mix, and cook for about 15 minutes while stirring regularly until the mixture thickens.?&#7- Add the vinegar, mix, and cook for 2 minutes.?&#8- Plate Zaalouk and decorate with fried eggplant slices and finely chopped cilantro. Serve hot or cold with crusty bread! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/689-eggplant-zaalouk/ 30 minutes
15 minutes 6 quiches Easy Appetizers Sep 17, 2018 688- Veggies Tomato Sauce https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Quiche-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the sauce:?&#2 carrots, grated?&#1 small onion, chopped?&#1 aubergine, cut to cubes?&#1 green pepper, cut to cubes?&#2 tbsp tomato sauce?&#360 g pizza sauce?&#250 ml of water?&#2 tbsp olive oil?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#For the sauce?&#1- Heat olive oil in a sauce pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 3 minutes while stirring with a spatula.?&#2- Add carrots, eggplants, green bell pepper, salt, and pepper and continue cooking for 15 minutes until tender.?&#3- Remove from the heat and place the mixture in a food processor, add tomato sauce, pizza sauce, and water.?&#4- Mix until you have a smooth texture.?&#You can use the sauce for quiche, pizza, or pasta, etc. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/688-veggies-tomato-sauce/ 25 minutes
15 minutes 6 people Easy Appetizers Jun 6, 2018 671- Crunchy Dip of Cheese with Peppers https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/IMG_8773-title.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 Carrefour spread cheese?&#1/2 Carrefour goat buche?&#50 grams Cocktail Mix Intersection, chopped?&#1/2 green pepper, cut into small cubes?&#1/2 red pepper, cut into small cubes?&#1 tablespoon chopped parsley?&#A pinch of ground paprika?&#Zest of a lemon Directions :?&#?&#1- In a bowl, place the Carrefour cheese spread and the Carrefour Goat Bûche, and mix using a spatula until you have a creamy texture.?&#2- Add peppers, parsley, paprika and lemon zest.?&#3- Mix until you have a homogeneous mixture. Add the Carrefour Cocktail Mix.?&#4- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Serve chilled with crackers or biscottes. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/671-crunchy-dip-of-cheese-with-peppers/
20 minutes 12 trays Medium Appetizers May 23, 2018 669- Candied Eggplants Trays https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/IMG_1535-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the candied eggplant:?&#1 teaspoon Chili Paste Carrefour?&#5 Dried Tomatoes Carrefour?&#2 eggplants, cut into cubes?&#1 tomato, grated?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 garlic cloves?&#1/2 teaspoon salt, according to taste?&#1 teaspoon cumin?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#?&#For the trays:?&#250 grams (8.82 oz) pastilla sheets Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the candied eggplant?&#1- In a frying pan over medium heat, heat the oil and add the eggplant.?&#2- Cook for 5 minutes, stirring regularly until the eggplant cubes are golden brown.?&#3- Add garlic and salt and cook, crushing everything for 3 minutes.?&#4- Add the grated tomato, mix and add the cumin, paprika and Chili Paste Carrefour .?&#5- Cook for about 5 minutes until it reduces.?&#6- Remove from the heat, cut the Dried Tomatoes Carrefour into small cubes, then add them to the candied eggplant and mix.?&#?&#Step 2: Form the trays?&#7- Using a cutter of 8 cm in diameter, cut discs in the pastilla sheets.?&#8- In the cavities of a muffin pan, place two discs of pastilla sheets, then bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for about 10 minutes until the trays are golden brown.?&#9- Once out of the oven, let cool a little, then remove the trays from the mold and garnish with the candied eggplant. Sprinkle with chopped coriander and serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/669-candied-eggplants-trays/ 35 minutes
15 minutes 20 Canapés Easy Appetizers Dec 12, 2017 611- Canapes https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/435-canape-fb.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# The base:?&#10 slices of bread?&#3 tablespoons tapenade pepper delight?&#?&#Garnish:?&#1/2 zucchini, cut into thin slices?&#6 cherry tomatoes?&#1/2 eggplant, cut into thin slices cut in two?&#Chives, finely chopped?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#1 tablespoon olive oil Directions :?&#?&#The base:?&#1- Heat a frying pan over low heat, and toast the slices of bread for 30 seconds on each side.?&#2- Cut into the toast approximately 20 squares of 2 cm on each side.?&#3- Spread the tapenade on the square toasts.?&#?&#Toppings:?&#4- Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat, place the cut vegetables then add salt and pepper. Cuisez 2 minutes de chaque coté jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient tendres.?&#5- Place the vegetables on the toasts and sprinkle with the chives. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/611-canapes/ 5 minutes

40 minutes 3 burger Facile Appetizers Sep 21, 2017 576- Krachel Burger https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/DSC_2298.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 krachels moyennes?&#?&#Pour le poulet:?&#150 grammes de blancs de poulet, coupé en petits morceaux?&#1 cuillère à café de coriandre moulue?&#1/2 cuillère à café de sel, selon le goût?&#1/4 cuillère à café de poivre, selon le goût?&#Le zeste d’un citron?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile végétale?&#?&#Pour la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde:?&#2 cuillères à soupe de fromage Kiri Délice?&#3 cuillères à soupe de moutarde à l’ancienne?&#1 cuillère à soupe de miel?&#?&#Pour la garniture:?&#3 feuilles de laitue?&#1 tomate moyenne, coupée en rondelles Directions :?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la Sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde?&#1- Dans un bol, placez le fromage Kiri Délice et mélangez avec une spatule jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une texture crémeuse.?&#2- Ajoutez-y la moutarde et le miel et mélangez jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une sauce lisse.?&#?&#Etape 2: Préparer la garniture?&#3- Dans une boîte hermétique, placez les morceaux de blanc de poulet et ajoutez-y la coriandre, le sel, le poivre et le zeste de citron.?&#4- Mélangez, fermez la boîte et laissez mariner 30 minutes.?&#5- Dans une poêle sur feu moyen, chauffez l’huile végétale et faites-y cuire les morceaux de blanc de poulet jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient bien cuits.?&#6- Une fois que les morceaux de blanc de poulet sont cuits, prélevez une cuillère à soupe de la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde, ajoutez-la au poulet et mélangez.?&#?&#Etape 3: Assembler le sandwich?&#7- Coupez les krachels en deux horizontalement, tartinez les tranches avec la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde, déposez dessus une feuille de laitue, des morceaux de blanc de poulet et des rondelles de tomates. Recouvrez avec la seconde tranche de krachel.?&#8- Servez immédiatement, ou emportez avec vous! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/576-krachel-burger/ 10 minutes

Cut the watermelon slice into 8 wedges. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/550-watermelon-pizza/
4 hours 5 Easy Appetizers Aug 9, 2017 547- Watermelon Granita with Orange Blossom Water https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/IMG_5954-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#800 grams (6-8 cups) watermelon, cubed?&#75 grams (1/3 cup) sugar?&#3 tablespoons orange blossom water?&#Juice of 1 lemon Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the cubed watermelon, sugar, orange blossom water, and lemon juice in your blender. Mix until smooth.?&#?&#2- Pour it all into a 9×13 pan and freeze for one hour.?&#3- Using a fork, scrape to loosen the granita.?&#4- Freeze for another hour and scrape again.?&#?&#5- After it has been frozen for three hours, scrape it once more and then serve in a hollowed watermelon or in cups with sliced lemons or mint leaves. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/547-watermelon-granita-orange-blossom-water/
35 minutes 12 pieces Easy Appetizers Aug 9, 2017 546- Watermelon and Shrimp with Harissa Bites https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/IMG_5942-001-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#12 shrimps, peeled and deveined?&#2 tablespoons spicy harissa paste?&#12 bite sized watermelon cubes Directions :?&#?&#1- Mix the shrimp with the harissa paste until the shrimp are evenly coated. Let marinate for 30 minutes.?&#?&#2- Heat a non-stick pan over medium high heat. Add shrimp and cook for about 5 minutes until both sides are cooked and change color. Remove from pan and let cool slightly.?&#?&#3- Thread one shrimp onto an appetizer skewer, followed by a watermelon cube. Repeat until all 12 are prepared.?&#4- Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/546-watermelon-shrimp-harissa-bites/
4 Easy Appetizers Jul 25, 2017 541- Cauliflower Zaalouk https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/435_MG_9835.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 medium-sized cauliflower?&#4 large garlic cloves?&#1/4 cup chopped parsley and cilantro (mixed)?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#Salt and pepper Directions :?&#?&#1- Slice the cauliflower into medium-sized chunks.?&#2- On high heat, place a large pot filled with water, add the cauliflower chunks and pinch of salt, cover, and cook until the cauliflower is tender enough to mash.?&#?&#3- Finely chop the garlic, parsley, and cilantro.?&#4- Drain the cauliflower from the water and place it in a large bowl.?&#5- Mash the cauliflower with a spoon until you get a soft mixture.?&#?&#6- In a large skillet, heat olive oil on medium heat, add the crushed garlic, and cook for 2 minutes. Now add the mashed cauliflower, ground paprika, ground cumin, chopped parsley and cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix well.?&#?&#7- Cook for a few minutes while stirring constantly. Taste and adjust the same spices per your taste. Cook for around 10 minutes until the liquids are absorbed.?&#Serve hot or cold, with a some fresh chopped cilantro on top and a squeeze of fresh lemon, and serve with crusty bread! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/cauliflower-zaalouk/
Easy Appetizers Jun 30, 2017 539- Malai Kofta https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Malai-Kofta.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients For The Kofta:?&#2 medium-sized potatoes?&#100 (3.5 oz) grams paneer (or mozarella)?&#2 tablespoons flour?&#Salt, to taste?&#2 tablespoons of raisins?&#Vegetable oil, for frying?&#Water, for boiling?&#?&#Ingredients For The Gravy:?&#2 small onions, thinly sliced?&#75g (1/2 cup) of raw unsalted cashew nuts?&#1 green chilli?&#3 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste?&#1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder?&#Salt, to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon white granulated sugar, to taste?&#50 ml (1/4 cup) Cream?&#1 tablespoon chopped cilantro?&#Water, for boiling Directions :?&#?&#STEP 1: Make The Kofta?&#1- Boil the potatoes in a pot filled with water until fully cooked.?&#2- Once done, remove the potatoes from the water and let them cool down. Then peel the skin, place the potatoes on a plate and mash them with a spoon or using your fingers.?&#3- Grate the paneer over the mashed potatoes. Add some salt, a little bit of flour and the raisins. Mix well with your fingers until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#4- With your hands, shape the mixture into small balls, sprinkle a little bit of flour on them and finish off the shaping to have smooth balls.?&#5- In a large pan, heat the vegetable oil and fry the koftas until their color becomes deep golden brown. The oil should cover half in the pan should cover half the koftas, so make sure to turn the koftas around so that all sides are fried.?&#6- Once done, remove the koftas from the oil and place them in a colander filled with tissue papers to absorb excess oil.?&#?&#STEP 2: Make The Gravy?&#1- Boil water In a medium pot, add the sliced onions, cashew nuts and the green chilli. Cook for 10 minutes or until the onions are soft.?&#2- Drain the onions, cashew nuts and green chili from the water and place them in a blender. Save the cooking-water for later purposes.?&#3- Blend the onion mixture on high speed, into a smooth paste and place it aside in a bowl.?&#4- In a deep pan over medium heat, heat the vegetable oil. Once hot, add the ginger-garlic paste, cook it for 30 seconds. Add the onion-cashew paste in the pan and mix it with oil using a wooden spoon. Cook for 30 seconds.?&#5- Add cardamom powder, a little bit of salt, sugar and mix well until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#6- Add some of cooking water to the pan and mix until you get a medium-thick sauce. Add the cream and cook everything for 30 seconds while stirring constantly until you get the desired gravy consistency.?&#?&#STEP 3 : Combine And Enjoy?&#1- Once ready to serve this dish, heat up the gravy in a pan, stir in the koftas then sprinkle some chopped cilantro on the combination.?&#2- Serve immediately with basmati rice or Indian bread!?&#?&#Notes:?&#– If you don’t have paneer, you can use mozzarella or crush some bread and mix it with the potatoes to make the kofta?&#– This dish is known for the sweetness because of the cream and the sugar, so keep the spice tone less and keep it on the sweeter palette. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/539-malai-kofta/ 30 minutes
15 minutes
Esay Appetizers Jun 22, 2017 533- Homemade Almond Paste https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/1-IMG_0797-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#300 grams (11 oz) blanched almonds?&#134 grams (2/3 cup) white granulated sugar?&#28 grams (2 tablespoons) butter, softened?&#1 teaspoon orange blossom water?&#A few pebbles of Gum Arabic (Meska), optional Directions :?&#?&#1- First, prepare the gum Arabic (or Meska). Add a pinch of sugar to a few Meska pebbles and crush them with the bottom of a cup until you get a fine powder.?&#?&#2- In a food processor, combine the blanched almonds, sugar, softened butter, Meska powder, and orange blossom water.?&#?&#3- Mix for 5 minutes until you get a smooth paste.?&#?&#4- Wrap the almond paste in a plastic wrap and place it in an airtight container. Refrigerate for up to 1 month or freeze for a couple of months. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/533-homemade-almond-paste/
30 minutes Around 35 fekkas Hard Appetizers Jun 22, 2017 532- Fekkas with Date Paste https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/1-1-IMG_2185.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Basic Fekkas Dough Ingredients:?&#Refer to Fekkas With Almonds recipe Filling Ingredients?&#320 grams (11.2 oz.) date paste?&#25 grams (2 tablespoons) unsalted butter?&#1/2 teaspoon cinnamon?&#?&#Egg Wash:?&#1 egg yolk?&#1/2 teaspoon orange blossom water (or just water) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Mixing The Wet Ingredients?&#Follow the instructions in the Fekkas With Almonds recipe.?&#?&#Step 2: Adding The Dry Ingredients?&#1- Add the flour and baking powder.?&#2- Continue mixing until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#?&#3- If necessary, add more flour and keep kneading the dough until you get a smooth dough that does not stick to your fingers but at the same it is not dry.?&#4- Divide the dough into 3 portions.?&#?&#Step 3: Preparing The Filling?&#5- Heat the date paste for 30 seconds in the microwave so it is easier to manipulate. Combine with the butter and cinnamon.?&#?&#6- Mix until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#?&#Step 4: Shaping The Logs?&#7- Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Roll out each dough into a rectangle.?&#?&#8- The rectangle should be around 20x25cm (8×10 inches) with a 2mm thickness.?&#9- Cut small portions of the filling and flatten them using your fingers.?&#?&#10- Gently place the filling pieces on top of the rolled dough. Make sure to cover all the surface of the dough.?&#11- With the longest side facing you, roll the dough as if you were rolling a carpet.?&#?&#12- Place the three dough rolls in a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#?&#Step 5: First Baking?&#Follow the instructions in the Fekkas With Almonds recipe.?&#Bake for about 25-30 minutes. Wrap a damp towel and let set overnight for at least 10 to 12 hours.?&#?&#Step 6: Slicing The Rolls?&#13- The next day, remove the towel from the rolls and cut each one into straight 0.5 cm (1/4 inches) slices.?&#?&#14- Press lightly on the sides of the roll when slicing to help minimize breakage.?&#?&#Step 7: Second Baking?&#15- Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Place the Fekkas slices in a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#16- Bake for about 15 minutes until the Fekkas have a light golden color.?&#?&#Let cool completely before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/532-fekkas-date-paste/ 30 minutes first baking 15 minutes second baking
40 minutes 3 burger Facile Appetizers Sep 21, 2017 576- Krachel Burger https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/DSC_2298.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 krachels moyennes?&#?&#Pour le poulet:?&#150 grammes de blancs de poulet, coupé en petits morceaux?&#1 cuillère à café de coriandre moulue?&#1/2 cuillère à café de sel, selon le goût?&#1/4 cuillère à café de poivre, selon le goût?&#Le zeste d’un citron?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile végétale?&#?&#Pour la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde:?&#2 cuillères à soupe de fromage Kiri Délice?&#3 cuillères à soupe de moutarde à l’ancienne?&#1 cuillère à soupe de miel?&#?&#Pour la garniture:?&#3 feuilles de laitue?&#1 tomate moyenne, coupée en rondelles Directions :?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la Sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde?&#1- Dans un bol, placez le fromage Kiri Délice et mélangez avec une spatule jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une texture crémeuse.?&#2- Ajoutez-y la moutarde et le miel et mélangez jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une sauce lisse.?&#?&#Etape 2: Préparer la garniture?&#3- Dans une boîte hermétique, placez les morceaux de blanc de poulet et ajoutez-y la coriandre, le sel, le poivre et le zeste de citron.?&#4- Mélangez, fermez la boîte et laissez mariner 30 minutes.?&#5- Dans une poêle sur feu moyen, chauffez l’huile végétale et faites-y cuire les morceaux de blanc de poulet jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient bien cuits.?&#6- Une fois que les morceaux de blanc de poulet sont cuits, prélevez une cuillère à soupe de la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde, ajoutez-la au poulet et mélangez.?&#?&#Etape 3: Assembler le sandwich?&#7- Coupez les krachels en deux horizontalement, tartinez les tranches avec la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde, déposez dessus une feuille de laitue, des morceaux de blanc de poulet et des rondelles de tomates. Recouvrez avec la seconde tranche de krachel.?&#8- Servez immédiatement, ou emportez avec vous! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/576-krachel-burger/ 10 minutes

4 hours 5 Easy Appetizers Aug 9, 2017 547- Watermelon Granita with Orange Blossom Water https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/IMG_5954-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#800 grams (6-8 cups) watermelon, cubed?&#75 grams (1/3 cup) sugar?&#3 tablespoons orange blossom water?&#Juice of 1 lemon Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the cubed watermelon, sugar, orange blossom water, and lemon juice in your blender. Mix until smooth.?&#?&#2- Pour it all into a 9×13 pan and freeze for one hour.?&#3- Using a fork, scrape to loosen the granita.?&#4- Freeze for another hour and scrape again.?&#?&#5- After it has been frozen for three hours, scrape it once more and then serve in a hollowed watermelon or in cups with sliced lemons or mint leaves. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/547-watermelon-granita-orange-blossom-water/
35 minutes 12 pieces Easy Appetizers Aug 9, 2017 546- Watermelon and Shrimp with Harissa Bites https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/IMG_5942-001-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#12 shrimps, peeled and deveined?&#2 tablespoons spicy harissa paste?&#12 bite sized watermelon cubes Directions :?&#?&#1- Mix the shrimp with the harissa paste until the shrimp are evenly coated. Let marinate for 30 minutes.?&#?&#2- Heat a non-stick pan over medium high heat. Add shrimp and cook for about 5 minutes until both sides are cooked and change color. Remove from pan and let cool slightly.?&#?&#3- Thread one shrimp onto an appetizer skewer, followed by a watermelon cube. 4 Easy Appetizers Jul 25, 2017 541- Cauliflower Zaalouk https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/435_MG_9835.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 medium-sized cauliflower?&#4 large garlic cloves?&#1/4 cup chopped parsley and cilantro (mixed)?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#Salt and pepper Directions :?&#?&#1- Slice the cauliflower into medium-sized chunks.?&#2- On high heat, place a large pot filled with water, add the cauliflower chunks and pinch of salt, cover, and cook until the cauliflower is tender enough to mash.?&#?&#3- Finely chop the garlic, parsley, and cilantro.?&#4- Drain the cauliflower from the water and place it in a large bowl.?&#5- Mash the cauliflower with a spoon until you get a soft mixture.?&#?&#6- In a large skillet, heat olive oil on medium heat, add the crushed garlic, and cook for 2 minutes. Now add the mashed cauliflower, ground paprika, ground cumin, chopped parsley and cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix well.?&#?&#7- Cook for a few minutes while stirring constantly. Taste and adjust the same spices per your taste. Cook for around 10 minutes until the liquids are absorbed.?&#Serve hot or cold, with a some fresh chopped cilantro on top and a squeeze of fresh lemon, and serve with crusty bread! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/cauliflower-zaalouk/
Easy Appetizers Jun 30, 2017 539- Malai Kofta https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Malai-Kofta.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients For The Kofta:?&#2 medium-sized potatoes?&#100 (3.5 oz) grams paneer (or mozarella)?&#2 tablespoons flour?&#Salt, to taste?&#2 tablespoons of raisins?&#Vegetable oil, for frying?&#Water, for boiling?&#?&#Ingredients For The Gravy:?&#2 small onions, thinly sliced?&#75g (1/2 cup) of raw unsalted cashew nuts?&#1 green chilli?&#3 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste?&#1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder?&#Salt, to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon white granulated sugar, to taste?&#50 ml (1/4 cup) Cream?&#1 tablespoon chopped cilantro?&#Water, for boiling Directions :?&#?&#STEP 1: Make The Kofta?&#1- Boil the potatoes in a pot filled with water until fully cooked.?&#2- Once done, remove the potatoes from the water and let them cool down. Then peel the skin, place the potatoes on a plate and mash them with a spoon or using your fingers.?&#3- Grate the paneer over the mashed potatoes. Add some salt, a little bit of flour and the raisins. Mix well with your fingers until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#4- With your hands, shape the mixture into small balls, sprinkle a little bit of flour on them and finish off the shaping to have smooth balls.?&#5- In a large pan, heat the vegetable oil and fry the koftas until their color becomes deep golden brown. The oil should cover half in the pan should cover half the koftas, so make sure to turn the koftas around so that all sides are fried.?&#6- Once done, remove the koftas from the oil and place them in a colander filled with tissue papers to absorb excess oil.?&#?&#STEP 2: Make The Gravy?&#1- Boil water In a medium pot, add the sliced onions, cashew nuts and the green chilli. Cook for 10 minutes or until the onions are soft.?&#2- Drain the onions, cashew nuts and green chili from the water and place them in a blender. Save the cooking-water for later purposes.?&#3- Blend the onion mixture on high speed, into a smooth paste and place it aside in a bowl.?&#4- In a deep pan over medium heat, heat the vegetable oil. Once hot, add the ginger-garlic paste, cook it for 30 seconds. Add the onion-cashew paste in the pan and mix it with oil using a wooden spoon. Cook for 30 seconds.?&#5- Add cardamom powder, a little bit of salt, sugar and mix well until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#6- Add some of cooking water to the pan and mix until you get a medium-thick sauce. Add the cream and cook everything for 30 seconds while stirring constantly until you get the desired gravy consistency.?&#?&#STEP 3 : Combine And Enjoy?&#1- Once ready to serve this dish, heat up the gravy in a pan, stir in the koftas then sprinkle some chopped cilantro on the combination.?&#2- Serve immediately with basmati rice or Indian bread!?&#?&#Notes:?&#– If you don’t have paneer, you can use mozzarella or crush some bread and mix it with the potatoes to make the kofta?&#– This dish is known for the sweetness because of the cream and the sugar, so keep the spice tone less and keep it on the sweeter palette. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/539-malai-kofta/ 30 minutes
15 minutes
Esay Appetizers Jun 22, 2017 533- Homemade Almond Paste https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/1-IMG_0797-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#300 grams (11 oz) blanched almonds?&#134 grams (2/3 cup) white granulated sugar?&#28 grams (2 tablespoons) butter, softened?&#1 teaspoon orange blossom water?&#A few pebbles of Gum Arabic (Meska), optional Directions :?&#?&#1- First, prepare the gum Arabic (or Meska). Add a pinch of sugar to a few Meska pebbles and crush them with the bottom of a cup until you get a fine powder.?&#?&#2- In a food processor, combine the blanched almonds, sugar, softened butter, Meska powder, and orange blossom water.?&#?&#3- Mix for 5 minutes until you get a smooth paste.?&#?&#4- Wrap the almond paste in a plastic wrap and place it in an airtight container. Refrigerate for up to 1 month or freeze for a couple of months. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/533-homemade-almond-paste/
30 minutes Around 35 fekkas Hard Appetizers Jun 22, 2017 532- Fekkas with Date Paste https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/1-1-IMG_2185.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Basic Fekkas Dough Ingredients:?&#Refer to Fekkas With Almonds recipe Filling Ingredients?&#320 grams (11.2 oz.) date paste?&#25 grams (2 tablespoons) unsalted butter?&#1/2 teaspoon cinnamon?&#?&#Egg Wash:?&#1 egg yolk?&#1/2 teaspoon orange blossom water (or just water) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Mixing The Wet Ingredients?&#Follow the instructions in the Fekkas With Almonds recipe.?&#?&#Step 2: Adding The Dry Ingredients?&#1- Add the flour and baking powder.?&#2- Continue mixing until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#?&#3- If necessary, add more flour and keep kneading the dough until you get a smooth dough that does not stick to your fingers but at the same it is not dry.?&#4- Divide the dough into 3 portions.?&#?&#Step 3: Preparing The Filling?&#5- Heat the date paste for 30 seconds in the microwave so it is easier to manipulate. Combine with the butter and cinnamon.?&#?&#6- Mix until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#?&#Step 4: Shaping The Logs?&#7- Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Roll out each dough into a rectangle.?&#?&#8- The rectangle should be around 20x25cm (8×10 inches) with a 2mm thickness.?&#9- Cut small portions of the filling and flatten them using your fingers.?&#?&#10- Gently place the filling pieces on top of the rolled dough. Make sure to cover all the surface of the dough.?&#11- With the longest side facing you, roll the dough as if you were rolling a carpet.?&#?&#12- Place the three dough rolls in a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#?&#Step 5: First Baking?&#Follow the instructions in the Fekkas With Almonds recipe.?&#Bake for about 25-30 minutes. Wrap a damp towel and let set overnight for at least 10 to 12 hours.?&#?&#Step 6: Slicing The Rolls?&#13- The next day, remove the towel from the rolls and cut each one into straight 0.5 cm (1/4 inches) slices.?&#?&#14- Press lightly on the sides of the roll when slicing to help minimize breakage.?&#?&#Step 7: Second Baking?&#15- Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Place the Fekkas slices in a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#16- Bake for about 15 minutes until the Fekkas have a light golden color.?&#?&#Let cool completely before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/532-fekkas-date-paste/ 30 minutes first baking 15 minutes second baking

Easy Appetizers May 27, 2017 505- Chicken Spinach Filling – حشوة السبانخ والدجاج https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/1-FinalPic-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (1/2 pound) chicken breast, cubed?&#100 grams (1/2 cup) spinach, chopped?&#1 medium onion, chopped?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#2 tablespoons cream cheese?&#A handful of grated cheese?&#1 tablespoon heavy cream?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#1 teaspoon grated nutmeg?&#1 tablespoon capers 1/2 preserved lemon, finely chopped?&#1 large cornichon, chopped Directions :?&#?&#1- On medium heat, melt 1/2 tablespoons of butter in a large frying pan. Add the spinach and cook for 10 minutes or until the spinach is completely wilted and has turned bright green. Place in a bowl and set aside.?&#?&#2- In the same pan where you cooked the spinach, melt the rest of the butter and add the chopped onion. Cook for a few minutes until the onion softens.?&#?&#3- Add the chicken cubes, salt, and pepper. Mix and cook for 15 minutes until the chicken is almost done.?&#?&#4- Add the cooked spinach, preserved lemon, capers, cornichon, and grated nutmeg to the chicken. Mix and cook for another 2 minutes.?&#?&#5- Now add the cream cheese, grated cheese, and heavy cream. Mix and cook for another 5 minutes until the cheese melts.?&#?&#6- Place the chicken filling in a bowl. You can use this chicken filling, still hot, to fill batbout or let it completely cool down before using it as a filling with warka or phyllo dough. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/505-chicken-spinach-filling/ 30 minutes
