2 Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 285 – Zapiekanka with a Moroccan Twist https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_285.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#0.6 pound (300 grams) ground beef or lamb?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4?&#teaspoon chili pepper?&#1/4 finely chopped cilantro (mixed)?&#Mushrooms (any type you like: white mushrooms, shitakee, etc.)?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#salt and pepper?&#cheese (grated)?&#1 french baguette or Italian long bread?&#1/2 cup ketchup?&#1 tablespoon Harissa Directions :?&#?&#Step1 – Preparing the Meat (Kefta) and Mushrooms?&#1. Place the ground meat in a large bowl.?&#2. Add the spices to the meat (paprika, ground cumin, ground cinnamon, salt, and hot chili pepper).?&#3. Add the finely chopped cilantro to the meat (leave a little bit of chopped cilantro as a topping).?&#4. Using your hand, mix the meat with the spices and herbs until well incorporated.?&#5. If you have time, cover the bowl with a plastic wrap, and place it in the fridge for 30 minutes – otherwise, just cook the meat right away.?&#6. Chop the mushrooms into small pieces.?&#Step2 – Cooking the Meat and Mushrooms?&#1. In a large pan, drizzle 3 tablespoons of olive oil, and heat for 30 seconds on medium-high heat.?&#2. Add the meat, and cook for 4-5 minutes. Use a wooden spoon to break the meat into small chunks while it’s cooking. Keep stirring the meat the entire time it is cooking. The meat is ready when it changes color to a nice brown. Do not overcook the meat or it’s going to be dry.?&#3. Remove the meat from the pan and reserve.?&#4. In the same pan that used to cook the meat add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the mushrooms.?&#5. Cook for a minute then add 1 tablespoon of water to the mushrooms, salt, and pepper to taste. 6- Cook the mushrooms for 3-4 minutes until they become soft.?&#Step3 – Making the Zapiekanka?&#1. Cut the French baguette in half, then cut again in half horizontally, to yield 4 pieces.?&#2. Layer the cooked meat, mushrooms, a little bit of chopped cilantro, and cheese on each bread slice.?&#3. Place the bread slices in a hot oven, and bake for 5-10 minutes until the cheese has melted.?&#Step4 – Final steps?&#1. To make the spicy ketchup, mix regular ketchup with the harissa. You can also just buy spicy ketchup from the store.?&#2. Once the Zpiekanka is ready, remove from the oven, and drizzle the spicy ketchup on top. Serve immediately! Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/zapiekanka-with-a-moroccan-twist/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 269 – Vegetarian Filling Recipe – Briwat Special Episode 2 https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_269.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 medium-sized onion (peeled and grated)?&#2 medium-sized carrots (peeled and grated)?&#1 medium-sized zucchini (grated)?&#1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro?&#4 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#1/2 teaspoon salt (to taste)?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon read chili pepper (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Peel and an grate (using the large grating wholes) the onion and carrots.?&#2- Grate (using the large grating wholes) the zucchini.?&#Step 2: Cooking the Vegetables?&#1- In a flat pan, add the vegetable oil, olive oil, grated onion, grated carrots, finely chopped cilantro, crushed garlic, salt, paprika, ground cumin, and red chili pepper. Mix all the ingredients.?&#2- Place the pan on medium-high heat and cook for 3-4 minutes.?&#3- Now add the grated zuchhini. We add the zucchini later because it takes less time to cook the zucchini than the carrots. Mix the carrots and the zucchini and continue cooking for another 5 minutes. Note: the total cooking time of the vegetables is 10 minutes.?&#4- Remove the vegetables from the pan and place in a bowl. Let the filling cool down before you can use it to fill the Phyllo dough or Warka to make Briwat.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/vegetarian-filling-briwat-special-episode-2/
1 Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 344 – Vegetables Stir-fry – Thai recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_344.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#3 cabbage leaves?&#1/4 medium sized onion?&#6 thin slices of carrot?&#4 baby corns?&#A few leaves of Chinese Kale (or spinach)?&#1/2 tomato?&#1 teaspoon crushed garlic?&#1 tablespoon light brown sugar?&#1 tablespoon oyster sauce?&#1 tablespoon light soy sauce?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#1/4 teaspoon white ground pepper Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#First, cut the vegetables into medium sized cubes (cabbage leaves, kale, onion, tomatoes, etc.). For the hard vegetables like carrots, you should thinly slice them.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Vegetables?&#1- Place all the vegetables in the same plate, add the crushed garlic, light brown sugar, oyster sauce, and light soy sauce!?&#2- Drizzle vegetable oil to a pan and heat it up on medium heat for a few seconds. Now add the vegetables!?&#3- With your spatula, mix them well, and also give them a nice massage with the back of the spatula while stirring. This will help blend all the flavors!?&#Note: Get creative with this recipe – use any vegetable of your choice as long as they are leafy, cook quickly, or are thinly sliced.?&#4- Stir-fry for 5 minutes, and that’s it!!! Really, we are done! Serve on a plate and sprinkle some white ground pepper on top! You can also add some chopped herbs like fresh cilantro or basil!?&#Note: Do not overcook the vegetables, they should still have some crunch in them!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/vegetables-stir-fry-thai-recipe/
Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 125 – Taktouka – Cooked Salad with Tomatoes and Roasted Green Peppers https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_125.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#(5) medium-sized tomatoes (grated). (basically cut each tomato in ½ and grate pulp and discard skin)?&#(2) large – green peppers?&#(1/4) cup – finely chopped cilantro?&#(1/4) cup – finely chopped parsley?&#(1) tsp – paprika?&#(1) tsp – cumin?&#(1/4) tsp – pepper?&#(1) tsp – salt?&#(2) TBL spoons – olive oil?&#(1) TBL spoon – tomato paste?&#(3) garlic cloves (crushed) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Roasting the Green Peppers?&#1- Grill green peppers (insert wood sticks in peppers and place directly on burner). Goal is to grill peppers on high heat until skin turns black. Cracking noise is a good sign; it means skin is cracking and pepper is roasting?&#2- Keep monitoring pepper and turn around until all sides become black. If you find it difficult to use wooden sticks, use tongs to turn pepper?&#3- Once peppers are roasted, place in a bowl with a plastic wrap for 15-20 minutes. This will steam the peppers and aide in removing the skin?&#?&#Step 2 – Cooking the Tomatoes?&#1- While peppers are steaming, gently cook tomatoes with spices, olive oil, tomato paste and garlic in a sauce pan on medium heat?&#2- Cook tomato mixture for 15 minutes on medium heat?&#Stir from time-to-time?&#3- Once cooked on medium heat for 15 minutes, reduce heat to low and then start to get peppers ready?&#?&#Step 3 – Combining the Tomatoes and the Peppers?&#1- Clean Peppers by removing burnt skin, cutting top of pepper and removing seeds?&#2- After cleaning peppers, slice and dice into small cubes?&#3- Add pepper cubes and chopped parsley and cilantro to tomato mixture?&#4- Cook tomatoes and peppers on medium heat for another 15-20 minutes?&#?&#Step 4 – Serving this delicious Cooked Salad?&#1- Salad is ready when it becomes dry and thick.?&#2- If you have preserved lemons, you can use them for decoration. First wash preserved lemon in water to remove some of the salt, then cut lemon and remove pulp so you can use the skin for decoration?&#Serve salad with Moroccan bread or French baguette as an appetizer?&#Eat warm or cold https://www.cookingwithalia.com/taktouka-cooked-salad-with-tomatoes-and-roasted-green-peppers/
4 easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 264 – Traditional Garlic Shrimp https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_264.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound (450 grams) large shrimp?&#6 garlic cloves (thinly sliced)?&#Chili pepper flakes?&#Salt and pepper to taste?&#Extra virgin olive oil?&#Chopped parsley?&#Lemon wedges & sliced baguette Directions :?&#?&#1- Heat olive oil in a cazuela (clay cooking dish) or saute pan.?&#2- Add garlic and chili pepper. Cook for a minute.?&#3- Salt and pepper the shrimp.?&#4- Add the shrimp, cook 2 minutes each side until the shrimp becomes pink. Add salt and pepper to taste.?&#5- If cooked in a cazuela you can serve directly, otherwise, move to a serving dish.?&#6- Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedges and sliced baguette. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/traditional-garlic-shrimp/
Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 011 – Sellou https://www.cookingwithalia.com/sellou/ Ingredients :?&#?&#2 1/4 cup of flour (250 gr)?&#2 cups of almonds (250 gr)?&#1 cup of sesame seeds (125 gr)?&#1/2 cup of honey (150 gr)?&#1 full cup of powdered sugar (125 gr)?&#1 stick of butter (8 tbsp)?&#1 tsp of anis seeds?&#1/2 tbsp of cinammon?&#Pinch of salt Directions :?&#?&#Preheat the oven at 350 degrees, and bake the flour in a pan for 40 minutes or until golden brown.?&#In a non-stick pan, roast the almonds, the sesame seeds and the anis seeds for 15-20 minutes on low heat. Stir constantly to avoid burning the nuts.?&#Take 2/3 of the nuts mixture and finely grind it in a food processor. Mix in the powdered sugar, cinnamon and salt.?&#Coarsely grind the rest of the nuts mixture.?&#In a large bowl, combine the two nuts mixture.?&#Sift the flour and add it to the nuts mixture.?&#Add in the melted butter and the honey.?&#Thoroughly mix all the ingredients.?&#Presentation:?&#1- Create a dome shape with the Sellou, swift powdered sugar over it and decorate with almonds. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/sellou/
4 medium Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 193 – Smoked Salmon and Avocado Egg Rolls https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_193.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 onion (grated)?&#4 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#1 teaspoon of fresh ginger peeled and grated?&#1/2 tablespoon olive oil?&#A pinch of salt?&#Smoked salmon?&#2 Avocados (peeled and sliced)?&#Spring roll wraps (you can replace with Warka or phyllo dough)?&#Vegetable oil for frying or olive oil for baking Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Onion?&#1- First we are going to cook the onion. Drizzle 1/2 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet, add a grated onion, 4 garlic cloves crushed, and 1 teaspoon of ginger paste (basically take fresh ginger, peel it, then grate it). Mix well. Add a pinch of salt – we are not going to add too much salt because smoked salmon is already salty.?&#2- Cook the onion on medium low heat until all the liquid is evaporated and the onion become dry. It will take around 15 minutes.?&#3- Place the onion mixture in a bowl and let it cool down before using it.?&#?&#Step 2: Wrapping the Egg Rolls?&#1- I am using Egg Roll Wraps but feel free to replace them with Warka, which is the famous Moroccan pastry that has an amazing crunchy result (check out my video with Paula Wolfert on how to make home made Warka) or you can use phyllo dough. If you use phyllo dough remember to brush each sheet with melted butter before rolling it.?&#2- Place the wrap down so that it looks like a diamond and place the filling diagonally on the wrap. First, layer the slices of smoked salmon, then add avocado slices, and a bit of the onion mixture. Fold the bottom corner over the filling half way, then fold the sides towards the center to cover the filling. Roll the wrap from the bottom as if you were rolling a carpet, then brush the edge with a bit of water and seal. If you are using warka or phyllo dough use egg wash to seal the roll.?&#?&#Step 3: Cooking the Egg Rolls?&#1- There are 2 ways for cooking the egg rolls you can either bake them or fry them. To bake them, preheat your oven to 400 F degrees (200 C), place the egg rolls in a baking pan covered with parchment paper, and brush them with olive oil. Bake until the egg rolls become golden brown.?&#2- To fry them, heat some vegetable oil in a deep skillet. When the oil is hot, place the egg rolls in the skillet and fry them in all sides until they become deep golden brown. Once done, place the egg rolls in a paper towel and pad to absorb all excess oil. Serve the egg rolls immediately over a lettuce bed.?&#3- You can serve them as is or with a sweet or spicy sauce! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/smoked-salmon-and-avocado-egg-rolls/
6 easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 215 – Savory and Sweet Stuffed Dates https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_215.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#30 Madjool dates?&#1 5.3 oz Dannon, Oikos, Greek Nonfat Plain Yogurt?&#8–10 slices of smoked turkey?&#1/2 cup chopped walnuts Directions :?&#?&#1- Cut the smoked turkey into small pieces.?&#2- In a large bowl, mix the smoked turkey, Dannon® Oikos® Greek Nonfat Plain Yogurt, and chopped walnut together.?&#3- Use a pairing knife to slice the dates and remove the pits. Keep the dates whole.?&#4- Fill the dates with the savory filling. Place the dates in the fridge until ready to serve. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/savory-and-sweet-stuffed-dates/
4 easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 268 – Shrimp Vermicelli Filling Recipe – Briwat Special Episode 1 https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_2681.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#8.8 oz (250 grams) Chinese vermicelli?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons (28 grams) butter?&#1/2 teaspoon salt (to taste)?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon red chili pepper (to taste)?&#3-4 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro?&#10 oz (300 grams) of peeled and pre-cooked shrimp Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Vermicelli?&#1- First, put the Chinese vermicelli in boiling water. Let the vermicelli sit for around 5 minutes until it softens up.?&#2- After 5 minutes, strain the vermicelli from the water.?&#3- Using a sharp knife (and a cutting board), cut the vermicelli into small pieces. Place in a bowl and reserve.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Shrimp?&#1- In a flat pan, add the vegetable oil, butter, salt, paprika, ground cumin, red chili pepper, crushed garlic, and finely copped cilantro. 2- Place the pan on medium heat and cook the spices with the butter and oil for 4-5 minutes.?&#3- Now add the pre-cooked shrimp. Either you buy the shrimp pre-cooked or you buy raw shrimp and place it in boiling water for 3-4 minutes until the shrimp becomes pink.?&#4- Place the shrimp in the pan and mix it well with the spices. Cook for around 3 minutes on medium heat.?&#5- Remove the shrim from the pan and place in a bowl.?&#6- Add the cut vermicelli to the pan and mix it with the remaining sauce / spices.?&#7- Using a knife and cuttin board, cut the shrimp into small pieces.?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Mix the vermicelli and shrimp together.?&#2- Let the filling cool down before you can use it to fill the Phyllo dough or Warka to make Briwat.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/shrimp-vermicelli-filling-briwat-special-episode-1/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 270 – Rolling and Cooking Briwat Recipe – Briwat Special Episode 3 https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_270.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Warka or Phyllo dough?&#Filling (shrimp filling, vegetarian, or any cooked filling of your choice!)?&#Melted butter?&#Egg yolk?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Rolling the Briwat?&#1- Watch the video to see how to roll the briwat into cigars, briwat (triangular shape) or bastilla (round shape)?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Briwat?&#1- you can either fry the briwat. Heat the vegetable oil in a flat pan. Once hot, start frying the briwat from all sides until they become deep golden brown.?&#2- Once done, remove the briwat from the oil and place them in a plate covered with paper towel to absorb all excess oil.?&#3- If you want to bake the briwat, brush them with melted butter and bake them in a preheated oven (400 F / 200 C) until they become deep golden brown. Serve hot!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/rolling-and-cooking-briwat-briwat-special-episode-3/
4 medium Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 119 – Pumpkin & Walnut Stuffing Recipe – Cooking Essentials https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_119.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 pounds of pumpkin (weighted with the skin)?&#2 cups of walnuts?&#3 tablespoons of sugar?&#2 tablespoons of honey?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt?&#1/2 teaspoon of ginger powder?&#1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon powder?&#a pinch of saffron?&#3 tablespoons of butter Directions :?&#?&#Preparing the pumpkin stuffing:?&#1- Remove the seeds from the pumpkin.?&#2- Place the pumpkin on a microwavable place, cover with a plastic wrap, and microwave for 15 minutes or until it becomes soft.?&#Note: if you dont have a microwave, you can cut the pumpkin into chunks and cook them in boiling water.?&#3- Remove the skin of the pumpkin, and cut the pumpkin pulp into chunks.?&#4- On medium heat, melt the butter in a flat pan. Add the pumpkin.?&#5- Cook the pumpkin for 30 minutes, while stirring from time to time and mashing it with a fork until you get a puree.?&#6- After 30 minutes, add the spices, sugar, and honey to the pumpkin.?&#7- Let the pumpkin cook for another 20-30 minutes until the mixture becomes dry. Once dry, taste the pumpkin filling and adjust the spices accordingly.?&#8- Chop the walnuts.?&#9- Mix the walnuts and the pumpkin puree together.?&#Note: This stuffing can be served as a side dish or be used for stuffing. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/pumpkin-walnut-stuffing-cooking-essentials/
Very easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 094 – Moroccan Lentils https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/lentil-small_3c684ac5ac1eb321b8ed359a86443636.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#9 oz of lentils, soaked in water for few hours?&#1 onion, thinly sliced?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#4 minced garlic cloves?&#1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder?&#1/2 teaspoon of cumin – to be adjusted during cooking?&#1 teaspoon of salt – to be adjusted during cooking?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper – to be adjusted during cooking Directions :?&#?&#Add the olive oil, onion, tomato, tomato paste, garlic, and spices to your pan.?&#Stir all the ingredients, cover your pan and cook for 5 minutes on medium heat.?&#Drain the lentils from the water and add to the pan. Mix well all the ingredients.?&#Cover your pan and let the lentils cook for 30 minutes on medium heat. Stir from time to time. Check on the water level and add if necessary. There should always be a some sauce in the pan.?&#After 30 minutes, taste the sauce and adjust the salt, pepper, and cumin to taste.?&#Add the chopped cilantro and parsley to the lentils. Stir well. Cover the pan and cook for another 10 minutes or until the lentils are done. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-lentils/
Very easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 096 – Moroccan Spring Rolls with Tuna and Potatoes https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/tunaspringrolls_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 potatoes peeled and diced?&#10 oz of tuna in water (drain the tuna from its liquid)?&#1 chopped onion?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#1 tablespoon of capers (can be replaced by small pieces of preserved lemons or gherkins?&#Spring roll pastry?&#1 egg (to make an egg wash mix the egg with 1 tablespoon water)?&#Oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#1.Cook the potatoes in boiling water until they become tender.?&#?&#2.On medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in a pan, and cook the onion until it becomes golden brown.?&#?&#3.Once the potatoes are cooked, drain them from the water and place them in a big bowl.?&#?&#4.Mash the potatoes with a fork.?&#?&#5.Add the onion, tuna, parsley, spices, and capers to the mashed potatoes. Mix well.?&#?&#6.Roll the spring rolls.?&#?&#7.Layer your filling on the edge of the wrapper closest to you.?&#?&#8.Gently pull away the edge of wrapper from work surface and roll over the filling.?&#?&#9.Fold both sides of the wrapper to the center.?&#?&#10.Slowly start to roll away from you. Brush the end of the roll with egg wash and close.?&#?&#11.To cook the spring rolls brush the rolls with melted butter, preheat the oven at 400 F degrees, and bake until they become golden brown. Heat vegetable oil, and fry the spring rolls until they become golden brown. Remove excess oil with towel paper. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-spring-rolls-with-tuna-and-potatoes/
4 medium Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 115 – Mini Shrimp Bastila Recipe – Ramadan Specials https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_115.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#9 oz of uncooked shrimp?&#2 small rolls of Chinese vermicelli (also known as bean thread)?&#1 oz dried porcini mushrooms (can also use another variety of dried black mushrooms)?&#2 tablespoons of finely chopped cilantro?&#3 garlic cloves?&#2 scallion heads?&#1 tomato?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#Some hot chili pepper?&#Pinch of saffron?&#2 bay leaves?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#In Morocco they use a pastry called WAKU but if you cant find it, feel free to use spring roll pastry or filler?&#dough?&#Butter?&#1 egg?&#Shredded swiss cheese or any cheese of choice that melts easily Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Filling?&#1. Pour hot water over the dried mushrooms and let it sit for 10-15 minutes or until they become soft?&#2. Grate the tomato?&#3. Slice the scallions?&#4. Mince the garlic?&#5. Cook shrimp in boiling water and add the (2) bay leaves to the water?&#6. While shrimp is cooking, drain mushrooms from water and cut into small pieces?&#7. Keep water that mushrooms soak in because you will use it later?&#8. When shrimp becomes pink, you will know it’s cooked.?&#9. Remove shrimp from water and put it in a bowl?&#10. Clean shrimp from shells and cut into small pieces?&#11. Add 1-cup of the water that mushrooms were soaking into water that shrimp cooked in?&#12. Bring water mixture to a boiling point (it will be used to cook vermicelli?&#13. Once water boils, cook vermicelli for 5 minutes. Once it is cooked, drain from water?&#14. Use scissors to cut vermicelli into small pieces?&#?&#Step 2 – Sauté the Filling?&#1. Last step is to sauté all ingredients in a pan?&#2. On medium heat, drizzle olive oil into pan and add garlic and scallions?&#3. Add tomato?&#4. Add spices?&#5. Let tomato cook 2-3 minutes?&#6. Add mushrooms?&#7. Add cilantro?&#8. Cook mushrooms a few minutes?&#9. Add shrimp?&#10. Add vermicelli?&#11. Taste mixture and add spices accordingly?&#12. Transfer mixture into a bowl?&#13. Let filling completely cool down before using Bastila?&#?&#Step 3 – Assemble the Bastila?&#1. Melt butter and beat egg?&#2. Spring roll pastry gets dry quickly so while working, cover it with a damp towel?&#3. Now assemble the Bastila. Use a small circular dish to shape them?&#4. Brush pastry with melted butter then add filing, cover with cheese, shape the bastila and brush with an egg?&#5. Brush dish with melted butter?&#6. Cover in parchment paper?&#7. Place (2) pastries in each side of dish and brush them with the melted butter?&#8. Place a sheet in the center, brush it with butter?&#9. Add filling in center and cheese on top?&#10. Bring each side of the pastry to the center and brush with an egg?&#11. Add one more pastry on top and brush with butter?&#12. Turn over plate and brush bottom with egg?&#13. Place mini bastila on baking sheet and brush top with egg?&#14. Pre-heat oven to 400°?&#15. Bastila is done when surface is golden brown. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mini-shrimp-bastila-ramadan-specials/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 133 – M’Batten Recipe – Fried Potato Pockets with Meat (Recipe from Libya) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_133.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound of ground lamb (or beef)?&#1 onion, grated?&#¼ cup of finely chopped cilantro?&#¼ cup of finely chopped parsley?&#6 scallions, chopped, only the white part?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/3 teaspoon of red chile pepper?&#¼ teaspoon of cinnamon powder?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#½ teaspoon of turmeric powder?&#3 garlic cloves?&#1 egg?&#1 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#Large white potatoes?&#Flour egg and vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Meat?&#1. Mix the egg, spices, garlic and tomato paste with ground meat.?&#2. Over medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in your pan.?&#3. Add the grated onion and cook for a few minutes.?&#4. After a few minute of cooking the inions, add the meat.?&#5. Cook the meat until done.?&#6. Once the meat is cooked, about 10 minutes, taste the meat and cook the spices accordingly.?&#7. Place the meat in a large bowl.?&#8. Add the cilantro, parsley and scallions to the cooked meat.?&#9. Let the mixture cool down.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Potatoes?&#1. Peel the potatoes?&#2. Slice the potatoes – the goal is to get pieces that look like a potato sandwich to fill with the meat.?&#3. Slice about ¾ of the way through the potato then make the next slice all the way down the potato.?&#?&#Step 3: Assembling and Frying the M’Batten?&#1. Take a potato sandwich and fill it with the meat then dip it in the egg and the flour.?&#2. The last step is to fry the M’Batten.?&#3. Heat the oil until it becomes very hot, then fry the M’Batten until they become golden brown.?&#4. Lace the fried M’Batten on paper towels to drain excess oil then sprinkle salt on top.?&#5. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mbatten-fried-potato-pockets-with-meat-recipe-from-libya/
6 easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 215 – Savory and Sweet Stuffed Dates https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_215.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#30 Madjool dates?&#1 5.3 oz Dannon, Oikos, Greek Nonfat Plain Yogurt?&#8–10 slices of smoked turkey?&#1/2 cup chopped walnuts Directions :?&#?&#1- Cut the smoked turkey into small pieces.?&#2- In a large bowl, mix the smoked turkey, Dannon® Oikos® Greek Nonfat Plain Yogurt, and chopped walnut together.?&#3- Use a pairing knife to slice the dates and remove the pits. Keep the dates whole.?&#4- Fill the dates with the savory filling. Place the dates in the fridge until ready to serve. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/savory-and-sweet-stuffed-dates/
4 easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 268 – Shrimp Vermicelli Filling Recipe – Briwat Special Episode 1 https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_2681.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#8.8 oz (250 grams) Chinese vermicelli?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons (28 grams) butter?&#1/2 teaspoon salt (to taste)?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon red chili pepper (to taste)?&#3-4 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro?&#10 oz (300 grams) of peeled and pre-cooked shrimp Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Vermicelli?&#1- First, put the Chinese vermicelli in boiling water. Let the vermicelli sit for around 5 minutes until it softens up.?&#2- After 5 minutes, strain the vermicelli from the water.?&#3- Using a sharp knife (and a cutting board), cut the vermicelli into small pieces. Place in a bowl and reserve.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Shrimp?&#1- In a flat pan, add the vegetable oil, butter, salt, paprika, ground cumin, red chili pepper, crushed garlic, and finely copped cilantro. 2- Place the pan on medium heat and cook the spices with the butter and oil for 4-5 minutes.?&#3- Now add the pre-cooked shrimp. Either you buy the shrimp pre-cooked or you buy raw shrimp and place it in boiling water for 3-4 minutes until the shrimp becomes pink.?&#4- Place the shrimp in the pan and mix it well with the spices. Cook for around 3 minutes on medium heat.?&#5- Remove the shrim from the pan and place in a bowl.?&#6- Add the cut vermicelli to the pan and mix it with the remaining sauce / spices.?&#7- Using a knife and cuttin board, cut the shrimp into small pieces.?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Mix the vermicelli and shrimp together.?&#2- Let the filling cool down before you can use it to fill the Phyllo dough or Warka to make Briwat.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/shrimp-vermicelli-filling-briwat-special-episode-1/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 270 – Rolling and Cooking Briwat Recipe – Briwat Special Episode 3 https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_270.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Warka or Phyllo dough?&#Filling (shrimp filling, vegetarian, or any cooked filling of your choice!)?&#Melted butter?&#Egg yolk?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Rolling the Briwat?&#1- Watch the video to see how to roll the briwat into cigars, briwat (triangular shape) or bastilla (round shape)?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Briwat?&#1- you can either fry the briwat. Heat the vegetable oil in a flat pan. Once hot, start frying the briwat from all sides until they become deep golden brown.?&#2- Once done, remove the briwat from the oil and place them in a plate covered with paper towel to absorb all excess oil.?&#3- If you want to bake the briwat, brush them with melted butter and bake them in a preheated oven (400 F / 200 C) until they become deep golden brown. Serve hot!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/rolling-and-cooking-briwat-briwat-special-episode-3/
4 medium Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 119 – Pumpkin & Walnut Stuffing Recipe – Cooking Essentials https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_119.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 pounds of pumpkin (weighted with the skin)?&#2 cups of walnuts?&#3 tablespoons of sugar?&#2 tablespoons of honey?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt?&#1/2 teaspoon of ginger powder?&#1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon powder?&#a pinch of saffron?&#3 tablespoons of butter Directions :?&#?&#Preparing the pumpkin stuffing:?&#1- Remove the seeds from the pumpkin.?&#2- Place the pumpkin on a microwavable place, cover with a plastic wrap, and microwave for 15 minutes or until it becomes soft.?&#Note: if you dont have a microwave, you can cut the pumpkin into chunks and cook them in boiling water.?&#3- Remove the skin of the pumpkin, and cut the pumpkin pulp into chunks.?&#4- On medium heat, melt the butter in a flat pan. Add the pumpkin.?&#5- Cook the pumpkin for 30 minutes, while stirring from time to time and mashing it with a fork until you get a puree.?&#6- After 30 minutes, add the spices, sugar, and honey to the pumpkin.?&#7- Let the pumpkin cook for another 20-30 minutes until the mixture becomes dry. Once dry, taste the pumpkin filling and adjust the spices accordingly.?&#8- Chop the walnuts.?&#9- Mix the walnuts and the pumpkin puree together.?&#Note: This stuffing can be served as a side dish or be used for stuffing. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/pumpkin-walnut-stuffing-cooking-essentials/
Very easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 094 – Moroccan Lentils https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/lentil-small_3c684ac5ac1eb321b8ed359a86443636.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#9 oz of lentils, soaked in water for few hours?&#1 onion, thinly sliced?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#4 minced garlic cloves?&#1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder?&#1/2 teaspoon of cumin – to be adjusted during cooking?&#1 teaspoon of salt – to be adjusted during cooking?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper – to be adjusted during cooking Directions :?&#?&#Add the olive oil, onion, tomato, tomato paste, garlic, and spices to your pan.?&#Stir all the ingredients, cover your pan and cook for 5 minutes on medium heat.?&#Drain the lentils from the water and add to the pan. Mix well all the ingredients.?&#Cover your pan and let the lentils cook for 30 minutes on medium heat. Stir from time to time. Check on the water level and add if necessary. There should always be a some sauce in the pan.?&#After 30 minutes, taste the sauce and adjust the salt, pepper, and cumin to taste.?&#Add the chopped cilantro and parsley to the lentils. Stir well. Cover the pan and cook for another 10 minutes or until the lentils are done. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-lentils/
Very easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 096 – Moroccan Spring Rolls with Tuna and Potatoes https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/tunaspringrolls_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 potatoes peeled and diced?&#10 oz of tuna in water (drain the tuna from its liquid)?&#1 chopped onion?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#1 tablespoon of capers (can be replaced by small pieces of preserved lemons or gherkins?&#Spring roll pastry?&#1 egg (to make an egg wash mix the egg with 1 tablespoon water)?&#Oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#1.Cook the potatoes in boiling water until they become tender.?&#?&#2.On medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in a pan, and cook the onion until it becomes golden brown.?&#?&#3.Once the potatoes are cooked, drain them from the water and place them in a big bowl.?&#?&#4.Mash the potatoes with a fork.?&#?&#5.Add the onion, tuna, parsley, spices, and capers to the mashed potatoes. Mix well.?&#?&#6.Roll the spring rolls.?&#?&#7.Layer your filling on the edge of the wrapper closest to you.?&#?&#8.Gently pull away the edge of wrapper from work surface and roll over the filling.?&#?&#9.Fold both sides of the wrapper to the center.?&#?&#10.Slowly start to roll away from you. Brush the end of the roll with egg wash and close.?&#?&#11.To cook the spring rolls brush the rolls with melted butter, preheat the oven at 400 F degrees, and bake until they become golden brown. Heat vegetable oil, and fry the spring rolls until they become golden brown. Remove excess oil with towel paper. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-spring-rolls-with-tuna-and-potatoes/
4 medium Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 115 – Mini Shrimp Bastila Recipe – Ramadan Specials https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_115.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#9 oz of uncooked shrimp?&#2 small rolls of Chinese vermicelli (also known as bean thread)?&#1 oz dried porcini mushrooms (can also use another variety of dried black mushrooms)?&#2 tablespoons of finely chopped cilantro?&#3 garlic cloves?&#2 scallion heads?&#1 tomato?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#Some hot chili pepper?&#Pinch of saffron?&#2 bay leaves?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#In Morocco they use a pastry called WAKU but if you cant find it, feel free to use spring roll pastry or filler?&#dough?&#Butter?&#1 egg?&#Shredded swiss cheese or any cheese of choice that melts easily Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Filling?&#1. Pour hot water over the dried mushrooms and let it sit for 10-15 minutes or until they become soft?&#2. Grate the tomato?&#3. Slice the scallions?&#4. Mince the garlic?&#5. Cook shrimp in boiling water and add the (2) bay leaves to the water?&#6. While shrimp is cooking, drain mushrooms from water and cut into small pieces?&#7. Keep water that mushrooms soak in because you will use it later?&#8. When shrimp becomes pink, you will know it’s cooked.?&#9. Remove shrimp from water and put it in a bowl?&#10. Clean shrimp from shells and cut into small pieces?&#11. Add 1-cup of the water that mushrooms were soaking into water that shrimp cooked in?&#12. Bring water mixture to a boiling point (it will be used to cook vermicelli?&#13. Once water boils, cook vermicelli for 5 minutes. Once it is cooked, drain from water?&#14. Use scissors to cut vermicelli into small pieces?&#?&#Step 2 – Sauté the Filling?&#1. Last step is to sauté all ingredients in a pan?&#2. On medium heat, drizzle olive oil into pan and add garlic and scallions?&#3. Add tomato?&#4. Add spices?&#5. Let tomato cook 2-3 minutes?&#6. Add mushrooms?&#7. Add cilantro?&#8. Cook mushrooms a few minutes?&#9. Add shrimp?&#10. Add vermicelli?&#11. Taste mixture and add spices accordingly?&#12. Transfer mixture into a bowl?&#13. Let filling completely cool down before using Bastila?&#?&#Step 3 – Assemble the Bastila?&#1. Melt butter and beat egg?&#2. Spring roll pastry gets dry quickly so while working, cover it with a damp towel?&#3. Now assemble the Bastila. Use a small circular dish to shape them?&#4. Brush pastry with melted butter then add filing, cover with cheese, shape the bastila and brush with an egg?&#5. Brush dish with melted butter?&#6. Cover in parchment paper?&#7. Place (2) pastries in each side of dish and brush them with the melted butter?&#8. Place a sheet in the center, brush it with butter?&#9. Add filling in center and cheese on top?&#10. Bring each side of the pastry to the center and brush with an egg?&#11. Add one more pastry on top and brush with butter?&#12. Turn over plate and brush bottom with egg?&#13. Place mini bastila on baking sheet and brush top with egg?&#14. Pre-heat oven to 400°?&#15. Bastila is done when surface is golden brown. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mini-shrimp-bastila-ramadan-specials/

Very easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 097 – Maakouda – Moroccan Potato Patties https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/maakouda_small2_f36a86727b352fd9d2c8697fa9d3b0a4.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound of potatoes, peeled and diced?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#¼ teaspoon of pepper?&#1 egg?&#3 minced garlic cloves?&#Other ingredients?&#Flour?&#2 eggs?&#Oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Potato Mixture?&#?&#1. Cook the potatoes in boiling water until they become soft.?&#2. Once the potatoes are cooked, drain them from the water.?&#3. Mash the potatoes with a fork or a manual potato masher.?&#4. Add the parsley and cilantro, egg and garlic and splices to the potatoes. If you like spicy food you can add hot chile pepper to the potatoes.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Patties?&#?&#1. Make small patties out of the potato mix.?&#?&#Step 3: Frying the Maakouda?&#?&#1. First heat the oil in the skillet?&#2. Dip the potato patties in the egg, then the flour and then fry them. Make sure the oil is very hot before frying.?&#3. Cook the Maakouda until it becomes golden brown and use paper towel to absorb the excess oil.?&#4. Serve the Maakouda immediately. You can serve it as an appetizer or as the way it is sold on the street in Morocco as a sandwich using French bread or Moroccan bread lettuce, tomato and hot sauce. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/maakouda-moroccan-potato-patties/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 149 – Moroccan Fava Beans with Charmoula Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_149.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound fresh fava beans (weighed with the skin)?&#1 tomato (grated)?&#1/3 cup finely chopped cilantro?&#1/3 cup olive oil?&#3 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#½ teaspoon of salt?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1 teaspoon cumin?&#water Directions :?&#?&#1. Peel all the fava beans and discard the skins. If you find large fava beans, slice the head with a pairing knife so that it can absorb the spices when cooked.?&#2. In a saucepan, mix the 1/3 cup olive oil with 1/4 cup water. Mix well and let the oil and water cook on medium heat until they start bubbling.?&#3. Add the fava beans to the oil / water mixture. Also, add the rest of the ingredients (garlic, cilantro, and spices). Mix well.?&#4. Add water to the saucepan until all the fava beans are covered with water. Cover the pan and let the fava beans cook for 50 minutes on medium heat. Stir the fava beans from time to time.?&#5. Cut the tomtato in half and grate it. Discard the skin.?&#6. Once the fava beans are cooked, add the grated tomato to the saucepan with the fava beans. Then let the fava beans and tomato cook for 3-4 minutes uncovered.?&#7. Serve the fava beans hot with Moroccan or French bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-fava-beans-with-charmoula/
2 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 161 – Moroccan Tomato Jam (Appetizer) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_161.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 pounds red ripe tomatoes?&#3 tablespoons honey (preferably orange blossom honey)?&#2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil?&#2 teaspoons orange blossom water?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#salt and pepper to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- Preheat your oven to 450 F degrees.?&#2- Place the tomatoes in a baking pan covered with foil.?&#3- Bake the tomatoes for 1 hours and 15 minutes until they become charred and soft.?&#4- Once the tomatoes are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool down.?&#5- Peel, seed, and chop the tomatoes into chunks.?&#6- Place the tomato chunks in a bowl and drain them as much as possible from their juice.?&#7- On medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in a skillet. Let it heat up for 1 minute.?&#8- Add the tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 20 minutes until most of the liquid has evaporated.?&#9- After 20 minutes, add the honey, orange blossom water, cinnamon, salt, and pepper to the tomatoes.?&#10- Increase the heat to medium-high and continue cooking for another 15 minutes until the tomatoes are dry and cramelized.?&#11- Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds on the Tomato jam before serving (hot or cold) with bread and crackers.?&#Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-tomato-jam/
6 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 218 – Mashed Potatoes Moroccan Style Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_218.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1.5 pounds (650 grams) gold potatoes?&#3 garlic cloves (peeled)?&#2 bay leaves?&#2/3 cup Dannon Oikos plain non-fat Greek yogurt?&#1 tablespoons finely choppsed cilantro?&#Salt, pepper, ground cumin to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Cooking the Potatoes?&#1- Pleel and slice the potatoes. Place the potatoes in a large bowl of cold water once peeled so they do not turn brown.?&#2- Drain the potatoes from the water, then place them in a large pot. Cover with cold water, add salt, the garlic cloves, and bay leaves. Cook on medium-high heat, covered, for around 30 minutes or until the potatoes become soft.?&#?&#Step 2: Rolling the Truffles?&#1- Drain the potatoes from the water and place them in a large bowl.?&#2- Add the greek yogurt and cilantro to the potatos. Mash with a manual potato-masher, fork, or food processor.?&#3- Season with salt, pepper, and ground cumin to taste. Serve immediately.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mashed-potatoes-moroccan-style/
4 Medium Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 271 – Mini Chicken Bastilla https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_271.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 pound (500 grams) chicken (breast and legs)?&#1 large onion (finely chopped)?&#2 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped parsley?&#Chicken spices:?&#1 tsp salt?&#1/2 tsp pepper?&#1/2 tsp ground turmeric?&#1/4 tsp ground cinnamon?&#2 tsps ground ginger?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#2 tablespoons white granulated sugar?&#3 large eggs?&#1 cup raw blanched almonds?&#1/4 cup granulated sugar?&#Vegetable oil for frying?&#Warka or Phyllo Dough?&#Egg yolk (for glueing the warka)?&#Melted butter?&#Vegetable oil for frying (or you can bake the Bastilla)?&#Powder sugar and ground cinnamon for decoration Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Cooking the Chicken?&#1- Place the chicken in a cooking pot.?&#2- Add the chopped onion to the chicken.?&#3- Add the crushed garlic, the finely chopped cilantro, the finely chopped parsley, salt, pepper, ground turmeric, ground cinnamon, and ground ginger.?&#4- Also add the vegetable oil and olive oil.?&#5- Mix all the ingredients together.?&#6- Cover the pot and cook the chicken on medium-high heat until done. From time to time, check on the chicken, turn it over, and add hot water if necessary for the chicken not to stick to the pot and burn. Also, the water is necessary to cook the chicken – but there should never be more than 2 cups of sauce in the pot.?&#7- It will take around 30 minutes for the chicken to be cooked. You know it is done when you taste it or cut it and the chicken is soft.?&#8- When the chicken is ready add the sugar to the pot and mix it in with the sauce. Cook the chicken and sauce on medium heat for around 1-2 minutes until the sugar is dissolved in the sauce.?&#9- Remove the chicken from the sauce. Place it in a plate and reserve. Keep the sauce in the pot, we are going to use it in the next steps.?&#Step 2: Cooking the Eggs?&#1- Break the eggs and add them to the sauce in the pot. Stir to mix in the eggs. Cook the eggs in the sauce on medium-high heat for around 4-5 minutes until they are cooked. You will see they are done when they become solid.?&#2- Once cooked, pour the eggs and the sauce in a strainer. Stir until the liquid is removed from the solids. Discard the liquid and keep the solid egg-onion mixture.?&#3- Place the egg-onion mixture in a large plate, and shred the chicken on top.?&#4- Mix both the egg mixture and the chicken pieces. Reserve until it cools down before using.?&#Step 3: Preparing the Almond Mixture?&#1- Heat vegetable oil in a flat pan. Once hot, add the blanched almonds to it and fry for around 5-8 minutes until they become golden brown.?&#2- Place the almonds on a plate covered with paper towel to absorb excess oil.?&#3- Using a food processor, mix the fried almonds with the sugar until you get a smooth paste.?&#Step 4: Assembling the Bastilla?&#1- Take a round Warka dough and brush with melted butter. You can also use phyllo dough.?&#2- Place a little bit of the chicken-egg mixture in the center of the warka. Top the chicken mixture with a little bit of the almond mixture.?&#3- Bring the sides of the wark to the center to cover the filling creating a circular shape. Use egg yolk to glue the wark in the center.?&#4- Cover the center with another warka and flip the bastilla. Now the chicken filling is at the top facing you.?&#5- Bring the edges of the warka to the center creating a circular shape. Use egg yolk to glue the edges.?&#6- Flip the bastilla again. Now the almond filling should be at the top, facing you. this is how you serve the bastilla (the almond filling at the top and the chicken filling below it). Brush the bastilla with melted butter.?&#Step 5: Cooking the Bastilla?&#1- You can either bake the bastilla in a hot oven (380 F / 190 C) until the bastilla becomes deep golden brown. Or you can heat vegetable oil in a flat pan and fry the mini bastilla from both sides.?&#2- Decorate with dusted powder sugar and ground cinnamon. Serve hot.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mini-chicken-bastilla-briwat-special-episode-3/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 302 – Moroccan Hash Browns Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_302.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 potatoes (around 1 pound / 500 grams)?&#1 teaspoon crushed garlic?&#1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper?&#1 large egg?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Potatoes:?&#1- Peel the potatoes. When you finish peeling a potatoe, place it in a bowl of water so it does not turn brown.?&#2- Using the large holes of a grater, grate the potatoes.?&#3- In a separate bowl, lightly beat the egg, salt, pepper, and garlic.?&#4- The final step is to squeeze the grated potatoes to get rid of the water they release, place them in a large bowl, add the egg mixture to them, and mix well.?&#?&#Step 2 – Frying the Potatoes:?&#1- Place the oil in a pan and heat it on medium-high heat.?&#2- You can check if the oil is ready ready by putting a shred of potato in the pan – if it’s sizzling then you’re good to go.?&#3- Reduce the heat to medium and place little bits of potato mixture and fry from both sides until they become golden brown.?&#4- Place the fried potatoes in a plate covered with paper towel to absorb any excess oil.?&#5- Serve immediately (hot) with ketchup!?&#bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-hash-browns/
4 Very easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 321 – Meat & Mushrooms Spring Rolls Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_321.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#300 grams ground meat?&#250 grams fresh (or canned) mushrooms?&#Meat spices: 1 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt,?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper?&#Salt and pepper to taste?&#Grated cheese?&#1 egg lightly beaten (to close the springrolls)?&#Butter?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Cooking the Ingredients?&#1- First, let’s prepare the filling items.?&#On Medium heat, melt some butter in a pan, add the mushrooms, a little bit of water, salt, and pepper. Stir the mushrooms and let them cook for 10 minutes or until they become soft. Keep in a bowl.?&#2- Now, in the same pan, melt some butter still on medium heat. Add the ground beef, and the spices: we have salt, pepper, paprika, and cumin! Stir the meat so all the spiced are mixed. Cook for around 10 minutes. The meat will become brown, it will release juices… hmmmm, the smell is just amazing! Once you see that the juices are reducing, remove the meat before it dries out.?&#?&#Step 2: Rolling the Cigars (Briwat)?&#1- Now, let’s get rolling!?&#Here is my warka – it’s home made, just check my video on how to make it yourself!?&#Since my warka is very thin, I am using two sheets superposed.?&#2- Very important – let the meat and mushrooms cool down before using them! OK??&#So put some of the meat in the edge of the warka closest to you. Add some mushrooms, and grated cheese?&#3- Roll the edge of the warka over the filling, fold both sides of the warka to the center, then roll the edge that contains the filling as if you were rolling a carpet.?&#4- Brush the edge with the egg… finish rolling and VOILA. It’s ready!?&#?&#Step 3: Frying the Springrolls!?&#1- On medium heat, heat some vegetable oil in a frying pan?&#2- Once hot, place the spring rolls in the oil. Fry for a few minutes from all sides, until they get a beautiful golden brown color.?&#3- Once ready, place the spring rolls in paper towel to absorb excess oil.?&#And that’s it… serve immediately, when they are hot, and enjoy these crunchy, cheesy, meaty spring rolls… YUMMMY! Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/meat-mushrooms-spring-rolls/
Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 052 – Loubia – Moroccan White Beans https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/loubia_277e6d68a7340632bf65075e13c3b29f.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 can of cannellini beans (white beans)?&#1 onion finely chopped?&#1 tomato peeled and diced?&#1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon of chopped parsley?&#1/2 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#1 cup of water?&#1 teaspoon of crushed garlic?&#1 large pinch of turmeric powder?&#1/2 teaspoon of cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#On medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in your pan. Add the onions and let them cook for 2 minutes white stirring.?&#Add the tomatoes to the onions and let them cook for another 2 minutes while stirring.?&#Add the parsley, cilantro, garlic, tomato paste, spices, and the water to the pan. Mix all the ingredients.?&#Wash and drain the beans, then add them to the pan.?&#Cover your pan and let the beans cook for the next 20 minutes. From time to time, stir the beans and check the level of water.?&#Serving:?&#Serve loubia hot with bread. Enjoy!?&#A note on Cannellini Beans (white beans):?&#If you are using dry white beans, make sure to soak them overnight. Boil them until they become tender before using them in this recipe. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/loubia-moroccan-white-beans-3/
1 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 337 – Easy Homemade Pizza https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_337.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Pizza dough (check out my recipe)?&#Pasta tomato sauce (of your choice)?&#Shredded cheese?&#Cherry tomatoes (halved)?&#Black olives (sliced)?&#2 onions (thinly sliced)?&#Olive oil?&#Salt Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Crust?&#1- We are using homemade pizza dough – check out my recipe?&#2- On a floured surface, stretch the dough with your fingers. The dough is very elastic and easy to manipulate. Place the dough on a pizza plate and keep stretching it to fit.?&#For the toppings, I am going very simple?&#?&#Step 2: Pizza Toppings?&#1- You can use any toppings of your choice!?&#2- First, the onions! In a pan, drizzle some olive oil, add thinly sliced onions, some salt, and cook on medium-low heat for 15 minutes or so, until the onions melt and get a beautiful golden brown color.?&#3- Here I have tomato sauce that I spread on top of the pizza dough.?&#4- Then I add different types of shredded cheese. Top it with the yummy onions – and of course more cheese!?&#5- I also have cherry tomatoes, cut in half, and black olives!?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Pizza?&#1- Preheat your oven at 400 F which is 200 C degrees?&#2- bake for around 25 minutes until the crust is slightly brown?&#3- I love to top my pizza with fresh rocket salad! Oh YUM! Crispy, cheesy, delicious… This is the perfect homemade pizza!?&#?&#Bon appetite https://www.cookingwithalia.com/easy-homemade-pizza/
Easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 041 – Crème Caramel (Flan) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/flan_25c182bc0493cbf39a87d7a91af1d19e.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 large eggs?&#2/3 cup of sugar?&#2 1/3 cups of milk?&#1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract or a pinch of saffron + 1/2 teaspoon of cardamom?&#Ingredients for the Caramel?&#1 cup of sugar?&#1/4 cup of water?&#1/2 teaspoon of lemon Directions :?&#?&#Steps for making the Caramel:?&#?&#1- On medium heat, cook the sugar, lemon juice, and water in a pan until the sugar turns into a light golden caramel.?&#2- Pour the caramel into the flan ramequins.?&#?&#Steps for making the Flan:?&#?&#1- Put the milk to boil.?&#2- Beat the eggs with the sugar until you get a whitish mixture.?&#3- Once the milk is boiled add the flavoring (for the traditional recipe add the vanilla, or give your flan a twist by adding the saffron and cardamom)?&#4- Slowly beat in the milk into the egg mixture.?&#5- Place the ramequins in a baking pan and pour the milk and egg mixture in the ramequins.?&#?&#Final steps:?&#?&#1- Preheat your oven at 400 degree.?&#2- Add hot water in the baking pan and bake the flan for 1 hour or until the mixture is set.?&#3- Let the flan cool down before putting the ramequins in the fridge for the next 1 hour or 2.?&#?&#Serving:?&#?&#Serve the flan cold. Gently separate the edges of the flan with a knife, top the ramequin with a plate and flip it, shake a little bit and the flan will be transferred to your plate. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/creme-caramel-flan/
easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 262 – Chilled Tomato Gazpacho https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_262.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 pounds (900 grams) ripe tomatoes (seeded and chopped)?&#1 cup cubed day old bread (crust removed)?&#1 small red bell pepper (seeded and chopped)?&#1 persian cucumber (peeled and chopped)?&#1 small garlic cloves (crushed)?&#1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil?&#2 tablespoons Jerez vinegar (or white vinegar)?&#1/4 cup water?&#Salt and pepper to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepping the Ingredients?&#Note: Recipe courtsey of Chef Sandra Cordero from the Cordero Negro?&#1- Clean, cut out core at top, and chop the tomatoes, bell pepper, cucumber, and shallot.?&#2- Soak bread in water, then squeeze out excess of water from the bread.?&#?&#Step 2: Blending the Ingredients?&#1- Mix all the ingredients and place in a blender.?&#2- Add olive oil, vinegar, and water.?&#3- Also add garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper.?&#4- Blend well all ingredients until you get a smooth texture.?&#5- Pour the gazpacho through a strainer into a pitcher, to get rid of all the clumps and have a smooth texture.?&#6- Cover the gazpacho and chill in the fridge for 1 hour before serving.?&#7- Serve in small or medium glasses and garnish with diced cucumber or/and chives.?&#Serve cold. Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chilled-tomato-gazpacho/
2 Very easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 316 – Chickpea Salad Moroccan Style https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_316.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 can (400 grams weighed with liquid) of chickpeas?&#A small bunch of cilantro?&#1 teaspoon lemon juice?&#2 teaspoons paprika?&#1 teaspoon cumin?&#salt and pepper to taste?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 garlic clove (crushed) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Steaming the canned chickpeas?&#1- We are using canned chickpeas… no overnight soaking, boiling, or extra work needed.?&#2- Just drain the canned chickpeas from their juices and place them, in a sieve, over boiling water… basically, we are steaming the chickpeas for 5 minutes just to heat them up.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the spices?&#1- In the meantime, finely chop the cilantro – you can also use parsley if you want. You don’t have any herbs in hand? no worries – keep going. This recipe is risk free! It will still be good!?&#2- Let’s make our spice mix – we need olive oil, a little bit of lemon juice, crushed garlic, ground cumin, paprika, pepper, and salt!!! Of course, you can adjust these spices to your taste!?&#3- Add a bit of the chopped cilantro – mix well, and you’re done!?&#?&#Step 3: Serve!?&#1- Place the hot chickpeas in a large bowl, add your spice mix, and give it a nice toss!?&#2- Serve in a plate, top with chopped cilantro, and eat right away!!!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chickpea-salad-moroccan-style-2/
4 Very easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 322 – Cheese Walnut Spring Rolls Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_322.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#7 oz (200 grams) creamy cheese (any type you like)?&#1/2 cup raw unsalted walnuts?&#1 egg lightly beaten (to close the springrolls)?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Using a sharp knife, chop the walnuts into small pieces.?&#2- n a bowl, mix the cream cheese with a fork. You can use goat cheese, or any creamy cheese of your choice.?&#3- Add the chopped walnuts and mix well.?&#4- In a separate bowl, lightly beat an egg.?&#?&#Step 2: Rolling the Cigars (Briwat)?&#1- Now, let’s get rolling!?&#Here is my warka – it’s home made, just check my video on how to make it yourself!?&#Since my warka is very thin, I am using two sheets superposed.?&#2- Put some of the cheese mixture in the edge of the warka closest to you?&#3- Roll the edge of the warka over the filling, fold both sides of the warka to the center, then roll the edge that contains the filling as if you were rolling a carpet.?&#4- Brush the edge with the egg… finish rolling and VOILA. It’s ready!?&#?&#Step 3: Frying the Springrolls!?&#1- On medium heat, heat some vegetable oil in a frying pan?&#2- Once hot, place the spring rolls in the oil. Fry for a few minutes from all sides, until they get a beautiful golden brown color.?&#3- Once ready, place the spring rolls in paper towel to absorb excess oil.And that’s it…?&#4- Drizzle with honey and serve immediately. Enjoy these crunchy, cheesy, nutty spring rolls… YUMMMY!?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/cheese-walnut-spring-rolls/
Very easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 032 – Moroccan Briwat with Goat Cheese https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/briwat_with_goat_cheese_77958bbfdf484cc6bc9a62a9e091e803.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Spring roll pastry (or Pastilla pastry if you can find it)?&#9 Oz of creamy goat cheese?&#1 egg yolk?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#Oil for frying?&#(Optional for spicy Briwat) Hot chili pepper to taste?&#(Optional for spicy Briwat) 1/4 cup of chopped parsley?&#(Optional for sweet Briwat) Honey Directions :?&#?&#Steps for making the filling:?&#?&#1- Mix the goat cheese with the egg yolk and the pepper?&#2- For spicy Briwat: if you are making spicy Briwat add the parsley and the hot chili pepper to the goat cheese mixture.?&#?&#Steps for rolling the Briwat:?&#?&#Put the equivalent of a tablespoon of goat mixture in the Spring roll pastry and roll the Briwat as shown in the video.?&#Fry the Briwat in very hot oil.?&#The spicy Briwat are served immediately. The sweet Briwat are dipped in honey before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/briwat-with-goat-cheese/
8 Very easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 132 – Bessara Recipe – Moroccan Fava Bean Dip https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_132.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#14 oz. of dried split fava beans (soaked in water overnight)?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#3 large garlic cloves Directions :?&#?&#1. If you cannot find the dried split fava beans and find the whole ones instead, place them in boiling water for 5-10 minutes and you will be able to remove their skin. Then you can soak them in water overnight.?&#2. Drain the fava beans from the water and place them in a cooking pan.?&#3. Add the garlic cloves and 7 cups of cold water.?&#4. Cover your pan and let the fava beans cook on medium high until the texture becomes so soft that you can puree them easily (about 50 minutes).?&#5. When the beans start making a mousse, remove it with a spoon.?&#6. Cover your pan but make sure there is a small opening for the steam to escape – this way, the water does not overflow.?&#7. When the fava beans are done you can puree them with the spoon because they are so soft.?&#8. Next transfer the fava beans to a food processor so that they can be pureed. Also transfer the garlic cloves that have boiled with the fava beans.?&#9. Add the olive oil and then the spices and puree the fava beans until you get a smooth texture.?&#10. The consistency of Bessara is very smooth, however, you can adjust it to your tastes. If you want it to be more liquidy, add hot water and mix it with the Bessara but if you want it to be thicker like a dip, boil it with less water.?&#11. Serve the Bessara hot in a boil with drizzled olive oil, cumin and paprika on top. Some people like to add lemon juice. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/bessara-moroccan-fava-bean-dip/
4 Medium Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 274 – Bibimbap with a Moroccan Twist! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_274.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 carrot?&#1 zucchini?&#2 cups of mushrooms (trumpet or white mushrooms)?&#1 cups of bean sprouts?&#A bunch of fresh spinach?&#Charmoula spices:?&#?&#2 teaspoons paprika?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon red chili pepper?&#Crushed garlic (6-8 cloves)?&#Olive oil?&#1 pound (450 grams) of peeled shrimp?&#1/2 lemon?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#Finely chopped cilantro?&#Cooked rice Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Peel the carrot and cut it Julienne style (thin short sticks).?&#2- Without peeling the zucchini, cut it Julienne style.?&#3- Cut the mushrooms Julienne style.?&#4- Boil water, and place the spinach in boiling water for 1 minute. Remove and place in a bowl of water and ice. Let sit for 3 minutes, then remove the spinach and squeeze it out from the water. Chop the spinach and reserve.?&#5- In the same boiling water, add a large pinch of salt, and add the bean sprouts. Boil for 15-20 minutes. Drain and reserve.?&#6- Mix the charmoula spices together.?&#7- In a large skillet, drizzle olive oil, add a bit of the charmoula spices in the oil, and a teaspoon of the crushed garlic. Mix. Add the zucchini and saute for 45 seconds. Remove and reserve.?&#8- Do the same for the carrots. Add olive oil in the skillet, add a bit of the charmoula mix, and garlic. Mix. Add the carrots and saute for 1-2 minutes. Remove and reserve.?&#9- Do the same with the mushrooms.?&#10- In a clean skillet, drizzle olive oil, add the shrimp, squeeze some fresh lemon juice on top, salt and pepper. Cook for a few minutes until the shrimp becomes pink. remove and reserve.?&#Step 2: Putting together the Bibimbap?&#1- Fill half of a bowl with rice.?&#2- Add the vegetables around the bowl in separate bits: carrots, zucchini, mushrooms, spinach, and bean sprouts.?&#3- Place the cooked shrimp in the center.?&#4- Sprinkle chopped cilantrop on top.?&#Serve with Koran hot sauce or Harissa!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/bibimbap-with-a-moroccan-twist/

Add the carrots and saute for 1-2 minutes. Remove and reserve.?&#9- Do the same with the mushrooms.?&#10- In a clean skillet, drizzle olive oil, add the shrimp, squeeze some fresh lemon juice on top, salt and pepper. Cook for a few minutes until the shrimp becomes pink. remove and reserve.?&#Step 2: Putting together the Bibimbap?&#1- Fill half of a bowl with rice.?&#2- Add the vegetables around the bowl in separate bits: carrots, zucchini, mushrooms, spinach, and bean sprouts.?&#3- Place the cooked shrimp in the center.?&#4- Sprinkle chopped cilantrop on top.?&#Serve with Koran hot sauce or Harissa!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/bibimbap-with-a-moroccan-twist/
15 minutes 2 cups Easy Beverages Nov 20, 2020 836- Matcha Hot Chocolate https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/HotDrinks-34.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 milliliters (2 1/2 cups) whole milk?&#1 teaspoon Matcah green tea powder?&#2 teaspoons coconut sugar (or brown sugar)?&#50 grams (1/4 cup) white chocolate?&#?&#For topping:?&#Whipped cream?&#Matcha Green tea powder Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the whole milk, Matcha green tea, white chocolate, and coconut sugar. Bring to a boil.?&#?&#2- Once the white chocolate has completely melted, remove the milk mixture from the heat, and allow to infuse for 10 minutes.?&#3- Return the milk to medium heat, and heat for 3 minutes.?&#?&#4- Serve the Matcha hot chocolate in mugs, top with whipped cream and Matcha green tea powder. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/836-matcha-hot-chocolate/

Top with whipped cream and garnish with chocolate chips and ground cinnamon. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/833-dates-hot-chocolate/
10 minutes 4 Easy Beverages Jul 22, 2020 810- Cherry & Basil Mojito https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CWA-CherryMojito-11.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the cherry syrup:?&#70 grams (2.4 oz) red cherries, pitted?&#1 tablespoon granulated sugar?&#3 tablespoons water?&#?&#For serving:?&#1 liter (4 cups) sparkling soda?&#10 red cherries, pitted and halved?&#12 fresh basil leaves?&#Cherry syrup?&#Juice of 1 lemon?&#Lemon slices?&#Ice cubes Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the syrup?&#?&#1- In a saucepan, over medium heat. Add the fresh cherries, sugar, water, and cook for 5 minutes stirring from time to time with a wooden spoon until the texture becomes similar to jam.?&#?&#2- Place a strainer on a bowl, add in the cherries jam and press it using a spoon to extract the syrup. Set aside and allow it to cool.?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the mojito?&#?&#3- Place 5 cherry halves, 3 basil leaves, 1 teaspoon of the cherry syrup, 1 teaspoon of lemon juice into the bottom of 4 individual serving glasses.?&#?&#4- Fill the serving glasses with the sparkling soda and set aside for about 30 minutes in the refrigerator to infuse.?&#?&#5- Add the ice cubes to the cherry and basil mojito and serve cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/810-cherry-basil-mojito/ 5 minutes

10 minutes 4 Easy Beverages Apr 14, 2020 779- Carrot and Turmeric Juice https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/2020-04-Carrot-Juice-04.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 oranges?&#?&#2 lemons?&#?&#4 carrots, peeled and grated?&#?&#5 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and cut into chunks?&#?&#2 teaspoons ground turmeric ?&#?&#2 tablespoons honey or brown sugar (optional)?&#?&#4 tablespoons warm water Directions :?&#?&#1- Juice the oranges and lemons and place the juice in a large jar.?&#?&#2- Add the grated carrots and ground turmeric. ?&#?&#3- Add the ginger pieces. 10 minutes 4 Easy Beverages Apr 13, 2020 778- Banana Lassi https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CWA-BananaLassi-16-3.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 cups plain yogurt?&#?&#2 bananas?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom?&#?&#1 tablespoon honey to taste (optional)?&#?&#Ice cubes Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel and cut the bananas into slices and place in a food processor.?&#?&#2- Add the plain yogurt, ground cardamom, honey, and mix all together until the bananas are completely broken down and ingredients are well blended.?&#?&#3- Check the consistency of the banana lassi. 10 minutes 3 people Easy Beverages May 13, 2019 719- Green Smoothie https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-04-CWA-GreenSmoothie-007-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#300 grams (10.5 oz.) pineapple?&#?&#1 medium size banana?&#?&#50 grams (1/4 cup) spinach?&#?&#10 mint leaves?&#?&#1/2 branch of celery?&#?&#240 ml (1 cup) water?&#?&#1 tablespoon lemon juice Directions :?&#?&#1- Cut the pineapple into cubes and the banana into slices and keep in the freezer for at least 8 hours?&#?&#2- In a blender, place the spinach, celery, mint leaves, lemon juice, and water and mix?&#?&#3- Add the frozen pineapple and banana and mix until you get at smooth texture?&#?&#4- If necessary, adjust the consistency of the smoothie by adding more water https://www.cookingwithalia.com/719-green-smoothie/
15 minutes 4 servings Easy Beverages Feb 6, 2019 709- Chocolate Chai Massala https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/2019-01-Masala-Choco-Chai-012.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 tablespoons (4 grams) chai masala spice mix?&#250 ml (1 cup) water?&#500 ml (2 cups) milk?&#3 tablespoons (37.5 grams) white granulated sugar?&#2 tablespoons (15 grams) unsweetened cocoa powder?&#1 tablespoon (2 grams) black tea leaves?&#Optional: whipped cream for decoration Directions :?&#?&#1- Pour the water and chai masala spice mix in a saucepan. Place it on the stove over medium heat, and let the water mixture cook until it starts boiling.?&#?&#2- When the water starts boiling, add the milk, sugar, and cocoa powder. Using a whisk, mix until well combined.?&#?&#3- Continue cooking until the mixture reaches a boiling point. Remove from the heat.?&#?&#4- Add the black tea leaves to the mixture and let it infuse for 3 minutes. If you let it infuse too long, the chai will get too strong.?&#?&#5- Strain the tea twice (important!) to get rid of all the spices and tea residues. Serve immediately topped with whipping cream. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/709-chocolate-chai-massala/ 5 minutes

Meanwhile, chop the dark chocolate.?&#3- Add the dark chocolate to the milk and whisk until it completely dissolves.?&#?&#4- Cook on medium high heat for 2-3 minutes while stirring with a spatula until the hot chocolate thickens.?&#5- Serve hot with marshmallows. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/707-spicy-hot-chocolate/ 5 minutes

Rinse the blender and do the same with the strawberry layer ingredients.?&#3- Pour the banana mixture in a large glass until ¾ full. Hold a spoon slightly above the banana layer then pour the strawberry mixture on the spoon first for it to fall gently and create a distinct top layer.?&#Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/614-2-colors-soy-smoothie/

15 minutes 2 large glasses Easy Beverages Nov 30, 2017 609- Orange Iced Tea https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/435-Orange-Ice-Tea-13.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 black tea bags?&#750 millilitres (3 cups) boiling water?&#2 tablespoons sugar?&#400 milliliters (1 2/3 cups) fresh orange juice?&#2 teaspoons orange blossom water?&#1/2 orange, sliced?&#A small bunch of fresh mint leaves, crushed Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the black tea bags in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Let the tea infuse for 5 minutes, then remove the tea bags and place the tea in the fridge or freezer until it cools down completely.?&#2- Add sugar, to your taste, to the tea. Stir until dissolved.?&#3- In your serving jar, add fresh orange slices, ice cubes, fresh mint that you crush a bit between your hands to release its flavor, cold black tea, fresh orange juice, and orange blossom water. Mix.?&#Note: you can adjust the amount of black tea or orange juice to your taste.?&#4- Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/609-orange-iced-tea/
3 Easy Beverages Nov 15, 2017 606- Creamy Hot Chocolate https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/chocolat-chaud-cremeux-fb.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 Carrefour milk chocolate praline tablet, broken?&#500 ml (2 cups) milk?&#40g (3 tablespoons) sugar (to taste)?&#10g (1 1/2 tablespoons) unsweetened cocoa powder?&#Large pinch of ground cinnamon?&#Pinch of salt?&#15g (1 1/2 tablespoons) cornstarch?&#50 ml milk (for mixing cornstarch)?&#50g cashew nuts, finely chopped Directions :?&#?&#1– In a saucepan, combine the 500 ml of milk, sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and salt. Whisk until all the ingredients are well combined.?&#2- Heat the milk until it reaches a boiling point. Add the chocolate and whisk until it completely dissolves.?&#3- Dissolve the cornstarch in the 50 ml of milk, and add it to the hot chocolate.?&#4- Cook on medium high heat for 2-3 minutes until the hot chocolate thickens. Serve cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/578-carrot-orange-smoothie/ 20 minutes

2 Easy Beverages Feb 2, 2017 468- Banana Dragon Fruit Smoothie https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/rsz_dragonfruit-banana-smoothie.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Banana slices, frozen?&#?&#1 dragon fruit?&#?&#1 lime?&#?&#Honey, to taste?&#?&#Ice cold water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare The Dragon Fruit?&#1- On a cutting board, slice the dragon fruit in the middle with a sharp knife.?&#2- Use a spoon to separate the pulp from the skin. Scoop the pulp out and slice it.?&#?&#Step 2: Make The Smoothie?&#1- In a blender, mix frozen banana slices, honey (to taste), freshly squeezed lime juice, and iced water.?&#2- Serve immediately in tall glasses. Don’t fill up the glasses, leave some space for the dragon fruit smoothie.?&#3- Now mix the dragon fruit, honey, and a little bit of iced water in the blender.?&#4- Top the banana smoothie with the dragon fruit smoothie.?&#5- Serve it and ask your guests to stir… and magic happens! 2 Easy Beverages Jan 5, 2017 467- Mango Strawberry Smoothie https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/rsz_mango-strawberry-smoothie.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Mangoes?&#?&#Strawberries?&#?&#Orange juice?&#?&#Sugar?&#Mint leaf Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare The Ingredients?&#1- First, stand the mangoes on the cutting board vertically and slice one of the largest sides down, turn them around and slice the other large side as well (these are called mango cheeks).?&#2- Slice the rest of the pulp around the mango seed.?&#3- Cut through the small mango pieces to separate skin from the pulp. For the mango cheeks, cut parallel slices without cutting the skin, then scoop with a spoon.?&#4- Remove the strawberries stem and freeze them.?&#Tip: It is better to use frozen mango and strawberry pieces instead of ice cubes for a better fruity flavors.?&#?&#Step 2 : Make The Smoothie?&#1- In a blender, mix the frozen mango pieces, orange juice, and sugar.?&#2- Serve immediately in tall glasses. Don’t fill up the glasses, leave some space for the strawberry smoothie.?&#3- Place the strawberry pieces in the blender and mix with orange juice and sugar?&#4- Top the mango smoothie with the strawberry smoothie. Decorate with a mint leaf and enjoy immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/467-mango-strawberry-smoothie/ 10 Minutes

Whisk until all the ingredients are well combined.?&#2- Heat the milk until it reaches a boiling point. Meanwhile, chop de dark chocolate.?&#3- Add the chocolate to the milk and whisk until it completely dissolves.?&#4- Dissolve the cornstarch in the 50 ml of milk, and add it to the hot chocolate.?&#5- Cook on medium high heat for 2-3 minutes until the hot chocolate thickens. Stir constantly with a spatula.?&#Serve hot. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/465-hot-chocolate/ 5 minutes
Easy Beverages Jul 20, 2016 444 – Moroccan Mint Tea https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/rsz_mint_tea_img_1931tif-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#A large handful of fresh mint?&#3 teaspoons loose green tea (Gunpowder or Chun Mee)?&#3 tablespoons white granulated sugar, or to taste?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#1- Boil the water.?&#2- Add the green tea to a large teapot and 1 cup of boiling water. Let rest for 1 minute then pour the water into a cup. Set aside. In Morocco, this tea water is called the “spirit of the tea”, which means it contains the first burst of flavors from the tealeaves.?&#3- Add another cup of boiling water to the teapot, swish around, then pour the water into a cup. Discard. This step is to clean the tea and you will notice that the water is darker the second time.?&#4- Pour back the “spirit of the tea” into the teapot. Add boiling water to the teapot until it is three quarters full.?&#5- Place the teapot on the stove and, on low heat, bring the tea to a boil.?&#6- Remove the teapot from the heat and immediately add the mint leaves and sugar to the teapot.?&#7- Mix all the ingredients by pouring the tea into a glass and then pouring it back into the teapot. Repeat this step 2-3 times.?&#8- Serve immediately. While pouring, hold the teapot high above the glass, to get the distinctive foam of Moroccan mint tea! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/444-moroccan-mint-tea-2/

Crush the mint leaves with a mallet or a spoon, to release all the minty flavors.?&#4- Fill half of the glass with fresh orange juice, you can add ice if you want.?&#5- Fill the rest of the glass with sparkling water.?&#6- Mix all ingredients with a spoon, add 2 slices of oranges…et voila!?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/417-orange-mintade/

Blend well.?&#6- Serve cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/393-fig-smoothie/

Cover and cool in the refrigerator.?&#Note: you can keep in the refrigerator for 2 or 3 weeks.?&#?&#RECIPE:?&#1- Classic lemonade: 1 cup of lemonade concentrate + 4 cups water + ice + fresh mint leaves?&#2- Orange lemonade: 1 cup of lemonade concentrate + 3 cups water + 1 cup orange juice + 1 teaspoon orange blossom water + ice?&#3- Strawberry lemonade: 1 cup of lemonade concentrate + 4 cups water + strawberry syrup + ice https://www.cookingwithalia.com/390-homemade-lemonade/
