Place in the fridge and let them cool down completely before using.?&#4- Keep the carrot water (to use later), place in the fridge, and let it cool down completely.?&#5- Using a blender, mix the cooked carrots, fresh orange juice, sugar (to taste), 1 cup peach yogurt, and a bit of cold carrot water. Mix until smooth.?&#6- Add more carrot water to get the consistency of your choice.?&#7- Serve cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/382-carrot-orange-smoothie/
4 Very easy Beverages Dec 31, 2015 379 – Beetroot smoothie 2 ways https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_379.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#RECIPE 1: BEET ORANGE SMOOTHIE?&#9 oz (250 grams) of cooked beets (cold)?&#3-4 oranges (Navel)?&#Sugar (to taste)?&#1/2 teaspoon orange blossom water (to taste)?&#RECIPE 2: BEETROOT SUPER SMOOTHIE?&#1 cup cooked beets (cold)?&#4-5 strawberries?&#1 banana?&#1 cup milk?&#2 madjool (large) dates?&#2 tablespoons cocoa powder?&#1 tablespoon honey (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Roasting beetroots: ?&#1- Brush the beetroots with olive oil?&#2- Wrap each beetroot in foil?&#3- Place the wrapped beetroots in a baking pan, and bake in a pre-heated oven at 425 F / 218 C for around 45 minutes?&#4- Check if the beets are cooked by inserting a knife – the knife should get through easily?&#5- Remove the foil from the beets and let them cool a bit?&#6- Peel and chop the beets. You may want to use gloves so you dont stain your hands?&#7- Place the chopped beets in a bowl and let them cool down in the fridge before using them in the juices?&#?&#Recipe 1: Beets Orange Smoothie ?&#1- Make fresh orange juice with the oranges?&#2- In a blender, place the cooked beets (cooled down), fresh orange juice, sugar, and orange blossom water. Mix until smooth.?&#3- Taste and adjust the ingredients. Add more orange juice if you want the juice to be more liquidy, and add more sugar for a sweeter taste.?&#4- Serve cold.?&#?&#Recipe 2: Beetroot Super Smoothie?&#1- In a blender, place the cooked beets (cold), chopped strawberries, chopped banana, chopped dates, milk, and honey. Mix until smooth.?&#2- Taste and adjust ingredients. Add more milk if you want the smoothie to be thinner or more honey if you want it sweeter.?&#3- Serve cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/379-beetroot-smoothie-2-ways/
2 Easy Beverages Feb 25, 2015 275 – The Perfect Milkshake Recipe! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_275.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Peach Milkshake:?&#?&#2 large and generous scoops of vanilla ice cream?&#?&#1 large peach?&#?&#sugar (to taste)?&#?&#a little bit of milk?&#Cookies & Cream Milkshake:?&#?&#2 large and generous scoops of vanilla ice cream?&#?&#4-5 chocolate cream cookies (example: oreos)?&#?&#a little bit of milk Directions :?&#?&#Making the Peach Milkshake?&#1- I am using a white peach for this milkshake. However, you can use any fruits of your choice just make sure they are soft fruits and ripe (e.g. apricots, strawberries, etc.). Apples are not good for this recipe, you can use pears instead of apples.?&#2- Peel and cut the peach.?&#3- Place the peach pieces in the blender.?&#4- Important note about the ice cream. It should NOT be hard! make sure the ice cream is out of the freezer 5-10 minutes before using it. The ice cream should be soft so you don’t have to add more milk for the blender to run. Otherwise, you will have to add more milk and it will make the milkshake watery.?&#5- Add 2 large GENEROUS scoopes of the softened ice cream to the blender.?&#6- Add a little bit of sugar (1-2 tablespoons). For a lighter version you can use yogurt instead of ice cream and skip the sugar.?&#7- Add a little bit of milk, 3-4 tablespoons just enough for the blender to run.?&#8- Mix. Serve immediately!?&#Making the Cookies and Cream Milkshake?&#1- To make the cookies and cream milkshake we follow the same steps, but instead of using a peach we are going to use chocolate and cream cookies (like Oreos).?&#2- Add 2 large GENEROUS scoopes of the softened ice cream to the blender.?&#3- Add a little bit of milk, 3-4 tablespoons just enough for the blender to run.?&#4- Crush the cookies and add them to the blender.?&#5- Mix. Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/the-perfect-milkshake/
Very easy Beverages Feb 25, 2015 65 – Summer Juices with a Moroccan Twist https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/juices_722d9a5a385a559ad8755355ab7137a5.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon of orange blossom water?&#3/4 cup of cold milk?&#1/4 cup of water?&#1/2 cup of whole almonds?&#1/2 tablespoon of sugar Directions :?&#?&#Mix all the ingredients together in a blender.?&#Sift the juice to get rid of the solid almond mix.?&#Serve cold https://www.cookingwithalia.com/summer-juices-with-a-moroccan-twist/
4 Easy Beverages Feb 25, 2015 210 – Spiced Hot Chocolate Recipe (the best ever!) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_210.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups (500 ml) cold milk?&#4.5 oz (127 grams) of dark chocolate (at least 52% cocoa content)?&#1 tablespoon white granulated sugar?&#1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder?&#Spices: 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla powder, a pinch of red chili pepper, a pinch of ground cloves Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Heating the Milk with the Spices?&#1- Place the milk in a saucepan. Add the spices, sugar, and cocoa powder. You can adjust the spices to your taste.?&#2- Heat the milk over medium heat, until it reaches a boiling point. Stir from time to time.?&#3- Turn off the heat right when the milk starts boiling. Let the milk sit (heat off) for 3 minutes to get the full flavors of the spices.?&#?&#Step 2: Melting the Dark Chocolate?&#1- Using a kitchen knife, chop the chocolate.?&#2- On low heat, add the chocolate to the milk mixture little by little, while stirring, until the chocoalte melts into the milk. Make sure to do this on low heat otherwise the chocolate would burn.?&#3- Serve immediately in small cups for drinking or large cups for dunking cookies!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/spiced-hot-chocolate/
2 Very easy Beverages Feb 25, 2015 258 – Summer Smoothies Recipes https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_258.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Exotic Smoothie: 1 kiwi (peeled and diced), 1 nectarine or peach (diced), 1 banana?&#Exotic Smoothie: Orange juice (1 cups), Squeeze of lime, granulated white sugar (to taste)?&#Mango Orange Smoothie: 1 mango (peeled and diced), 1-2 cups orange juice, sugar to taste. Directions :?&#?&#Smoothie 1: Exotic Smoothie?&#1- In a blender, first place the kiwis then add athe nectarines (you can also use peaches if you want).?&#2- Now add the banana. I am using a red banana, which will make the smoothie even more exotic!?&#3- Add a little squeeze of lime.?&#4- Add sugar to taste and a little bit of orange juice. Blend all the ingredients.?&#5- Serve immediately in a glass and decorate with a lime!?&#Smoothie 2: Orange Mango Smoothie?&#1- In a blender, first place the mango (peeled and cut) and the orange juice.?&#2- Add sugar to taste. Blend all the ingredients.?&#3- Serve immediately in a glass and decorate with an orange ring. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/258-summer-smoothies-recipes/
6 Easy Beverages Feb 25, 2015 144 – Rose Water Strawberry Lemonade https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/Valentines-Lemonade-9585-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound strawberries?&#?&#1 cup sugar?&#?&#2 1/2 cups water?&#?&#2 lemons?&#?&#2 teaspoons rose water Directions :?&#?&#1- Remove the stem from the strawberries and cut the strawberries into 2 or 3 pieces.?&#2- Place the strawberries in a bowl and add the sugar.?&#?&#3- Tightly cover the bowl with a plastic wrap and cook on the strawberries in a bain-marie (over boiling water) for 45 minutes or until all their juice is released.?&#?&#4- Strain the strawberries to get their juice.?&#?&#5- Place the strawberry juice in the fridge until it is completely cooled down.?&#Note: do not throw the cooked strawberries, place them in the fridge to cool down, then serve them with yogurt or whipped cream!?&#6- Juice the Lemons.?&#?&#7- In a pitcher, mix the strawberry juice, lemon juice, water, and rose water.?&#?&#8- Serve the lemonade cold!?&#Note: you can adjust any of the ingredients to your taste. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/rose-water-strawberry-lemonade-ramadan-special/
Easy Beverages Jan 1, 2016 385 – Moroccan Almond Milk https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/rsz_385.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup of raw unsalted almonds + water for soaking?&#Pinch of salt?&#2 tablespoons honey (to taste)?&#4 cups water?&#1 teaspoon orange blossom water (optional) Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the almonds in a large bowl and soak in water overnight (8 hours)?&#2- The next day, drain the almonds and discard soaking water?&#3- Place the almonds, honey, pinch of salt, and 4 cups of water in a blender. Blend on high for 1-2 minutes until you get smooth milky texture.?&#4- Strain the almond milk using a sieve, then take the reminder of the almond chunks, put in a cheese cloth and squeeze until you get all the milk out.?&#Note: You can use the remaining almond pulp in cookies!?&#5- Place the almond milk in a jar. Add orange blossom water (to taste) to the milk and shake well.?&#6- Keep almond milk in the fridge for up to 4 days. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/385-moroccan-almond-milk/
4 Easy Beverages Dec 31, 2015 382 – Carrot Orange Smoothie https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_382.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2-3 carrots?&#1 cup peach yogurt?&#sugar (to taste)?&#Fresh orange juice (1-2 oranges)?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel and chop the carrots?&#2- Boil the carrots in water until they become soft (around 20 minutes)?&#3- Remove the carrots and place in a bowl. Place in the fridge and let them cool down completely before using.?&#4- Keep the carrot water (to use later), place in the fridge, and let it cool down completely.?&#5- Using a blender, mix the cooked carrots, fresh orange juice, sugar (to taste), 1 cup peach yogurt, and a bit of cold carrot water. Mix until smooth.?&#6- Add more carrot water to get the consistency of your choice.?&#7- Serve cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/382-carrot-orange-smoothie/

2 very easy Beverages Feb 25, 2015 247 – Coffee Lemonade (Mazagran https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_247.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup black coffee (cold)?&#1/2 cup lemon juice (adjust amount to taste)?&#White granulated sugar (adjust amount to taste)?&#Ice Directions :?&#?&#1- The ingredients are simple but you would have never thought of paring them together: lemon juice, coffee, sugar, and ice! Coffee and lemon juice may seem weird but they pair up amazing together! You can just use your favorite regular black coffee.?&#2- This recipe is flexible meaning you can adjust the amount of the ingredients to your taste. In this recipe we are using double the amount of coffee to the lemon juice, but adjust to your taste.?&#3- Mix the coffee with the lemon juice. Add the sugar to your taste. I have a sweet tooth so I put more sugar.?&#Fill up the cup with ice. You can also add spices or herbs like vanilla or cinnamon to change it up! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/247-coffee-lemonade-mazagran-capile-portuguese-recipe/
4 very easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 362 – Pineapple Panna Drink https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_362.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 whole pineapple?&#3 tablespoons of whitle granuulated sugar (to taste)?&#A pinch of salt?&#1 cup water (or more)?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cumin (to taste)?&#Fresh mint leaves for decoration Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel the pineapple and cut it into small pieces.?&#2- Place the pineapple pieces in a blender along with the sugar and pinch of salt. Add 1 cup of water and blend.?&#3- Check the consistency of the mixture, it should be thin (like a thick lemonade). Feel free to adjust the consistency to your choice by adding more water.?&#4- Add cumin and mix for another 30 seconds.?&#5- Using a sieve, filter the juice mixture.?&#6- Serve cold and decorate with mint leaves!?&#?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/362-pineapple-panna-drink/
Very easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 051 – Moroccan Pomegranate Juice – Valentines Specials https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/pomegranate_juice_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 1/2 cups of pomegranate juice?&#1/4 cup of lemon juice?&#1/2 tablespoon of orange blossom water?&#1 cup of sparkling water?&#4 tablespoons of sugar Directions :?&#?&#Combine all the ingredients. Mix well.?&#You can either obtain the juice by blending pomegranate seeds then straining them to obtain their juice. Or you can use pre-made 100% pomegranate juice with no additives. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-pomegranate-juice-valentines-specials/
2 Easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 121 – Moroccan Saffron Tea Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_121.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3-4 cups of water?&#3 tablespoons of sugar?&#1 tablespoon of Chinese green tea (gunpowder)?&#A pinch of saffron Directions :?&#?&#1- Bring the water to a boiling point.?&#2- Place the green tea in the teapot and add a little bit of the boiling water. Mix well, then pour the water from the tea pot. This step is to wash out the green tea to remove any bitterness from the tea leaves before using them to brew the tea.?&#3- Add the sugar and saffron to the green team in the teapot.?&#4- Pour the boiling water in the teapot.?&#5- Return the teapot to the stove for few minutes on medium heat, until the water comes to a boiling point again. The purpose of this step is to caramelize the sugar and infuse the green tea and saffron.?&#6- Once the water reaches boiling point, mix the tea mixture by pouring some tea in a glass, and re-pouring the tea back in the teapot. Repeat for 3-4 times.?&# Serve immediately. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-saffron-tea/
5 Easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 163 – Mocktails: Nojito and Shirley Temple Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_163.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Nojito: 1 lime?&#Nojito: 10 fresh mint leaves?&#Nojito: 5 teaspoons sugar?&#Nojito: 1/4 cup lemonade?&#Nojito: club soda?&#Nojito: Angostura Bitters (optional)?&#Shirley Temple: Orange Juice?&#Shirley Temple: Ginger Ale (or Seven Up)?&#Shirley Temple: Grenadine?&#Shirley Temple: Maraschino Cherries Directions :?&#?&#Making the Nojito:?&#Mojito is a cuban drink made of 5 ingredients, white rum, sugar, lime juice, sparkling water, and mint. But we are going to skip the rum.?&#1- First, roll a lime on your counter top to soften it up, so that it’s easier to squeeze.?&#2- Cut the lime into quarters.?&#3- Place the lime quarters in a cup and add 5 teaspoons of sugar.?&#4- Now, add around 10 leaves of fresh mint to the cup.?&#5- Using a pestle of the back of a wooden spoon, crush the lime and mint leaves, until the lime juice dissolves the sugar.?&#6- Remove the lime quarters from the cup and add ¼ cup of lemonade. Stir with a spoon.?&#Strain the lime mixture into a glass filled with ice.?&#7- Fill the glass with club soda.?&#8- Now I am going to show you my secret ingredient when making this drink: Angostura Bitters, which is a food and beverage flavoring, and it tempers the acidity of citrus ingredients.?&#So if you have it, add a few drops to your mojito.?&#9- Stir the drink with a straw, add fresh mint leaves, and decorate the glass with a lime ring!?&#?&#Making the Shirley Temple:?&#Now to our next drink – the classic Shirley temple, named after the Hollywood child movie star Shirley Temple.?&#1- In a glass filled with ice, pour orange juice till you fill a ⅓ of the glass.?&#2- Next pour ginger ale until the glass is filled. You can also use Seven up if you dont have ginger ale.?&#3- Add a splash of grenadine. Stir with a straw and garnish with maraschino cherries and an orange ring. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mocktails-nojito-and-shirley-temple/
2 Easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 238 – Mango Strawberry Lassi (Yogurt Beverage) – Indian Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_238.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/2 mango (peeled and diced)?&#1/2 cup sliced strawberries?&#1/2 cup plain yogurt?&#sugar (to taste)?&#water (to reach desired consistency) Directions :?&#?&#1- In a blender, place the fresh strawberries, the freshly cut mango, and some sugar to taste. Add plain yogurt (preferably whole milk yogurt).?&#2- Blend all the ingredients!?&#3- This is a super easy recipe! if you would like to make the consistency of the lassi thinner add a bit of water.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/238-mango-strawberry-lassi-yogurt-beverage-indian-recipe/
2 Very easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 152 – Indian Spiced Chai https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_152.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Chai Masala:?&#?&#4 tbsp green cardamom (powder)?&#2 tsp cinnamon powder?&#1 tsp anise powder?&#1/2 tsp ginger powder?&#1/2 tsp pepper (ground)?&#¼ tsp cloves powder?&#?&#Spiced Tea:?&#?&#2 tablespoons of chai masala?&#1 cup water?&#2 cups milk?&#3 tablespoons sugar?&#1 tablespoon loose black tea Directions :?&#?&#Making the Chai Masala:?&#1- Mix all the Chai Masala spices together and store them in a canister.?&#?&#Making the Spiced Tea:?&#1- Pour 1 cup of water and 2 tablespoons of the chai masala in a saucepan.Place it on the stove, and let the water mixture cook until it starts boiling.?&#2- when the water is boiling, add 2 cups of milk and 3 tablespoons of sugar. Continue cooking until the milk start boiling. Turn off the heat.?&#3- Add 1 tablespoon of loose black tea leaves to the milk/water mixtures and let it brew for 3 minutes. It you let it sit too long, the Chai will get too strong.?&#4- Strain the tea twice (important!) to get rid of all the spices and tea residues. Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/indian-spiced-chai/
4 Easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 188 – Homemade “Raibi Jamila” https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_188.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups (400 ml) buttermilk?&#3 tablespoons grenadine syrup?&#1 tablespoon sugar?&#1 strawberry yogurt (4 oz / 113 grams cup)?&#1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#1 full tablespoon powdered milk?&#A few drops red colorant Directions :?&#?&#Place all the ingredients in a blender and mix untill you get a smooth drink. You may adjust the quantities of buttermilk, grenadine syrup, and sugar based on the brands of buttermilk and grenadine syrup you are using.?&#Serve cold! Bonne Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/homemade-raibi-jamila/
5 minutes 7 individual galettes Easy Breads Oct 4, 2020 820- Harcha Variations https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/IMG_1324.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Plain Harcha dough, not cooked?&#A handful of cured black olives, sliced into small pieces?&#A handful of grated cheese Directions :?&#?&#Preparing The Harcha Dough: Follow the instructions in the Plain Harcha recipe. Do not cook the harcha.?&#1- Split the Plain Harcha dough into two. Mix the black olive slices in one portion of the dough and form small balls.?&#?&#2- For the cheese filling, form small balls with the dough, make a hole in the center of each ball, and fill it with some grated cheese. Then close the hole with the dough around it.?&#3- Flatten the harcha balls. Place the opening of a cup on the harcha rounds to perfectly shape the edges into a nice circle.?&#?&#4- Follow the cooking instructions in the Plain Harcha recipe. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/820-harcha-variations/ 10 minutes
10 minutes 5 people Easy Breads Sep 25, 2020 819- Harcha https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/harcha-432-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams (2 1/2 cups) fine semolina?&#1 1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1 teaspoon white granulated sugar?&#1/2 teaspoon baking powder?&#100 ml vegetable oil?&#350 ml water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, combine all the dry dough ingredients: the fine semolina, salt, granulated sugar, and baking powder. Mix by hand until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#2- Add the vegetable oil, and continue mixing until all ingredients are well coated and the mixture has a sandy texture.?&#3- Add water, little by little, while mixing. The goal is to get butter that has a texture similar to porridge.?&#4- Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.?&#5- On medium heat, warm up a nonstick pan.?&#6- Dust the pan with semolina and place the dough mixture, shape it into a circle with medium thickness, and dust it again with semolina.?&#7- Cook the first side for 7 minutes then flip the harcha and continue cooking the second side for another 7 minutes, until both sides have a beautiful golden color.?&#8- Serve immediately, warm, with honey, goat cheese, or any filling of your choice! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/818-harcha/ 15 minutes
1 hour 15 minutes 15 Easy Breads Apr 29, 2020 785- Fluffy Bread https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CWA-Bread-17.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 Kilogram (5 cups) all-purpose white flour?&#?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#?&#240 milliliters (1 cup) lukewarm milk?&#?&#240 milliliters (1 cup) lukewarm water?&#?&#1 tablespoon dry yeast?&#?&#2 tablespoons granulated sugar?&#?&#120 milliliters (1/2 cup) vegetable oil?&#?&#1 egg white?&#?&#100 grams (1/2 cup) butter, at room temperature?&#?&#250 grams (9 oz) grated mozarella?&#?&#50 grams (1/2 cup) sesame seeds ?&#?&#2 egg yolks ?&#?&#2 tablespoons milk Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, add the flour, baking powder, salt, and mix with a spatula until well combined.?&#?&#2- In another large bowl, add the milk, water, dry yeast, granulated sugar, vegetable oil, egg white, and mix all the ingredients together with a whisk until well combined.?&#?&#3- Add the flour little by little to the milk mixture and mix using hands until a smooth dough ball is formed. If the dough is not coming together, add 2 to 3 tablespoons of flour.?&#?&#4- Add the butter to the dough and continue mixing until well incorporated.?&#?&#5- On a working surface, knead the dough for 10 minutes until it becomes homogeneous, soft, and no longer sticky. ?&#?&#6- Put the dough back to the bowl, cover with a clean kitchen cloth, and let it rise for 1 hour until it doubles in size.?&#?&#7- Divide the dough into 15 equal balls, slightly spread each ball using your hand palm, and place some grated mozzarella cheese in the centre. ?&#?&#8- Bring back the edges of the dough into the center on top of the mozzarella cheese and shape into buns.?&#?&#9- Place the stuffed buns near to each other on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper.?&#?&#10- Mix the egg yolks and milk in a small bowl, brush the surface of the stuffed buns, and sprinkle them with sesame seeds.?&#?&#11- Cover the buns with parchment paper and let them rise for another 15 minutes.?&#?&#12- Bake the buns in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 25 minutes until golden brown.?&#?&#13- Remove the fluffy breads from the oven and cover with a clean towl for 10 minutes to make them tender. Serve warm. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/785-fluffy-bread-%d8%ae%d8%a8%d8%b2-%d9%86%d8%a7%d8%b9%d9%85/ 25 minutes
20 minutes
Easy Breads Feb 27, 2020 773- Batbout https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/435-2020-02-CWA-Batbout-012.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (2 cups) all purpose flour?&#125 grams (1 cup) fino (fine semolina)?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1 teaspoon dry yeast?&#220 mililiters (1 cup) lukewarm water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, combine all the dry ingredients (flour, semolina, dry yeast, and salt). Add a little bit of water and start mixing.?&#2- Continue adding the water little by little and keep mixing with your hands, until all the dry ingredients are well incorporated.?&#3- Knead the dough by hand on a lightly floured surface, for about 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. The dough should be soft but not sticky.?&#4- Place the dough in a bowl. Cover it with a plastic wrap and a clean, dry towel. Set aside for 30 minutes.?&#5- Dust some flour on your working surface. Take some of the dough and roll it out with a rolling pin to a medium thickness.?&#6- With a round cookie-cutter or any shape you like, cut out circles in the dough. You can choose the size you want.?&#7- Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat. Once the pan is hot, start cooking the batbout.?&#8- Cook the batbout for a few minutes on each side until it puffs up and gets golden brown spots.?&#9- When cooking, keep turning on both sides several times.?&#10- Put the batbout aside until it cools down. Then fill it up with whatever filling you want. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/773-batbout/ 20 minutes
6 Medium Breads Jul 2, 2019 732- Gluten Free Harcha with Olives and Thyme https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-05-Harcha-013.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 g cornstarch?&#?&#100 g of rice flour?&#?&#50 g corn flour?&#?&#4 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#?&#1 teaspoon dry yeast?&#?&#1 teaspoon of sugar?&#?&#1 tablespoon thyme, dried?&#?&#50 g black olive, pitted and cut into pieces?&#?&#A pinch of salt?&#?&#Lukewarm water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a bowl, place the sugar and the yeast then add warm water to activate it. Set aside for 5 minutes.?&#?&#2- Add cornstarch, corn flour and rice flour by sieving and mixing.?&#?&#3- Add the salt and vegetable oil and mix.?&#?&#4- Add the thyme and black olives.?&#?&#5- Gradually add water while mixing until you obtain a smooth and homogeneous dough.?&#?&#6- Form dough balls then roll them in corn flour and flatten them to form your harcha.?&#?&#7- Cook the harcha in a preheated pan over medium heat. Let the harcha cook for 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/732-gluten-free-harcha-with-olives-and-thyme/
30 minutes 4 people Easy Appetizers May 5, 2019 717- Rainbow Pizza https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-05-04-Alia-Rainbow-Pizza00488-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Precooked Pizza Dough (4 medium sized disks or 1 large)?&#?&# ?&#?&#Pizza Sauce:?&#?&#3 large tomatoes, grated and skin discarded?&#?&#1 small onion, finely chopped?&#?&#1 garlic clove, grated?&#?&#1 tablespoon tomato paste?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 tablespoon dried oregano?&#?&#1 tablespoon sugar?&#?&#1 tablespoon paprika?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon pepper?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#1 teaspoon onion powder?&#?&# ?&#?&#Toppings:?&#?&#1/2 cup of grated cheese?&#?&#1 cup broccoli?&#?&#1 cup green pepper, cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup yellow pepper cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup red pepper cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup cherry tomatoes cut in half?&#?&#1 cup red onion cut into small cubes?&#?&#1 cup canned corn?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: The Pizza Sauce?&#?&#1- On medium heat, heat olive oil in a pan. Add the chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes until it get a golden color.?&#?&#2- Add the grated garlic and tomato paste. Mix and cook for a few minutes.?&#?&#3- Add the grated tomatoes and spices. Mix and cook for 15 minutes until the sauce thickens. Stir from time to time.?&#?&#Step 2: The Pizza?&#?&#1- Spread the pizza sauce on the pre-cooked pizza circles. Avoid adding the sauce to the edges of the crust or it would burn when baking the pizza.?&#?&#2- Add the grated cheese on top evenly.?&#?&#3- Arrange the veggies in a rainbow look and in a circular formation.?&#?&#4- Drizzle some olive oil on top of the veggies and on the edges of the crust.?&#?&#5- Bake the pizza in a preheated oven at 200 C / 400 F for about 20 minutes. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/717-rainbow-pizza/ 20 minutes
20 minutes 8 pieces Medium Breads May 2, 2019 715- Oats Flaxseed Bread https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2019-04-flaxbread-012.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 grams (3/4 cup) whole wheat flour?&#?&#100 grams (1 cup and 1 tablespoon) oat flour?&#?&#1 tablespoon sesame seeds?&#?&#1 tablespoon flaxseed?&#?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#?&#1 teaspoon dry yeast?&#?&#A pinch of salt?&#?&#Lukewarm water?&#?&#100 grams (3/4 cup) whole wheat flour to roll the dough Directions :?&#?&#1- In a bowl, combine all dry ingredients: the whole wheat flour, oat flour, sesame seeds, flaxseeds, and the dry yeast then the olive oil. Mix?&#?&#2- Gradually add the water while mixing until your dough is homogeneous and not sticking to your hands anymore?&#?&#3- Knead the dough for around 10 minutes. While kneading, soak your hands in water and sprinkle your working surface with a little bit of whole wheat flour from time to time to stop the dough from sticking to your hands and to the working surface?&#?&#4- Dust your work surface with some whole wheat flour then roll to a 8.6 inch disk (22 centimeter). Flip and dust your dough frequently while rolling to prevent it from sticking to the surface?&#?&#5- Using a round cookie cutter of 2.5 inch (6.5 centimeters) in diameter, cut small disks that will form your bread?&#?&#6- Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat, place your bread disks and cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until you get a golden brown color on each side https://www.cookingwithalia.com/715-oats-flaxseed-bread/ 20 minutes
1 hour 30 minutes 15 Mellawi Expert Breads Dec 20, 2018 701- Mellawi https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/MlawiRghifa_435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Dough Ingredients:?&#360 grams all-purpose white flour (3 cups)?&#150 grams fino semolina (extra fine semolina, you can replace it by fine semolina) (1 cup)?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#300 ml water?&#?&#Shaping Ingredients:?&#50 grams butter, melted (1.8 oz.)?&#50 ml vegetable oil?&#50 grams fino semolina (extra fine semolina, you can replace it with fine semolina) (1.8 oz.) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the dough?&#1- In a large plate, or in a Gasaa which is a Moroccan clay plate, place the fino semolina, white flour, and salt. Mix all the ingredients together.?&#2- Add lukewarm water little by little and continue mixing until you form a dough ball; it should not be too moist and it should definitely not be sticky. If you put too much water, just add a little flour to balance it.?&#3- Knead the dough with your fists and palms for around 10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.?&#4- Brush the dough with a little bit of vegetable oil, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rest for 20 minutes.?&#5- Once the dough is ready, brush it again with a little bit of vegetable oil. Grasp a portion of the dough, and using your thumb and index fingers, cut small dough balls that are the size of a tennis ball. From time to time, put vegetable oil on your hands to keep them well oiled while cutting the dough.?&#6- Place the dough balls in a plate, lightly brush them with vegetable oil, and cover them with a clean cloth. Let them rest for 15 minutes.?&#?&#Step 2: Shape the dough?&#7- After 15 minutes, the dough balls are ready to be shaped into disks, which is the traditional shape of Mellawi.?&#8- Brush your work surface with vegetable oil. Take a dough ball and flatten it with the palm of your hand. Using your fingers, gently push the edges of the dough to expand it into a very thin disk of dough – the dough is almost transparent at this point and you can somewhat see your work surface through it.?&#9- Add about 1 teaspoon of melted butter on the dough and spread it evenly with your hands.?&#10- Sprinkle a little bit of fino flour all over the dough. Fold the upper edge towards the center and add a bit of melted butter on top. Now fold the lower edge of the dough towards the center on top of the other edge, to create a long rectangle of dough. Add a bit of melted butter on top of it.?&#11- Flatten the dough strip to remove any air bubbles and rolls it up like a rug into a coil. Pinch the loose end of the dough on the edges of the coil to seal it.?&#12- Place all the coils in a plate, stand them up right, cover with a clean cloth and let them rest for 15 minutes.?&#?&#Step 3: Cook the Mellawi?&#13- When the dough is ready, brush your work station with vegetable oil, take one of the coils upright and flatten it with your fingers from the center outward it into a circle about 1 mm ( ⅛ inch) thick.?&#14- Heat your pan on high heat and once ready drizzle some vegetable oil on it. Reduce the heat to medium-high and cook the Mellawi on both sides for a few minutes each, turning over several times until each side has a golden brown color and the center of the Mellawi is cooked.?&#15- Once the meloui is done, remove from the pan, and push the edges towards the center to fluff it up. Serve the Mellawi immediately, with honey, cheese, or any other toppings of your choice. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/701-mellawi/ 30 minutes
5 minutes 7 individual galettes Easy Breads Oct 4, 2020 820- Harcha Variations https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/IMG_1324.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Plain Harcha dough, not cooked?&#A handful of cured black olives, sliced into small pieces?&#A handful of grated cheese Directions :?&#?&#Preparing The Harcha Dough: Follow the instructions in the Plain Harcha recipe. Do not cook the harcha.?&#1- Split the Plain Harcha dough into two. Mix the black olive slices in one portion of the dough and form small balls.?&#?&#2- For the cheese filling, form small balls with the dough, make a hole in the center of each ball, and fill it with some grated cheese. Then close the hole with the dough around it.?&#3- Flatten the harcha balls. Place the opening of a cup on the harcha rounds to perfectly shape the edges into a nice circle.?&#?&#4- Follow the cooking instructions in the Plain Harcha recipe. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/820-harcha-variations/ 10 minutes

10 minutes 6 people Easy Breads Dec 19, 2018 700- Sun Tart with Pesto https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Sun-Tart-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 g puff pastry?&#50 g Pesto Vert Carrefour?&#1 egg?&#Sesame seeds Directions :?&#?&#Preparing the dough:?&#1- Preheat oven to 180°C.?&#2- Spread the puff pastry and garnish. it well with Carrefour green pesto all over the surface, leave 2 cm border.?&#3- Place the second dough over the first one by pressing on the edges.?&#4- Put a small empty glass in the center and press lightly to mark a circle on the dough without cutting it.?&#5- Cut the dough into 4 equal parts around the glass from the center to the outside, cut each quarter into 2, and again into 2 bands till you obtain 16 bands at the end.?&#6- Remove the glass, and turn each band twice on itself.?&#?&#Baking the dough:?&#7- Beat the egg yolk and brush it over the dough.?&#8- Pour sesame seeds in the center.?&#9- Cook the pie for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/700-sun-tart-with-pesto/ 30 minutes
1 hour 30 minutes 15 msmmens Expert Breads Dec 13, 2018 696- Msemmen https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/MlawiRghifa_Top_Styling-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Dough Ingredients:?&#360 grams all-purpose white flour (3 cups)?&#150 grams fino semolina (extra fine semolina, you can replace it with fine semolina) (1 cup)?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#300 ml water?&#?&#Shaping Ingredients:?&#50 grams butter, melted (1.8 oz.)?&#50 ml vegetable oil?&#50 grams fino semolina (extra fine semolina, you can replace it with fine semolina) (1.8 oz.) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the dough?&#1- In a large plate, or in a Gasaa which is a Moroccan clay plate, place the fino semolina, white flour, and salt. Mix all the ingredients together.?&#2- Add lukewarm water little by little and continue mixing until you form a dough ball; it should not be too moist and it should definitely not be sticky. If you put too much water, just add a little flour to balance it.?&#3- Knead the dough with your fists and palms for around 10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.?&#4- Brush the dough with a little bit of vegetable oil, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rest for 20 minutes.?&#5- Once the dough is ready, brush it again with a little bit of vegetable oil. Grasp a portion of the dough, and using your thumb and index fingers, cut small dough balls that are the size of a tennis ball. From time to time, put vegetable oil on your hands to keep them well oiled while cutting the dough.?&#6- Place the dough balls in a plate, lightly brush them with vegetable oil, and cover them with a clean cloth. Let them rest for 15 minutes.?&#?&#Step 2: Shape the dough?&#7- After 15 minutes, the dough balls are ready to be shaped into squares, which is the traditional shape of Msmmen.?&#8- Brush your work surface with vegetable oil. Take a dough ball and flatten it with the palm of your hand. Using your fingers, gently push the edges of the dough to expand it into a very thin disk of dough – the dough is almost transparent at this point and you can somewhat see your work surface through it.?&#9- Add about 1 teaspoon of melted butter on the dough and spread it evenly with your hands.?&#10- Sprinkle a little bit of fino flour all over the dough. Fold the upper edge towards the center and add a bit of melted butter on top. Now fold the lower edge of the dough towards the center on top of the other edge, to create a long rectangle of dough. Add a bit of melted butter on top of it.?&#11- Sprinkle with semolina again, then fold the right and left edges of the dough towards the center, on top of each other, to form a square.?&#12- Place the dough squares on a plate, cover them, and let them rest for 15 minutes.?&#?&#Step 3: Cook the Msmmen?&#13- When the dough is ready, brush your workstation with vegetable oil, take one dough square and flatten it with your fingers and the palm of your hand, until you get a thin square that is around 3 times larger. Spread a bit of melted butter on it.?&#14- Heat your pan on high heat and once ready drizzle some vegetable oil on it. Reduce the heat to medium-high and cook the Msmmen on both sides for a few minutes each, turning over several times until each side has a golden brown colour and the center of the Msmmen is cooked. The Msmmen may puff up while cooking, but will immediately become flat if you push it down with your hand. The cooked Msmmen is chewy but should not taste raw. Serve the Msmmen immediately, with honey, cheese, or any other toppings of your choice. Roll and enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/696-msemmen/ 30 minutes
1 hour
Difficult Breads Oct 12, 2018 691- Tafarnout Bread https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Tafernout_Top_Simple-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) bowl fino flour (or super fine semolina)?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) all-purpose white flour?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1 teaspoon dry yeast?&#250 ml (1 cup) lukewarm water?&#vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, combine the fino flour (which can be replaced with super fine semolina) and all-purpose white flour. Mix well.?&#2- Create a well in the center, add salt, dry yeast, and half of the water. Stir gently with your fingers to incorporate the water into the flour mixture.?&#3- Continue adding the water in very small amounts, while mixing with your hands, until you get the ingredients are combined into a dough.?&#4- Knead the dough with your hands (or kneading machine) for 10 minutes until you get a soft dough.?&#5- Make a large ball with the dough, cover with a clean cloth, and let it rest for 30 minutes until the volume of the dough doubles.?&#6- In the meantime, Dada Zohra is placing wood in the Tafarnout, the traditional berber clay oven.?&#7- After the dough has rested, place some fino flour on the table, put some vegetable oil in your hands and divide the dough into individual portions the size of a hand fist. Place the dough portions on the flour.?&#8- Use the palm of your hand to flatten the dough portions into circles about 1/2 cm (1/4-inch) thick. Flip the dough circles so that both sides are covered with fino flour.?&#9- Wet a large wooden paddle with water, place the dough circle on it, and flatten the dough a bit more with your finger tips.?&#10- Place the bread in the Tafarnout oven, over a bed of stones. Of course, if you are making this bread at home, bake it in a pre-heated oven at 200C / 390 F degrees.?&#11- As the bread cooks, it will inflate. Once the bread is done and has a deep brown color, remove it from the oven. As the bread cools down it will deflate and gain its famous flat bumpy shape with a soft crispy texture. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/691-tafarnout-bread/
25 minutes 4 Medium Breads Sep 15, 2017 570- Indian Paratha https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/IMG_4161.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (2 cups) all purpose flour – and about 60 grams (1/2 cup) extra to use as needed?&#1 egg?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#Vegetable oil – for kneading, shaping, and cooking?&#80ml to 120 ml (1/3 cup to 1/2 cup) water – as needed Directions :?&#?&#1- Put the flour on your working table (or in a large bowl) and make a well in the center.?&#2- Sprinkle some salt and add the egg, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, and a little bit of water in the well.?&#3- Mix the ingredients with the tips of your fingers, then start combining the flour. Add a little bite of water if needed and knead the dough until it becomes soft.?&#4- Once the dough becomes soft, add 1 tablespoon vegetable oil and continue kneading. The dough should be hard.?&#5- Wrap the dough and let it rest for 15 minutes.?&#6- Now unwrap the dough and divide it into 4 equal parts, then roll each part into a ball.?&#7- Drizzle some oil on your working table. Take one ball and roll it into a large circle as big as you can.?&#8- Drizzle some oil on the rolled dough and spread it evenly with your hands, sprinkle some flour evenly on top, then fold the dough like a fan.?&#9- From one end of the dough, start rolling it like a snake and tuck the last end inside, then flatten it with your fingers and roll it with the pin.?&#10- Heat a skillet or a tawa on low-medium heat. Once hot, place the rolled Paratha on it and allow to cook for one minute, then flip it on the other side.?&#11- Drizzle some vegetable oil and flip it again. Keep cooking while drizzling some vegetable oil from time to time and flipping until the Paratha is done.?&#12- Once done, remove from the heat and transfer it to a cutting board, then crush it with your hands from all sides so you can see the layers. Serve hot. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/570-indian-paratha/ 15 minutes
30 minutes
Easy Breads Jun 26, 2017 538- Supernova Baghrir For Eid https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Giant-Baghrir-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Baghrir Dough Ingredients:?&#300 grams (1 3/4 cups) fine semolina?&#100 grams (3/4 cup) white all-purpose flour?&#6 grams (2 teaspoons) dry yeast?&#8 grams (1 1/2 teaspoons) baking powder?&#1 tablespoon white granulated sugar?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#750 ml (3 cups plus 2 tablespoons) lukewarm water?&#?&#Serving ingredients:?&#Butter?&#Honey?&#Amlou?&#Almonds?&#Nuts?&#Dry fruits Directions :?&#?&#1- Place all the dry ingredients (semolina, flour, dry yeast, baking powder, sugar, and salt) in a bowl.?&#2- Add the water and mix.?&#3- Place in a blender and mix until you reach the desired consistency. The batter should be rather thin, about the same consistency as a French crepe.?&#4- Place the batter in a bowl, cover with a clean towel, and leave to rest for 20 minutes in a warm place.?&#5- Heat a nonstick pan on medium heat. Stir the batter and pour 1/2 cup of it into the center of the hot pan (for the normal size).?&#6- The batter will naturally spread evenly into a circle.?&#7- You will notice the holes forming at the surface as the batter is drying up.?&#8- The Baghrir is done when the surface looks dry and does not feel wet anymore. Do not flip, Baghrir is cooked on one side only.?&#9- Pour the remaining batter into the center of the pan (for the supernova size!).?&#10- Spread with butter, honey, amlou, and sprinkle with almonds, nuts, and dry fruits! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/538-supernova-baghrir-eid/ 5 minutes
5 minutes 7 Easy Breads Jun 8, 2017 520- Gluten Free Harcha https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Gluten-Free-Harcha-e1497792047309.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Harcha dough ingredients:?&#100 g corn semolina?&#50 g corn flour?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1/2 tablespoon sugar?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#80ml water?&#?&#Shaping ingredients:?&#corn flour Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Batter?&#1- In a large bowl, combine all the dry dough ingredients. Mix by hand until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#2- Add the olive oil, and continue mixing until all ingredients are well coated and the mixture has a sandy texture.?&#3- Add water, little by little, while mixing. The goal is to get a batter that has a texture similar to porridge.?&#4- Let the dough rest for 20 minutes before shaping it.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the Harcha?&#5- Dust a flat surface with corn flour and place the dough mixture, shape it into a circle with medium thickness and cover it with flour.?&#6- Continue shaping the circle while adding more corn flour until the batter is not sticky anymore.?&#7- Now using a cup, cut circles within the dough to make individual small harcha breads.?&#8- Another easy way to shape harcha breads, form small balls with the dough and roll each one of them in corn flour. Flatten the ball between the palm of your hands while sprinkling more corn flour until the ball does not feel wet or sticky anymore.?&#?&#Step 3: Cooking the Harcha?&#9- On medium heat, warm up a nonstick pan. Once hot, place the individual harcha circles on the pan.?&#10- Cook the first side for 5 minutes then flip the harcha and continue cooking the second side for another 5 minutes, until both sides have a beautiful golden color.?&#11- Serve immediately, warm, with honey, goat cheese, or any filling of your choice! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/520-gluten-free-harcha/
15 pancakes Hard Breads May 31, 2017 510- Msemen, Moroccan Square Pancakes https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/1-IMG_1558-1-e1497790080501.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Dough Ingredients:?&#250 grams (2 cups) all purpose white flour?&#250 grams (1 1/2 cups) fine semolina?&#2 teaspoons salt?&#300 ml cold water?&#?&#Other Ingredients:?&#80 ml vegetable oil?&#100 grams (7 tablespoon) butter?&#130 grams (3/4 cups) fine semolina?&#1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, combine the flour, fine semolina, and salt. Add a little bit of water and start mixing.?&#?&#2- Continue adding the water little by little and continue mixing, until all the dry ingredients are well incorporated.?&#3- Knead the dough by hand (or using a stand mixer) for about 10 minutes or until you get a smooth and elastic dough. Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.?&#4- Divide the dough into 15 portions and shape each one into a ball then a thick cylinder.?&#?&#5- Prepare your ingredients for shaping the dough: combine the semolina and baking powder together, and melt the butter. Drizzle some vegetable oil on your workstation and hands.?&#6- Take a dough portion and using your fingers, flatten it into a a very thin circle. Add vegetable oil when necessary to ease the stretching of the dough without tearing it.?&#7- Sprinkle over the dough circle some semolina-baking powder mixture and about 1/2 teaspoon of melted butter. This will help keep the folded layers separated once cooked.?&#?&#8- Fold one side of the dough towards the center.?&#9- Fold the opposite side over the first side.?&#10- Using the tips of your fingers gently press on the strip to elongate it.?&#?&#11- Fold one side of the strip towards the center.?&#12- Now fold the opposite side of the strip over the first side to have a square. Repeat steps 5-11 with the rest of the dough portions until all of them become squares.?&#?&#13- When ready to cook the Msemen, preheat a very lightly oiled cast iron skillet over medium heat.?&#14- Take a dough square and using the tips of your fingers or palm gently press to flatten until the square triples in size.?&#?&#15- Place the Msemen in the hot skillet and, on medium low heat, cook one side until it has a golden brown color.?&#?&#16- Turn the Msemen and cook the other side.?&#17- Add a bit of melted butter on the Msemen while cooking it.?&#18- Keep turning the Msemen several times until it is cooked. The inside should have a chewy texture but should not feel gummy or raw. If the outside of the Msemen becomes hard but the inside is not cooked, it means that the heat is too high and you need to reduce it.?&#?&#19- Repeat steps 13-17 until all the Msemen squares are cooked.?&#20- Enjoy warm with soften butter and honey. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/510-msemen-moroccan-square-pancakes/
2 hours 4 medium sized loaves of bread Medium Breads May 31, 2017 509- Khobz, Moroccan Bread https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/01-IMG_1748-1-e1497789877482.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#300 grams (2 1/2 cups) all-purpose white flour?&#350 grams (2 cups) yellow wheat flour or fine semolina?&#2 teaspoons dry yeast?&#2 teaspoons salt?&#2 teaspoons white granulated sugar?&#250ml lukewarm water?&#Extra fine semolina for shaping Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, combine all the dry ingredients (white flour, yellow wheat flour, yeast, salt, and sugar) together.?&#2- Add a little bit of water and start mixing.?&#?&#3- Knead the dough by hand (or using a stand mixer) for about 10 minutes.?&#4- The dough should become smooth and elastic.?&#?&#5- Cover the dough with a clean towel and let it rest for around 1 hour in a warm place.?&#?&#6- Divide the dough into four to six portions (depending on the desired bread size) and shape each one into a round mound.?&#?&#7- Use the tips of your fingers to gently flatten the dough into circles about 6 mm (1/4 inches) thick.?&#?&#8- Cover the breads with a clean towel and let the dough rise for 30 minutes.?&#9- Preheat your oven to 200°C (395°F). Poke the breads several times using a fork.?&#?&#10- Place the breads in a greased baking pan and bake them in the oven for about 20 minutes until they have a light golden color. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/509-khobz-moroccan-bread/ 20 minutes

5 minutes 7 individual galettes Easy Breads May 31, 2017 507- Plain Harcha https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/1-IMG_1298-001-e1497788625871.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Harcha dough ingredients:?&#300 grams (1 3/4 cups) fine semolina?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1 tablespoon white granulated sugar?&#2 teaspoons baking powder?&#1 teaspoon dry yeast?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#400 ml water?&#?&#Shaping ingredients:?&#Extra fine semolina?&#Vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, combine all the dough ingredients except water.?&#2- Mix by hand until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#3- Add water, little by little, while mixing.?&#?&#4- Continue mixing until all the water is completely absorbed. Place the opening of a cup on the harcha rounds to perfectly shape the edges into a nice circle.?&#?&#7- On medium heat, warm up a heavy frying pan. Once hot, place the individual harcha galettes on the pan.?&#?&#8- Cook the first side for 5 minutes then flip the harcha and continue cooking the second side for another 5 minutes, until both sides have a beautiful golden color.?&#9- Serve immediately, warm, with butter, honey, jam, cheese, or any filling of your choice! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/507-plain-harcha/ 10 minutes

Stir the batter and pour 1/2 cup of it into the center of the hot pan.?&#6- Spread the batter evenly into a circle.?&#7- You will notice the holes forming at the surface as the batter is drying up.?&#8- The Baghrir is done when the surface looks dry and does not feel wet anymore.
