Bring to boil for 1 minute.?&#7- Pour the sauce on the steak and serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/591-steak-apples-dry-fruits/ 15 minutes
30 minutes 2 Paninis Moyen Kiri Maroc Sep 28, 2017 588- Panini à La Viande Hachée https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/DSC_1751.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 pains à panini ou ciabatta?&#?&#Pour l’oignon caramélisé:?&#1 oignon moyen, coupé en lamelles?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#Une pincée de sel, selon le goût?&#1 cuillère à café de sucre cassonade?&#?&#Pour la viande hachée:?&#1 cuillère à soupe de fromage Kiri Délice?&#250 grammes de viande hachée?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#2 cuillères à café de paprika?&#1/4 cuillère à café de piment, selon le goût?&#1 cuillère à café de sel, selon le goût?&#1/4 cuillère à café de poivre, selon le goût?&#10 olives vertes, dénoyautées et coupées en petits morceaux?&#?&#Pour la sauce Kiri Délice-Ketchup:?&#2 cuillères à café de fromage Kiri Délice?&#1 cuillère à café de ketchup Directions :?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer l’Oignon Caramélisé?&#1- Dans une poêle sur feu doux, faites chauffer l’huile d’olive, puis ajoutez-y les lamelles d’oignon ainsi qu’une pincée de sel.?&#2- Cuisez pendant 5 minutes environ tout en remuant régulièrement, puis ajoutez-y le sucre cassonade et mélangez.?&#3- Poursuivez la cuisson pendant 15 minutes jusqu’à ce que les lamelles d’oignon soient caramélisées.?&#4- Retirez du feu et placez les lamelles d’oignons caramélisées dans un bol. Réservez.?&#?&#Etape 2: Préparer la Viande Hachée?&#5- Remettez la même poêle sur feu moyen, faites-y chauffer l’huile d’olive puis ajoutez-y la viande hachée, le paprika, le piment, le sel et le poivre.?&#6- Mélangez et cuisez tout en écrasant avec une spatule en bois jusqu’à ce que la viande soit cuite.?&#7- Ajoutez le fromage Kiri Délice et les olives et mélangez jusqu’à ce que le fromage soit complètement fondu.?&#?&#Etape 3: Préparer la Sauce Kiri Délice-Ketchup?&#8- Dans un bol moyen, placez le fromages Kiri Délice et à l’aide d’une spatule, mélangez jusqu’à ce que vous ayez un mélange crémeux.?&#9- Ajoutez-y le ketchup et mélangez ensemble.?&#?&#Etape 4: Assembler le Panini?&#10- Coupez le pain dans le sens de la longueur, tartinez de sauce Kiri Délice-Ketchup, déposez dessus des lamelles d’oignon caramélisées puis garnissez de viande hachée.?&#11- Placez le sandwich dans une presse à panini, ou griller-le des deux faces dans une poêle à griller placée sur feu moyen.?&#12- Servez immédiatement, ou emportez avec vous! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/588-panini-la-viande-hachee/ 20 minutes
40 minutes 3 burger Facile Appetizers Sep 21, 2017 576- Krachel Burger https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/DSC_2298.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 krachels moyennes?&#?&#Pour le poulet:?&#150 grammes de blancs de poulet, coupé en petits morceaux?&#1 cuillère à café de coriandre moulue?&#1/2 cuillère à café de sel, selon le goût?&#1/4 cuillère à café de poivre, selon le goût?&#Le zeste d’un citron?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile végétale?&#?&#Pour la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde:?&#2 cuillères à soupe de fromage Kiri Délice?&#3 cuillères à soupe de moutarde à l’ancienne?&#1 cuillère à soupe de miel?&#?&#Pour la garniture:?&#3 feuilles de laitue?&#1 tomate moyenne, coupée en rondelles Directions :?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la Sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde?&#1- Dans un bol, placez le fromage Kiri Délice et mélangez avec une spatule jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une texture crémeuse.?&#2- Ajoutez-y la moutarde et le miel et mélangez jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une sauce lisse.?&#?&#Etape 2: Préparer la garniture?&#3- Dans une boîte hermétique, placez les morceaux de blanc de poulet et ajoutez-y la coriandre, le sel, le poivre et le zeste de citron.?&#4- Mélangez, fermez la boîte et laissez mariner 30 minutes.?&#5- Dans une poêle sur feu moyen, chauffez l’huile végétale et faites-y cuire les morceaux de blanc de poulet jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient bien cuits.?&#6- Une fois que les morceaux de blanc de poulet sont cuits, prélevez une cuillère à soupe de la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde, ajoutez-la au poulet et mélangez.?&#?&#Etape 3: Assembler le sandwich?&#7- Coupez les krachels en deux horizontalement, tartinez les tranches avec la sauce Kiri Délice-Miel-Moutarde, déposez dessus une feuille de laitue, des morceaux de blanc de poulet et des rondelles de tomates. Recouvrez avec la seconde tranche de krachel.?&#8- Servez immédiatement, ou emportez avec vous! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/576-krachel-burger/ 10 minutes
20 Minutes 4 Easy Carrefour Maroc Aug 31, 2017 562- Liver Skewers and its Rice Pilaf https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/brochette-de-foie-et-son-riz-pillaf-fb-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the rice:?&#200 grams Rice Mix Carrefour (2 cups / 7.0 OZ)?&#250 ml Carrefour Pineapple Juice?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 leek, cut into rings?&#1/2 red pepper, cubed?&#1/2 green pepper, cubed?&#1/2 yellow pepper, cubed?&#2 garlic cloves, chopped?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#250 ml water?&#?&#For the liver skewers:?&#2 large pieces liver (250g)?&#1 tablespoon cumin?&#1 tablespoon paprika?&#1 tablespoon chilli pepper?&#1 can pineapple in syrup Directions :?&#?&#1- In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil, add the leek and fry it for 2 minutes. Add garlic, red, green and yellow peppers. Mix all the ingredients together and cook for 3 minutes.?&#2- To the pan, add the rice, salt and pepper. Mix, then add the pineapple juice and water. Let cook for 3 minutes over medium heat until the rice is tender.?&#3- Grill the liver pieces on an electric grill plate, 1 minute on each side. Place the liver on a wooden board and cut into medium sized cubes.?&#4- In a large bowl, add the liver cubes, cumin, sweet pepper, hot pepper. Mix the ingredients together to cover the liver with spices, then add the salt and stir again.?&#5- Cut the pineapple into pieces. Then garnish the skewered picks by inserting the pieces of liver and pineapple.?&#6- Place the skewers on the plate and grill on each side until the liver is cooked through.?&#7- Add pieces of pineapple to the rice and mix to incorporate it.?&#Serve the liver skewers on a bed of pineapple rice! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/562-liver-skewers-rice-pilaf/ 35 Minutes
15 minutes 2 Easy Carrefour Maroc Aug 3, 2017 545- Fruity Banana Cream Parfait https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/July-Parfait-fruité-banane-FB.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 large bananas?&#4 Carrefour verbena mint infusions?&#300 ml boiling water?&#1 can Carrefour pears?&#1 packet Carrefour coconut golden galets?&#50g walnuts?&#Mint leaves Directions :?&#?&#1- Cut your bananas into pieces and place them in an airtight container and freeze overnight or at least 4 hours.?&#2- Infuse the verbena and mint infusions in boiling water for 5 minutes. Take the tea bags out and let the tea cool completely in the refrigerator.?&#3- Drain the pears and cut them into small pieces.?&#4- In a food processor, mix the frozen bananas with half the cooled tea for 3 minutes at high speed until a creamy mixture is obtained.?&#5- Dip a coconut golden galet in the remaining tea, place it at the bottom of a large glass, add frozen banana cream, pear pieces then two other soaked coconut golden galets and repeat the process the same way, finish with frozen banana cream and then pear pieces. Garnish the parfait with walnuts, decorate with mint leaves and serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/545-fruity-banana-cream-parfait/ 0 minute
20 Minutes 10 Easy Appetizers Jun 20, 2017 529- Khlii and Eggs Square Pockets https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Briwate-aux-oeufs-et-Khlii.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 servings of Kiri cheese?&#150 g of khlii, cut into slices?&#1 tablespoon of khlii fat?&#4 eggs?&#250 g of warka?&#1 egg yolk?&#Chopped parsley Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the filling?&#1- In a frying pan over medium heat, melt the khlii fat, add the khlii slices and cook for 1 minute while stirring.?&#2- Add the eggs and let cook uncovered, while stirring. Once the mixture is ready, remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture cool.?&#3- Cut each portion of Kiri cheese into 4 strips.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the square pockets?&#1- Cut the warka into disks, place a little bit of the filling in the center then 2 strips of Kiri cheese and a pinch of chopped parsley on top.?&#2- Form the square pockets and brush their edges with egg yolk to secure them.?&#3- Fry in a hot oil bath until the square pockets are golden and then pat them with a paper towel to remove excess oil.?&#Serve immediately, while the square pockets are still warm and crispy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/529-khlii-eggs-square-pockets/ 15 Minutes
20 Minutes 20 Medium Appetizers Jun 10, 2017 521- Turkey and Basil Briwat https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Briwate-de-dinde-et-basilic-e1497792122480.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#4 servings of Kiri cheese?&#250 g of ground turkey?&#10 basil leaves, chopped?&#3 leeks, chopped?&#3 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 teaspoon of ground ginger?&#Juice of 1/2 lemon?&#Salt and pepper?&#250 g of warka?&#1 egg yolk?&#Vegetable oil for frying?&#——————————————————————————————————-?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#4 portions de fromage Kiri?&#250 g de dinde hachée?&#10 feuilles de basilic, hachées?&#3 poireaux, hachés?&#3 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#1 cuillère à café de gingembre moulu?&#Le jus d’1/2 citron?&#Sel et poivre?&#250 g de feuilles de pastilla?&#1 jaune d’oeuf?&#Huile végétale pour la friture Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the filling?&#1- Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the chopped leeks and cook for 2 minutes.?&#2- Add the turkey to the leeks and continue cooking for 10 minutes, stirring regularly while crushing the ground turkey into small pieces.?&#3- Remove the frying pan from the heat, add the lemon juice and the servings of Kiri cheese and mix until the cheese melts.?&#4- Taste and add ginger, salt and pepper according to your preference.?&#5- Add the chopped basil.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the triangles (Briwat)?&#1- Cut the warka into long strips about 5 cm wide, and use them to form the triangles.?&#2 – Brush the tip with a little bit of egg yolk to secure the triangle.?&#3- Fry in a hot oil bath until the triangles are golden and then pat them with a paper towel to remove excess oil.?&#Serve immediately when the briwat are still warm and crispy!?&#————————————————————————————————————?&#?&#DIRECTION EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la farce?&#1- Faites chauffer l’huile d’olive dans une poêle sur feu moyen. Ajoutez les poireaux hachés et laissez cuire pendant 2 minutes.?&#2- Ajoutez la dinde aux poireaux et poursuivez la cuisson pendant 10 minutes en remuant régulièrement et en écrasant la dinde hachée en petits morceaux.?&#3- Retirez la poêle du feu, ajoutez-y le jus de citron et les portions de fromage Kiri et mélangez jusqu’à ce que le fromage soit fondu.?&#4- Goûtez et ajoutez le gingembre, le sel et le poivre selon votre préférence.?&#5- Ajoutez le basilic haché.?&#?&#Etape 2: Façonner les triangles?&#1- Coupez les feuilles de pastilla en longues bandes d’environ 5 cm de largeur, et utilisez-les pour former les triangles.?&#2- Badigeonnez la pointe avec un peu de jaune d’œuf pour fixer le triangle.?&#3- Faites frire dans un bain d’huile chaude jusqu’à ce que les triangles soient dorés puis tapotez-les avec une serviette en papier pour enlever l’excédent d’huile.?&#Servez immédiatement quand les briouates sont encore chaudes et croustillantes! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/521-turkey-basil-briwat/ 20 Minutes
15 Minutes 6 Easy Appetizers Jun 7, 2017 516- Beef Bruschetta https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/May-Bruschetta-FB.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#6 Carrefour wheat tartines?&#150g minced ​​beef, cut into small pieces?&#1 onion, cut into strips?&#1 clove of garlic, chopped?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 tablespoons of capers?&#3 tablespoons Carrefour green pesto sauce?&#8 cherry tomatoes, cut into 4?&#1/2 avocado, peeled and cut into small cubes?&#10 basil leaves, chopped?&#Salt and pepper?&#?&#————————————————————————————?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#6 tartines au froment Carrefour?&#150g émincé de bœuf, coupé en petits morceaux?&#1 oignon, coupé en lamelles?&#1 gousse d’ail, hachée?&#2 cuillères à soupe huile d’olive?&#2 cuillères à soupe câpres Carrefour?&#3 cuillères à soupe sauce pesto vert Carrefour?&#8 tomates cerises, coupées en 4?&#1/2 avocat, épluché et coupé en petits cubes?&#10 feuilles de basilic, hachée?&#Sel et poivre Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH: ?&#?&#1- Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Brown the onion with a pinch of salt and pepper for 3 minutes.?&#2- Add the beef and garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes until the meat is cooked through. Add capers, mix and remove from heat.?&#3- Spread some green pesto sauce on the wheat tartines. Place a little of the meat, onion and capers mixture, then cherry tomatoes quarters, avocado cubes and finally sprinkle with chopped basil.?&#4- Serve immediately.?&#?&#————————————————————————————————-?&#?&#DIRECTIONS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#1- Chauffez l’huile d’olive dans une poêle sur feu moyen. Faites-y dorer l’oignon avec une pincée de sel et de poivre pendant 3 minutes.?&#2- Ajoutez l’émincé de bœuf et l’ail. Cuisez environ 5 minutes jusqu’à ce que la viande soit bien cuite. Ajoutez les câpres, mélangez puis retirez du feu.?&#3- Tartinez les tartines de froment de sauce pesto vert. Déposez dessus un peu du mélange viande, oignon et câpre, puis des quartiers de tomate cerise, des cubes d’avocat et parsemez finalement de basilic haché.?&#4- Servez immédiatement. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/516-beef-bruschetta/ 10 Minutes
20 minutes 10 Easy Appetizers Jun 5, 2017 511- Asian Express Spring Rolls https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/5-RoulauxDePrintemps.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#5 servings of Kiri cheese?&#2 carrots?&#1 cucumber?&#1 avocado?&#10 surimi sticks?&#10 leaves of lettuce?&#10 rice paper wrappers?&#20-25 mint leaves?&#Soy sauce?&#?&#———————————————————————————————?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#5 portions de fromage Kiri?&#2 carottes?&#1 concombre?&#1 avocat?&#10 bâtonnets de surimi?&#10 feuilles de laitue?&#10 feuilles de riz?&#20-25 feuilles de menthe?&#Sauce soja Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the filling?&#1- Peel and cut the cucumber and carrots into thin sticks.?&#2- Peel the avocado, pit it and cut it into slices.?&#3- Cut the surimi lengthwise in two and Kiri cheese into 3 strips.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the spring rolls?&#1- Dip a rice paper wrapper in lukewarm water for a few seconds to rehydrate, then place it on a plate.?&#2- Place a leaf of lettuce on one half of a rice papper wrapper and place on top of it carrot sticks, cucumber sticks and avocado slices.?&#3- Roll half the rice paper wrapper on the lettuce.?&#4- On the second half, place the strips of surimi, the mint leaves, and the strips of Kiri cheese. Roll the rest of the rice paper wrapper. Cut in half.?&#Serve immediately with soy sauce!?&#?&#————————————————————————————————————?&#?&#DIRECTIONS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la farce?&#1- Epluchez et coupez le concombre et les carottes en bâtonnets très fins.?&#2- Epluchez l’avocat, dénoyautez-le et coupez-le en lamelles.?&#3- Coupez le surimi en deux au sens de la longueur et fromage Kiri en 3 bandes.?&#?&#Etape 2: Façonner les rouleaux de printemps?&#1- Plongez une feuille de riz dans de l’eau tiède quelques secondes le temps de la réhydrater, puis posez-la sur une assiette.?&#2- Placez une feuille de laitue sur la moitié de la feuille de riz et déposez dessus des bâtonnets de carottes, des bâtonnets de concombre et des lamelles d’avocat.?&#3- Roulez la moitié de la feuille de riz sur la laitue.?&#4- Sur la seconde moitié, placez des bandes de surimi, des feuilles de menthe, et des bandes de fromage Kiri. Roulez le restant de feuille de riz. Coupez en deux.?&#Servez immédiatement, avec de la sauce soja! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/511-asian-express-spring-rolls/ 0 minute
30 minutes 6 medium Appetizers May 27, 2017 502- Indian Vegetable Samosa https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/3-Indian-samosa.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#4 servings of Kiri cheese?&#2 potatoes, peeled and cut into very small cubes?&#1 onion, chopped?&#150 g of peas?&#3 tablespoons of olive oil?&#3 tablespoons of tomato purée?&#A small piece of fresh ginger, grated?&#1 teaspoon of turmeric?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of dried coriander?&#1 teaspoon of old-fashioned mustard?&#1/2 teaspoon of pepper?&#1 tablespoon of garam masala?&#Salt and black pepper?&#250 g of warka?&#1 egg yolk?&#Oil for frying?&#?&#—————————————————————————————-?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#4 portions de fromage Kiri?&#2 pommes de terre, épluchées et découpées en très petits cubes?&#1 oignon, haché?&#150 g de petits pois?&#3 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#3 cuillères à soupe de purée de tomates?&#Un petit morceau de gingembre frais, rapé?&#1 cuillère à café de curcuma?&#1 cuillère à café de cumin?&#1 cuillère à café de coriandre séchée?&#1 cuillère à café de moutarde à l’ancienne?&#1/2 cuillère à café de piment?&#1 cuillère à soupe de garam masala?&#Sel et poivre?&#250 g de feuille de pastilla?&#1 jaune d’oeuf?&#Huile pour la friture Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the filling?&#1- In a saucepan, cover the potatoes with water, add a pinch of salt and cook for 10 minutes over high heat until they are half cooked.?&#2- In a frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat, add the chopped onion and cook for 3 minutes.?&#3- Drain the potatoes and add them to the onion as well as peas, tomato purée, ginger, turmeric, cumin, coriander, mustard, pepper, garam masala, salt and black pepper. Cook for about 15 minutes.?&#4- Cut the servings of Kiri cheese into small cubes.?&#5- Remove the pan from the heat and add the Kiri cheese cubes.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the triangles?&#1- Cut the warka into long strips about 8 cm wide, and use them to form the triangles.?&#2- Brush the tip with a little bit of egg yolk to secure the triangle.?&#3- Fry in a hot oil bath until the triangles are golden and then pat them with a paper towel to remove excess oil. Serve immediately!?&#————————————————————————————————————-?&#?&#DIRECTIONS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la farce?&#1- Dans une casserole, couvrez les pommes de terre d’eau, ajoutez-y une pincée de sel et laissez cuire pendant 10 minutes sur feu fort jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient à moitié cuit.?&#2- Dans une poêle, faites chauffer l’huile d’olive à feu moyen, ajoutez-y l’oignon haché et laissez cuire pendant 3 minutes.?&#3- Egouttez les pommes de terre et rajoutez-les à l’oignon ainsi que les petits pois, la purée de tomates, le gingembre, le curcuma, le cumin, la coriandre, la moutarde, le piment, le garam masala, le sel et le poivre. Laissez cuire environ 15 minutes.?&#4- Découpez les portions de fromage Kiri en petits cubes.?&#5- Retirez la poêle du feu et ajoutez les cubes de fromage Kiri.?&#?&#Etape 2 : Façonner les triangles?&#1- Coupez les feuilles de pastilla en longues bandes d’environ 8 cm de largeur, et utilisez-les pour former les triangles.?&#2- Badigeonnez la pointe avec un peu de jaune d’œuf pour fixer le triangle.?&#3- Faites frire dans un bain d’huile chaude jusqu’à ce que les triangles soient dorés puis tapotez-les avec une serviette en papier pour enlever l’excédent d’huile. Servez immédiatement! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/502-indian-vegetable-samosa/ 40 minutes
40 Minutes 5 Medium Appetizers May 24, 2017 523- Mhencha with Spicy Ground Meat https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/2-Mhencha-piquante-harissa-et-viande-hachée-e1497792635737.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#4 servings of Kiri cheese?&#250 g ground beef?&#1 tablespoon of harissa?&#1 onion, grated?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#2 tablespoons of chopped parsley?&#Salt and pepper?&#250 g of warka?&#Melted butter?&#1 egg?&#?&#—————————————————–?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#4 portions de fromage Kiri?&#250 g de viande hachée de bœuf?&#1 cuillères à soupe de harissa?&#1 oignon, râpé?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#1 cuillère à café de cumin?&#2 cuillères à soupe de persil haché?&#Sel et poivre?&#250 g de feuilles de pastilla?&#Beurre fondu?&#1 oeuf Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the filling?&#1- Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat, then add the chopped onion and fry for 3 minutes.?&#2- Add the ground beef, salt, pepper, cumin and chopped parsley. Continue cooking.?&#3- When the meat is thoroughly cooked, remove the frying pan from the heat, add the servings of Kiri cheese and mix well until the cheese melts.?&#4- Allow the mixture to cool before adding the harissa.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the mhencha?&#1- Using the warka and stuffing, form mini-mhenchas.?&#2- In a small bowl, beat the egg, brush a little bit on the mhenchas with a brush then place them in a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#3- Bake at 410 °F (210 °C) for 30 minutes, or until the mhencha is golden brown.?&#Serve immediately!?&#?&#————————————————————————————————————?&#?&#DIRECTIONS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la farce?&#1- Faites chauffer l’huile dans une poêle sur feu moyen, puis ajoutez-y l’oignon haché et laissez frire pendant 3 minutes.?&#2- Ajoutez la viande hachée, le sel, le poivre, le cumin et le persil haché. Continuez la cuisson.?&#3- Lorsque la viande est bien cuite, retirez la poêle du feu, ajoutez-y les portions de fromage Kiri et mélangez bien jusqu’à ce que le fromage soit fondu.?&#4- Laissez le mélange refroidir avant d’ajouter l’harissa.?&#?&#Etape 2: Former la mhencha?&#1- En utilisant les feuilles de pastilla et la farce, formez des minis-mhenchas.?&#2- Dans un petit bol, battez l’œuf, badigeonnez-en un peu sur la mhencha à l’aide d’un pinceau puis placez-les dans un moule à four recouvert de papier sulfurisé.?&#3- Enfournez à 210°C pendant 30 minutes, ou jusqu’à ce que la mhencha soit bien dorée.?&#Servez immédiatement! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mhencha-spicy-ground-meat/ 40 Minutes
1 hour 6 Medium Carrefour Maroc Apr 20, 2017 482- Chocolate birthday cake https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/CarrefourBirthdayCake.png Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients in English:?&#?&#For the cakes:?&#200g Carrefour dark chocolate?&#150g butter, softened?&#80g sugar?&#4 eggs, whites and yolks separated?&#Pinch salt?&#50g all-purpose flour?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#?&#For the chocolate cream:?&#500 ml whipping cream Carrefour, cold?&#200g Carrefour dark chocolate?&#?&#For garnishing:?&#Carrefour red fruits mix?&#?&#———————————————————-?&#?&#Ingredients in French:?&#?&#Pour les gâteaux:?&#200g chocolat noir Carrefour?&#150g beurre, ramolli?&#80g sucre?&#4 oeufs, blancs et jaunes séparés?&#Pincée sel?&#50g farine?&#1 cuillère à café levure chimique?&#?&#Pour la crème chocolat:?&#500 ml crème à fouetter, froide?&#200g chocolat noir Carrefour?&#?&#Pour la garniture:?&#Mélange de fruits rouges (fraises, framboises, myrtilles) Directions :?&#?&#Steps in English:?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the cakes?&#1- Melt the chocolate in a ‘bain-marie’ by placing the container with chocolate on top of a pan with boiling water. Let it cool down.?&#2- In a large bowl, mix the butter and sugar with a spatula or beater until you get a smooth texture. Add egg yolks and mix until well incorporated.?&#3- Add the chocolate and mix well to incorporate.?&#4- In a second bowl, use an egg beater to beat the egg whites and salt, until white firm peaks are formed.?&#5- Combine the flour and the baking powder.?&#6- With a spatula, gently fold half of the fluffy egg whites into the chocolate mixture then add half of the flour mixture and mix until well incorporated. Repeat the same process with remaining halves of egg whites and flour mixture.?&#7- Split the batter into 2 round molds (diameter 22 cm). Bake in a preheated oven at 180 C for 15 minutes or until the cake is done. To verfiy, gently touch the center of the cake with the tips of your fingers, it should feel firm.?&#8- Let cool down completely before unmolding the cakes.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the chocolate cream?&#1- Melt the chocolate in a ‘bain-marie’. Let it cool down completely before using it.?&#2- In a bowl, use the beater to whip the cream until it thickens with firm peaks. Add the dark chocolate and mix with the beater for a few seconds then switch to a spatula and fold in the mixture until homogenous.?&#?&#Step 3: Assemble the cake?&#1- On a serving plate, place one layer of cake, spread 1/3 of the chocolate cream, top with another layer of cake and use the remaining cream to frost the top and sides of the cake.?&#2- Top with red fruits. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.?&#?&#———————————————————————————————————?&#?&#Steps in French:?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the cakes?&#1- Melt the chocolate in a ‘bain-marie’ by placing the container with chocolate on top of a pan with boiling water. Let it cool down.?&#2- In a large bowl, mix the butter and sugar with a spatula or beater until you get a smooth texture. Add egg yolks and mix until well incorporated.?&#3- Add the chocolate and mix well to incorporate.?&#4- In a second bowl, use an egg beater to beat the egg whites and salt, until white firm peaks are formed.?&#5- Combine the flour and the baking powder.?&#6- With a spatula, gently fold half of the fluffy egg whites into the chocolate mixture then add half of the flour mixture and mix until well incorporated. Repeat the same process with remaining halves of egg whites and flour mixture.?&#7- Split the batter into 2 round molds (diameter 22 cm). Bake in a preheated oven at 180 C for 15 minutes or until the cake is done. To verfiy, gently touch the center of the cake with the tips of your fingers, it should feel firm.?&#8- Let cool down completely before unmolding the cakes.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the chocolate cream?&#1- Melt the chocolate in a ‘bain-marie’. Let it cool down completely before using it.?&#2- In a bowl, use the beater to whip the cream until it thickens with firm peaks. Add the dark chocolate and mix with the beater for a few seconds then switch to a spatula and fold in the mixture until homogenous.?&#?&#Step 3: Assemble the cake?&#1- On a serving plate, place one layer of cake, spread 1/3 of the chocolate cream, top with another layer of cake and use the remaining cream to frost the top and sides of the cake.?&#2- Top with red fruits. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/482-chocolate-birthday-cake/ 25 minutes + 1 hour for cooling
10 minutes 2 Easy Carrefour Maroc Apr 3, 2017 478 – Sauted beef with cashew nuts https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/rsz_march-beef-fb.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients in English:?&#?&#300g of beef shoulder, cut into cubes?&#2 tablespoons Sauce Basquaise Carrefour?&#50g of Salted toasted cashew nuts Carrefour?&#1 large onion, chopped?&#1 clove garlic, chopped?&#A small piece of grated ginger?&#1 tablespoon of vegetable oil?&#100 ml of mandarin juice Carrefour?&#500 ml of water?&#Salt and pepper?&#1 bag Thai Rice Carrefour?&#?&#Ingredients in French:?&#?&#300g d’épaule de bœuf, découpée en cubes?&#2 cuillères à soupe de Sauce Basquaise Carrefour?&#50g de Noix de cajou grillées salées Carrefour?&#1 gros oignon, haché?&#1 gousse d’ail, hachée?&#Un petit morceau de gingembre, râpé?&#1 cuillère à soupe d’huile de tournesol?&#100 ml de jus de mandarine Carrefour?&#500 ml d’eau?&#Sel et poivre?&#1 sachet de Riz Thaï Carrefour Directions :?&#?&#Directions in English:?&#?&#1- Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onion, garlic, ginger and a small pinch of salt. Cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.?&#2- Add the meat and brown.?&#3- Add the mandarin juice and the water. Cover and cook for about 30 minutes.?&#4- Add the Sauce Basquaise. Continue cooking for 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.?&#5- Prepare the rice according to the instructions on the package.?&#6- Serve immediately on a plate: put the rice, cover with the meat and finally cashew nuts.?&#?&#Directions in French:?&#?&#1- Chauffez l’huile dans une poêle. Faites-y revenir l’oignon, l’ail, le gingembre et une petite pincée de sel pendant 5 minutes sur feu moyen.?&#2- Ajoutez-y la viande et faites dorer.?&#3- Ajoutez-y le jus de mandarine et l’eau. Couvrez et cuisez environ 30 minutes.?&#4- Ajoutez la sauce basquaise. Poursuivez la cuisson pendant 5 minutes. Salez et poivrez selon le goût.?&#5- Préparez le riz suivant les instructions sur le paquet.?&#6- Servez immédiatement dans une assiette: mettez le riz, recouvrez avec la viande et finalement des noix de cajou. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/478-sauted-beef-cashew-nuts/ 40 minutes
15 Minutes 2 Easy KFC Apr 1, 2017 477 – KFC Chicken Burrito Bowl https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/rsz_ricesalad_top.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 bucket KFC whole chicken?&#?&#1 can of black beans?&#?&#3 cups pre-cooked white rice?&#?&#1 onion, finely chopped?&#?&#2 tomatoes, cut into small pieces?&#?&#1 can of corn, drained?&#?&#1 avocado, peeled and cut into thin slices?&#?&#1/2 cup finely chopped cilantro?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#?&#1 teaspoon garlic powder?&#?&#100 ml sour cream?&#?&#1 lime Directions :?&#?&#1- In a sauce pan, place the black beans and the liquid from the can. Add cumin and garlic powder to the beans. Bring to a boil and let it simmer for a minute or two. Stir in 2 tablespoons of cilantro and remove from the heat.?&#2- Separate the KFC chicken meat from the bones, and slice it into pieces.?&#3- In a large bowl, combine the pre-cooked rice, cooked black beans, chopped onion, tomatoes, corn, avocado, KFC chicken pieces, remaining cilantro, and a good amount of sour cream.?&#4- Mix all ingredients together, squeeze some lime juice and enjoy. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/477-kfc-chicken-burrito-bowl/ 5 Minutes
5 Minutes 4 Pieces Easy KFC Mar 20, 2017 476 – KFC Chicken Eggplant Pizzettes https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/rsz_copy_of_eggplant_kfc.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 box of KFC crispy chicken strips?&#?&#1 large thick eggplant?&#?&#4 teaspoons olive oil?&#?&#Salt and pepper?&#?&#1/4 cup pasta sauce?&#?&#1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese?&#?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro Directions :?&#?&#1- Cut the eggplant crosswise into thick slices. Place them in a baking sheet covered with parchment paper.?&#2- Brush both sides of each eggplant slice with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.?&#3- Bake the eggplant slices in a preheated oven at 200C for 15 minutes or until they become tender. Make sure to turn the eggplant slices once, while baking.?&#4- Once soft, layer each eggplant slice with 1 tablespoon of pasta sauce, shredded cheese, and KFC crispy chicken strips cut into bite-sized pieces.?&#5- Bake again for 5 minutes until the cheese melts.?&#6- Top each eggplant pizzette with chopped cilantro and serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/476-kfc-eggplant-pizzettes/ 20 Minutes
4 people Medium Couscous Dec 17, 2017 612- Couscous Stuffed Chicken https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/435IMG_5167-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the couscous:?&#350 grams (0.8 pound) couscous?&#150 grams (1 cup) whole almonds, blanched, fried?&#100 grams (2/3 cup) raisins, soaked in water?&#3 tablespoons white granulated sugar?&#2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#2 teaspoons orange blossom water?&#?&#For the chicken:?&#1 whole chicken?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#A pinch of saffron threads?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#?&#Ingredients for the sauce:?&#2 medium onions (250 grams / 9 oz.), chopped?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons butter?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro?&#1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#A pinch of saffron threads?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1 cinnamon stick Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the couscous?&#1- Cook the couscous either by steaming it the traditional way or by using an express method.?&#2- In a large bowl, place the cooked couscous and add the rest of the couscous ingredients: Chopped almonds, raisins, sugar, ground cinnamon, salt, and orange blossom water. Mix. Keep some of the chopped almonds for decoration.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare and fill the chicken?&#3- Wash the chicken in water and rinse with salt and lemon.?&#4- To prepare the chicken marinade, in a large bowl, combine: ground ginger, ground turmeric, pepper, salt, saffron threads, and vegetable oil and mix. Rub the marinade all over the chicken. Cover and let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes.?&#5- Fill the chicken with the couscous mix. Keep the rest of the couscous to serve alongside the chicken.?&#6- Close the chicken cavity using toothpicks.?&#7- Truss the chicken using kitchen thread.?&#?&#Step 3: Cook the chicken?&#8- On medium heat, drizzle a large pot with vegetable oil. Add the butter. Add the chopped onions. Add the spices: ground ginger, ground turmeric, pinch of saffron, a cinnamon stick, and salt. Mix.?&#9- Add the chicken and cook for a few minutes on all sides so that the chicken absorbs all the onion and spice flavors.?&#10- Half-cover the chicken with water, add a bouquet of fresh cilantro, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 15 minutes then turn the chicken and cook for another 15 minutes.?&#11- Place the chicken in a baking pan lined with parchment paper. Rub with butter. Place in the oven at 200°C / 400°F degrees for around 15 minutes or until the chicken develop a golden color.?&#?&#Step 4: Plate all?&#12- Remove the cilantro and the cinnamon stick from the sauce. Add sugar, and mix. Continue cooking the sauce on high heat for 5 minutes to thicken.?&#13- If you want even more flavors in the raisins we add to the couscous, drain the raisins from their soaking water, place them in a saucepan, cover them with the chicken sauce, and cook for around 10 minutes. Then add them to the couscous.?&#14- Take some of the chicken sauce and pour it all over the couscous. Mix.?&#15- Taste the couscous and adjust salt, sugar, ground cinnamon, and orange blossom water to your taste.?&#16- Remove the thread from the chicken.?&#17- To decorate, create small heaps made of couscous then place the chicken in the center of your serving plate.?&#18- Pour the sauce on top of the chicken and top with fried blanched almonds. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/612-couscous-stuffed-chicken/
2 Easy Couscous Apr 17, 2016 427 – Breakfast Couscous Parfait https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscousparfait-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4-5 large dates?&#4-5 large dried apricots?&#1/2 cup orange juice?&#1 tablespoon honey (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom (to taste)?&#2 cups cooked barley couscous, cold?&#2 cups unsweetened plain Greek yogurt?&#Raw walnuts and almonds, chopped Directions :?&#?&#A- Prepare the Date and Apricot Topping?&#1- First, remove the pits and tips of the dates?&#2- Slice the apricots and dates into bite size strips?&#3- in a saucepan combine the dates and apricots, orange juice, honey, and ground cardamom. Mix?&#?&#4- Cook, on medium heat, for around 10 minutes or until the dates and apricots soften and the sauce becomes syrupy.?&#?&#B- Prepare the Belboula?&#1- Watch my video on how to prepare store-bought barley couscous the express way!?&#?&#C- Make the Parfait?&#5- In a cup place the cold barley couscous (belboula) first?&#6- Add unsweetened Greek yogurt?&#7- Add the cooked dates and apricots?&#8- And top with chopped raw almonds and walnuts?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/427-breakfast-couscous-parfait/
2 Meduim Couscous Apr 10, 2016 426 – Couscous Shrimp Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscousshrimpsalad-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Veggies Ingredients:?&#?&#1 celery stick?&#1/2 cucumber?&#1/2 red bell pepper?&#1/2 yellow bell pepper?&#6-7 cherry tomatoes?&#A handful of finely chopped cilantro?&#1/4 preserved lemon (skin only)?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#?&#Shrimp ingredients:?&#?&#10 large shrimp?&#Zest of 1 lemon?&#6 hole garlic cloves?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#Red chili flakes (to taste)?&#1/4 cup olive oil?&#?&#Other:?&#?&#2 cups cold cooked couscous (amount to your taste) Directions :?&#?&#A – Prepare the Veggies?&#1- Trim the leafy part of the celery stick, slice the celery stick lengthwise, and dice into small pieces.?&#2- Cut the cucumber lengthwise, slice into thin sticks, and dice into small pieces.?&#3- Slice off the top of the red pepper, pull out the seeds, cut the peppers in half and remove the white inner strips. 4- Slice the pepper half into thin strips and chop into small pieces.?&#5- Do the same with the yellow bell pepper.?&#6- Chop the cherry tomatoes into quarters.?&#7- Finely chop the cilantro.?&#8- Remove the pulp of the preserved lemon, we are only using the skin. Chop it finely.?&#9- Here are all our ingredients: cucumber, red pepper, celery, cherry tomatoes, cilantro, yellow pepper, and preserved lemon.?&#10- Mix all the vegies together.?&#11- Add olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix.?&#?&#B – Cook the Shrimp?&#1- On medium heat, heat the olive oil in a cazuela or skillet.?&#2- Add the garlic cloves and cook for a few minutes so all the garlic flavors infuse the oil.?&#3- Add the shrimp to the cazuela. Sprinkle salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest. Mix and cook for a few minutes until the shrimp changes color and becomes opaque.?&#4- Once done, remove the shrimp from the oil and reserve.?&#?&#C – Mix It All?&#1- In a large plate, mix the veggies with cold cooked couscous. Click the link on the screen to learn how to cook couscous.?&#2- Add the shrimp and continue mixing.?&#And that’s it – plate in a large glass, decorate with a whole shrimp and cilantro, and serve right away.?&#Hmmm…. So yummy! Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/426-couscous-shrimp-salad/
4 Meduim Couscous Apr 10, 2016 425 – How to Steam Couscous https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscous1-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams dry couscous (not instant) or barley couscous (Belboula)?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons butter (or Moroccan smen)?&#½ teaspoon salt?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Boil Water?&#1- Fill the bottom part of the couscous pot halfway with water and bring it to a boil.?&#2- Add a lemon to the water, to avoid the pot being stained with just boiling water.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare Couscous?&#1- Place the couscous in a large plate; I am using the Moroccan traditional couscous plate called Gasaa.?&#2- Add some cold water, and work the couscous… lift the grains, rub them, give them some love and make sure they are all coated with water.?&#3- Place the couscous top over a plate, to minimize kitchen mess, and transfer the couscous in the couscous top. Don’t worry, the moist couscous grains wont fall through the holes… I promise.?&#?&#Step 3: Steam Couscous – Round 1?&#1- After cooking the meat for 20 minutes, place the couscous top over the couscous bottom. Seal both pots with a cheesecloth or foil, this way we don’t lose any steam.?&#2- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#3- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate, and gently break the couscous grains with a fork. We dont want any lumps.?&#4- Add vegetable oil, and continue fluffing the couscous.?&#5- Add a large pinch of salt. Mix.?&#6- Now add a little bit of water, and continue fluffing, until each couscous grain is plump and happy.?&#7- Let the couscous rest while you start cooking the veggies!?&#?&#Step 4: Steam Couscous – Round 2?&#1- We need to steam the couscous a second time.?&#2- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back on top of the boiling water. Seal both pots.?&#3- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer again, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#4- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate, and you guessed it, fluffing time!?&#5- Add a little bit of water and gently break all the lumps with a fork…. Or your hands if you can stand the heat!?&#6- Let the couscous rest for 5 minutes.?&#?&#Step 5: Steam Couscous – Round 3?&#1- This is the 3rd and final steaming of the couscous.?&#2- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back on top of the boiling water. Seal both pots.?&#3- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer again, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes or until done. If you taste the couscous grains, you will actually know when they are ready… they just feel cooked.?&#4- By the way, you can cook barley couscous called Belboula the same exact way. However, it will take a little longer to cook, so leave it in the 3rd steaming until the barley couscous tastes ready.?&#5- Once done. Empty the couscous in the large plate, and fluff again… but this time just with butter (or Moroccan Smen)!?&#6- Look at these little grains of happiness… they smell like home.?&#?&#Your cooked couscous or barley couscous is ready to be used in recipes requiring it! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/425-how-to-steam-couscous/
2 Easy Couscous Mar 27, 2016 424 – Saykouk – Barley Couscous & Buttermilk https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/rsz_saykouk_pic.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup pre-cooked barley couscous (Belboula)?&#1 ½ cup boiling water?&#A pinch of salt?&#2 teaspoons vegetable oil?&#A little bit of unsalted butter?&#Buttermilk, cold Directions :?&#?&#Overview:?&#In Morocco, there are different types of couscous. The most popular ones are: semolina wheat couscous that has a pale yellow color and barley couscous (called Belboula) that has a light brown color.?&#Saykouk is traditionally made with Barley Couscous, so let’s use that one today?&#?&#Step 1: Cooking the Belboula?&#1- We are preparing Barley Couscous the express way with just boiling water. For each 1 cup of uncooked barley couscous, you need 1.5 cups of boiling water and of course, dont forget a pinch of salt!?&#2- First, prepare your bowl by arranging a plastic wrap on top.?&#3- Place the uncooked Belboula couscous in the bowl, add the vegetable oil, and work out the grains with your fingers until all grains are well coated with the oil.?&#4- Add the boiling water and immediately cover the bowl with the plastic wrap so that the steam is trapped inside.?&#5- Let the couscous sit for 10 minutes.?&#6- You will notice that the couscous has absorbed all the water and the grains became plump. Unwrapp and fluff the grains with a fork.?&#7- Add a little bit of butter and keep fluffing.?&#8- Transfer the Belboula couscous in a plate and let it cool down completely before using it in saykouk.?&#?&#Step 2: Making Saykouk?&#1- To make saykouk, place some cold Belboula couscous in a bowl, and cover it with cold buttermilk… and that’s it.?&#2- You can add sugar if you want, but hey save on the calories… just mix well and enjoy as is. It’s healthy and delicious, especially in the hot summer days! Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/424-saykouk-barley-couscous-buttermilk/
4 Meduim Couscous Mar 21, 2016 423 – Couscous with Seven Vegetables https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/rsz_couscous.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Couscous Ingredients:?&#?&#500 grams dry couscous (not instant)?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons butter (or Moroccan smen)?&#½ teaspoon salt?&#Water?&#?&#Meat Ingredients:?&#?&#500 grams lamb or beef, cut into large pieces?&#1 tomato, grated and skin discarded?&#1 onion, chopped?&#¼ cup olive oil?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#½ teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#½ teaspoon turmeric?&#A large pinch saffron threads?&#A bouquet of fresh parsley and cilantro, tied together?&#2 cups dry chickpeas, soaked overnight?&#?&#Vegetables:?&#?&#3 carrots?&#2 sweet potatoes?&#2-3 turnips?&#2 zucchini?&#1/2 of a small cabbage?&#1-2 small sections of pumpkin?&#1 red chili pepper?&#You can also use fresh fava beans, potatoes, or other vegetables of your choice. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prep Vegetables?&#1- Peel and cut the veggies?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare Meat?&#1- In the bottom of the couscous pot, combine the meat, olive oil, saffron, turmeric, ground ginger, pepper, and salt. Add the chopped onion, and mix. Brown the meat for a few minutes, then add the grated tomato and the fresh herbs.?&#2- Cover the meat with water. Drain the chickpeas and add them to the rest of the ingredients.?&#3- Cover the pot and let the meat cook for around 20 minutes and start preparing your couscous.?&#?&#Step 3: Prepare Couscous?&#1- Place the couscous in a large plate, I am using the Moroccan traditional couscous plate called Gasaa.?&#2- Add some cold water, and work the couscous… lift the grains, rub them, give them some love and make sure they are all coated with water.?&#3- place the couscous top over a plate, to minimize kitchen mess, and transfer the couscous in the couscous top. Don’t worry, the moist couscous grains wont fall through the holes… I promise.?&#?&#Step 4: Steam Couscous – Round 1?&#1- After cooking the meat for 20 minutes, place the couscous top over the couscous bottom. Seal both pots with a cheesecloth or foil, this way we don’t lose any steam.?&#2- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#3- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate, and gently break the couscous grains with a fork. We dont want any lumps.?&#4- Add vegetable oil, and continue fluffing the couscous.?&#5- Add a large pinch of salt. Mix.?&#6- Now add a little bit of water, and continue fluffing.?&#7- Let the couscous rest while you start cooking the veggies!?&#?&#Step 5: Cook Root Vegetables?&#1- Cook the root vegetables first: carrots, sweet potatoes, and turnip. These require more cooking time.?&#2- Place them with the meat and add boiling water to cover it all.?&#?&#Step 6: Steam Couscous – Round 2?&#1- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back over the meat. Seal both pots.?&#2- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer again, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#3- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate and fluff.?&#4- Add a little bit of water and gently break all the lumps with a fork.?&#5- Let the couscous rest for 5 minutes while you are cooking the other vegetables.?&#?&#Step 7: Cook the Other Vegetables?&#1- First let’s check on the root vegetables. My carrots still need a bit more cooking time… but the turnips and sweet potatoes are ready! It’s time to remove them from the pot and place them in a plate.?&#2- Let’s add the other vegetables: zucchini, pumpkin, and cabbage.?&#?&#Step 8: Steam Couscous – Round 3?&#1- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back over the meat. Seal both pots.?&#2- Let the couscous steam for 15 minutes or until done.?&#3- Empty the couscous in the large plate, and fluff again with butter (or Moroccan Smen)!?&#?&#Step 9: Check Meat & Vegetables?&#1- Check the veggies and remove the ones that are ready out of the pot.?&#2- Remove the herbs and discard.?&#3- Check on the meat… mine still needs some cooking.?&#4- Taste your sauce and adjust the seasoning: salt and pepper?&#5- In my case, I will close the pot and let the meat cook a bit more.?&#6- Time for all the veggies to come back to the pot.?&#?&#Step 10: Plate Couscous?&#1- First place the couscous grains in a dome shape.?&#2- Pour some of the broth over the couscous grains.?&#3- Place the meat in the center. Arrange the veggies around and on top of the couscous.?&#4- In a separate bowl, pour the broth and serve on the side https://www.cookingwithalia.com/423-couscous-with-seven-vegetables/
4 Easy Couscous Dec 30, 2015 364 – Couscous Shrimp Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_364.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice?&#1 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1/2 teaspoon cumin?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#A handful of finely chopped cilantro?&#12 large whole shrimps?&#2 cups cooked couscous?&#1 small tomato?&#1 small cucumber?&#Canned corn Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- First let’s prepare all our ingredients. Before squeezing the lemon, roll it while putting pressure on it with your hands. This will help extract more juice from the lemon!?&#2- Next, slice and chop the tomato into small pieces.?&#3- Same with the cucumber, chop it into small pieces.?&#4- Then, get some fresh cilantro and finely chop it.?&#?&#Step 2 – Cooking the Shrimp: ?&#1- Now, let’s heat our grilling pan. Once hot, sprinkle salt on the pan then add the shrimps, whole, with head, peel, and everything –then sprinkle some salt on top of the shrimp. We are grilling the shrimp dry style, no need for oil, butter, or anything else. Just salt. It really brings out the flavors of the shrimp itself.?&#2- Grill on both sides, as soon as the shrimp gets a nice pink color remove from the grill. Peel the shrimp and cut it into small pieces.?&#3- Leave a few shrimp whole for decoration.?&#?&#Step 3 – Making the Couscous Salad: ?&#1- In a large bowl, add the lemon juice, olive oil, ground paprika, ground cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix well. These are the basic ingredients for making the famous Moroccan charmoula. Now, add the chopped tomato, the chopped cucumber, shrimp pieces, and some canned corn. Mix well.?&#2- Add the chopped cilantro, mix, taste, and adjust the salt and pepper.?&#3- Finally, add the cooked couscous – preferably hot.?&#Note: watch my video: How to cook Couscous in 10 minutes.?&#4- Mix all the ingredients until they are all well coated with the charmoula spices.?&#5- Serve immediately, top with whole grilled shrimp, fresh chopped cilantro… et voila!!! .?&#?&#Bonne appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/364-couscous-shrimp-salad/
Meduim Couscous Feb 24, 2015 099 – Moroccan Couscous with Vegetables https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/couscous_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 Cups of Couscous?&#1 Tbs of Smen (Clarified Butter)?&#2 Tbs of Vegetable Oil?&#2 Cups of Water?&#1 Chicken (2 lbs)?&#1/3 Cup Olive Oil?&#½ Tsp Turmeric?&#1 Tsp Ginger Powder?&#1 Tsp Salt?&#½ Tsp Pepper?&#1 Large Pinch of Saffron?&#1 Cabbage?&#1 Butternut Squash?&#2 Cups of Dried Chickpeas (soaked in water overnight) or 1 Can of Chickpeas?&#2 Tomatoes?&#1 Bunch of Parsley?&#1 Bunch of Cilantro?&#4 Carrots?&#1 Zucchini?&#2 Potatoes?&#2 Turnips?&#1 Onion?&#3 Red Chilies Directions :?&#?&#Steps to prepare the Vegetables:?&#1- Peel and slice all the vegetables in large pieces.?&#Steps to cook the Chicken and Vegetables:?&#1 – You will need a Moroccan Couscous Pot. You will use the bottom piece of the pot to cook the Chicken and Vegetables and the top perforated part to cook the Couscous.?&#2 – Place the Chicken, Oil, meat spices, tomato and onions in the bottom pot.?&#3 – Cover the pot and cook on Medium Heat for 10 minutes.4 – After 10 minutes have elapsed add the following vegetables: Cilantro, Parsley, Cabbage, Potatoes, Carrots, Turnips, cabbage and the Chickpeas. Note: If using canned Chickpeas add these at the end.?&#5 – Add 2 cups of Water; continue to cook on Medium Heat for 40 minutes.?&#?&#Steps to cook the Couscous:?&#1 – While the Chicken and Vegetables cook prepare the couscous.?&#2 – In a bowl mix the Couscous with the oil and water.?&#3 – Once the 40 minutes have elapsed remove the Chicken.?&#4 – Taste the sauce and adjust your spices.?&#5 – Add the rest of the vegetables: Zucchini, Butternut Squash and the Red Chili peppers.?&#6 – Place the couscous in the top section of the couscous pot, place on top of the section of the pot that contains the vegetables, cover and cook until you see steam coming up from the couscous. (Approximately 10 minutes)?&#7 – Remove the Couscous from the Couscous pot and place in a large bowl.?&#8 – Add Salt to taste and 1 Cup of Water and mix.?&#9 – Return the couscous to steam again (approximately 10 Minutes)?&#10 – Remove the Couscous from the pot once again and work the couscous with the smen.?&#?&#Serving the Couscous:?&#Serve the couscous by setting the couscous grains first in a dome, adding some sauce to the couscous, then adding the vegetables on the top of the ‘dome’ and around. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-couscous-with-vegetables/
4 people Medium Couscous Dec 17, 2017 612- Couscous Stuffed Chicken https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/435IMG_5167-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the couscous:?&#350 grams (0.8 pound) couscous?&#150 grams (1 cup) whole almonds, blanched, fried?&#100 grams (2/3 cup) raisins, soaked in water?&#3 tablespoons white granulated sugar?&#2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#2 teaspoons orange blossom water?&#?&#For the chicken:?&#1 whole chicken?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#A pinch of saffron threads?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#?&#Ingredients for the sauce:?&#2 medium onions (250 grams / 9 oz.), chopped?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons butter?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro?&#1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#A pinch of saffron threads?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1 cinnamon stick Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the couscous?&#1- Cook the couscous either by steaming it the traditional way or by using an express method.?&#2- In a large bowl, place the cooked couscous and add the rest of the couscous ingredients: Chopped almonds, raisins, sugar, ground cinnamon, salt, and orange blossom water. Mix. Keep some of the chopped almonds for decoration.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare and fill the chicken?&#3- Wash the chicken in water and rinse with salt and lemon.?&#4- To prepare the chicken marinade, in a large bowl, combine: ground ginger, ground turmeric, pepper, salt, saffron threads, and vegetable oil and mix. Rub the marinade all over the chicken. Cover and let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes.?&#5- Fill the chicken with the couscous mix. Keep the rest of the couscous to serve alongside the chicken.?&#6- Close the chicken cavity using toothpicks.?&#7- Truss the chicken using kitchen thread.?&#?&#Step 3: Cook the chicken?&#8- On medium heat, drizzle a large pot with vegetable oil. Add the butter. Add the chopped onions. Add the spices: ground ginger, ground turmeric, pinch of saffron, a cinnamon stick, and salt. Mix.?&#9- Add the chicken and cook for a few minutes on all sides so that the chicken absorbs all the onion and spice flavors.?&#10- Half-cover the chicken with water, add a bouquet of fresh cilantro, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 15 minutes then turn the chicken and cook for another 15 minutes.?&#11- Place the chicken in a baking pan lined with parchment paper. Rub with butter. Place in the oven at 200°C / 400°F degrees for around 15 minutes or until the chicken develop a golden color.?&#?&#Step 4: Plate all?&#12- Remove the cilantro and the cinnamon stick from the sauce. Add sugar, and mix. Continue cooking the sauce on high heat for 5 minutes to thicken.?&#13- If you want even more flavors in the raisins we add to the couscous, drain the raisins from their soaking water, place them in a saucepan, cover them with the chicken sauce, and cook for around 10 minutes. Then add them to the couscous.?&#14- Take some of the chicken sauce and pour it all over the couscous. Mix.?&#15- Taste the couscous and adjust salt, sugar, ground cinnamon, and orange blossom water to your taste.?&#16- Remove the thread from the chicken.?&#17- To decorate, create small heaps made of couscous then place the chicken in the center of your serving plate.?&#18- Pour the sauce on top of the chicken and top with fried blanched almonds. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/612-couscous-stuffed-chicken/
2 Easy Couscous Apr 17, 2016 427 – Breakfast Couscous Parfait https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscousparfait-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4-5 large dates?&#4-5 large dried apricots?&#1/2 cup orange juice?&#1 tablespoon honey (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom (to taste)?&#2 cups cooked barley couscous, cold?&#2 cups unsweetened plain Greek yogurt?&#Raw walnuts and almonds, chopped Directions :?&#?&#A- Prepare the Date and Apricot Topping?&#1- First, remove the pits and tips of the dates?&#2- Slice the apricots and dates into bite size strips?&#3- in a saucepan combine the dates and apricots, orange juice, honey, and ground cardamom. Mix?&#?&#4- Cook, on medium heat, for around 10 minutes or until the dates and apricots soften and the sauce becomes syrupy.?&#?&#B- Prepare the Belboula?&#1- Watch my video on how to prepare store-bought barley couscous the express way!?&#?&#C- Make the Parfait?&#5- In a cup place the cold barley couscous (belboula) first?&#6- Add unsweetened Greek yogurt?&#7- Add the cooked dates and apricots?&#8- And top with chopped raw almonds and walnuts?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/427-breakfast-couscous-parfait/
2 Meduim Couscous Apr 10, 2016 426 – Couscous Shrimp Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscousshrimpsalad-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Veggies Ingredients:?&#?&#1 celery stick?&#1/2 cucumber?&#1/2 red bell pepper?&#1/2 yellow bell pepper?&#6-7 cherry tomatoes?&#A handful of finely chopped cilantro?&#1/4 preserved lemon (skin only)?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#?&#Shrimp ingredients:?&#?&#10 large shrimp?&#Zest of 1 lemon?&#6 hole garlic cloves?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#Red chili flakes (to taste)?&#1/4 cup olive oil?&#?&#Other:?&#?&#2 cups cold cooked couscous (amount to your taste) Directions :?&#?&#A – Prepare the Veggies?&#1- Trim the leafy part of the celery stick, slice the celery stick lengthwise, and dice into small pieces.?&#2- Cut the cucumber lengthwise, slice into thin sticks, and dice into small pieces.?&#3- Slice off the top of the red pepper, pull out the seeds, cut the peppers in half and remove the white inner strips. 4- Slice the pepper half into thin strips and chop into small pieces.?&#5- Do the same with the yellow bell pepper.?&#6- Chop the cherry tomatoes into quarters.?&#7- Finely chop the cilantro.?&#8- Remove the pulp of the preserved lemon, we are only using the skin. Chop it finely.?&#9- Here are all our ingredients: cucumber, red pepper, celery, cherry tomatoes, cilantro, yellow pepper, and preserved lemon.?&#10- Mix all the vegies together.?&#11- Add olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix.?&#?&#B – Cook the Shrimp?&#1- On medium heat, heat the olive oil in a cazuela or skillet.?&#2- Add the garlic cloves and cook for a few minutes so all the garlic flavors infuse the oil.?&#3- Add the shrimp to the cazuela. Sprinkle salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest. Mix and cook for a few minutes until the shrimp changes color and becomes opaque.?&#4- Once done, remove the shrimp from the oil and reserve.?&#?&#C – Mix It All?&#1- In a large plate, mix the veggies with cold cooked couscous. Click the link on the screen to learn how to cook couscous.?&#2- Add the shrimp and continue mixing.?&#And that’s it – plate in a large glass, decorate with a whole shrimp and cilantro, and serve right away.?&#Hmmm…. So yummy! Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/426-couscous-shrimp-salad/
4 Meduim Couscous Apr 10, 2016 425 – How to Steam Couscous https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscous1-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams dry couscous (not instant) or barley couscous (Belboula)?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons butter (or Moroccan smen)?&#½ teaspoon salt?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Boil Water?&#1- Fill the bottom part of the couscous pot halfway with water and bring it to a boil.?&#2- Add a lemon to the water, to avoid the pot being stained with just boiling water.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare Couscous?&#1- Place the couscous in a large plate; I am using the Moroccan traditional couscous plate called Gasaa.?&#2- Add some cold water, and work the couscous… lift the grains, rub them, give them some love and make sure they are all coated with water.?&#3- Place the couscous top over a plate, to minimize kitchen mess, and transfer the couscous in the couscous top. Don’t worry, the moist couscous grains wont fall through the holes… I promise.?&#?&#Step 3: Steam Couscous – Round 1?&#1- After cooking the meat for 20 minutes, place the couscous top over the couscous bottom. Seal both pots with a cheesecloth or foil, this way we don’t lose any steam.?&#2- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#3- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate, and gently break the couscous grains with a fork. We dont want any lumps.?&#4- Add vegetable oil, and continue fluffing the couscous.?&#5- Add a large pinch of salt. Mix.?&#6- Now add a little bit of water, and continue fluffing, until each couscous grain is plump and happy.?&#7- Let the couscous rest while you start cooking the veggies!?&#?&#Step 4: Steam Couscous – Round 2?&#1- We need to steam the couscous a second time.?&#2- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back on top of the boiling water. Seal both pots.?&#3- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer again, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#4- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate, and you guessed it, fluffing time!?&#5- Add a little bit of water and gently break all the lumps with a fork…. Or your hands if you can stand the heat!?&#6- Let the couscous rest for 5 minutes.?&#?&#Step 5: Steam Couscous – Round 3?&#1- This is the 3rd and final steaming of the couscous.?&#2- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back on top of the boiling water. Seal both pots.?&#3- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer again, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes or until done. If you taste the couscous grains, you will actually know when they are ready… they just feel cooked.?&#4- By the way, you can cook barley couscous called Belboula the same exact way. However, it will take a little longer to cook, so leave it in the 3rd steaming until the barley couscous tastes ready.?&#5- Once done. Empty the couscous in the large plate, and fluff again… but this time just with butter (or Moroccan Smen)!?&#6- Look at these little grains of happiness… they smell like home.?&#?&#Your cooked couscous or barley couscous is ready to be used in recipes requiring it! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/425-how-to-steam-couscous/
2 Easy Couscous Mar 27, 2016 424 – Saykouk – Barley Couscous & Buttermilk https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/rsz_saykouk_pic.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup pre-cooked barley couscous (Belboula)?&#1 ½ cup boiling water?&#A pinch of salt?&#2 teaspoons vegetable oil?&#A little bit of unsalted butter?&#Buttermilk, cold Directions :?&#?&#Overview:?&#In Morocco, there are different types of couscous. The most popular ones are: semolina wheat couscous that has a pale yellow color and barley couscous (called Belboula) that has a light brown color.?&#Saykouk is traditionally made with Barley Couscous, so let’s use that one today?&#?&#Step 1: Cooking the Belboula?&#1- We are preparing Barley Couscous the express way with just boiling water. For each 1 cup of uncooked barley couscous, you need 1.5 cups of boiling water and of course, dont forget a pinch of salt!?&#2- First, prepare your bowl by arranging a plastic wrap on top.?&#3- Place the uncooked Belboula couscous in the bowl, add the vegetable oil, and work out the grains with your fingers until all grains are well coated with the oil.?&#4- Add the boiling water and immediately cover the bowl with the plastic wrap so that the steam is trapped inside.?&#5- Let the couscous sit for 10 minutes.?&#6- You will notice that the couscous has absorbed all the water and the grains became plump. Unwrapp and fluff the grains with a fork.?&#7- Add a little bit of butter and keep fluffing.?&#8- Transfer the Belboula couscous in a plate and let it cool down completely before using it in saykouk.?&#?&#Step 2: Making Saykouk?&#1- To make saykouk, place some cold Belboula couscous in a bowl, and cover it with cold buttermilk… and that’s it.?&#2- You can add sugar if you want, but hey save on the calories… just mix well and enjoy as is. It’s healthy and delicious, especially in the hot summer days! Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/424-saykouk-barley-couscous-buttermilk/
4 Meduim Couscous Mar 21, 2016 423 – Couscous with Seven Vegetables https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/rsz_couscous.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Couscous Ingredients:?&#?&#500 grams dry couscous (not instant)?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons butter (or Moroccan smen)?&#½ teaspoon salt?&#Water?&#?&#Meat Ingredients:?&#?&#500 grams lamb or beef, cut into large pieces?&#1 tomato, grated and skin discarded?&#1 onion, chopped?&#¼ cup olive oil?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#½ teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#½ teaspoon turmeric?&#A large pinch saffron threads?&#A bouquet of fresh parsley and cilantro, tied together?&#2 cups dry chickpeas, soaked overnight?&#?&#Vegetables:?&#?&#3 carrots?&#2 sweet potatoes?&#2-3 turnips?&#2 zucchini?&#1/2 of a small cabbage?&#1-2 small sections of pumpkin?&#1 red chili pepper?&#You can also use fresh fava beans, potatoes, or other vegetables of your choice. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prep Vegetables?&#1- Peel and cut the veggies?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare Meat?&#1- In the bottom of the couscous pot, combine the meat, olive oil, saffron, turmeric, ground ginger, pepper, and salt. Add the chopped onion, and mix. Brown the meat for a few minutes, then add the grated tomato and the fresh herbs.?&#2- Cover the meat with water. Drain the chickpeas and add them to the rest of the ingredients.?&#3- Cover the pot and let the meat cook for around 20 minutes and start preparing your couscous.?&#?&#Step 3: Prepare Couscous?&#1- Place the couscous in a large plate, I am using the Moroccan traditional couscous plate called Gasaa.?&#2- Add some cold water, and work the couscous… lift the grains, rub them, give them some love and make sure they are all coated with water.?&#3- place the couscous top over a plate, to minimize kitchen mess, and transfer the couscous in the couscous top. Don’t worry, the moist couscous grains wont fall through the holes… I promise.?&#?&#Step 4: Steam Couscous – Round 1?&#1- After cooking the meat for 20 minutes, place the couscous top over the couscous bottom. Seal both pots with a cheesecloth or foil, this way we don’t lose any steam.?&#2- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#3- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate, and gently break the couscous grains with a fork. We dont want any lumps.?&#4- Add vegetable oil, and continue fluffing the couscous.?&#5- Add a large pinch of salt. Mix.?&#6- Now add a little bit of water, and continue fluffing.?&#7- Let the couscous rest while you start cooking the veggies!?&#?&#Step 5: Cook Root Vegetables?&#1- Cook the root vegetables first: carrots, sweet potatoes, and turnip. These require more cooking time.?&#2- Place them with the meat and add boiling water to cover it all.?&#?&#Step 6: Steam Couscous – Round 2?&#1- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back over the meat. Seal both pots.?&#2- After 5 minutes of so, you will notice steam rising from the couscous. Now start your timer again, and let the couscous steam for 15 minutes.?&#3- Time’s up! Empty the couscous in the large plate and fluff.?&#4- Add a little bit of water and gently break all the lumps with a fork.?&#5- Let the couscous rest for 5 minutes while you are cooking the other vegetables.?&#?&#Step 7: Cook the Other Vegetables?&#1- First let’s check on the root vegetables. My carrots still need a bit more cooking time… but the turnips and sweet potatoes are ready! It’s time to remove them from the pot and place them in a plate.?&#2- Let’s add the other vegetables: zucchini, pumpkin, and cabbage.?&#?&#Step 8: Steam Couscous – Round 3?&#1- Transfer the couscous in the couscous top and place it back over the meat. Seal both pots.?&#2- Let the couscous steam for 15 minutes or until done.?&#3- Empty the couscous in the large plate, and fluff again with butter (or Moroccan Smen)!?&#?&#Step 9: Check Meat & Vegetables?&#1- Check the veggies and remove the ones that are ready out of the pot.?&#2- Remove the herbs and discard.?&#3- Check on the meat… mine still needs some cooking.?&#4- Taste your sauce and adjust the seasoning: salt and pepper?&#5- In my case, I will close the pot and let the meat cook a bit more.?&#6- Time for all the veggies to come back to the pot.?&#?&#Step 10: Plate Couscous?&#1- First place the couscous grains in a dome shape.?&#2- Pour some of the broth over the couscous grains.?&#3- Place the meat in the center. Arrange the veggies around and on top of the couscous.?&#4- In a separate bowl, pour the broth and serve on the side https://www.cookingwithalia.com/423-couscous-with-seven-vegetables/
4 Easy Couscous Dec 30, 2015 364 – Couscous Shrimp Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_364.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice?&#1 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1/2 teaspoon cumin?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#A handful of finely chopped cilantro?&#12 large whole shrimps?&#2 cups cooked couscous?&#1 small tomato?&#1 small cucumber?&#Canned corn Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- First let’s prepare all our ingredients. Before squeezing the lemon, roll it while putting pressure on it with your hands. This will help extract more juice from the lemon!?&#2- Next, slice and chop the tomato into small pieces.?&#3- Same with the cucumber, chop it into small pieces.?&#4- Then, get some fresh cilantro and finely chop it.?&#?&#Step 2 – Cooking the Shrimp: ?&#1- Now, let’s heat our grilling pan. Once hot, sprinkle salt on the pan then add the shrimps, whole, with head, peel, and everything –then sprinkle some salt on top of the shrimp. We are grilling the shrimp dry style, no need for oil, butter, or anything else. Just salt. It really brings out the flavors of the shrimp itself.?&#2- Grill on both sides, as soon as the shrimp gets a nice pink color remove from the grill. Peel the shrimp and cut it into small pieces.?&#3- Leave a few shrimp whole for decoration.?&#?&#Step 3 – Making the Couscous Salad: ?&#1- In a large bowl, add the lemon juice, olive oil, ground paprika, ground cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix well. These are the basic ingredients for making the famous Moroccan charmoula. Now, add the chopped tomato, the chopped cucumber, shrimp pieces, and some canned corn. Mix well.?&#2- Add the chopped cilantro, mix, taste, and adjust the salt and pepper.?&#3- Finally, add the cooked couscous – preferably hot.?&#Note: watch my video: How to cook Couscous in 10 minutes.?&#4- Mix all the ingredients until they are all well coated with the charmoula spices.?&#5- Serve immediately, top with whole grilled shrimp, fresh chopped cilantro… et voila!!! .?&#?&#Bonne appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/364-couscous-shrimp-salad/

Note: If using canned Chickpeas add these at the end.?&#5 – Add 2 cups of Water; continue to cook on Medium Heat for 40 minutes.?&#?&#Steps to cook the Couscous:?&#1 – While the Chicken and Vegetables cook prepare the couscous.?&#2 – In a bowl mix the Couscous with the oil and water.?&#3 – Once the 40 minutes have elapsed remove the Chicken.?&#4 – Taste the sauce and adjust your spices.?&#5 – Add the rest of the vegetables: Zucchini, Butternut Squash and the Red Chili peppers.?&#6 – Place the couscous in the top section of the couscous pot, place on top of the section of the pot that contains the vegetables, cover and cook until you see steam coming up from the couscous. (Approximately 10 minutes)?&#7 – Remove the Couscous from the Couscous pot and place in a large bowl.?&#8 – Add Salt to taste and 1 Cup of Water and mix.?&#9 – Return the couscous to steam again (approximately 10 Minutes)?&#10 – Remove the Couscous from the pot once again and work the couscous with the smen.?&#?&#Serving the Couscous:?&#Serve the couscous by setting the couscous grains first in a dome, adding some sauce to the couscous, then adding the vegetables on the top of the ‘dome’ and around. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-couscous-with-vegetables/

Easy Desserts Dec 31, 2020 844- Galette des Rois with Orange Almond Cream https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/DSC06647.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams (17 oz) puff pastry?&#?&#For the almond cream:?&#140 grams (4.9 oz) unsalted butter, softened?&#160 grams (5.6 oz) powdered sugar, sifted?&#160 grams (5.6 oz) almond powder?&#20 grams (2 1/2 tablespoons) cornstarch?&#2 medium eggs?&#2 teaspoons vanilla extract?&#?&#For the flavoring:?&#2 tablespoons orange zest?&#2 tablespoons orange blossom water?&#?&#For decoration:?&#1 egg yolk?&#1 tablespoon milk?&#1 bean, to put inside the galette?&#1 paper crown Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the almond cream?&#1- In a large bowl, add the softened butter, powdered sugar, almond powder, cornstarch, eggs, and vanilla extract.?&#2- Mix all the ingredients together using a whisk until well combined and the cream is homogeneous. Set aside in the fridge and allow to cool for at least 1 hour.?&#?&#Step 2: Assembling?&#3- On a floured working surface, and using a rolling pin, spread the puff pastry until it is 1.5 mm thick.?&#4- Using 2 round cookie cutters (Or round plates), one of 24 cm and one of 26 cm, cut the puff pastry into two circles. The top one should be slightly larger to make the assembling easier.?&#5- Place the puff pastry circle of 24 cm on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, brush the edges with water and evenly spread the almond cream. Make sure to leave 3 cm between the edges and the cream.?&#6- Add the orange zest and the orange blossom water to the almond cream. Mix well using a spatula until well combined. Place a small bean within the cream, then cover the filling with the second puff pastry circle. Gently press the edges to assemble the circles together and also to avoid possible leaks during cooking.?&#7- In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and milk until homogeneous.?&#8- Evenly brush the entire surface of the Galette des Rois and place it in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.?&#9- Brush the Galette des Rois a second time with egg yolk mixture, then use the back of a knife very carefully, to trace the decorations of your choice on top. Make sure to make a small hole on top in the center of the Galette so that the cream can “breath” during cooking time and not make the galette explode.?&#10- Place the Galette des Rois in a preheated oven at 180°C (365°F) and bake for 30 minutes until golden brown. Allow to cool on a rack. Serve warm. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/844-galette-des-rois-with-orange-almond-cream-%d9%81%d8%b7%d9%8a%d8%b1%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%85%d9%84%d9%88%d9%83-%d8%a8%d9%83%d8%b1%d9%8a%d9%85%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%84%d9%88%d8%b2-%d9%88%d8%a7/ 30 minutes

Easy Desserts Dec 31, 2020 843- Galette des Rois with Amlou https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/DSC06658.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams (17 oz) puff pastry?&#?&#For the almond cream:?&#140 grams (4.9 oz) unsalted butter, softened?&#160 grams (5.6 oz) powdered sugar, sifted?&#160 grams (5.6 oz) almond flour?&#20 grams (2 1/2 tablespoons) cornstarch?&#2 medium eggs?&#2 teaspoons vanilla extract?&#?&#For the flavoring:?&#Almond cream?&#60 grams (2.1 oz) amlou (Moroccan almond butter)?&#?&#For decoration:?&#1 egg yolk?&#1 tablespoon milk?&#1 bean, to put inside the galette?&#1 paper crown Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the almond cream?&#1- In a large bowl, add the softened butter, powdered sugar, almond powder, cornstarch, eggs, and vanilla extract.?&#2- Mix all the ingredients together using a whisk until well combined and the cream is homogeneous. Set aside in the fridge and allow to cool for at least 1 hour.?&#?&#Step 2: Assembling?&#3- On a floured working surface, and using a rolling pin, spread the puff pastry until it is 1.5 mm thick.?&#4- Using 2 round cookie cutters (or round plates), one of 24 cm and one of 26 cm, cut the puff pastry into two circles. The top one should be slightly larger to make the assembling easier.?&#5- Place the puff pastry circle of 24 cm on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, brush the edges with water and evenly spread the almond cream in the center. Make sure to leave 3 cm between the edges and the cream.?&#6- Top the almond cream with a layer of amlou, place a small bean within the cream, then cover the filling with the second puff pastry circle. Gently press the edges to assemble the circles together and also to avoid possible leaks during cooking.?&#7- In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and milk until homogeneous.?&#8- Evenly brush the entire surface of the Galette des Rois and place it in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.?&#9- Brush the Galette des Rois a second time with egg yolk mixture, then use the back of a knife very carefully, to trace the decorations of your choice on top. Make sure to make a small hole on top in the center of the Galette so that the cream can “breath” during cooking time and not make the galette explode.?&#10- Place the Galette des Rois in a preheated oven at 180°C (365°F) and bake for 30 minutes until golden brown. Allow to cool on a rack. Serve warm. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/843-galette-des-rois-with-amlou-%d9%81%d8%b7%d9%8a%d8%b1%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%85%d9%84%d9%88%d9%83-%d8%a8%d9%83%d8%b1%d9%8a%d9%85%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%84%d9%88%d8%b2-%d9%88%d8%a3%d9%85%d9%84/ 30 minutes
