If you don’t have the mold, fold the circle in half to enclose the filling, press the edges with your thumb to make sure it’s closed, then use a fork to print the edges.?&#7- Place the pastry on a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#8- Brush all the top surface of the pastry with the egg wash.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Chaussons?&#1- Place the chaussons / turnovers in the freezer for 10-15 minutes before baking. The pastry will be more crispy if it’s baked when it is cold.?&#2- Bake the chaussons / turnovers in the oven for around 15-20 minutes until they become puffed with a golden brown color.?&#3- Remove from the baking pan, let cool down a bit, and serve warm!?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/246-chocolate-chaussons-turnovers-homemade-recipe/
8 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 255 – Cherry Chocolate Cake – homemade Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_2551.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#6 oz (170 grams) butter (soften)?&#1/2 cup (100 grams) white granulated sugar?&#5 oz (150 grams) dark chocolate 60-70%?&#4 large eggs (white and yolks separated)?&#Pinch of salt?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#1/2 cup (60 grams) white all-purpose flour?&#1 pound (450 grams) cherries?&#Cocoa powder for dusting on top of the cake Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Melt the chocolate and butter on medium heat in a ‘bain-marie’ placing the container with chocolate on top of a pan with boiling water.?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Batter?&#1- First, mix the butter with half of the sugar (keep the other half of the sugar for later). The butter has to be soft. Mix using an egg beater until you get a creamy texture.?&#2- Chocolate is one of the most important ingredients in this recipe. I am using 70% dark chocolate. Try to use the best chocolate quality you can find because it makes a difference in the taste.?&#3- Melt the chocolate in the microwave or a bain-marie. If you are using the microwave, melt the chocolate in 30 seconds shots, while mixing in between, to avoid burning it.?&#4- Add the egg yolks to the butter and sugar mixture. Mix using the egg beater.?&#5- Add a little bit of the melted chocolate to the egg yolk mixture. Mix using the egg beater. Then add the rest of the melted chocolate and mix all the ingredients.?&#6- We want the chocolate cake to be flully, that’s why we separate the egg yolks and the egg whites. In a separate bowl, place the egg whites, and make sure that they have NO traces of egg yolks when separating them, otherwise, they would not fluff.?&#7- Add a pinch of salt to the egg whites and beat them using a CLEAN egg beater, until you get a thick white foam. Then add the rest of the sugar, and continue beating, until you get firm white peaks.?&#8- Add vanilla extract to the egg white mixture and beat for 15 seconds just to integrate it.?&#9- Integrate the egg whites with the chocolate mixture. Add 1/3 of the egg white mixture to the chocolate mixture, and gently mix both using a spatula. When well integrated, add a little more of the egg white mixture and continue mixing. You’ll end up with a very soft batter.?&#10- Sift the flour on top of the chocolate batter. Mix it in using a spatula.?&#Step 2: Preparing the Cherries?&#1- Cut the cherries in half and remove the pits.?&#Step 3: Baking the Cake?&#1- Preapre you baking pan by covering it with butter and lining it up with parchment paper.?&#2- Pour half of the chocolate batter in the baking pan. Spread using a spatula.?&#3- Place the cherry halves on top of the batter.?&#4- Cover the cherries with the rest of the chocolate batter.?&#5- Now bake the cake in a hot oven. Make sure to preheat your oven to 360 F / 180 C.?&#6- Bake for around 40-45 minutes. You know it’s done when you press, gently, the center of the cake with your fingers and it feels firm.?&#7- Let the cake cool down. Dust with cocoa powder. Serve warm or cold!?&#Serving: Decorate with powdered sugar. Serve cold with fruit and whipped cream. Enjoy!?&#Conserving: Wrap the cake in foil and freeze for up to 2 weeks. Just unwrap and thraw at room temperature before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/255-cherry-chocolate-cake-homemade-recipe/
4 Medium Desserts Feb 23, 2015 273 – Chocolate Zucchini Cake Recipe – the BEST cake ever! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_273.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 1/4 cups (160 grams) all purpose flour?&#1/4 cup (30 grams) unsweetened cocoa powder?&#1/2 teaspoon baking soda?&#1/4 teaspoon baking powder?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#3/4 cups (150 grams) white granulated sugar?&#2 large eggs?&#1/2 cup vegetable oil?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1 large zucchini (300 grams)?&#1/2 cup chocolate chunks (preferably dark chocolate) Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients.?&#1- The first thing is to grate the zucchini. Cut the tips of the zucchini, and using the big holes of your grater, grate the zucchini. No need to peel the zucchini!?&#2- Get the best chocolate you can find – especially dark chocolate (get 60-70% cocoa content). Chop the chocolate using a sharp knife into medium pieces.?&#Step 2: Making the Batter?&#1- First mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, add the eggs and beat them with the sugar (using an egg beater) for a few minutes until they become whitish and fluffy.?&#2- Add the vegetable oil, the vanilla extract, and ground ginger to the egg mixture and mix in with the egg beater for about a minute.?&#Note: if you do not like ground ginger you can substitute with ground cinnamon or a little bit of ground cloves.?&#3- Now we are going to add the dry ingredients. Place the flour and unsweetened cocoa powder in a sifter, mix and sift over the egg mixture. Also, add the salt, baking powder, and baking soda to the egg mixture.?&#4- Using a spatula mix in the wet and dry ingredients together.?&#5- Finally add the chopped chocolate and the grated zucchini to the batter. Mix in with the spatula until all the ingredients are well integrated.?&#Step 3: Baking the Cake?&#1- Prepare the pan (I am using a rectangular bread loaf pan – 9 inches long). Butter the pan, place parchment paper in it, then butter the parchment paper. The reason we butter the pan first is for the parchment paper to stick to the pan, otherwise, it would be difficult to work with it.?&#2- Pour the batter in the pan. The batter will only fill half of the pan, but no worries, the cake will puff up when baking. So make sure not to fill the entire pan or the cake will be overflowing in the oven!?&#3- Bake the cake in a pre-heated oven at 360F / 180C for around 50 minutes.?&#4- The cake is ready when you gently touch the top and it feels firm. If it still feels moist it means the cake needs more baking time – but do not overbake it!?&#5- Remove the cake from the pan and let it sit on the kitchen counter until it cools down. You can serve it warm or cold!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/caramel-chocolate-apples-homemade-recipe-2/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 280 – Caramel Chocolate Apples Homemade Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_280.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Chewy caramel candies (8.4 oz / 240 grams)?&#3 medium-sized apples (pink ladies, granny smith, or other apples of your choice.?&#4 tablespoons heavy whipping cream?&#Dark chocolate?&#Toppings (slices almonds, chocolate confetti, crushed cookies, etc.)?&#Wooden skewers?&#Bonus Walnut Caramel Candies: leftover caramel sauce + walnut halves Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- The first step is to melt the caramel. Unwrap the chewy caramel candies and place them in a bowl. Place the bowl over a pot half-filled with boiling water, and continue heat on medium heat. The caramels will melt after around 10 minutes.?&#2- While the caramel is melting, wash the apples. Place the apples in a large bowl filled with cold water, and srub them well. Then use a towel to wipe them. Srub well to remove the wax that covers the apples so that the caramel sticks better on them.?&#3- Take the wooden sticks (large skewers or popsicle sticks) and insert them in the bottom of each apple.?&#4- When the caramel starts melting (it becomes more liquid), add the heavy cream. Mix well. The reason we add the heavy cream is for the caramel to stay chewy when it hardens on the apples otherwise it would become hard.?&#Dipping the Apples in Caramel?&#1- Now the fun part! on your working table, keep the caramel on top of the boiling water pot so it stays soft and liquid while you are dipping the apples.?&#2- Dip each apples in the caramel. Roll the apple around to get the excess of the caramel off.?&#3- At this point , if you only want the caramel no chocolate, you can dip the apples on nuts (sliced almonds or walnuts for example) or any other topping.?&#4- Place the apples on a plate covered with wax paper.?&#5- Place the apple in the fridge (or freezer) for the caramel to set.?&#Dipping the Apples in Chocolate?&#1- Place dark chocolate (or other types of chocolate) in a bowl and melt using the microwave. Melt in 30 seconds shots while stirring in between so the chocolate does not burn.?&#2- Remove the caramel apples from the fridge and dip them in the melted chocolate. Roll for excess chocolate to drip.?&#3- You can dip the apples in nuts or chocolate confettis or any other topping.?&#4- Place the apples in a plate coved with parchment paper and place in the fridge for a few hours before serving.?&#Bonus candy: Walnut Caramel Candies?&#1- If you have leftover caramel sauce, pour in it nuts (for example walnut) and mix well.?&#2- Using two spoons, place small amounts of the walnut-caramel mixture on a plate covered with wax paper.?&#3- Place in the fridge for a few hours before serving.?&#And voila – beautiful walnut caramel candies!!!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/caramel-chocolate-apples-homemade-recipe/
3 Easy Breads Feb 23, 2015 298 – Crêpes – French Pancakes Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_298.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Ingredients for the Crêpes?&#1 cup (240 ml) of milk?&#3 tablespoons (43 grams) of butter?&#3 large eggs?&#1 tablespoon of sugar (only 1/2 teaspoon for savory crepes)?&#A pinch of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract (optional)?&#3/4 cup (96 grams) of flour?&#Ingredients for the Fillings?&#Savory: cheese, cooked ground meat, etc.?&#Sweet: honey, nutella, chocolate sauce, fruits, jams, etc. Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Steps for making the Crêpe batter:?&#1- Bring the milk to a boil.?&#2- Once the milk is boiling add the butter and mix until it melts.?&#3- In a separate bowl, lightly beat the 3 eggs with a whisk.?&#4- Add the sugar, salt, and vanilla to the eggs and mix.?&#Note: you can replace the vanilla with any flavor of your choice (e.g. ground cinnamon, ground cardmom, etc. and for savory crepes you could use dried herbs)?&#5- Incorporate the flour mixture into the eggs.?&#6- Add a little bit of the hot milk and butter to the egg and flour mixture – while mixing, to temper the eggs and bring up the temperature.?&#7- Slowly add the rest of the hot milk and butter to the eggs and flour mixture, while whisking constantly until you a smooth and soft batter. The batter has a thick liquid consistency.?&#?&#Steps for cooking the Crêpe batter:?&#Note: You will need a non-stick pan preferably reserved for only making crêpes.?&#1- Heat the pan on high heat before starting to make the crêpes.?&#2- Once the pan is hot, spread the crêpe batter by rotating the pan in a circular motion.?&#3- Let the crêpe cook for a few minutes in one side before flipping it to the other side.?&#4- Cook the second side for a minute or so until the crepe can slide easily on the pan.?&#The crêpe should have a golden color. Beware not to overcook!?&#?&#Final steps:?&#Fill the crêpes with your favorite filling and serve warm. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/298-crpes-french-pancakes-recipe/
4 easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 307 – Cajuzinhos – Brazilian Peanut Bonbons https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_307.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#200 grams ground roasted peanuts?&#1 can (395 grams) sweetened condensed milk?&#2 generously filled kitchen tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder (if using U.S. tablespoons it would be around 4)?&#1 tablespoon salted butter (or regular butter + pinch of salt)?&#Refined, powdered, or regular white sugar Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Cajuzinhos Mixture:?&#1- Place the ground peanut powder in a bowl. You can buy it from the store or make it yourself: roast the peanuts and ground them into a powder.?&#2- Add the cocoa powder and salted butter (or regular butter + pinch of salt).?&#3- Add the sweetened condensed milk little by litte. Mix well with a spatula and your hands until all ingredients are well integrated. You will have a peanut dough that is moist but that you can still roll into balls.?&#?&#Step 2 – Making Cajuzinhos:?&#1- Roll the peanut mixture it into cylindar or balls (the size of a small walnut).?&#2- Roll the balls in sugar. Add a roasted peanut at the top-center of the cylindar to make it look like a caju fruit!?&#3- Place in small paper cups and serve!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/cajuzinhos-brazilian-peanut-bonbons/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 309 – Carrot Chocolate Cake Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_309.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 large carrots (around 650 grams)?&#3.5 oz (100 grams) dark chocolate (60-70% cocoa)?&#4 large eggs?&#1/2 cup (100 grams) white granulated sugar?&#1/2 cup (113 grams) butter (softened)?&#3/4 cup (100 grams) almond powder?&#3/4 cup (100 grams) all-purpose flour?&#3 tablespoons (25 grams) semolina?&#1 teaspoon baking powder + pinch of salt?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#Topping: 3.5 oz (100 grams) dark chocolate (60-70% cocoa) + 2 tablespoons (30 grams) butter Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the ingredients:?&#1- First peel the carrots… this step is easy, just use a vegetable peeler.?&#2- Then, grate the carrots using the big wholes of the grator… this step is not as easy, but hey, you are working your arm muscles here. Good work out!!!?&#3- Chop the chocolate – try to use good dark chocolate 60-70% cocoa, it will make a huge difference in the taste.?&#?&#Step 2 – Making the batter:?&#1- Place the butter and sugar in a large bowl and mix them together. Note that the butter has to be soften, so take it out from the fridge 1 hour before using it. Mix mix mix… Now add the eggs and continue mixing until well integrated. Use a whisk it’s easier.?&#2- Add the almond powder to the mixture. You can buy it from the store or make it yourself by grounding blanched almonds.?&#3- Add vanilla, Mix. Baking powder with a pinch or salt, mix. Semolina, mix. And sift the flour before adding it. Mix well.?&#4- Finally add the grated carrots and chocolate!!! YUM!!! Mix, mix , mix until you get a soft smooth mixture.?&#?&#Step 3 – Baking the cake:?&#1- Butter your baking pan first so that the parchment paper sticks to it, then butter the parchment paper and the edges of the pan.?&#2- Pour the mixture in your pan and bake in a pre-heated oven at 360 F, which is 180 C. Bake for around 45 minutes and you will get this beautiful golden color cake. To test if it’s ready, gently press the center of the cake, it should feel firm.?&#3- Let the cake cool down… then flip it on a plate. Gently remove the parchment paper and voila!!!?&#?&#Step 4 – Final steps:?&#1- Make the topping by microwaving the chocolate with butter. Microwave in shots of 30 seconds only and mix in between. Otherwise, you will burn the chocolate.?&#2- Pour the beautiful chocolate sauce on top of the cake.?&#3- Place the cake in the fridge and let it cool down.?&#4- Serve and hear your friends and family say “hmmm” “wooow” “Yummyyyyy”?&#?&#All you have to say is “bon appetite” https://www.cookingwithalia.com/carrot-chocolate-cake-cake-recipe/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 314 – Chocolate Chickpea Cake (Gluten free) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_314_-_chocolatechickpeacake.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3.5 oz (100 grams) of pitted dates (weighed without their pits)?&#1 cup (200 ml) of boiling water?&#200 grams (7 oz) dark chocolate (60-70% cocoa)?&#12 oz (360 grams) chickpea can?&#2 eggs?&#Pinch of salt?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom (or ginger or cinnamon) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Here we have beautiful dates, pitted – which means you already removed the hard pit in the middle – that we place in a bowl and cover with hot boiling water. Let the dates sit for 30 minutes, and they will become soft.?&#2- Now, let’s deal with the chocolate! We are going to melt it in the microwave. Use only 30 second shots, then mix in between, otherwise, you can burn the chocolate! Oh, and make sure you use dark chocolate 60-70% cocoa content – it really makes a difference in the taste!?&#3- Chickpea time! Drain a can of chickpeas from their water – and just keep the chickpeas?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Batter?&#1- In a blender add the chickpeas, the dates with their water, the melted chocolate, the eggs, and we are using 2, pinch of salt, baking powder, vanilla extract, and cardamom, my favorite spice ever – you can also use cinnamon or ginger instead!?&#2- Blend it all… blend, blend, blend, until smooth and that’s it!?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Cake!?&#1- Quickly prepare your baking pan,. Butter it first for the parchment paper to stick, then butter the parchment paper.?&#2- Now, pour this goowy, smooth, yummy chocolate batter… yep, this cake is THAT easy!!!?&#3- Bake in a preheated oven at 360 F / 180 C for around 30 minutes or until done.?&#You know it is ready by gently touching the surface of the cake – it should feel firm.?&#4- Let the cake completely cool down before removing it from the mold. First run a knife around the edges of the cake to make sure it’s not sticking to the pan. Place a plate on top and flip it! YAY check this out…?&#5- very gently remove the parchment paper from the surface of the cake et voila! Dust with cocoa powder… and yes, here comes the yummiest richest most chocolaty gluten-free, sugar-free, fat-free cake ever!!!?&#?&#When you guests say “WOWWW YUM”… just say: “bon appetite” https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chocolate-chickpea-cake/
12 medium Breads Feb 23, 2015 333 – Chocolate Baghrir Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_333.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups (350 grams) semolina?&#2 cups (270 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#2 tablespoons sugar?&#1 tablespoon dry yeast + a little bit of sugar?&#2 teaspoons baking powder?&#3 full tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder?&#½ teaspoon of salt?&#2 cups (473 ml) warm water?&#2 cups (473 ml) warm milk?&#1 large egg?&#Topping: honey syrup or chocolate paste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Batter?&#1- The first step is to activate the yeast.Mix the sugar and yeast together, and add some warm water. Stir until the yeast dissolves. Let the yeast mixture rest while preparing the batter for baghrir.?&#2- In your blender, add all the ingredients: warm milk, semolina, flour, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, baking powder, one egg, and water. Mix well. Add the yeast and continue mixing until you get a very smooth batter.?&#3- Pour the baghrir batter in a large bowl. Cover and let it rest on your kitchen counter for 45 minutes.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Baghrir?&#1- Now we are ready to cook. Heat up a pan, it has to be hot, pour some batter in the center of the pan, lower the heat to medium, and cook the baghrir for a couple of minutes.?&#2- You will see that the batter drying up and holes forming at the surface. We cook baghrir from only one side! So do NOT flip it.?&#Note: The pan is a very important element in cooking the baghrir, make sure to use a good quality non-stick pan. wash the pan with water and place it on the stove at medium heat.?&#3- Leave the water drops on the pan as they will evaporate when the pan is hot enough – this will be the sign that we can start cooking the baghrir!?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Place the cooked baghrir on a pan covered with parchment paper.?&#do not stock baghrir one on top of the other, otherwise they will stick. They have to be place one next to each other. Then you can cover the first layer with parchment paper, and place the next batch of baghrir on top.?&#Note: To freeze baghrir, cover each one with parchment paper and put them in a freezer bag.?&#2- place the freezer bag in the freezer and they can be preserved for 3-4 weeks. You just need to thaw them before heating them in a pan and dipping them in the butter-honey sauce.?&#?&#Step 4: Topping for Baghrir?&#1- Talking about the butter-honey sauce, melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan, then add 2-3 tablespoons of honey.?&#2- Let the syrup heat up for few minutes, then just take baghrir, even if it’s at room temperature, and dip the face with the wholes in the syrup. Place in a plate and serve immediately.?&#3- The baghrir will become hot due to the high temperature of the syrup.?&#4- Or, if you want a more chocolaty baghrir – you can cover it with chocolate paste – fold in half, push the edges a bit to seal them… and here you go, a baghrir chocolate pocket! Yummy… now this is something different!?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chocolate-baghrir-recipe/
1 very easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 338 – Canelés De Bordeaux – French custard cake recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_338.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups (500 ml) milk?&#3 1/2 tablespoons (50 grams) butter?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#3/4 cup (100 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1 1/4 cups (250 grams) white granulated sugar?&#Pinch of salt?&#2 whole large eggs + 2 egg yolks?&#Extra butter for the mold Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Batter?&#1- In a saucepan, combine the milk and butter. Cook on medium heat until the milk reaches a boiling point.?&#2- In the meantime, sift the flour into a large bowl.?&#3- Add the sugar and the pinch of salt. Mix.?&#4- Add the 2 eggs and the 2 eggs yolks to the flour mixture. Mix well with a whisk until you get a very smooth batter.?&#5- Remove the milk from the heat and add the vanilla extract. Let the milk mixture cool down a bit (for 5 minutes).?&#6- Whisk the milk mixture into the flour and egg mixture. First add a little bit while mixing, for the eggs to warm up, then keep adding the milk mixture a little bit at time, while mixing vigorously.?&#7- Cover the batter with a plastic wrap and put in the fridge for at least 1 hour (and up to 12 hours) before baking.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Molds?&#?&#1- You need Canneles molds – but if you do not have them, you can use regular molds.?&#2- Brush the molds with melted butter, then place them in the fridge for 30 minutes for the butter to stick.?&#3- If you are using silicon molds, place them on the baking rack before filling them so it’s easier to move them.?&#4- Fill the molds 3/4 full with the batter.?&#Step 3: Baking the Canneles?&#1- Preheat your oven at 500 F which is 260 C degrees?&#2- Bake for 10-15 minutes at this high temperature to get the brown caramelized crust?&#3- Then, reduce oven temperature to 360 F / 180 C and bake for around 1 hour?&#4- The canneles will have a deep brown crust around them. When done, remove them from the mold when still hot and let them cool down. You can eat them warm or cold. They are even better the next day!!!!?&#?&#Bon appetite https://www.cookingwithalia.com/caneles-de-bordeaux-french-custard-cake-recipe/
6 Medium Desserts Feb 23, 2015 348 – Chocolate Cake with Cocoa Syrup Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_3482.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 1/2 cups (200 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1/2 cup (50 grams) unsweetened cocoa powder?&#1/2 teaspoon baking powder?&#Pinch of salt?&#3/4 cup (175 grams) butter (softened)?&#1 1/2 cups (200 grams) powdered sugar?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#2 large eggs?&#1/4 cup and 2 tablespoons (80 grams) heavy cream?&#6 oz (175 grams) dark chocolate at 70%?&#1/2 cup (125 ml) boiling water?&#Syrup ingredients:?&#1/2 cup (125 ml) water?&#1/2 cup (100 grams) white granulated sugar?&#1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Mixing the Dry Ingredients?&#1- First, let’s mix the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, sift the flour and the cocoa powder. Mix with a whisk, then add the baking powder and a pinch of salt. Done!?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the Wet Ingredients?&#1- Now, let’s mix the wet ingredients.?&#Here we have the butter, but it’s at room temperature – it has to be soft. Beat the butter for 1 minute with an electrical beater to make it creamy.?&#2- Add the powdered sugar, into 3 times, and beat in between until well integrated before adding more sugar.?&#3- Add the vanilla.. .here I am using a super flavorful vanilla paste. You can use vanilla extract, ground ginger, cinnamon, or whatever spice you like!?&#4- In a small bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Then add them to the butter mixture and beat in for 30 seconds.?&#5- Finally add the heavy cream and quickly beat it with the butter – then switch to a spatula to mix in the melted chocolate. Delicious! You will get a super smooth, velvety, butter chocolate mixture.?&#?&#Step 3: Making the Batter and Baking the Cake?&#1- Preheat your oven to 360F / 180C?&#2- Let’s join forces and get the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients.?&#3- Add the dry mixture to the butter mixture little by little, while mixing with the spatula until well integrated.?&#4- Add the boiling water little by little to the chocolate batter and continue mixing. You will notice that the batter will become smoother and creamier!!!?&#5- Place the batter in a baking pan covered with parchment paper. Use the spatula to smooth the surface… and to the oven that you have preheated to 360 F / 180 C.?&#6- Bake the cake for around 50 minutes.?&#?&#Step 4: Final Steps?&#1- 10 minutes before the cake is ready, make the syrup! All you have to do is place water, sugar, and cocoa powder in a saucepan and heat up on medium heat until the syrup reaches a boiling point.?&#2- Our cake is ready – when you touch the surface in the middle of the cake, it should feel firm and springy to the touch – but not hard.?&#3- Pour the syrup on the cake. You can make hole with a toothpick so that the syrup gets all in side the cake! And that’s it!!!?&#4- The hardest part is to wait for the cake to absorb all the syrup – ideally, you should leave it overnight.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chocolate-cake-with-cocoa-syrup/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 353 – Carrot Soufflé Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_353.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 1/2 lbs. (680 grams) carrots?&#1/2 teaspoon salt (for boiling the carrots)?&#6 tablespoons (85 grams) butter?&#3 large eggs?&#3/4 cup (150 grams) white granulated sugar?&#2 tablespoons brown sugar (light or dark)?&#1 teaspoon ground cardamom?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cloves?&#1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon vanilla paste (or extract)?&#1/4 cup (36 grams) presifted flour?&#Butter for baking pan?&#Heavy cream for serving (optional) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Ok, ready… start by peeling the carrots. Cut the tips of the carrots, then lengthwise, slice, and dice into small pieces!?&#2- In a large pot, add water, salt, and the carrot pieces. Cover and cook on medium-high heat until the carrot pieces are tender and soft.?&#3- In the meantime, let me show you how to measure flour. First, sift the flour, then fill your measuring cup and use a knife or your spoon handle, to flatten the surface of the flour and remove excess. That’s the way to do it!?&#4- The carrots are ready – it takes around 20 minutes for them to cook. You should be able to easily cut a carrot piece with a fork.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Batter?&#1- Drain the carrots from the water, and place them in a food processor. Add the butter, and mix to combine.?&#2- Add the eggs and continue mixing. Now add the white sugar, brown sugar, baking powder, and spices: here I have ground cardamom, ground clove, ground nutmeg, and ground cinnamon!?&#3- Add vanilla, I am using vanilla paste, which is more flavorful than vanilla extract; and finally flour.?&#4- Mix well until you get a smooth texture with all the ingredients combined. Feel free to taste and adjust the spices accordingly – you may like it spicier!?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Carrot Souffle?&#1- Prepare the baking pan by buttering it for the parchment paper to stick, and buttering the parchment paper as well.?&#2- Pour the carrot mixture in the baking pan, and bake in a preheated oven, of course, at 360 F, which is 180 C.?&#3- Bake for around 1 hour or until the soufflé is done; if you gently touch the center of the souffle it should feel firm.?&#4- Serve immediately, and I like to add heavy cream to it… so soft, so warm, so spiced… it’s just perfect! Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/carrot-souffle-recipe-2/
6 Medium Desserts Feb 23, 2015 359 – Chocolate Hidden Heart Cake Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_359.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Red Cake:?&#12 1/2 tablespoons (175 grams) unsalted butter (softened)?&#3/4 cups and 2 tablespoons (175 grams) white granulated sugar?&#3 large eggs?&#1 teaspoon vanilla paste (or extract)?&#1 cup 1/3 cup (175 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#Pinch of salt?&#Red colorings?&#Chocolate Cake:?&#12 1/2 tablespoons (175 grams) unsalted butter (softened)?&#3/4 cups and 2 tablespoons (175 grams) white granulated sugar?&#3 large eggs?&#1 teaspoon vanilla paste (or extract)?&#1 cup 2 tablespoons (150 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#Pinch of salt?&#6 oz (170 grams) dark chocolate Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Red Cake Batter?&#1- First, we are going to make the red cake. Place the softened butter in a large bowl, add the sugar, then beat on high speed with the eggbeater until the butter and sugar are well integrated.?&#2- Add the first egg. Mix. The second egg. Mix. Then the third egg and mix again. Add the vanilla paste or vanilla extract and mix to incorporate.?&#3- Now, let’s add the dry ingredients. Sift the flour, add the baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Using a spatula, gently fold the dry ingredients into the butter mixture.?&#4- I want my cake to be red, so I am using bright red coloring…. Check out this delicious color, it screams valentine’s day!!!?&#5- Butter your baking pan and pour the red cake batter into it.?&#?&#Step 2: Baking the Red Cake?&#1- Bake in a pre-heated oven to 360 F / 180 C for around 40-45 minutes or until the cake is done.?&#2- When the cake is ready, remove it from the oven, gently push the sides of the cake using a knife, then flip it on a plate or cutting board.?&#3- Place the cake in the freezer so it cools down quickly while you prepare the second cake.?&#?&#Step 3: Making the Chocolate Cake Batter?&#1- Here we go, let’s make the chocolate cake. We are going to follow the same steps: cream the softened butter and sugar, mix in the eggs one at a time, add the vanilla paste, sift in the flour, add the baking powder, and pinch of salt. The cake batter is ready!?&#?&#Step 4: Making the Red Hearts?&#1- Before we add the melted chocolate, let’s make our red cake hearts!?&#2- Remove the red cake from the freezer and slice it into medium-thick slices. Discard the edges because they are crunchy, and we only want soft spongy cake for this part!?&#3- Line up the cake slices, then using a small heart cookie cutter (or any shape of your choice), stamp out 2 hears in each cake slice.?&#Note: Yes, I know you are left out with all this cake… don’t worry, watch my video on how to make Chocolate Cake Balls… you will be thankful to have all this leftover cake.?&#?&#Step 5: Assembling Both Cakes?&#1- Ok, back to our chocolate cake. Melt the chocolate in the microwave, in 30 second shots and mix in between, so you don’t burn it. Then add the melted chocolate to the cake batter. If we have done this earlier, the chocolate batter would have hardened and it would have been difficult to work with it. That’s why we leave the melted chocolate until the end.?&#2- Butter your pan and pour in 1/3 of the chocolate batter. Using a spoon, smooth out the surface of the batter.?&#3- Pack the heart shaped cut outs together, tightly, in 2 rows and gently place them on top of the chocolate batter. Leave some space at each end of the pan.?&#4- Gently place the remaining chocolate batter on top of the red hearts. Very gently, don’t try to smooth it out, just place it on top and on the sides, the heat of the oven will make it spread evenly.?&#?&#Step 6: Final Steps?&#1- Bake in a pre-heated oven to 360 F / 180 C for 40-45 minutes or until the cake is done.?&#2- Here is my beautiful chocolate cake. It’s ready! When you touch the surface of the cake it should feel firm but not hard – that’s how you know it is ready. Using a knife, gently push the sides of the cake form the pan, then flip the cake and let it cool down completely before serving.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chocolate-hidden-heart-cake/
6 advanced Desserts Feb 23, 2015 122 – Black Forest Cake Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_122.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#(4) large eggs?&#(3/4) cup – flour?&#(1/2) cup – sugar?&#(4oz) bitter sweet chocolate (60% cocoa content)?&#(2) TBL spoons – corn starch?&#(2) TBL spoons – sugar (this is separate from ½ cup of sugar)?&#pinch of salt?&#(1) pint – heavy cream (be sure the heavy cream and container are very cold)?&#(2) TBL spoons – powdered sugar?&#(2) tsp – vanilla extract?&#(1) jar – maraschino cherries (separate cherries from juice into separate bowls)?&#Will need 1-2 bars of dark chocolate to create shavings, using a vegetable peeler Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Chocolate Cake?&#1. Separate egg whites from yolks (make sure there are no traces of yolk in whites, otherwise it will be difficult to beat into a white mixtures)?&#2. Beat egg yolks with a ½ cup of sugar, until you get a white mixture?&#3. Melt chocolate into a Bain-Marie where you have chocolate container on top of boiling water?&#4. Once chocolate is melted, add to yolk mixture. Just add a little to tempure egg yolks so they don’t coo, then add the rest?&#5. Beat egg whites with (2) TBL spoons of sugar and pinch of salt until you get a firm white mixture?&#6. Make sure there are no traces of egg yolk in whites and that your beater is clean and dry?&#7. Add pinch of salt to egg whites?&#8. Once egg whites starts to firm up, add the 2 TBL spoons of sugar?&#9. Mix corn starch with flour and sift into different container?&#10. Incorporate egg whites and flour and corn starch into chocolate mixture?&#11. Now going to add some of egg white and flour into chocolate mixture?&#?&#Step 2 – Baking the Chocolate Cake?&#1. Get baking pan ready (using a 13×9 pan in video)?&#2. Butter the pan and place parchment paper on pan?&#3. Butter parchment paper and place chocolate mixture in pan?&#4. Pre-heat oven to 360°?&#5. Bake for 20-25 minutes?&#6. To check if the cake is cooked, press on top – it should feel firm?&#Gently move to rack so it cools down?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Cream?&#1. Now beat the heavy cream into whipped cream by mixing with powdered sugar and vanilla extract?&#2. Make sure the heavy cream, container and beater heads are cold by placing them in the refrigerator for a few hours before making the whipped cream?&#3. The consistency of the whipped cream should be firm?&#4. Cover heavy cream with plastic wrap and put in refrigerator until ready to use?&#?&#Step 4 – Other things to Prepare?&#1. Make chocolate shavings by shaving chocolate bar with vegetable peeler?&#2. Cut maraschino cherries into small pieces?&#?&#Step 5 – Assembling the Black Forest Cake?&#1. Now that the cake is at room temperature, use a glass to cut small circular pieces of cake for individual sizes?&#2. Use circular pieces for cake, but save excess to make extra in glass?&#3. Now going to assemble the Black Forest?&#4. First wet cake with syrup, then add whipped cream and cherries, and repeat a few times. Then cover whole cake with the whipped cream and chocolate shavings?&#5. Now going to decorate top of the Black Forest, so going to pipe some whipped cream on top using a piping bag and piping tip.?&#6. To use piping bag, first insert piping tip inside bag, then cut edge to be able to pipe; then turn over in hands and fill with some cream. Use thumbs to push cream down; turn piping bag up and push down cream?&#7. Put cream circles around top of cake and add a cherry in the middle?&#8. Place in refrigerator for 4-hours so it cools down and cake absorbs syrup?&#?&#For Leftovers of Cake?&#1. Take some cake and crumble it in a cup?&#2. Add some syrup?&#3. Add whipped cream?&#4. Add cherries?&#5. Crumble more cake?&#6. Add syrup?&#7. Decorate with some chocolate shavings?&#Note: If you don’t like cherries, you can replace with other fruit (ie: raspberries, and for juice you can replace with jam that has been diluted in some water) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/black-forest-cake/
6 Medium Desserts Feb 23, 2015 127 – Bûche de Noël (Yule Log) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_127.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients for the Sponge Cake?&#?&#(1) cup – Flour?&#(1/2) cup – Sugar?&#(4) Egg Whites (make sure there is no trace of egg yolk in whites)?&#(4) Egg Yolks (large eggs)?&#(1) Large – Egg?&#(2) Tsp – Vanilla Extract?&#Pinch of Salt?&#?&#Ingredients for Pastry Cream?&#?&#Refer to video on how to make pastry cream. The difference is instead of flavoring with vanilla extract, going to flavor with (2) tablespoons of orange blossom water and a zest of a large orange.?&#?&#Ingredients for Butter Cream?&#?&#(4) oz Dark Chocolate?&#(3) large Egg Yolks?&#(8) Tablespoons – Butter (Soft/Room Temperature)?&#(1/2) cup – Sugar?&#(1/4) cup – Water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Sponge Cake?&#1. Beat egg whites until you get firm white peaks. Make sure you get no trace of egg yolks in whites and be sure beaters are clean and dry?&#2. Mix egg yolks with the sugar until you get a whitish mixture. Once mixture is creamy and whitish, add one more (whole) egg?&#3. Use spatula to mix vanilla extract and salt to egg yolk mixture?&#4. Sift in the flour?&#5. Add egg whites to egg yolk mixture?&#6. Prepare baking pan (using a 15” pan in video)?&#7. first, Butter the baking pan?&#8. then, Place parchment paper on pan?&#9. finally, butter the parchment paper?&#10. Pour mixture on the baking pan and spread evenly?&#11. Pre-heat oven to 400°F?&#12. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until done?&#13. The cake is ready when you touch the top of the cake it should feel firm.?&#14. Next step is to roll the cake. Sprinkle powdered sugar on clean towel?&#15. Flip cake on towel and gently remove parchment paper?&#16. Dust powder sugar on top of cake?&#17. Place cake at edge of towel when the cake it is still hot, then gently roll cake with towel (has to be tight)?&#18. Let cake cool down in towel. The steam will make the cake go soft.?&#19. By rolling it, now you have the yule log shape.?&#?&#Step 2 – Preparing the Pastry Cream?&#1. In the pastry cream recipe, the last step calls for adding the butter and vanilla extract, but in this recipe, going to add the butter, (2) TBL spoons of orange blossom water and a zest of a large orange?&#2. Cover top surface of cream with plastic wrap so it doesn’t create a film, then let it cool down in refrigerator?&#?&#Step 3 – Making the Butter Cream?&#1. In a saucepan, cook sugar and water on medium heat until you get a thick syrup?&#2.In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks and slowly pour in the sugar syrup over the egg yolks?&#3. The bottom of the bowl is warm. Keep beating the egg yolks mixture until bowl becomes cold?&#4. When the egg yolks cools down, beat in butter little by little. The butter should be soft.?&#5. Now we are going to melt the chocolate – You can melt in either in a bain-marie or microwave. If you do heat I the microwave, be sure not to burn the chocolate, so heat in 30 second shifts, and stir from time-to-time?&#6. Mix chocolate with the butter cream?&#?&#Step 4 – Assembling the Yule Log?&#1. Gently unroll cake?&#2. Fill cake with pastry cream and gently roll back the cake?&#3. Cut the sides of cake and place one of the slices on top of cake?&#4. Spread chocolate cream all over (top) of the cakse?&#5. Use fork to make stripes on the log?&#6. Place cake in a plate and decorate with meringues, orange sticks or other candy of choice?&#7. Put yule log in fridge for a few hours before serving.?&#BON APPETIT!!!! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/buche-de-noel-yule-log/
12 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 130 – Basbousa – Egyptian Semolina Cake Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_130.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1-¼ cups of semolina?&#½ cup of flour?&#1-½ cups of natural unsweetened shredded coconut?&#1 cup of milk?&#¾ cup of sugar?&#1 egg?&#1 teaspoon of almond extract?&#1 teaspoon of baking powder?&#8 tablespoons of butter (4oz)?&#1 cup of water?&#1 cup of sugar?&#2 tablespoons of lemon juice?&#1 tablespoon of rose water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Cake?&#1. Mix together the semolina, flour, coconut, sugar & baking powder.?&#2. Melt the butter?&#3. Beat the egg?&#4. Add the milk, egg, melted butter and almond extract to the dry mixture and mix until combined and smooth.?&#5. Prepare an 8×11 pan. Generously butter the pan.?&#6. Transfer the mixture into the baking pan.?&#7. Using a sharp knife, cut the Basbousa into diamond shapes.?&#8. Preheat the oven to 350°F.?&#9. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown.?&#10. Retrace the cuts made prior to baking with a knife.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Syrup?&#1. Bring to boiling point the water, sugar & lemon juice.?&#2. Once the syrup reaches boiling point, reduce the heat to medium-low and let it simmer for 5-6 minutes.?&#3. After thickening the syrup a little bit by simmering it, add the rose water and let the syrup simmer again for another 1-2 minutes.?&#4. Transfer the syrup into a measuring jug and let it cool down.?&#?&#Step 3: Soaking the Cake with Syrup?&#1. Pour the syrup on the Basbousa and decorate with shredded coconut. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/basbousa-egyptian-semolina-cake/
8 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 104 – Beignets Recipe – Best Doughnuts Ever! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_104.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#12 oz. of flour?&#½ cup of milk?&#¼ cup of water?&#1 tablespoon of sugar?&#1 tablespoon of dried yeast?&#½ teaspoon of salt?&#1 teaspoon of vanilla extract?&#1 egg?&#Vegetable oil for frying?&#Sugar for decoration Directions :?&#?&#1. Dilute the yeast in 1 tbsp warm water, mix with a fork.?&#2. Mix all of the ingredients together in a stand mixture using a dough hook. If you don’t have a stand mixture you can knead the dough by hand until you get a non-sticky malleable dough.?&#3. If the dough is too sticky, add more flour and if it is too hard, add more liquid.?&#4. Cover the dough and let it rest in a warm place for 1 hour.?&#5. Place some flour on your workstation.?&#6. Roll the dough into a thin layer for thin and crispy doughnuts and a medium-thick layer for soft and spongy doughnuts.?&#7. To shape the doughnuts make a large circle with a small circle inside using cookie cutters or other utensils.?&#8. After you shape the doughnuts, remove the excess dough and roll again to make more doughnuts.?&#9. Cover the dough and let it rest in a warm place for 30 minutes – 1hour or until the doughnuts gain some volume.?&#10. Heat the oil in a pan on high heat.?&#11. When the oil is hot start frying the doughnuts.?&#12. Fry the doughnuts on both sides until they become golden brown. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/beignets-best-doughnuts-ever/
6 Easy Breads Feb 23, 2015 138 – Best Banana Bread Recipe Ever! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_138.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 1/2 cups of flour?&#1 cup of sugar?&#1/4 teaspoon of baking powder?&#1/2 teaspoon of baking soda?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt?&#1 cup of unsalted roasted slivered almonds?&#1 cup of mashed (super ripe) bananas?&#1/2 cup of milk?&#8 tabespoons of butter?&#2 large eggs?&#1 teaspoon of vanilla extract?&#1 can of Dulce de Leche Directions :?&#?&#1- Sift the flour and mix all the dried ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt).?&#2- In a large ball, lighty beat the eggs. Add the melted butter, bananas, vanilla extract, and almonds to the eggs. Mix well.?&#3- Incorporate the flour mixture into the eggs mixture. Use a spatula to fold in the ingredients – do not overmix. Add the milk to the batter and mix well.?&#4- Preheat your oven to 360 F degrees. Prepare a loaf pan (9 inches) by buttering the pan and lining it with parchment paper?&#5- Pour the batter in your pan. Add the dulce de leche to the batter and swirle it using a knife.?&#6- Bake the banana bread for (around) 1 hour 15 minutes. The banana bread is done when it feels firm when gently pressing the top with your finger.?&#7- Let the banana bread cool down on a rack before servin. Bonne appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/best-banana-bread-ever/
8 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 203 – Best Key Lime Pie Recipe : Making the Graham Crust https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_204.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 oz (140 grams) Graham crackers?&#5.5 oz (154 grams) raw cashews (or blanched almonds)?&#2 tablespoons white sugar?&#5 tablespoons (70 grams) butter Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing Ingredients?&#1- Mix the graham crackers in a food processor until you get a very fine texture. If you get pieces of graham crackers that do not get mix with the rest, just pulse them a few times and they would get mixed.?&#2- Mix the raw cashews in a food processor until you get a very fine texture.?&#3- Melt the butter.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the Ingredients?&#1- In a large bowl, mix the graham crackers and cashews powders.?&#2- Add the melted butter and mix until well incorproated. The texture should feel like wet sand.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Crust?&#1- Preheat your oven to 350 F (176 C) degree.?&#2- Spread the Graham mixture into your baking pan (preferably a 9 inch baking pan – if the pan is larger you may need more mixture, if the pan is smaller, you many not meed the entire mixture).?&#3- Your the palm of your hands to flatten the Graham mixture into the pan in an even layer. Do not forget to side of the pan to create an elevation of the pie.?&#4- Bake for 10 minutes.?&#5- Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool down before using it! You can use this crust with the key lime pie recipe or any other pie recipe!?&#Note: Check out Best Key Lime Pie: Making the Filling to complete the recipe. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/best-key-lime-pie-making-the-crust/
8 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 204 – Best Key Lime Pie Recipe: Making the Filling https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_204.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 can 14 oz (400 grams) sweetened condensed milk?&#1/2 cup (100 ml) Persian lime juice?&#Zest of 3 Persian limes?&#4 egg yolks Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Important Note About Limes?&#1- In this recipe, I am using Persian limes, which are less tart than the key limes. If you are using key limes, you may have to adjust the amount of juice and zest to get the right tartness of the pie filling. If you can not find limes at all, you can use lemons instead but still have to adjust the amount accordingly.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the Ingredients?&#1- The secret of a very creamy Key Lime pie filling is beating the condensed milk and the egg yolks until you get a very thick creamy mixture.?&#2- Place the egg yolks and condensed milk in a large bowl. Using an egg beater, beat the yolks and the milk, on high speed, for around 8 minutes until you get a really thick whitish mixture.?&#3- Add the zest of 3 Persian limes. Mix using a spatula.?&#4- Add the lime juice, little by little, and mix in the mixture using a spatula.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Pie?&#1- Preheat your oven to 350 F (176 C).?&#2- Place the lime filling within the Graham crust. Smooth the surface with a spatula.?&#3- Bake for around 10 minutes. You will notice small bubbles on the surface – that’s a sign that the filling is done.?&#4- Let the pie cool down for around 30 minutes on your counter, then place in the fridge for at least 4 hours before serving.?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Optional step: Prepare the whipped cream by beating 1 cup of heavy cream, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 tablespoon of powdered sugar. Beat until you get stiff peaks – but do not overbeat otherwise the cream would curdle.?&#2- Pipe the whipped cream on top of the Key Lime Pie. Let sit in the fridge for another 30 minutes.?&#3- Serve cold!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/best-key-lime-pie-making-the-filling/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 211 – Baked Apples Moroccan Style Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_211.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 golden apples (you can also use Fuji or Gala apples)?&#5 tablespoons (70 grams) softened butter?&#1/3 cup (73 grams) brown sugar?&#1 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg?&#A pinch of ground cloves?&#The zest of 1 orange?&#1/3 cup of chopped walnuts?&#1 small lemon Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Butter Filling?&#1- Make sure that the butter is softened otherwise it will be difficult to mix it with the rest of the ingredients.?&#2- In a bowl, using a fork, mix the butter and brown sugar.?&#3- Add the cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and the zest of 1 orange and continue mixing until you get a smooth texture.?&#4- Add the chopped walnuts and continue mixing.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Apples?&#1- Using a pairing knife or apple corer, remove the core of the apple without makig a whole at the bottom of the apple. Make sure that the whole is a wide enough to be able to stuff it with the butter mixture.?&#2- Run the knife (in a think cut) around the apple at the center. This way, when the apple bakes, the skin does not explode.?&#3- Cut the bottom of the apple (thinly) so that the apple can ‘stand’ on it’s bottom, otherwise it would roll.?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Preheat your oven to 375 F degrees (190 C).?&#2- Place the apples in a baking pan and squeeze some lemon juice on the apples.?&#3- Fill the apples with the butter mixture, then top them with the rest of the butter mixture.?&#4- Bake the apples for 45-50 minutes. The more you bake them the softer they become.?&#5- Serve the apples immediately, still hot, with vanilla ice cream!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/baked-apple-moroccan-style/
4 Very easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 232 – The BEST gluten free cookies ever! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_232.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups almond flour?&#2 Tbsp + 1tsp coconut flour?&#1/4 cup grass-fed butter, room temperature (even softer if you’re hand mixing)?&#2 Tbsp almond butter (if unavailable, substitute with honey)?&#1 jumbo egg (or 2 small eggs), room temperature?&#1/3 cup coconut sugar (or brown sugar) + 1 tbsp of honey?&#2 Tbsp vanilla extract?&#3/4 tsp baking soda?&#3/4 tsp salt?&#3/4 cup dark chocolate chips (recipe used a mix of chunky and regular)?&#1 tsp large sea salt crystals (garnish at the end if desired) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Mixing the Wet Ingredients?&#1- Using a food processor, mix the following ingredients: butter, almond butter, egg, coconut sugar, and the vanilla extract. Mix until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing In the Dry Ingredients?&#1- Add to the butter mixture, the rest of the ingredients: almond flour, coconut flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix until you get a smooth texture. From time to time, scrape the sides of the food processor using a spatula to make sure that all the ingredients are well mixed-in.?&#2- Place the dough in a bowl and add the chocolate chips. Using a spoon, make sure that the chocolate chips are well-incorporated into the dough.?&#?&#Step 3: Shaping and Baking the Cookies?&#1- Preheat your oven to 350 F (176 C).?&#2- Using a large spoon, or even better an ice cream scooper, place portions of the dough in a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#3- Place a piece of parchment on top of the dough balls, and gently press on top of the parchment paper to flatten the cookies.?&#4- Bake the cookies for around 9-11 minutes. Make sure not to overbake.?&#5- Once the cookies are done, they will be soft, so let them cool down before you eat them. They will be soft and chewy!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/232-the-best-gluten-free-cookies-ever/
4 easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 306 – Brigadeiros – Brazilian Chocolate Bonbons https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_306.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 generously filled kitchen tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder (if using U.S. tablespoons it would be around 8)?&#1 can (395 grams) sweetened condensed milk?&#1 tablespoon salted butter (or regular butter + pinch of salt)?&#Chocolate confettis for rolling (also you can use chopped nuts, etc. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Brigadeiro Mixture:?&#1- Place the cocoa powder in a sauce pan.?&#2- Add the sweetened condensed milk to the cocoa powder little by litte. Mix well with a spatula before adding the rest of the condensed milk.?&#3- Add the salted butter (or regular butter + a pinch of salt) to the chocolate mixture. the butter has to be soften at room temperature. Mix well.?&#4- Cook the chocolate mixture on medium heat for 10-15 minutes while stirring constantly. You will notice that the mixture will thicken as it cooks. the more you cook it the more chewy the brigadeiro will be. So adjust the cooking time to the consistency of your choice.?&#5- Remove the brigadeiro mixture from the heat, place in a plate (previously brushed with butter) and let it cool down.?&#?&#Step 2 – Making Brigadeiro Balls:?&#1- Once the brigadeiro mixture cools down, roll it into balls (the size of a small walnut). Spread some butter on your hands when rolling the balls so the chocolate does not stick to your hands.?&#2- Roll the balls in chocolate confettis, coconut powder, chopped nuts, or anything you want.?&#3- Place in small paper cups and serve!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/brigadeiros-brazilian-chocolate-bonbons/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 308 – Beijinhos – Brazilian Coconut Bonbons https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_308.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/2 cups (40 grams) dried unsweetened shredded coconut?&#1 can (395 grams) sweetened condensed milk?&#1 tablespoon salted butter (or regular butter + pinch of salt)?&#Granulated white sugar or more shredded coconut for rolling?&#Whole cloves Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Beijinhos Mixture:?&#1- Place the sweetened condensed milk in a pan.?&#2- Add the unsweetened shredded coconut to the condensed milk. Mix well.?&#3- Add the salted butter (or regular butter + a pinch of salt) to the mixture. the butter has to be soften at room temperature. Mix well.?&#4- Cook the coconut mixture on medium heat for 5-10 minutes while stirring constantly. You will notice that the mixture will thicken as it cooks. Do not stop stirring or the coconut mixture will become crystallized?&#5- Remove the beijinhos mixture from the heat, place in a plate (previously brushed with butter) and let it cool down.?&#?&#Step 2 – Making Beijinhos Balls:?&#1- Once the beijinhos mixture cools down, roll it into balls (the size of a small walnut). Spread some butter on your hands when rolling the balls so the mixture does not stick to your hands.?&#2- Roll the balls in cristallized sugar or coconut powder.?&#3- Place in small paper cups and insert 1 whole cloves in the center of each ball – it’s both for decoration and flavor.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/beijinhos-brazilian-coconut-bonbons/
1 Very easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 345 – Banana in Coconut Milk – Thai recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_345.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 small banana?&#1 cup (230 ml) Coconut milk (diluted with a bit of water)?&#2 tablespoons sugar (or to taste)?&#1 pinch of salt Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Simple Steps?&#1- First, peel the banana and slice it sideways to get these beautiful oval shapes.?&#2- Place the banana slices in a saucepan.?&#3- Add the coconut milk?&#Note that you may have to add a little bit of water to the coconut milk to dilute it. Add the salt and sugar. Cook on medium heat for 5 minutes until it reaches a boiling point.?&#4- Place a few ice cubes in a bowl, add the bananas and pour the coconut milk. Serve immediately!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/banana-in-coconut-milk-thai-recipe/
6 Medium Desserts Feb 23, 2015 350 – Best Apple Pie Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_350.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#4 large red apples?&#1/2 cup (100 grams) granulated white sugar?&#1/2 cup (110 grams) brown sugar?&#1/4 cup (30 grams) cornstarch?&#1 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg?&#1/8 teaspoon ground cloves?&#1/4 teaspoon salt?&#2 cups (473 ml) water?&#600 grams puff pastry?&#Egg Wash: 1 egg yolk + 1 tablespoon water?&#Glaze: 1 tablespoons honey + 1 tablespoon water Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Apple Filling?&#1- Peel the apples, cut them in half, then in quarters, remove the core… well, no one wants to eat the seeds, then cut the apples in medium-sized cubes. You want nice chunks so when you bite into the apple pie, you can feel the apple pieces!?&#2- In a large saucepan, add the white sugar, brown sugar, cornstarch, salt, and spices. Here we have ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and a small pinch of ground cloves!?&#3- Whisk all these ingredients together. Then add the water and continue whisking until well integrated.?&#4- Place the saucepan on your stove and heat the mixture for a few minutes, then add the apple pieces.?&#5- Spread the apple pieces around, cover your pan, and cook for about 15 minutes. Stir from to time.?&#6- The apple filling is ready when the sauce has thickened and the apple pieces are done – which means if you try to cut an apple piece with a fork you can do it easily, but at the same time, it still has a soft crunch. You don’t want to overcook the apples, otherwise, you will lose texture in your pie!?&#7- Let the filling cool down completely before using it.?&#?&#Step 2: Putting the Pie Together?&#1- I am using homemade puff pastry, but you can also use piecrust instead.?&#2- For the base of the pie, you need around 400 grams of puff pastry. Lightly dust your work station, pastry, and rolling pin.?&#3- Roll the puff pastry and place your pie pan in the center it to see if it fits. The pastry should be wide enough to cover the sides of the pan.?&#4- When ready, place the rolling pin on the edge of the pastry, and roll it along the pastry. Put the pie pan underneath, and roll the pastry in the pan.?&#Note: Remember, you have to work quickly with puff pastry because it gets sticky when it becomes warm. If so, just put it in the fridge for 30 minutes before continuing to work with it.?&#5- Gently place the pastry in the pan, and make sure it covers all the sides of the pan. Then press on the edges or use a knife, to cut the excess pastry around.?&#6- Prick the base of the pastry with a fork then put it in the fridge while rolling the rest of the pastry (around 200 grams). As before, dust your surface, pastry, and rolling pin and roll it enough to cover the pastry pan.?&#7- Take your pastry base (that was in the fridge of course), place in it your apple filling that is now cold – and I emphasize COLD!- brush the sides of the pastry with water so they become sticky and roll the second pastry on top.?&#8- Et voila!!! Press the edges of the pan to cut excess pastry and have a perfectly sized top.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Pie ?&#1- The final step is to make an egg wash which is just egg yolk and a little bit of water, and brush the top of the pie. This way we have a beautiful golden color when baked.?&#2- Place the pie in the fridge for 30 minutes before baking it.?&#3- In the meantime, if you are bored, you can do cute little decorations. Here I am rolling leftover pastry, then cutting it into leaves. Now I put them in the freezer for 10 minutes, then use the tip of the knife to make them prettier!?&#4- Let’s bring back the pie from the fridge, put my little leaves on top, brush with the egg wash, put a little hole in the center of the pie for the steam to come out during baking, and do some cute little lines on the surface.?&#5- To the oven!!! Of course, preheated so you have to do that earlier, at 390 F / 200 C and bake the pie for 50 minutes or until you have a beautiful golden brown crust.?&#?&#Step 4: Final Steps?&#1- Here is my baked pie!!! All I have to do is brush it with a little honey diluted in water, to give it a nice glossy look!?&#2- Let the pie cool down until it becomes warm or reaches room temperature before removing it from the pan. If you are using a pie pan, place it in a bowl so the surrounding circle falls down.?&#3- All you need is some whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for you to go to heaven!!!!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/best-apple-pie-recipe/
Very easy Desserts Jun 14, 2009 067 – Chocolate Surprise https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/chocolate_surprise_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#12 oz of chocolate?&#nuts: almonds, walnuts, etc.?&#filling: peanut butter, jam, caramel sauce, dulce de leche, etc.?&#small baking cups Directions :?&#?&#1.Melt the chocolate in a ‘bain marie’ by placing the chocolate container on top of a pan with boiling water.?&#?&#2.Fill half of each baking cup with melted chocolate and let the chocolate cool down for 10 minutes.?&#?&#3.Add the nuts and filling of your choice in the baking cupes.?&#?&#4.Cover the fillings with more melted chocolate and smooth the surface with a spoon.?&#?&#5.Refrigerate the chocolate for 2 hours. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-chocolate-surprise/
Easy Desserts Apr 22, 2009 090 – Crepe Cake https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-crepe-cake/ Ingredients :?&#?&#1 1/2 cups of milk?&#1/2 cup of sugar?&#1/4 cup of flour?&#2 egg yolks?&#1 egg?&#2 tablespoons of butter?&#1 1/2 teaspoons of vanilla extract?&#1 cup of heavy cream?&#6 oz of dark chocolate Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Crepes:?&#?&#Please refer to the Crepes recipe – Double the ingredients to make enough crepes for this cake.?&#?&#Step 2 – Making the Vanilla Pastry Cream:?&#?&#1- Heat the milk to a boiling point.?&#2- Whisk the egg yolks, ett, and sugar until you get a smooth texture. Incorporate the flour, little by little, until it is fully mixed with the egg mixture.?&#3- Once the milk is heated, whisk 1/2 cup of the milk into the egg mixture to temper the eggs yolks.?&#4- Pour the egg mixture in the pan and mix it well with the milk. Place the mixture on medium heat and continue whisking until you get a thick cream.?&#5- Once the cream is thick, remove from the heat, and whisk in the butter and vanilla extract.?&#6- Place the cream in a bowl, and press a piece of plastic wrap directly on the surface (to avoid the creation of a crust). Place the cream in the fridge and let it cool down completely.?&#?&#Step 3 – Making the Chocolate Ganache:?&#?&#1- Bring the cream to a boiling point.?&#2- Place the chocolate in a bowl, and pour the hot cream over the chocolate. Let it stand for 1 minute.?&#3- Mix the cream and chocolate together. Place the ganache in the fridge and let it cool down completely.?&#?&#Step 4 – Assembling the Cake:?&#?&#1- Place a crepe on a rack and evenly spread the pastry cream on it. Cover the first crepe with another crepe, then spread the pastry cream (or another filling). Keep doing so until you place the last crepe at the top.?&#2- Pour the chocolate ganache on the top crepe and distribute evenly around the cake.?&#3- Place the cake in the fridge for 2 hours before serving.?&#Serving: Decorate with powdered sugar or chocolate shavings. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-crepe-cake/
Easy Desserts Mar 29, 2009 056 – Moroccan Almond Macaroons https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-moroccan-almond-macaroons/ Ingredients :?&#?&#12 oz of whole almonds?&#6 oz of powdered sugar?&#2 eggs?&#1 small lemon?&#1 teaspoon of baking powder?&#1 tablespoon of cooking oil for rolling?&#few whole almonds for decoration Directions :?&#?&#Grind the almonds in a grinder until you get an almond powder with a fine texture.?&#Grate the peel of the lemon to get the lemon zest.?&#Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.?&#Mix the egg yolks with the almond powder, powdered sugar, lemon zest, and the baking powder.?&#Beat the egg whites until you obtain a thick white foam.?&#Incorporate the egg whites in the egg yolks mixture. Use your hand to mix the dough to ensure that all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#To roll the macaroons, put some cooking oil in your hands so that the dough does not stick to them. Take a small amount of the dough and roll it in a ball, flatten it a bit, and place it in a baking pan with wax paper.?&#Preheat your oven at 350 F and bake the macaroons for 15 minutes.?&#Note: When still hot, the macaroons are very soft, their texture will change as they cool down. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-moroccan-almond-macaroons/
Very easy Desserts Feb 8, 2009 050 – Chocolate Bites – Valentines Special https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/02/chocolate_bites_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#10 oz of dark chocolate?&#1/2 cup of sugar?&#1/2 cup of flour?&#8 tablespoons of butter?&#3 eggs?&#A pinch of salt?&#1 pound of strawberries?&#1/3 cup of powdered sugar?&#2 tablespoons of orange blossom water Directions :?&#?&#1- Melt the chocolate in a ‘bain marie’ (boiling water below and a container with chocolate on top) and add the butter.?&#2- Separate the egg whites from the egg yolks. Make sure that the egg whites dont contain any drops from the egg yolks, otherwise it will not foam if whipped.?&#3- Beat the egg yolks with the sugar until you get an off-white mixture.?&#4- Incorporate the chocolate mixture to the egg yolk mixture. Mix well.?&#5- Add the flour and salt. Mix well.?&#6- Beat the white eggs until they triple their volume and you end up with a white thick foam. Make sure that the beater is clean and dry.?&#7- Gently incorporate the white eggs foam into the chocolate mixture.?&#8- Put a wax paper on your baking pan and place the baking cups. Fill the baking cups with the chocolate batter.?&#9- Preheat your oven at 400 degrees, and bake the chocolate bites for 10 minutes.?&#?&#Steps to prepare the strawberry sauce:?&#?&#1- Mix the strawberries, sugar, and orange blossom water until you get a thick puree.?&#Tip: experiment with different temperatures and times to get you ideal consistency of this cake. If you prefer a chocolate bite with a fudgy center, then bake it at 360 degrees for 10 minutes.?&#?&#Serving:?&#?&#Serve the chocolate bites with the strawberry sauce and whipped cream. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-chocolate-bites-valentines-special/
Very easy Breads Oct 12, 2008 024 – Sweet Dough Recipe (Pâte Sucrée) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-sweet-dough-recipe-pate-sucree/ Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups of flour?&#1/3 cup of sugar?&#2 large eggs?&#1 stick of cold butter (8 Tbsp)?&#1/4 tsp of salt?&#1/2 tsp of baking powder Directions :?&#?&#Mix all the dry ingredients together (flour, sugar, salt and baking powder)?&#Cut the cold butter into pieces and work it into the flour until it is fully incorporated.?&#In a separate bowl beat slightly the eggs, just enough to mix the yolks with the whites.?&#Mix the eggs with the dry mix.?&#Sprinkle some flour on a flat surface and work the dough until it becomes smooth.?&#Separate the dough into 2 batches.?&#Notes:?&#– Sweet dough can be frozen up to 2 months. Just make sure to put it in the fridge the night before you are planning to use it so it defrosts.?&#– Sweet dough is very forgiving when it comes to re-rolling. It actually stretches better the second time. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-sweet-dough-recipe-pate-sucree/
Easy Desserts Aug 16, 2008 016 – Traditional Ghriba https://www.cookingwithalia.com/recipe-traditional-ghriba/ Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups of flour?&#1/2 cup of powdered sugar?&#1 stick of butter (8 Tbsp)?&#1/4 cup of oil?&#2 tablespoon of sesame seeds?&#1 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder?&#Pinch of salt Directions :?&#?&#1- Roast the sesame seeds on low heat for 2-3 minutes stirring consistently until they become golden brown.?&#2- Melt the butter.?&#3- Mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and sesame seeds.?&#4- Add the butter and the oil. Work the dough for 10-15 minutes until you get a grainy texture.?&#?&#Rest:?&#?&#Cover the dough and let it rest for 2-3 hours.?&#?&#Final steps:?&#?&#1- re-work the dough for couple of minutes.?&#7- Make small balls with the dough (if you find it difficult add some oil) and put them on your pan covered with a parchment paper.?&#3- Preheat your oven at 375 degrees. Bake the Ghriba for 15 minutes or until it takes a light golden color.?&#?&#Presentation:?&#?&#These cookies taste amazing with Moroccan tea. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/recipe-traditional-ghriba/
12 Easy Desserts Aug 8, 2008 294 – Almond Briwat (Springrolls) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/08/rsz_2941.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 roll of Pastilla dough (or fillo dough)?&#1 cup (112 grams) whole raw almonds?&#1/2 cup (100 grams) white granulated sugar?&#A little more than 1/2 tablespoon (10 grams) butter (softened)?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#A pinch of ground mastic gum?&#1-2 teaspoon orange blossom water (to taste)?&#1 egg + 1 tablespoon water (egg wash)?&#Vegetable oil for frying?&#Honey?&#Sesame seeds Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Steps to make the walnut filling:?&#1- Drizzle oil on a cooking pan and roast the walnuts for 2 minutes to enhance their flavor.?&#2- Grind very finely the walnuts. You might have to do this process 2-3 times until you get a very smooth consistency.?&#3- Continue grinding the walnut with the sugar and cinnamon.?&#4- Add the melted butter and blossom water to the walnuts paste.?&#?&#Steps to roll the Briwat:?&#1- Because Fillo dough is a very delicate dough, take 2 leafs of Fillo dough (one on top of the other).?&#2- Generously brush the top Fillo leaf with melted butter.?&#3- Cut the Fillo in 4 long strips.?&#4- Put the filling in the left tip of the stip then cover the filling with the right tip to make a triangle. (see Briwat video)?&#5- Keep moving the Fillo dough strip left and right to make a triangle.?&#6- Brush the last tip of the Fillo with egg yolk and close the Briwat.?&#Note: Don’t worry if the Briwat are not perfect, once they are fried, all the imperfections will disappear?&#?&#Steps to cook the Briwat:?&#1- In hot oil, fry the Briwat for few minutes until golden brown.?&#2- Drain the Briwat from the oil, and dip them in warm honey.?&#3- Drain the Briwat from the honey and sprinkle them with sesame seeds.?&#4- Serve cold with Moroccan tea! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/294-almond-briwat-springrolls-recipe/
Meduim Desserts Aug 8, 2008 020 – Makrout – Moroccan Date Cookie https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-makrout-moroccan-date-cookie/ Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients for the dough:?&#2 cups of cornmeal?&#1/3 cup of blossom water?&#1 stick of butter (8 tablespoon)?&#1 tablespoon of sugar?&#A pinch of salt?&#Ingredients for the filling:?&#2 cups of pitted dates?&#1 tablespoon of blossom water?&#1 tablespoon of butter?&#1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon?&#1/4 teaspoon of ground nutmeg?&#Other Ingredients:?&#Oil for frying?&#Honey?&#Blossom water Directions :?&#?&#Steps to make the dough:?&#?&#1- Melt the butter.?&#2- Mix the cornmeal, sugar and salt.?&#3- Slowly add the melted butter to the cornmeal while mixing thoroughly.?&#4- Transfer the cornmeal mixture in a flat surface. Work the dough while adding the blossom water until you get a very smooth texture.?&#?&#Note: You might need to slightly increase/reduce the amount of butter and blossom water depending on the quality of the cornmeal.?&#?&#Steps to make the filling:?&#?&#1- Steam the dates for 20 minutes until they soften.?&#2- In a food processor, mix the dates, the butter, the cinnamon and the ground nutmeg until you get a smooth date paste.?&#?&#Steps to roll the Makrout:?&#?&#1- Make a roll with the dough.?&#2- Make long rolls with the date paste.?&#3- Make an incision in the middle of the dough and widen by sculting the middle of the roll.?&#4- Place the date roll inside dough ‘tunnel’.?&#5- Close the dough roll by reshaping it by hand.?&#6- Cut the dough roll into diagonal pieces.?&#?&#Steps to cook the Makrtout:?&#?&#1- In very hot oil, fry the Makrout until golden brown.?&#2- Drain the Makrout from the excell oil and immediately dip it in the flavored honey. The honey should be warm and flavored with blossom water following your taste.?&#3- Let the Makrout cool down and serve them with Moroccan mint tea. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/video-makrout-moroccan-date-cookie/
Easy Desserts Oct 9, 2006 005 – French Lemon Souffle https://www.cookingwithalia.com/souffle/ Ingredients :?&#?&#4 large egg whites?&#3 large egg yolks?&#3/4 cup sugar?&#2 Tbsp flour?&#Zest of 1 lemon?&#1/4 cup lemon juice?&#1 cup milk?&#Pinch of salt?&#Confectioners’ sugar for dusting Directions :?&#?&#Heat oven to 350°F. Insert a cake pan with 1 in. of hot water. The water should reach half of the soufflé cups you are using.?&#Beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until you get white peaks. Then add 1 Tbsp of sugar while beating the eggs until stiff, shiny peaks form when beaters are lifted.?&#In a large bowl, beat yolks and remaining sugar until mixture is light. Keep beating while adding the flour, lemon zest, milk and juice.?&#Pour the egg whites into the large bowl containing the yolk mixture.?&#Using a whisk, gently fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture, with a circular movement from top to bottom, to keep the fluffiness of the texture.?&#Fill the soufflé cups with batter to the top.?&#Put the cups in the cake pan in the oven and let it bake for 25 minutes. Do not open the oven during this time.?&#After 25 minutes check that the soufflés have a golden brown top. If not let them bake for another 10-15 minutes.?&#Serve the soufflé warm with confectioners’ sugar dusted on top of it. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/souffle/
10 minutes 4 glaces Facile Desserts Oct 29, 2017 602- Smoothie Et Bâtonnets Glacés Au Chocolat https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/DSC_0022.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 portions de fromage Kiri?&#2 bananes moyennes, coupées en morceaux et congelées?&#2 cuillères à soupe de cacao?&#250 ml de lait?&#2 cuillères à soupe de miel (facultatif) Directions :?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer le smoothie?&#1- Dans un mixeur, placez les bananes, le cacao et les portions de fromage Kiri et mixez jusqu’à ce que vous ayez une texture lisse et onctueuse.?&#2- Goûtez et ajoutez le miel si nécessaire, puis mixez de nouveau pendant 30 secondes.?&#Servez le smoothie frais, ou préparez-en des bâtonnets de glace!?&#?&#Etape 2: Préparer les bâtonnets de glace?&#1- Une fois votre smoothie près, versez-le dans des moules à glaces et remplissez-les jusqu’à ras bord.?&#2- Plantez-y les bâtonnets et placez au congélateur pendant au moins 4 heures jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient complètement congelés.?&#3- A la sortie du congélateur, préparez un grand verre rempli d’eau légèrement tiède, et placez-y chaque cavité du moule pendant quelques secondes, puis retirez vos bâtonnets de glace. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/602-smoothie-et-batonnets-glaces-au-chocolat/
