Medium Desserts May 6, 2017 489- Marble Cake https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/07-IMG_1044.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 large eggs?&#1/2 cup and 2 tablespoons (125 grams) granulated sugar?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#Pinch of salt?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#1 stick (8 tablespoons / 113 grams) butter?&#1 cup (128 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#4.4 oz (125 grams) dark chocolate?&#4.4 oz (125 grams) white chocolate Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making the cake Batter?&#1- The first step is to beat the 5 eggs with the sugar, using an egg beater. You want the eggs to become double in volume, fluffy, and have a withish color. This is an important step to make the cake moist!?&#?&#2- The eggs are ready when they become very thick – you can actually create a ‘ribbon’ with the batter when you pour some of it with a spoon over the rest of the batter!?&#?&#3- Add the vanilla extract, a pinch of salt, and the baking powder to the egg mixture. Continue mixing for a few seconds until well incorporated.?&#4- Melt the butter (either in the microwave or in a sauce pan).?&#5- Add the melted butter to the egg mixture while continuously stirring.?&#?&#6- Sift the flour over the egg mixture and gently fold all the ingredients together using a spatula, until well incorporated.?&#?&#7- Split the batter, equally, into 2 separate bowls. In one portion we are going to add melted dark chocolate, and the other one melted white chocolate. If you dont like white chocolate you can skip it, or you can replace the dark chocolate with cocoa powder. You can even create your own flavors, for example, strawberry and chocolate, or green tea and white chocolate!?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Separate Batters?&#1- Melt the dark chocolate and white chocolate separately.?&#2- Preheat your oven to 360 F / 180 C.?&#3- Add the melted dark chocolate to one portion of the batter. Then add the melted white chocolate to the other portion of the batter. Mix well.?&#4- Butter your cake mold, then place parchment paper in it (I am using an 8″ rectangular cake pan). The reason we need to butter the pan before the parchment paper is to get the paper to stick to the pan, otherwise, the paper will not stick! Cut the border of the parchment paper with scissors to get even borders.?&#5- First pour half of the white chocolate batter in the pan. Then cover it with the entire dark chocolate batter, use a spatula to spread evently. Finally pour the rest of the white chocolate batter on top of the chocolate batter.?&#?&#6- Insert the knife in the batter and move it around to create swirles.?&#?&#7- Bake the cake for around 45 minutes or until it is done. It will become golden brown, and when you press the top of the cake it feels firm.?&#8- Remove the cake from the pan and let it cool down!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/489-marble-cake/ 45 Minutes
Easy Desserts May 6, 2017 488- Best Brownies Ever https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/rsz_img_2056.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/2 pound (225g) unsalted butter?&#230 grams (8 oz) bitter sweet or semisweet chocolate, cut into 1/4-inch pieces?&#4 large eggs?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#200 grams (1 cup) granulated sugar?&#220 grams (1 cup) dark brown sugar, firmly packed?&#2 teaspoons vanilla extract?&#130 grams (1 cup) all-purpose flour?&#zest of 1 orange Directions :?&#?&#1- Preheat your oven to 180C / 360F degrees.?&#2- Bring a saucepan of water to a boil, place a bowl on top, and place butter and chocolate in the bowl. Stir occasionally until melted.?&#3- In a large bowl, whisk the eggs along with salt, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and orange zest.?&#4- Add the chocolate and butter mixture little by little into the egg mixture while mixing.?&#5- Add the flour and combine using a spatula.?&#6- Pour batter into prepared pan (33 cm x 23 cm x 5 cm / 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan) and spread evenly.?&#7- Bake for about 40-45 minutes, until top has formed a shiny crust.?&#8- Cool the cake completely before removing from the pan and cutting it. in pan on a rack.?&#Variations: Add walnuts or pecan pieces to the batter. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/488-best-brownies-ever/ 45 Minutes
20 madeleines Easy Desserts May 6, 2017 487- Honey Madeleines https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/rsz_img_2021.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 eggs?&#100 grams white granulated sugar?&#A pinch of salt?&#2 tablespoons of honey?&#150 grams unsalted butter?&#200 grams all-purpose white flour?&#½ teaspoon baking powder?&#1 lime or lemon Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with the sugar and pinch of salt until well incorporated.?&#2- In a separate bowl, combine the honey and butter. Cover with a wrap and microwave for 1 minute or until the butter melts.?&#3- Add the melted butter-honey mixture to the egg mixture, little by little. Whisk constantly while adding the two. If you add the hot butter-honey mixture at once to the eggs, you will cook them because of the difference of temperature. So make sure you add the butter-honey mixture little by little and whisk at the same time!?&#4- Add the baking powder and sift the flour into the egg mixture. Mix well using a spatula until you get a smooth batter.?&#5- Place the batter in the fridge for 1 hour.?&#6- Preheat your oven to 220C / 430 F.?&#7- Fill the ¾ of each madeleine mold with the batter.?&#8- Bake the madeleines for 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to 180C / 360 F and continue cooking for another 10 minutes until the madeleines have a beautiful golden brown color.?&#9- Remove from the mold. Eat warm or at room temperature! Place in an airtight container and keep in the fridge for up to 10 days. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/487-honey-madeleines/
1 hour 30 cookies Medium Desserts Mar 20, 2017 475 – Sable With Jam https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/rsz_img_2229.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Plain Sable Cookie Dough?&#Apricot or strawberry jam?&#Powdered sugar?&#?&#Egg Wash:?&#1 egg yolk?&#1/2 teaspoon orange blossom water (or just water) Directions :?&#?&#Follow the instructions in the Plain Sable Cookies recipe until step 11.?&#1- Shape the dough using a marguerite flower cookie cutter. Half of the cookies should be a solid marguerite shape and the other half should have a hole in the center.?&#2- Place the cookies in a baking pan covered with parchment paper. Mix the egg and orange blossom water together and use it to brush the cookies with the hole so they get a nice golden color.?&#3- Bake for about 15 minutes until golden. Let the cookies cool down completely before moving to the next step.?&#4- Spread a bit of jam over of the cookies with a solid surface.?&#5- Sift powdered sugar on the top of the cookies with a hole. This is an optional step, you can just keep them as is with their beautiful golden color.?&#6- Combine the two cookies with the hole being on top. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/475-sable-jam/ 15 minutes
30 Minutes 20 medium baghrir & 20 cookies Easy Breads Mar 20, 2017 474 – Moroccan Delights The Easy Way https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/rsz_img_1384.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Recipe 1- Baghrir, the 1000-Hole Pancakes?&#?&#Baghrir Dough Ingredients:?&#300 grams (1 3/4 cups) fine semolina?&#?&#100 grams (3/4 cup) white all-purpose flour?&#?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#?&#6 grams (2 teaspoons) dry yeast?&#?&#8 grams (1 1/2 teaspoons) baking powder?&#?&#750ml (3 cups plus 2 tablespoons) lukewarm water?&#Honey-Butter Syrup Ingredients:?&#?&#Honey?&#?&#Butter?&#?&#——————————————————–?&#?&#Recipe 2: Coconut Apricot Cookies Ingredients:?&#?&#8-10 ladyfingers?&#?&#1 cup apricot jam?&#?&#1 teaspoon orange blossom water?&#?&#1 cup dried unsweetened finely shredded coconut Directions :?&#?&#Recipe 1- Baghrir, the 1000-Hole Pancakes?&#?&#Step 1: Making The Baghrir?&#1- Place all the dry ingredients (semolina, flour, salt, dry yeast, and baking powder) in a blender.?&#2- Add 500 ml of water and mix. Keep adding the rest of the water little by little and mixing, until you reach the desired consistency. The batter should be rather thin, about the same consistency as a French crepe.?&#?&#3- Place the batter in a bowl, cover with a clean towel, and leave to rest for 20 minutes in a warm place.?&#?&#4- Heat a nonstick pan on medium heat. Stir the batter and pour 1/2 cup of it into the center of the hot pan.?&#5- The batter will naturally spread evenly into a circle.?&#6- You will notice the holes forming at the surface as the batter is drying up.?&#?&#7- The Baghrir is done when the surface looks dry and does not feel wet anymore. Do not flip, Baghrir is cooked on one side only.?&#?&#8- Place the Baghrir on a flat surface in a single layer, preferably on a clean cloth. Do not stack the Baghrir one on top of each other or they would stick.?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing The Honey-Butter Syrup?&#?&#9- Place the butter and honey (amounts to your taste) in a pan over medium low heat.?&#10- Stir with a spatula until the butter has completely melted and the honey is bubbling. Turn off the heat.?&#?&#11- Dip the surface of the Baghrir with holes in the hot honey-butter syrup for a few seconds.?&#?&#12- Place the Baghrir on a plate, holes up, and serve immediately.?&#?&# ?&#?&#————————————————————?&#Recipe 2: Coconut Apricot Cookies?&#?&#1- Slice the ladyfingers in half.?&#2- Prepare all your ingredients: ladyfingers, dried coconut, and jam. Heat the apricot jam in the microwave for 30 seconds and mix in the orange blossom water.?&#?&#3- Dip each ladyfinger in the jam, then roll it in the coconut until all sides are well covered.?&#?&#4- Chill the cookies in the fridge for one hour before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/474-moroccan-delights-easy-way/ 3 Minutes each baghrir
30 minutes
Easy Fish Feb 20, 2020 770- Thai Soup Simplified https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/435-2020-02-CWA-Soup-011.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 grams (3.5 oz.) whole wheat asian noodles?&#250 grams (8.8 oz.) chicken breast?&#250 grams (8.8 oz.) peeled shrimps?&#200 grams (7 oz.) canned mushrooms, drained?&#200 mililiters (1 cup) coconut milk?&#50 grams (1/4 cups) butter?&#1 onion, finely chopped?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#2 tablespoon soy sauce?&#1 tablespoon fish sauce (Nuoc Mam)?&#Juice of half lemon?&#1.5 liter (6 cups) fish stock (or water mixed with a fish bouillon cube)?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro and parsley mixed?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro Directions :?&#?&#1- Over medium heat, melt the butter in a large non-stick pan. Add the chopped onion and salt. Cook for two minutes.?&#2- Add the chicken and the canned mushrooms to the pan and cook for 15 minutes until the chicken is almost cooked.?&#3- Add the shrimp and continue cooking for a couple of minutes.?&#4- Add 1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro and parsley mixed, continue cooking for a minute, and set aside.?&#5- On medium heat, bring the fish stock to a boil. Place the noodles and cook for a few minutes (per package instructions).?&#6- Add the chicken and shrimp mixture. Season with salt and pepper, add the soy sauce, the fish sauce, and the coconut milk. Mix and cook for 5 minutes.?&#7- Finish off with 1 tablespoon of finely chopped cilantro and a bit of lemon juice. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/770-thai-soup-simplified/ 20 minutes
10 minutes 4 Easy Fish Feb 12, 2020 768- Seafood Gratin https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/435-StoryOfViluska-0122.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pack rigatoni Panzani?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#500 grams mixed raw seafood (white fish, shrimp, and calamari)?&#4 leeks, sliced?&#2 garlic cloves, minced?&#1 teaspoon lemon juice?&#Black pepper, to taste?&#Salt, to taste?&#?&#White Sauce:?&#3 tablespoons corn starch?&#3 cups milk?&#a pinch of nutmeg?&#?&#Topping:?&#Cheese (Edam) Directions :?&#?&#1- Preheat oven to 180C/350F.?&#2- Bring a medium pan of salted water to boil, place the rigatoni and cook for 8 minutes or until it’s cooked.?&#3- Heat the olive oil in a skillet over high heat. Add the leeks and cook for 1 minute. Add the fish, salt and pepper and cook. Turn off the heat, add the lemon juice and mix.?&#4- In a (28.2cm x18.2cm) baking dish, mix pasta, seafood and leeks together?&#5- In a small bowl, mix the corn starch with a little milk.?&#6-In a sauce pan, add the milk, the cornstarch and mix. Cook, while whisking constantly as it thickens, for around 5 minutes or until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.?&#Season with nutmeg, salt and pepper.?&#7- Pour the milk cream over the pasta. Top with cheese.?&#8- Bake for 20 – 25 minutes, or until the top is golden. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/768-seafood-gratin/ 30 minutes
10 minutes 2 persons Easy Fish Dec 19, 2019 760- Smoked Salmon Tagliatelle https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/435-StoryOfViluska-0869.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#6 rolls of Panzani Tagliatelle?&#250 grams smoked salmon, cut into bite size pieces?&#1/4 cup capers, drained?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1/2 white onion, finely chopped?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#3/4 cup heavy cream?&#2 tablespoons freshly chopped dill, plus more for garnish?&#Pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot, add the water and salt. Bring to a boiling point.?&#2- Add the Panzani tagliatelle rolls and cook for 10 minutes. Once ready, drain the pasta from water and reserve 1/4 cup of the pasta water for later.?&#3- In a large pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion, garlic and cook for 2 minutes until soft.?&#4- Add the heavy cream and continue cooking for 3 minutes until the cream thickens. Season with a pinch of pepper.?&#5- Add the smoked salmon pieces, capers, and half of the chopped dill. Cook the salmon until it is warmed for about 2 minutes. Pour the sauce over the tagliatelle pasta and gently mix using a spatula until it is completely coated and well combined. Add ¼ cup pasta water if sauce is too thick.?&#6- Garnish with more dill and Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/760-smoked-salmon-tagliatelle-tagliatelle/ 20 minutes
10 minutes 2 persons Easy Fish Dec 14, 2019 759- Linguine Frutti Di Mare https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/435-StoryOfViluska-0978.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) panzani linguini Pasta?&#150 grams (5.2 oz) peeled small shrimp?&#150 grams (5.2 oz) large whole shrimp?&#150 grams (5.2 oz) mussels, peeled?&#2 mussels with shells for garnish, rinced and cooked (any opened mussel to discard)?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 small zucchini, cut into thin slices?&#1 small white onion, finely chopped?&#50 grams (1.7 oz) cherry tomatoes, bruised?&#50 grams (1.7 oz) unsalted butter?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#1 teaspoon dried thyme?&#80 milliliters (1/2 cup) water?&#Zest of 1/2 lemon?&#1/2 lemon?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook linguine pasta for about 8 to 10 minutes. Once ready, drain and reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water for later.?&#2- In a medium pan, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and heat over medium heat. Add the zucchini slices and cook from each side until they become lightly golden. Remove from the pan and set aside.?&#3- In a large bowl, wash the mussels under running water and pull off the hairy ‘beard’ that sticks out from the mussels, if it has one.?&#4- In a large pan, add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and heat over medium heat. Add the shrimps, the cleaned mussels, salt, pepper and cook for 2 minutes. Remove the sea fruits from the pan and set aside.?&#5- In the same pan, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, onion, garlic, salt and pepper and cook until soft for 5 minutes. Add the butter, thyme, cook and stir constantly using a spatula for about 1- 2 minutes. Pour in the water, lemon zest and squeeze in a touch of lemon juice to get more freshness to the sauce then bring to a simmer.?&#6- Add the cooked sea fruits, linguini pasta and parsley to the butter sauce and gently mix until it is completely coated and well combined.?&#7- Add a little of the pasta cooking water if needed to thin the sauce.?&#8- In a preheated grilling pan over medium heat, drizzle with olive oil, place the large shrimps and grill from each side for 2 minutes until they become pink. leave it to cool down then remove all of the shell except for the part that is around the tail and the head.?&#9- Garnish the linguini pasta with the grilled shrimps, zucchini, glazed cherry tomatoes, mussels and fresh parsley finely chopped. Serve immediately with a quarter of lemon on the side if desired. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/759-linguine-frutti-di-mare-linguine/ 20 minutes
30 minutes 9 wraps Easy Appetizers May 10, 2019 718- Shrimp Lettuce Wraps https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/2019-04-srimpWrap-010.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the filling:?&#?&#250 g (8.6 oz.) shrimp?&#?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#?&#Zest of 1/2 lemon?&#?&#50 grams (1.7 oz.) chinese vermicelli ?&#?&#1 tablespoon nuoc mam sauce Carrefour?&#?&#1 tablespoon fresh mint, chopped?&#?&#1 carotte?&#?&#1 cucumber?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&# ?&#?&#For the sauce:?&#?&#3 tablespoons sesame oil Carrefour?&#?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#?&#1 tablespoon sauce nuoc mam Carrefour?&#?&#1 tablespoon brown sugar?&#?&#1 garlic clove, minced?&#?&# ?&#?&#For preparing the wrap:?&#?&#Lettuce leaves?&#?&#Fresh mint leaves?&#?&#Parsley leaves?&#?&#Roasted unsalted peanuts, chopped Directions :?&#?&#1- In a pan, over medium heat, melt the butter. Sauté the shrimp with salt, pepper, and lemon zest?&#?&#2- Place the vermicelli in a large bowl. Pour boiling water over the vermicelli and let it sit for 10 minutes until it becomes soft and translucent?&#?&#3- Drain the vermicelli from the water. Using a pair of scissors, cut the vermicelli into bite size threads. Season with 1 teaspoon nuoc mam sauce?&#?&#4- Add the shrimp and the chopped mint to the vermicelli and mix?&#?&#5- Cut the carrot and cucumber into julienne (thin sticks)?&#?&#6- Prepare the sauce by mixing together all the ingredients of the sauce?&#?&#7- Serve all the ingredients separated: lettuce and herbs, carrot sticks, cucumber sticks, and vermicelli shrimp mix. Place the sauce in a bowl and serve it as well?&#?&#8- In a lettuce leaf, place the shrimp and vermicelli mixture, add the cut veggies, add a sprinkle of chopped peanuts, and decorate with a leaf of mint or parsley?&#?&#9- To eat the shrimp lettuce wrap, roll it then dip it in the sauce https://www.cookingwithalia.com/718-shrimp-lettuce-wraps/ 10 minutes
10 minutes
Easy Fish Feb 15, 2019 712- Calamari Tagine https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/calamari-tagine-Edited-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound (500 grams) of calamari (squid), cut into rings?&#2 tomatoes, peeled and grated?&#1/2 onion, chopped?&#4 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#1 (8 oz or 225 grams) can of tomato sauce?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#2 teaspoons of paprika Directions :?&#?&#1- To make the sauce, cut the tomatoes in half and grate them using the large holes of the grater. Discard the skin.?&#2- Finely chop the parsley.?&#3- Cut the onion in half, and finely chop it.?&#4- On medium heat, heat up the olive oil for 1 minute. Use the best quality olive oil in this dish because it really affects the taste. Add the chopped onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add the grated tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes.?&#5- Add the tomato sauce, salt, pepper, paprika, and half of the finely chopped parsley. Mix well.?&#6- Cover the pan and let the sauce cook for 5 minutes.?&#7- Add the fresh calamari rings to the sauce. Cover the pan and cook on medium heat for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Check on the calamari from time to time and stir.?&#8- When about 40 minutes of the cooking time has passed add the rest of the chopped parsley and continue cooking until the calamari is done and the sauce becomes thick.?&#9- Serve immediately with crusty bread! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/712-calamari-with-tomato-sauce/ 1 hour
20 minutes 20 Spring rolls Medium Carrefour Maroc May 16, 2018 668- Seafood Spring Rolls https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/IMG_1514-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the stuffing:?&#1 bag Beans Vermicelli Carrefour?&#2 tablespoons Soy Sauce Carrefour?&#2 tablespoons Nuoc-mâm Sauce Carrefour?&#200 grams (7.05 oz) ground chicken meat?&#150 grams (5.29 oz) of squid, cut into small cubes?&#150 grams (5.29 oz) of shrimp, shelled?&#1/2 onion, grated?&#1 carrot, grated?&#2 cloves of garlic, finely chopped?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#1/2 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#1/4 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#15 mint leaves, finely chopped?&#?&#For briouates:?&#250 grams (8.82 oz) pastilla sheets?&#50 grams (1.76 oz) butter, melted?&#1 egg yolk Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the filling?&#1- In a bowl, place the Beans Vermicelli Carrefour and cover with boiling water. Set aside for 10 minutes then drain it and with a pair of scissors, cut the vermicelli.?&#2- Heat the olive oil in a large pan, and cook onions and garlic with salt and pepper for 3 minutes, stirring regularly with a wooden spatula, until the onions become slightly translucent.?&#3- Add the carrots and cook for 5 minutes.?&#4- Add the ground chicken meat, and cook while crushing, then add the squid and shrimp and mix until cooked through.?&#5- Add the vermicelli, Soy Sauce Carrefour and Nuoc-mâm Sauce Carrefour, mix. Cook for 2 minutes until the vermicelli has absorbed the sauce.?&#6- Add the chopped mint and mix.?&#7- Remove from the heat and drain to remove excess water if necessary. Let cool completely.?&#?&#Step 2: Make the spring rolls?&#8- Using the pastilla sheets, form rolls about 7 cm long and close their ends with a little egg yolk.?&#9- Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, brush with butter and bake in a preheated oven, at 180°C.?&#10- Cook for 25 minutes until golden brown. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/668-seafood-spring-rolls/ 40 minutes
50 minutes + marinate 5 Easy Fish Apr 20, 2018 654- Grilled Sardines Chermoula https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/IMG_0566_435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 Kilo of sardines, cleaned and cut into filets?&#2 tomatoes, sliced?&#1 oinon, sliced?&#?&#For the chermoula:?&#½ a bunch of parsley, chopped?&#½ a bunch of coriander, chopped?&#2 cloves of garlic, grated?&#½ tsp sweet paprika?&#1 tsp ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon chili, chopped?&#A few threads of saffron?&#A thumb-sized bit of ginger, peeled?&#1 ripe tomato, grated?&#Juice of 1 lemon?&#Pinch of salt?&#4 tbsp olive oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Charmoula?&#1- In a bowl, place all the charmoula ingredients and mix until well integrated. You should get a smooth thick marinade.?&#?&#Step 2: Marinating the Fish?&#1-Clean the fish?&#2- Save some charmoula for the tomatos and onions. Put the flat opened sardine fillets in a large bowl and cover with the chermoula. Turn to coat a couple of times.?&#3- Lift the sardines one at a time from the marinade and place the fish in a baking pan.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Fish?&#1- Preheat the oven to 360 F / 180 C.?&#2- Slice the tomato and onions into thin slices and place in the charmoula bowl, mix well.?&#3- On a baking pan covered with parchement paper, place the slices of the tomato and onion and top with the fish.?&#4- Place the fish in the oven and bake for 35-40 minutes or until done (you can test the fish meat, it should be cooked and soft). Do not overbake or the fish will become dry.?&#Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/654-grilled-sardines-chermoula/ 40 minutes
30 minutes

Put the flat opened sardine fillets in a large bowl and cover with the chermoula. Turn to coat a couple of times.?&#3- Lift the sardines one at a time from the marinade and place the fish in a baking pan.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Fish?&#1- Preheat the oven to 360 F / 180 C.?&#2- Slice the tomato and onions into thin slices and place in the charmoula bowl, mix well.?&#3- On a baking pan covered with parchement paper, place the slices of the tomato and onion and top with the fish.?&#4- Place the fish in the oven and bake for 35-40 minutes or until done (you can test the fish meat, it should be cooked and soft). Do not overbake or the fish will become dry.?&#Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/654-grilled-sardines-chermoula/ 40 minutes

10 minutes 2 Easy Fish Sep 7, 2017 569- Alleppey Fish Curry https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/fish-curry.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#300 grams Fish fillet?&#1 onion, chopped?&#2 tomatoes, chopped?&#200ml Coconut milk?&#1tsp Turmeric powder?&#1tsp Mustard seeds?&#20 nos Curry leaves?&#1tsp Chilli powder?&#1tsp Coriander powder?&#1tsp Ginger garlic paste?&#5tbsp Oil?&#Salt?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Cooking the Fish?&#1- Cut the fish into medium size cubes.?&#2- Add salt and turmeric. Mix.?&#2- Add the onions. Mix and cook for 3 minutes until the onion becomes soft.?&#3- Add tomatoes. Mix then add some ginger garlic paste, turmeric, chilli powder, and some salt. Combine well together.?&#4- Add a little bit of water (about ½ cup). Mix well and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.?&#5- Once the tomatoes are cooked and the gravy becomes thick, add the coconut milk and mix well.?&#6- Add some water to finish up the sauce and mix well .?&#?&#Step 3: Combine and Enjoy?&#1- Add the fish to the sauce and cover the pan and cook on low heat for 5 minutes.?&#2- Serve hot. 2 Easy Fish Jun 12, 2017 522- Pineapple Fried Rice https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/rsz_pineapple_fried_rice_2.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1½ cups chopped fresh pineapple (keep the shell for serving)?&#1 large red bell pepper?&#1/2 onions, chopped?&#1 Carrot?&#1 tomato?&#½ cup chopped raw, unsalted cashews?&#Fresh cilantro?&#1 small lime?&#1 tablespoon soy sauce?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 garlic cloves?&#Pepper to taste?&#1 cup of cooked rice?&#Shrimps?&#2 eggs Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#1- First, peel the onions, cut in half and finely chop it.?&#2- Cut the tomato into 4 quarters, remove the seeds, then slice and cut the tomato into cubes.?&#3- Peel the carrot, cut in half, remove the core then cut the carrot into small cubes.?&#4- Cut the top of the red bell pepper, remove the seeds, then chop it into small cubes.?&#5- Cut the pineapple in half. Empty the pulp and keep the shells for serving. Then Cut the pulp into small pieces.?&#6- Finely chop the cilantro.?&#7- Finely chop the garlic cloves.?&#8- Chop the cashews.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the pineapple fried rice?&#1- On medium heat, in a deep saucepan, drizzle the vegetable oil.?&#2- Add the shrimp and cook for a few minutes until their color changes from translucent to pink. Once done, transfer the shrimp to the empty bowl and keep them for later.?&#3- In the same pan, add the eggs and scramble them with a wooden spoon. Cook the eggs for one minute until they lightly set.?&#4- Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir to combine with the eggs. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is hot, about 3 minutes. Then transfer the rice to an empty bowl.?&#5- Add one tablespoon of oil to the pan and add the onion and garlic and stir. Then add the tomatoes and cook for another minute while stirring. Transfer the contents of the pan to your bowl of shrimps.?&#6- Add the carrot cubes. Cook for 2 minutes then add the red bell pepper and pineapple cubes. Cook, stirring constantly, for a few minutes until the vegetables are half cooked.?&#7- Pour the contents of the bowl with shrimp back into the pan and stir to combine.?&#8- Add the soy sauce, pepper, cashew, Mix.?&#9- Add the cooked rice with eggs and combine all the ingredients.?&#10- Add the chopped cilantro. Mix and cook for one minute.?&#11- Serve the fried rice immediately in the pineapple halves.?&#12- Squeeze some lime for extra flavor!?&#This dish smells heavenly!!! Hmmmm bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/522-pineapple-fried-rice/ 45 Minutes

10 minutes 2 Easy Fish Apr 4, 2017 481 – Nests of fish with chermoula https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/rsz_fish_with_chermoula_07.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients in English:?&#?&#4 cod fillets of about 200 grams?&#200 grams of carrots?&#400 grams of potatoes?&#3 peppers (of different colors)?&#1 large preserved lemon?&#200 grams of cherry tomatoes?&#?&#For the chermoula:?&#6 tablespoons olive oil?&#6 garlic cloves finely chopped?&#2 bunches of coriander, finely chopped?&#4 teaspoons ground cumin?&#4 teaspoons of paprika?&#Juice of 2 lemons?&#2 teaspoons of salt?&#A pinch of pepper?&#?&# ?&#?&#Ingredients in French:?&#?&#4 filets de cabillaud d’environ 200 grammes?&#200 grammes de carottes?&#400 grammes de pommes de terre?&#3 poivrons (de couleurs différentes, idéalement)?&#1 grand citron confit?&#200 grammes de tomates cerise?&#?&#Pour la chermoula:?&#6 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#6 gousses d’ail finement émincées?&#2 bouquets de coriandre, finement émincés?&#4 cuillères à café de cumin moulu?&#4 cuillères à café de paprika?&#Le jus de 2 citrons?&#2 cuillères à café de sel?&#Une pincée de poivre Directions :?&#?&#Recipe in English:?&#?&#1- Mix all the ingredients of the chermoula, divide it in two and marinate the fish fillets in a the first part.?&#?&#2- Peel and grind the carrots and potatoes. Cut the peppers into small cubes. Remove the pulp from the preserved lemon and cut the skin into small pieces.?&#?&#3- Heat a large frying pan over medium heat, pour in the grated potatoes and carrots and the last part of chermoula and mix together.?&#4- Cover the pan and cook for 30 minutes until the mixture is cooked. Stir regularly.?&#5- In a baking dish, share the carrot and potato mixture in 4 and form small nests.?&#?&#6- Place a marinated fish fillet on each nest. Cover each fillet with diced peppers, candied lemons and cherry tomatoes?&#7- Cover the dish with foil and bake in a preheated oven at 200 ° C for 12 to 15 minutes until the fish fillets are cooked?&#Serve immediately!?&#?&# ?&#?&#Recipe in French:?&#?&#1- Mélangez tous les ingrédients de la chermoula, divisez-la en deux et marinez les filets de poissons dans une part de chermoula.?&#2- Pelez et râpez les carottes et les pommes de terre. Coupez les poivrons en petits cubes. Retirez la pulpe du citron confit et coupez sa peau en petits dés.?&#3- Faites chauffer une grande poêle sur feu moyen, versez-y les pommes de terre et carottes râpées ainsi que la dernière part de chermoula et mélangez ensemble.?&#4- Recouvrez la poêle et laissez cuire pendant 30 minutes jusqu’à ce que le mélange soit cuit. Remuez régulièrement.?&#5- Dans un plat de four, partagez le mélange de carottes et pommes de terre en 4 et formez des petits nids.?&#6- Sur chaque nid, disposez un filet de poisson mariné. Recouvrez chaque filet de dés de poivrons, citrons confits et tomates cerise.?&#7- Recouvrez le plat de papier aluminium et enfournez dans un four préchauffé à 200°C pendant 12 à 15 minutes jusqu’à ce que les filets de poissons soient cuits.?&#Servez immédiatement! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/481-nests-fish-chermoula/ 45 minutes
2 Easy Fish Apr 4, 2017 480 – Calamari and Mango Noodle Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/rsz_salade_calamar_et_mangue_9.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients in English:?&#?&#500 grams of cleaned calamari?&#2 mangoes?&#1 bunch of parsley?&#1 tablespoon sesame seeds?&#?&#For the vinaigrette:?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#1/2 tablespoon soy sauce?&#1/2 tablespoon honey?&#1/4 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/4 teaspoon salt?&#1 clove of finely chopped garlic?&#A pinch of pepper?&#?&# ?&#?&#Ingredients in French:?&#?&#500 grammes de calamar nettoyé?&#2 mangues mûres?&#1 bouquet de persil?&#1 cuillère à soupe de graines de sésame?&#?&#Pour la vinaigrette:?&#2 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#2 cuillères à soupe de jus de citron?&#½ cuillère à soupe de sauce soja?&#½ cuillère à soupe de miel?&#¼ cuillère à café de gingembre moulu?&#¼ cuillère à café de sel?&#1 gousse d’ail finement émincée?&#Une pincée de poivre Directions :?&#?&#Recipe in English:?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#1- Cut the calamari into strips of about 5 mm?&#?&#2- In a saucepan, boil water, dip in the calamari for 45 seconds, drain them and pass them directly under cold water. Let cool?&#3- Cut the mango on each side of the core into 2 thick slices. Throw away the slice that contains the kernel?&#?&#4- Incise the flesh of the mango without piercing the skin, horizontally and vertically. Turn the mango over to reveal the grid and then use a knife to cut the dice?&#?&#Step 2: Making the salad?&#1- Place the calamari, mangos cubs and parsley in a bowl. Mix together?&#?&#2- Mix together all the ingredients in the vinaigrette, then add it to the previous mixture?&#3- Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately?&#?&# ?&#?&#Recipe in French:?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer les éléments?&#1- Découpez le calamar en lamelles d’environ 5 mm.?&#2- Dans une casserole, faites bouillir de l’eau, trempez dedans les calamars pendant 45 secondes, égouttez-les et passez-les directement sous l’eau froide. Laissez refroidir.?&#3- Coupez la mangue de chaque côté du noyau en 2 tranches épaisses. Jetez la tranche qui contient le noyau.?&#4- Incisez la chair du fruit sans percer la peau, horizontalement et verticalement. Retournez la mangue afin de laisser apparaître le quadrillage puis utilisez un couteau pour découper les petits dés.?&#?&#Etape 2: Assembler la salade?&#1- Placez le calamar, les dés de mangue et le persil dans un bol. Mélangez ensemble.?&#2- Mélangez ensemble tous les ingrédients de la vinaigrette, puis ajoutez-la au mélange précédent.?&#3- Saupoudrez de graines de sésame et servez immédiatement. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/480-calamari-mango-noodle-salad/ 15 Minutes
2 Easy Appetizers Oct 27, 2016 456 – Fancy Tuna Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/rsz_tunasalad1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 canned tuna?&#?&#2 large tomatoes?&#?&#1 celery stick (or 1/2 apple)?&#?&#1 shallot (or 1/4 onion)?&#?&#1/2 lemon?&#?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro?&#?&#Spicy olive oil, to taste?&#?&#1/4 preserved lemon. rind only Directions :?&#?&#1- First, drain the tuna from the water or oil, and place it in a large bowl.?&#2- Cut the ends of the celery stick. Thinly slice the celery stick then chop it into small cubes. Add the celery pieces to the tuna.?&#3- Now finely chop the shallots and add to the tuna bowl.?&#4- Remove the pulp from the preserved lemon quarter as we are just using the skin. Thinly slice the preserved lemon skin then chop it into small cubes. Add to the tuna bowl.?&#5- Remove the cilantro leaves from the stem, and finely chop the leaves. Add to the tuna bowl.?&#6- Slice off the top of the tomatoes and keep them on the side for later. Use a spoon to empty the tomatoes. Do it gently so you don’t cut through the tomato skin because we want to have a nice tomato bowl with a cute little hat!?&#7- Chop the tomato pulp and add it to the tuna bowl.?&#8- Squeeze fresh lemon juice on all the ingredients, and add spicy olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Mix all the ingredients together, taste, and adjust seasoning.?&#9- Now fill the tomato bowls with the tuna salad and place the hat on top. Chill in the fridge before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/456-fancy-tuna-salad/
1 hour 4 Hard Fish Aug 4, 2016 449 – Seafood and Spinach Pastilla https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/rsz_fishpastilla.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Warka (or phyllo dough)?&#?&#500 grams white fish (whiting), cut into bite sized chunks?&#?&#500 grams calamari, cleaned and cut into rings?&#?&#500 grams shrimp, peeled and cleaned?&#?&#700 grams fresh spinach?&#?&#1 cup finely chopped fresh parsley?&#?&#1 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro?&#?&#3 teaspoons ground paprika?&#?&#2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon red chilli pepper powder, to taste?&#?&#3 garlic cloves, crushed?&#?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1/2 preserved lemon?&#?&#1 teaspoon lemon juice?&#?&#1 teaspoon Harissa (spicy north african paste) – optional?&#?&#1 egg?&#?&#Vegetable oil for frying?&#?&#Grated cheese (optional) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#1- Roughly chop the spinach. Finely chop the parsley and cilantro. Crush the garlic cloves. Finely chop the preserved lemon.?&#2- To prepare the charmoula, in a large bowl combine: the chopped parsley, chopped cilantro, salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, red chilli pepper, crushed garlic cloves, and olive oil. Mix well.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Filling?&#1- In a deep saucepan, heat a little bit of olive oil. Add the chopped spinach and cook on medium heat for 20 minutes or until the spinach is cooked and the liquids in the pan have evaporated.?&#2- Remove the spinach from the pan and reserve.?&#3- In the same saucepan, drizzle a little bit of olive oil. Add the calamari and cook for 3-4 minutes.?&#4- Add half of the charmoula sauce to the calamari, mix and continue cooking for another 2 minutes.?&#5- Add the white fish chunks. Gently mix in with the calamari, and continue cooking for a minute or so until the fish changes color from translucide to opaque.?&#6- Remove the calamari and fish from the pan and reserve.?&#7- In the same saucepan, drizzle a little bit of olive oil. Add the shrimp and the rest of the charmoula. Mix and cook for a few minutes until the shrimp is done.?&#8- Remove the shrimp from the pan and reserve. Make sure that the liquids stay in the pan, and that the shrimp is removed dry.?&#9- In a large plate place: the spinach, calamari, white fish, and shrimp. Add the preserved lemon, fresh lemon juice, and harissa. Gently mix all the ingredients together.?&#10 – Let the seafood filling completely cool down before using it.?&#?&#Step 3: Wrapping the Mini Pastilla?&#1- Lightly beat 1 egg with a fork. This will be used to ‘glue’ the warka.?&#Note: We are making mini-pastilla, but you can make the pastilla with the size of your choice.?&#2- For small pastilla, take a small round deep ramequin and place a round warka inside, the edges of the wark should be overflowing from the ramequin.?&#3- Fill the ramequin (warka) with the seafood filling. Bring the edges of the warka to the center and close them over the ramequin. Brush the edges with the egg so that they stick together.?&#4- Flip the ramequin and take out the warka pocket carefully.?&#5- Place another round warka on top of your working area. Place the warka pocket (from the ramequin) in the center of the warka on the table, smooth face up and rippled side down.?&#6- Bring the edges of the warka on the table over the warka pocket in its center. Gather the edges on the top and brush with the egg so that they stick together.?&#7- Place the pastilla in a plate and repeat the wrapping instructions with the rest of the warka until you finish the filling.?&#?&#Step 4: Cooking the Pastilla?&#Note: You can either brush the pastilla with melted butter and bake it at 180 C / 370 F until it becomes deep golden brown or fry it. In this video we are frying the mini pastilla.?&#1- In a deep saucepan, heat the vegetable oil. Once hot, place the mini-pastillas in the hot oil smooth face down first and fry until it becomes deep golden brown.?&#2- Flip the pastilla to the other side, and continue frying until the second side becomes golden brown as well.?&#3- Place the fried pastilla, smooth face up, on a plate covered with paper towel to absorb excess oil.?&#4- top immediately with grated cheese. Serve immediately, hot and crunchy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/449-seafood-spinach-pastilla/ 20 minutes
20 minutes 4 Medium Fish Jul 28, 2016 448 – Fish Tagine with Onions and Raisins https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/rsz_1img_7170cr2.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 kilo white fish chunks (for example, Conger)?&#3 large onions?&#1/2 cup raisins?&#2 teaspoons ground ginger?&#1 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1/2 teaspoon smen (or butter)?&#Large pinch of saffron threads?&#2 cinnamon stick?&#Small fresh cilantro bunch?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#1- Peel the onions.
