15 minutes 4 Easy Indian Aug 16, 2017 556- Potato Aloo Took https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/AlooTook2.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#200 grams baby potatoes?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1 teaspoon chilli powder?&#2 teaspoons chat masala?&#Chopped cilantro?&#Oil for deep-frying Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the potatoes in boiling water over medium heat.?&#2- Prepare the spice mixture: put salt, chat masala and chilli powder in a bowl and mix.?&#3- Once the potatoes are half done, remove them from water and place them under cold water and let them cool down.?&#4- Lightly press the potatoes between your palms and flatten them.?&#5- Heat sufficient oil in a pan. Deep fry the potatoes on medium heat untill they become crisp and golden.?&#6- Once the potatoes are done, drain and place them in a bowl covered with paper towels to absorb the excess oil.?&#7- Place the potatoes in a bowl and sprinkle with the spice mixture.?&#8- Add some chopped cilantro and mix.?&#9- Serve the Aloo tuk hot. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/556-potato-aloo-took/ 15 minutes
1 hour 2 Easy Indian Aug 10, 2017 552- Beef Seekh Kebab https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Beef-Kebab.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams ground beef?&#One handful chopped cilantro?&#1 1/2 teaspoons ginger garlic paste?&#1 teaspoon chili powder?&#Salt to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon garam masala?&#2 tablespoons flour?&#1 egg?&#Bunch of cilantro?&#Melted butter for grilling?&#1 lime for serving Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the ground beef in a bowl. Add the chopped cilantro, ginger garlic paste, chili powder, salt, garam masala, flour, and one egg.?&#2- Mix all ingredients together untill well combined.?&#3- Cover and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.?&#4- Prepare barbeque.?&#5- Wrap the meat around the skewers. Then put it on the charcoal and grill on all sides.?&#6- Use a bunch of cilantro to brush melted butter over the meat.?&#7- Squeeze fresh lime over it and serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/552-beef-seekh-kebab/ 15 دقيقة
5 Minutes 2 Easy Desserts Jul 6, 2017 540- Indian Carrot Halwa https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/IMG_5323-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#300 grams of carrot?&#75 grams of butter?&#25 grams cashew nuts?&#20 grams of raisins?&#3 cardamom pods (or 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom)?&#1 teaspoon caster sugar (to be adjusted according to your taste)?&#500 ml milk?&#50 ml sweetened condensed milk Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel and grate the carrots.?&#2- Place a frying pan over medium heat and melt the butter. Cook for few minutes and the butter is golden brown.?&#3- Put the cashews and raisins into the melted butter. Fry for a 30 seconds until the cashew nuts become golden.?&#4- Add the grated carrots.?&#5- Cook the carrots, cashews and raisins for about 8 minutes until the carrots are soft. Stir constantly to prevent carrots from burning.?&#6- Pour the milk into the frying pan and stir until it is completely absorbed.?&#7- Crush the cardamom pods and add them to the carrots (or, alternatively, the ground cardamom). Cook for a few minutes until the milk is reduced.?&#8- Add the sweetened condensed milk and mix until it is completely incorporated.?&#9- Taste, and add the sugar if necessary. Stir to melt.?&#10- Cook for few minutes until the preparation is reduced.?&#Serve warm or cold, decorated with a few cashews or better, a ball of vanilla ice cream! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/540-halwa-cardamom-carrots/ 30 Minutes
Easy Appetizers Jun 30, 2017 539- Malai Kofta https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Malai-Kofta.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients For The Kofta:?&#2 medium-sized potatoes?&#100 (3.5 oz) grams paneer (or mozarella)?&#2 tablespoons flour?&#Salt, to taste?&#2 tablespoons of raisins?&#Vegetable oil, for frying?&#Water, for boiling?&#?&#Ingredients For The Gravy:?&#2 small onions, thinly sliced?&#75g (1/2 cup) of raw unsalted cashew nuts?&#1 green chilli?&#3 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste?&#1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder?&#Salt, to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon white granulated sugar, to taste?&#50 ml (1/4 cup) Cream?&#1 tablespoon chopped cilantro?&#Water, for boiling Directions :?&#?&#STEP 1: Make The Kofta?&#1- Boil the potatoes in a pot filled with water until fully cooked.?&#2- Once done, remove the potatoes from the water and let them cool down. Then peel the skin, place the potatoes on a plate and mash them with a spoon or using your fingers.?&#3- Grate the paneer over the mashed potatoes. Add some salt, a little bit of flour and the raisins. Mix well with your fingers until all the ingredients are well incorporated.?&#4- With your hands, shape the mixture into small balls, sprinkle a little bit of flour on them and finish off the shaping to have smooth balls.?&#5- In a large pan, heat the vegetable oil and fry the koftas until their color becomes deep golden brown. The oil should cover half in the pan should cover half the koftas, so make sure to turn the koftas around so that all sides are fried.?&#6- Once done, remove the koftas from the oil and place them in a colander filled with tissue papers to absorb excess oil.?&#?&#STEP 2: Make The Gravy?&#1- Boil water In a medium pot, add the sliced onions, cashew nuts and the green chilli. Cook for 10 minutes or until the onions are soft.?&#2- Drain the onions, cashew nuts and green chili from the water and place them in a blender. Save the cooking-water for later purposes.?&#3- Blend the onion mixture on high speed, into a smooth paste and place it aside in a bowl.?&#4- In a deep pan over medium heat, heat the vegetable oil. Once hot, add the ginger-garlic paste, cook it for 30 seconds. Add the onion-cashew paste in the pan and mix it with oil using a wooden spoon. Cook for 30 seconds.?&#5- Add cardamom powder, a little bit of salt, sugar and mix well until all ingredients are well incorporated.?&#6- Add some of cooking water to the pan and mix until you get a medium-thick sauce. Add the cream and cook everything for 30 seconds while stirring constantly until you get the desired gravy consistency.?&#?&#STEP 3 : Combine And Enjoy?&#1- Once ready to serve this dish, heat up the gravy in a pan, stir in the koftas then sprinkle some chopped cilantro on the combination.?&#2- Serve immediately with basmati rice or Indian bread!?&#?&#Notes:?&#– If you don’t have paneer, you can use mozzarella or crush some bread and mix it with the potatoes to make the kofta?&#– This dish is known for the sweetness because of the cream and the sugar, so keep the spice tone less and keep it on the sweeter palette. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/539-malai-kofta/ 30 minutes
2 Easy Fish Jun 12, 2017 522- Pineapple Fried Rice https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/rsz_pineapple_fried_rice_2.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1½ cups chopped fresh pineapple (keep the shell for serving)?&#1 large red bell pepper?&#1/2 onions, chopped?&#1 Carrot?&#1 tomato?&#½ cup chopped raw, unsalted cashews?&#Fresh cilantro?&#1 small lime?&#1 tablespoon soy sauce?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 garlic cloves?&#Pepper to taste?&#1 cup of cooked rice?&#Shrimps?&#2 eggs Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#1- First, peel the onions, cut in half and finely chop it.?&#2- Cut the tomato into 4 quarters, remove the seeds, then slice and cut the tomato into cubes.?&#3- Peel the carrot, cut in half, remove the core then cut the carrot into small cubes.?&#4- Cut the top of the red bell pepper, remove the seeds, then chop it into small cubes.?&#5- Cut the pineapple in half. Empty the pulp and keep the shells for serving. Then Cut the pulp into small pieces.?&#6- Finely chop the cilantro.?&#7- Finely chop the garlic cloves.?&#8- Chop the cashews.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the pineapple fried rice?&#1- On medium heat, in a deep saucepan, drizzle the vegetable oil.?&#2- Add the shrimp and cook for a few minutes until their color changes from translucent to pink. Once done, transfer the shrimp to the empty bowl and keep them for later.?&#3- In the same pan, add the eggs and scramble them with a wooden spoon. Cook the eggs for one minute until they lightly set.?&#4- Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir to combine with the eggs. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is hot, about 3 minutes. Then transfer the rice to an empty bowl.?&#5- Add one tablespoon of oil to the pan and add the onion and garlic and stir. Then add the tomatoes and cook for another minute while stirring. Transfer the contents of the pan to your bowl of shrimps.?&#6- Add the carrot cubes. Cook for 2 minutes then add the red bell pepper and pineapple cubes. Cook, stirring constantly, for a few minutes until the vegetables are half cooked.?&#7- Pour the contents of the bowl with shrimp back into the pan and stir to combine.?&#8- Add the soy sauce, pepper, cashew, Mix.?&#9- Add the cooked rice with eggs and combine all the ingredients.?&#10- Add the chopped cilantro. Mix and cook for one minute.?&#11- Serve the fried rice immediately in the pineapple halves.?&#12- Squeeze some lime for extra flavor!?&#This dish smells heavenly!!! Hmmmm bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/522-pineapple-fried-rice/ 45 Minutes
30 minutes 6 medium Appetizers May 27, 2017 502- Indian Vegetable Samosa https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/3-Indian-samosa.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#4 servings of Kiri cheese?&#2 potatoes, peeled and cut into very small cubes?&#1 onion, chopped?&#150 g of peas?&#3 tablespoons of olive oil?&#3 tablespoons of tomato purée?&#A small piece of fresh ginger, grated?&#1 teaspoon of turmeric?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of dried coriander?&#1 teaspoon of old-fashioned mustard?&#1/2 teaspoon of pepper?&#1 tablespoon of garam masala?&#Salt and black pepper?&#250 g of warka?&#1 egg yolk?&#Oil for frying?&#?&#—————————————————————————————-?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#4 portions de fromage Kiri?&#2 pommes de terre, épluchées et découpées en très petits cubes?&#1 oignon, haché?&#150 g de petits pois?&#3 cuillères à soupe d’huile d’olive?&#3 cuillères à soupe de purée de tomates?&#Un petit morceau de gingembre frais, rapé?&#1 cuillère à café de curcuma?&#1 cuillère à café de cumin?&#1 cuillère à café de coriandre séchée?&#1 cuillère à café de moutarde à l’ancienne?&#1/2 cuillère à café de piment?&#1 cuillère à soupe de garam masala?&#Sel et poivre?&#250 g de feuille de pastilla?&#1 jaune d’oeuf?&#Huile pour la friture Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the filling?&#1- In a saucepan, cover the potatoes with water, add a pinch of salt and cook for 10 minutes over high heat until they are half cooked.?&#2- In a frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat, add the chopped onion and cook for 3 minutes.?&#3- Drain the potatoes and add them to the onion as well as peas, tomato purée, ginger, turmeric, cumin, coriander, mustard, pepper, garam masala, salt and black pepper. Cook for about 15 minutes.?&#4- Cut the servings of Kiri cheese into small cubes.?&#5- Remove the pan from the heat and add the Kiri cheese cubes.?&#?&#Step 2: Shaping the triangles?&#1- Cut the warka into long strips about 8 cm wide, and use them to form the triangles.?&#2- Brush the tip with a little bit of egg yolk to secure the triangle.?&#3- Fry in a hot oil bath until the triangles are golden and then pat them with a paper towel to remove excess oil. Serve immediately!?&#————————————————————————————————————-?&#?&#DIRECTIONS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#Etape 1: Préparer la farce?&#1- Dans une casserole, couvrez les pommes de terre d’eau, ajoutez-y une pincée de sel et laissez cuire pendant 10 minutes sur feu fort jusqu’à ce qu’ils soient à moitié cuit.?&#2- Dans une poêle, faites chauffer l’huile d’olive à feu moyen, ajoutez-y l’oignon haché et laissez cuire pendant 3 minutes.?&#3- Egouttez les pommes de terre et rajoutez-les à l’oignon ainsi que les petits pois, la purée de tomates, le gingembre, le curcuma, le cumin, la coriandre, la moutarde, le piment, le garam masala, le sel et le poivre. Laissez cuire environ 15 minutes.?&#4- Découpez les portions de fromage Kiri en petits cubes.?&#5- Retirez la poêle du feu et ajoutez les cubes de fromage Kiri.?&#?&#Etape 2 : Façonner les triangles?&#1- Coupez les feuilles de pastilla en longues bandes d’environ 8 cm de largeur, et utilisez-les pour former les triangles.?&#2- Badigeonnez la pointe avec un peu de jaune d’œuf pour fixer le triangle.?&#3- Faites frire dans un bain d’huile chaude jusqu’à ce que les triangles soient dorés puis tapotez-les avec une serviette en papier pour enlever l’excédent d’huile. Servez immédiatement! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/502-indian-vegetable-samosa/ 40 minutes
2 Cups Easy Desserts May 6, 2017 490- Mhallabia with Exotic Fruit Sauce https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/rsz_mhallabia.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For Mhallabia:?&#2 cups milk?&#3 tablespoons sugar?&#2 tablespoons corn starch (Maizena)?&#1 tablespoon orange blossom water?&#?&#For Papaya Coulis:?&#Papaya?&#Sugar?&#Lime juice?&#?&#For Pineapple Compote:?&#1 cup pineapple, peeled, cored and cubed?&#4 tablespoons brown sugar?&#juice of 1 orange juice?&#juice of ½ lime?&#1 tablespoon cornstarch?&#100 ml water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Mhallabia?&#1- Pour the cold milk in a saucepan. Add the sugar and the corn starch also called Maizena.?&#2- Mix with a wooden spoon until all the lumps are dissolved.?&#3- Place the saucepan on medium heat and bring the milk to a boiling point while stirring constantly. You will notice that the milk mixture gets thicker as it gets hotter.?&#4- Once the milk mixture reaches a boiling point, add the orange blossom water.?&#5- Continue cooking the mixture for another 2-3 minutes.?&#6- Filter the milk mixture through a sieve to get rid of all solid pieces.?&#7- Pour the milk mixture in canisters, bowls, or even tall classes. Let the pudding sit on the counter until it reaches room temperature, then place it in the fridge for a few hours before serving.?&#?&#Step 2 – Making Papaya Coulis?&#1- Cut the papaya and remove the seeds.?&#2- Using a knife, separate the papaya flesh from the skin. Discard the skin and cut the flesh into cubes.?&#3- Place papaya, lime juice and sugar in a food processor; process until smooth.?&#4- Transfer to a small bowl. Refrigerate, covered, until cold.?&#?&#Step 3 – Making Pineapple Compote?&#1- Cut the pineapple, slice it and remove the core from each slice.?&#2- Cut the pineapple flesh into small cubes.?&#3- In a saucepan, place the pineapple chunks and add the sugar. Cook on medium heat until the pineapple pieces become a bit brown and the sugar caramelizes.?&#4- When the pineapple is golden brown, add the orange juice, lime juice and water and allow to simmer until the liquid has reduced by half.?&#5- Stir cornstarch in cold water and add to the pineapple to thicken.?&#6- Remove from the heat and allow to cool completely before serving.?&#?&#Step 4- Serve and Enjoy?&#Serve the mhallabia cold, and top it with the cold papaya coulis or the pineapple compote. Surprise your friends and family with this classic mhallabia but with an exotic twist. Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/490-mhallabia-exotic-fruit-sauce/
4 Medium Desserts Dec 31, 2015 377 – Korean Sweet Pancake (Hotteok) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_377.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#DOUGH INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#2 cups (256 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#2 teaspoons Instant yeast?&#2 tablespoons white granulated sugar?&#A pinch of salt?&#1 cup lukewarm water?&#?&#FILLING INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#1/2 cup (110 grams) dark brown sugar?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon cocoa powder?&#Pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, walnuts, etc.?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Dough: ?&#1- In a large bowl, mix all the dry ingredients: flour, white sugar, dry yeast, and salt.?&#2- Add the water and mix well with a spatula until you get a smooth dough that is very sticky?&#3- Cover the bowl with a humid towel and let the dough rest in a warm place for 1 hour until the dough volume doubles?&#?&#Step 2 – Making the Stuffing: ?&#1- In a bowl mix the brown sugar, cinnamon, and cocoa powder together.?&#2- Add around 2 tablespoons of chopped nuts.?&#?&#Step 3 – Making the Hotteoks: ?&#1- Preparing a baking pan by covering it with parchment paper and brushing the paper with vegetable oil?&#2- Check on the dough, it should have doubled or tripled volume. Knead the dought a bit.?&#3- Brush oil on your hands, thake a bit of the dough and make a ball the size of a mandarine.?&#4- Flatten the dough ball between your hands and in the center fill it up with a teaspoon or so of the brown sugar filling?&#5- Close the dough as a pocket and roll it again into a ball. Place the ball with on the baking pan.?&#6- Continue until you finish all the dough.?&#7- in a deep pan, heat the vegetable oil.?&#8- When the oil is hot, place a few hotteoks in the pan and start frying them. Dip a spatula in the oil and use it to flatten the hotteok into a round pancake.?&#9- When one side becomes golden brown, flip the hotteok and fry the other side until deep golden brown.?&#10- Place the hotteok on a plate covered with paper towel to absorb any exccess oil. Serve immediately, hot!?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/korean-sweet-pancake-hotteok/
4 Easy Appetizers Dec 31, 2015 375 – Korean Japche (fried noodles) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_375.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#MAIN INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#8.8 oz (250 grams) Dangmyeon (Korean sweet potato- replacement: glass noodles)?&#1 small zucchini?&#1/2 onion?&#1/2 carrot?&#1/2 red bell pepper?&#1/2 yellow bell pepper?&#4 shiitake mushroom?&#?&#MARINADE INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#6 tablespoons soy sauce?&#2 tablespoons light brown sugar?&#2 tablespoons sesame oil?&#A pinch of black pepper?&#1 teaspoon minced garlic?&#?&#OTHER:?&#?&#Toasted sesame seeds?&#Vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Cooking the Noodles: ?&#1- Boil water in a sauce pan.?&#2- Place the Dangmyeon noodles in the boiling water and cook for 11 minutes over medium-high heat.?&#3- When done, drain from the water and place in a bowl. Drizzle some vegetable oil on top for the noodles not to sti?&#Note: If you dont have Dangmyeon noodles you can use Chinese glass noodles. Just place them in a bowl filled with boiling water and let them sit for 5 minutes until soft.?&#?&#Step 2 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- Julienne (cut into thin sticks) the vegetables: zucchini, 1/2 onion, 1/2 carrot, 1/2 red bell pepper, and 1/2 yellow red pepper.?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Marinade: ?&#1- In a bowl mix: the soy sauce, brown sugar, black pepper, sesame oil, grated garlic.?&#2- Slice the mushrooms and place them in the marinade while preparing the rest of the recipe.?&#?&#Step 4 – Cooking the Vegetables: ?&#1- Drizzle vegetable oil on a pan and heat it up on medium heat. Cook the vegetables one type at a time.?&#2- First, the sliced onion. Place in the pan, add a small pinch of salt and cook for a few minutes until they become translucent. Remove the onions from the pan and reserve in a bowl.?&#3- Now cook the carrot sticks with a small pinch of salt until they are soft (but not mushy). Remove from the pan and place reserve.?&#4-Cook the bell pepper sticks with a bit of salt until soft but not mushy. Remove from pan and reserve.?&#5- Finally, cook the zucchini sticks with a bit of salt until soft but not mushy. Reseve.?&#You may have to add a bit of vegetable oil in between cooking the different types of vegetables.?&#6- Squeeze firmly the mushrooms to get rid of juices that they have absorbs while marinating in the soy sauce mixture. Then cook the mushrooms in a pan for a few minutes until soft.?&#Keep the marinade as we will be using it later.?&#?&#Step 5 – Final Steps: ?&#1- Place the cooked noodles in large pan over medium heat and add a little bit of the soy sauce marinade (used to marinate the mushrooms). Mix well.?&#2- Add the vegetables over the noodles. Mix well. You may have to use your hands to made sure all these ingredients are well integrated.?&#3- Sprinkle some toasted sesase seeds and mix with the noodles and vegetables.?&#4- Add the soy sauce marinade to the noodles and vegetables to your taste.?&#5- Serve immediately hot, or warm, or cold.?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/375-korean-japche-fried-noodles-recipe/
Easy Appetizers Dec 31, 2015 376 – Korean Seafood Pancake (Haemul Pajeon) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_376.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup (128 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1 cup (236 ml) water?&#1/8 teaspoon (large pinch) salt?&#12-14 scallions (green onions)?&#A small handful of peeled shrimp?&#1/2 a squid (sliced)?&#1 large egg?&#Red chili pepper (thinly sliced)?&#?&#SAUCE INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#2 tablespoons soy sauce?&#1 tablespoons white vinegar?&#Leftover scallion trimmings / chili pepper slices?&#Korean chili fakes (Gochugaru) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- First, prepare the pancake mixture. In a large bowl, mix the flour, large pinch of salt, and water. Make sure that there are no clumps.?&#2- In a separate small bowl, beat the egg with a pinch of salt.?&#3- Place the green scallions on your frying pan, then trim the scallions ends (green part) to fit the pan.?&#4- Thinly slice the red chilli pepper (optional)?&#?&#Step 2 – Making the Pajeon: ?&#1- On medium heat, drizzle vegetale oil on your frying pan, and let it heat up for a minute.?&#2- Lay down the scallions on the fying pan as if you are creating a ‘carpet’ of scallions.?&#3- Pour the pancake mixture over the scallion evenly, so it covers all the pan.?&#4- Right away, place the shrimp, sliced squid all, and few slices of red chillis over the pancake mixture and scallions.?&#5- Pour the beaten egg on top (make sure you pour in center of the pancake) and use a spatula to evenly distribute the egg all over the surface of the pancake?&#Note: you have to layer the ingredients one after the other – no waiting time in between.?&#6- Cook the pajeon for a few minutes until the bottom surface becomes crispy (check from time to time, by lifting the pancake and looking at the bottom surface)?&#7- Slide the pajeon (cooked surface down, uncooked surface up) in a plate, then flip it back into the frying pan, uncooked surface down (in contact with the frying pan) to cook it.?&#8- Cook for a few minutes until the other surface is golden brown and a bit crispy?&#9- Serve immediately with the sauce?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Sauce: ?&#1- In a bowl mix: the soy sauce, vinegar, Korean chili flakes (hot chili pepper), thinly sliced chili peppers?&#2- Serve with the Pajeon as a dipping sauce?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/376-korean-seafood-pancake-haemul-pajeon/
4 Easy Appetizers Dec 31, 2015 373 – Korean Cucumber Kimchi (Oi-Sobaegi) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_373.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#MAIN INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#4 long cucumbers?&#2 tablespoons sea salt (or rock salt)?&#?&#STUFFING INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#A large bunch of garlic chives (buchu)?&#1/2 onion?&#1/2 red bell pepper?&#1 small carrot (or 1/2 large carrot)?&#2 large garlic cloves?&#A small piece of fresh ginger?&#?&#SEASONING INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#1/3 cup Korean red chili flakes (or a mix of paprika and cayenne pepper)?&#1 1/2 tablespoons of fish sauce?&#1 tablespoon of sugar Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Cucumbers: ?&#1- Slice off the ends of the cucumbers. Cut the cucumbers into 7 cm / 3″ pieces. Place the cucumber piece on one end, then cut in half down length without cutting through; rotate, and cut, perpendicular, down length, creating a cross.?&#2- Place the cucumber pieces in a large bowl and add the sea salt. You can also use rock sold, but do NOT use regular fine salt.?&#3- Pour boiling water over the cucumber and sea salt, until all cucumbers are covered.?&#4- Let the cucumber rest for 30 minutes in the boiling water before stuffing it.?&#?&#Step 2 – Preparing the Stuffing: ?&#1- While waiting for the cucumbers to brine, prepare the rest of the ingredients. Slice the chives into 3 cm / 1″ long pieces?&#2- Thinly slice the half onion. Cut the the half red bell pepper into thin sticks (Julienne).?&#3- Peel the carrot then grate it using the large holes of the grater.?&#4- Grate the garlic cloves and peeled fresh ginger using the small holes of the grater.?&#5- Place all these ingredients in one large bowl.?&#?&#Step 3 – Marinating the Stuffing: ?&#1- Add the Korean red chili flakes to the vegetables.?&#Note: if you dont have Korean red chili flakes, you can use a mix of paprika and cayenne pepper.?&#2- Add the sugar and fish sauce.?&#Note: if you dont have fish sauce, you can use a can of sardines in water. Puree a little bit of the sardine meat with the sauce in the can and use as a susbsitute.?&#3- Using plastic gloves, mix well the seasoning with the vegetables with your hands until all ingredients are well incorporated. Taste and adjust the seasoning accordingly.?&#?&#Step 4 – Stuffing the Cucumbers: ?&#1- Drain the cucumbers from the water.?&#2- Open each cucumber piece and stuff it with the seasoned vegetables.?&#3- Place the stuffed cucumbers in a container with a lid. Rub the surface of the cucumbers with the rest of the seasoned vegetables.?&#4- Place the stuffed cucumbers over your counter and let them ferment for at least 1 hour, preferable 3-5 hours to ferment.?&#5- Serve on a plate as a side dish!?&#Note: you can keep these cucumbers in the fridge for 2-3 days. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/373-korean-cucumber-kimchi-oisobaegi/
4 Easy International Recipes Dec 31, 2015 374 – Korean Beef Short Ribs (Galbi) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_374.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 1/2 pounds (700 grams) beef short ribs?&#1/2 onion?&#1/2 kiwi?&#1/2 apple?&#5 garlic cloves?&#1/4 cup (60 ml) soy sauce?&#1 tablespoon sesame oil?&#1 tablespoon light brown sugar?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#1/4 teaspoon black pepper?&#3/4 cup water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Soaking the Meat: ?&#1- Place the beef slices in a large bowl, cover with cold water, and let the meat soak for 30 minutes to remove blood and any meat after-taste.?&#?&#Step 2 – Preparing the Marinade: ?&#1- Peel and cut into chunks the 1/2 onion, 1/2 apple, and 1/2 kiwi.?&#2- Mince the garlice cloves.?&#3- Place all these ingredients in a food processor and mix until you get a smooth puree.?&#4- Pour the puree in a large bowl an add the soy sauce, brown sugar, the honey, sesame oil, black pepper, and water. Mix well with a spoon.?&#?&#Step 3 – Marinating the Meat: ?&#1- Drain the meat from the water and place it evenly on a large pan.?&#2- Pour the marinade all over the meat. Cover the pan with a plastic wrap and place in the fridge for at least 3 hours before cooking the meat.?&#Note: if you want to marinate the meat overnight and cook it the next day, omit the kiwi from the recipe as the kiwi can over-tenderize the meat.?&#?&#Step 4 – Cooking the Meat: ?&#1- Heat a grilling pan on medium heat.?&#2- Grill the meat on both sides until the outside is nicely browned. It should take 5-10 minutes.?&#3- Serve immediately with some rice and other side dishes.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/374-korean-beef-short-ribs-galbi-recipe/
4 Easy Breads Dec 31, 2015 368 – Korean Egg Bread https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_368.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup (128 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1/2 teaspoon baking soda?&#1 teaspoon baking powder?&#2-4 tablespoons sugar (to taste)?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1 large egg for the batter?&#2 tablespoons (28 grams) butter?&#3/4 cup (177 ml) milk?&#2 tablespoons white vinegar?&#8-10 whole eggs?&#toppings: shredded cheese, chopped parsley, etc. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- First, make homemade buttermilk by mixing the milk and the vinegar together, and letting them sit for 5 minutes while preparing the rest of the ingredients.?&#2- Melt the butter?&#3- Chop any herbs that you will be using as a topping (parsley, cilantro, etc.)?&#?&#Step 2 – Preparing the Batter: ?&#1- In a large bowl, mix all the dry ingredients: flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and sugar. You can adjust the amount of sugar depending on how sweet you would like the cake to be.?&#2- Now add the wet ingredients: melted butter, 1 egg, and the buttermilk (milk + vinegar)?&#3- Mix well all the ingredients until you get a smooth dough?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Egg Breads: ?&#1- Place paper cups in a muffin tray?&#2- Scoop a tablespoon of batter into each paper cup?&#3- Break a whole egg in each paper cup (each muffin whole)?&#4- Top the each egg with batter?&#5- You can add toppings such as shredded cheese or chopped herbs?&#?&#Step 4 – Final steps: ?&#1- Bake in a pre-heated oven to 360 F / 180C for 25 minutes or until the breads get a nice deep golden color?&#2- Remove from oven when egg breads are ready and serve immediately?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/368-korean-egg-bread/
1 Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 344 – Vegetables Stir-fry – Thai recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_344.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#3 cabbage leaves?&#1/4 medium sized onion?&#6 thin slices of carrot?&#4 baby corns?&#A few leaves of Chinese Kale (or spinach)?&#1/2 tomato?&#1 teaspoon crushed garlic?&#1 tablespoon light brown sugar?&#1 tablespoon oyster sauce?&#1 tablespoon light soy sauce?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#1/4 teaspoon white ground pepper Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#First, cut the vegetables into medium sized cubes (cabbage leaves, kale, onion, tomatoes, etc.). For the hard vegetables like carrots, you should thinly slice them.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Vegetables?&#1- Place all the vegetables in the same plate, add the crushed garlic, light brown sugar, oyster sauce, and light soy sauce!?&#2- Drizzle vegetable oil to a pan and heat it up on medium heat for a few seconds. Now add the vegetables!?&#3- With your spatula, mix them well, and also give them a nice massage with the back of the spatula while stirring. This will help blend all the flavors!?&#Note: Get creative with this recipe – use any vegetable of your choice as long as they are leafy, cook quickly, or are thinly sliced.?&#4- Stir-fry for 5 minutes, and that’s it!!! Really, we are done! Serve on a plate and sprinkle some white ground pepper on top! You can also add some chopped herbs like fresh cilantro or basil!?&#Note: Do not overcook the vegetables, they should still have some crunch in them!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/vegetables-stir-fry-thai-recipe/
6 Medium Desserts Feb 25, 2015 239 – Tres Leches Mexican Flan https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_239.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 large eggs (use organic eggs if you can)?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#The zest of 1 orange?&#A pinch of salt?&#1 can evaporated milk (12 oz / 354 ml)?&#1 can condensed milk (14 oz / 396 grams)?&#500 ml (a little more than 2 cups) of regular milk?&#Caramel Ingredients: 1 cup of granulated white sugar?&#Boiling water for baking the flan Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Flan Mixture?&#1- First we need 5 whole eggs. Use organic eggs if you can. Place the eggs in a blender.?&#2- Add vanilla extract. You can use any extract you like.?&#3- Add the zest of 1 orange and a pinch of salt. Whenever you make a dessert, anything sweet, always add a little bit of salt because it really brings up the sweet flavors.?&#4- Add the evaporated milk. If you dont have evaporated milk just replace it with regular milk.?&#5- Add the sweetened condensed milk and the regular milk.?&#6- Blend all the ingredients together.?&#7- Prepare for the next steps by getting some water boiling and preparing the caramel.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Caramel?&#1- Preheat oven to 350 F / 180 C.?&#2- Boil water (we will use it later when baking the flan)?&#3- Pour the sugar in a skillet and cook on medium-high heat. Keep stirring the sugar constantly. At one point the sugar becomes hard – don’t worry about it, it will eventually melt.?&#4- After a few minutes, all the sugar melts into a golden brown liquid. Continue stirring and cooking until the sugar is completely dissolved and you get a nice golden brown caramel. Make sure not to overcook, otherwise the caramel would burn.?&#5- Pour the caramel in a baking pan (I am using an 8.5 inches rectangular pan) and make sure that the caramel covers all the bottom surface of the pan.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Flan?&#1- Using a spoon, remove the top foam (if any) that formed when blending the flan ingredients. Then stir the flan mixture just before pouring it into the baking pan.?&#2- It’s time to bake the flan. Make sure that your oven is preheated to 350 F / 180 C.?&#3- Place the baking pan containing the flan mixture into a larger baking pan. We going to pour boiling water in the larger baking pan and the boiling water will surround the pan containing the flan.?&#4- First place the large pan (containing the smaller flan pan) in the oven rack, then pour the boiling water until the water reaches half the height of the flan pan. It’s much easier to do it this way than moving the pans around when water is in.?&#5- Bake the flan for around 1 hour.?&#6- When ready, the flan will have a beautiful golden color at the top. The flan is still jiggly but if you insert a knife in the center, it comes out clean. That’s how you know the flan is ready.?&#7- Remove the flan pan from the water bath, place it in your counter for 1 hour to cool down.?&#8- Then place the flan pan in the fridge for at least 4 hours before serving the flan.?&#9- Once the flan is cold, run a sharp knife all around the edges, to make sure that the flan edges are not sticking to the pan.?&#10- Place a place on top of the pan, flip, then give it a shake.?&#11- Slowly remove the pan and you will have your flan beautifully displayed on your plate! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/239-tres-leches-mexican-flan/
4 Medium Desserts Dec 31, 2015 377 – Korean Sweet Pancake (Hotteok) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_377.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#DOUGH INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#2 cups (256 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#2 teaspoons Instant yeast?&#2 tablespoons white granulated sugar?&#A pinch of salt?&#1 cup lukewarm water?&#?&#FILLING INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#1/2 cup (110 grams) dark brown sugar?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon cocoa powder?&#Pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, walnuts, etc.?&#Vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Making the Dough: ?&#1- In a large bowl, mix all the dry ingredients: flour, white sugar, dry yeast, and salt.?&#2- Add the water and mix well with a spatula until you get a smooth dough that is very sticky?&#3- Cover the bowl with a humid towel and let the dough rest in a warm place for 1 hour until the dough volume doubles?&#?&#Step 2 – Making the Stuffing: ?&#1- In a bowl mix the brown sugar, cinnamon, and cocoa powder together.?&#2- Add around 2 tablespoons of chopped nuts.?&#?&#Step 3 – Making the Hotteoks: ?&#1- Preparing a baking pan by covering it with parchment paper and brushing the paper with vegetable oil?&#2- Check on the dough, it should have doubled or tripled volume. Knead the dought a bit.?&#3- Brush oil on your hands, thake a bit of the dough and make a ball the size of a mandarine.?&#4- Flatten the dough ball between your hands and in the center fill it up with a teaspoon or so of the brown sugar filling?&#5- Close the dough as a pocket and roll it again into a ball. Place the ball with on the baking pan.?&#6- Continue until you finish all the dough.?&#7- in a deep pan, heat the vegetable oil.?&#8- When the oil is hot, place a few hotteoks in the pan and start frying them. Dip a spatula in the oil and use it to flatten the hotteok into a round pancake.?&#9- When one side becomes golden brown, flip the hotteok and fry the other side until deep golden brown.?&#10- Place the hotteok on a plate covered with paper towel to absorb any exccess oil. Serve immediately, hot!?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/korean-sweet-pancake-hotteok/
4 Easy Appetizers Dec 31, 2015 375 – Korean Japche (fried noodles) Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_375.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#MAIN INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#8.8 oz (250 grams) Dangmyeon (Korean sweet potato- replacement: glass noodles)?&#1 small zucchini?&#1/2 onion?&#1/2 carrot?&#1/2 red bell pepper?&#1/2 yellow bell pepper?&#4 shiitake mushroom?&#?&#MARINADE INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#6 tablespoons soy sauce?&#2 tablespoons light brown sugar?&#2 tablespoons sesame oil?&#A pinch of black pepper?&#1 teaspoon minced garlic?&#?&#OTHER:?&#?&#Toasted sesame seeds?&#Vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Cooking the Noodles: ?&#1- Boil water in a sauce pan.?&#2- Place the Dangmyeon noodles in the boiling water and cook for 11 minutes over medium-high heat.?&#3- When done, drain from the water and place in a bowl. Drizzle some vegetable oil on top for the noodles not to sti?&#Note: If you dont have Dangmyeon noodles you can use Chinese glass noodles. Just place them in a bowl filled with boiling water and let them sit for 5 minutes until soft.?&#?&#Step 2 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- Julienne (cut into thin sticks) the vegetables: zucchini, 1/2 onion, 1/2 carrot, 1/2 red bell pepper, and 1/2 yellow red pepper.?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Marinade: ?&#1- In a bowl mix: the soy sauce, brown sugar, black pepper, sesame oil, grated garlic.?&#2- Slice the mushrooms and place them in the marinade while preparing the rest of the recipe.?&#?&#Step 4 – Cooking the Vegetables: ?&#1- Drizzle vegetable oil on a pan and heat it up on medium heat. Cook the vegetables one type at a time.?&#2- First, the sliced onion. Place in the pan, add a small pinch of salt and cook for a few minutes until they become translucent. Remove the onions from the pan and reserve in a bowl.?&#3- Now cook the carrot sticks with a small pinch of salt until they are soft (but not mushy). Remove from the pan and place reserve.?&#4-Cook the bell pepper sticks with a bit of salt until soft but not mushy. Remove from pan and reserve.?&#5- Finally, cook the zucchini sticks with a bit of salt until soft but not mushy. Reseve.?&#You may have to add a bit of vegetable oil in between cooking the different types of vegetables.?&#6- Squeeze firmly the mushrooms to get rid of juices that they have absorbs while marinating in the soy sauce mixture. Then cook the mushrooms in a pan for a few minutes until soft.?&#Keep the marinade as we will be using it later.?&#?&#Step 5 – Final Steps: ?&#1- Place the cooked noodles in large pan over medium heat and add a little bit of the soy sauce marinade (used to marinate the mushrooms). Mix well.?&#2- Add the vegetables over the noodles. Mix well. You may have to use your hands to made sure all these ingredients are well integrated.?&#3- Sprinkle some toasted sesase seeds and mix with the noodles and vegetables.?&#4- Add the soy sauce marinade to the noodles and vegetables to your taste.?&#5- Serve immediately hot, or warm, or cold.?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/375-korean-japche-fried-noodles-recipe/
Easy Appetizers Dec 31, 2015 376 – Korean Seafood Pancake (Haemul Pajeon) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/rsz_376.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup (128 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1 cup (236 ml) water?&#1/8 teaspoon (large pinch) salt?&#12-14 scallions (green onions)?&#A small handful of peeled shrimp?&#1/2 a squid (sliced)?&#1 large egg?&#Red chili pepper (thinly sliced)?&#?&#SAUCE INGREDIENTS:?&#?&#2 tablespoons soy sauce?&#1 tablespoons white vinegar?&#Leftover scallion trimmings / chili pepper slices?&#Korean chili fakes (Gochugaru) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Ingredients: ?&#1- First, prepare the pancake mixture. In a large bowl, mix the flour, large pinch of salt, and water. Make sure that there are no clumps.?&#2- In a separate small bowl, beat the egg with a pinch of salt.?&#3- Place the green scallions on your frying pan, then trim the scallions ends (green part) to fit the pan.?&#4- Thinly slice the red chilli pepper (optional)?&#?&#Step 2 – Making the Pajeon: ?&#1- On medium heat, drizzle vegetale oil on your frying pan, and let it heat up for a minute.?&#2- Lay down the scallions on the fying pan as if you are creating a ‘carpet’ of scallions.?&#3- Pour the pancake mixture over the scallion evenly, so it covers all the pan.?&#4- Right away, place the shrimp, sliced squid all, and few slices of red chillis over the pancake mixture and scallions.?&#5- Pour the beaten egg on top (make sure you pour in center of the pancake) and use a spatula to evenly distribute the egg all over the surface of the pancake?&#Note: you have to layer the ingredients one after the other – no waiting time in between.?&#6- Cook the pajeon for a few minutes until the bottom surface becomes crispy (check from time to time, by lifting the pancake and looking at the bottom surface)?&#7- Slide the pajeon (cooked surface down, uncooked surface up) in a plate, then flip it back into the frying pan, uncooked surface down (in contact with the frying pan) to cook it.?&#8- Cook for a few minutes until the other surface is golden brown and a bit crispy?&#9- Serve immediately with the sauce?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Sauce: ?&#1- In a bowl mix: the soy sauce, vinegar, Korean chili flakes (hot chili pepper), thinly sliced chili peppers?&#2- Serve with the Pajeon as a dipping sauce?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/376-korean-seafood-pancake-haemul-pajeon/
