Really, we are done! Serve on a plate and sprinkle some white ground pepper on top! You can also add some chopped herbs like fresh cilantro or basil!?&#Note: Do not overcook the vegetables, they should still have some crunch in them!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/vegetables-stir-fry-thai-recipe/
6 Medium Desserts Feb 25, 2015 239 – Tres Leches Mexican Flan https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_239.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 large eggs (use organic eggs if you can)?&#1 teaspoon vanilla extract?&#The zest of 1 orange?&#A pinch of salt?&#1 can evaporated milk (12 oz / 354 ml)?&#1 can condensed milk (14 oz / 396 grams)?&#500 ml (a little more than 2 cups) of regular milk?&#Caramel Ingredients: 1 cup of granulated white sugar?&#Boiling water for baking the flan Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Flan Mixture?&#1- First we need 5 whole eggs. Use organic eggs if you can. Place the eggs in a blender.?&#2- Add vanilla extract. You can use any extract you like.?&#3- Add the zest of 1 orange and a pinch of salt. Whenever you make a dessert, anything sweet, always add a little bit of salt because it really brings up the sweet flavors.?&#4- Add the evaporated milk. If you dont have evaporated milk just replace it with regular milk.?&#5- Add the sweetened condensed milk and the regular milk.?&#6- Blend all the ingredients together.?&#7- Prepare for the next steps by getting some water boiling and preparing the caramel.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Caramel?&#1- Preheat oven to 350 F / 180 C.?&#2- Boil water (we will use it later when baking the flan)?&#3- Pour the sugar in a skillet and cook on medium-high heat. Keep stirring the sugar constantly. At one point the sugar becomes hard – don’t worry about it, it will eventually melt.?&#4- After a few minutes, all the sugar melts into a golden brown liquid. Continue stirring and cooking until the sugar is completely dissolved and you get a nice golden brown caramel. Make sure not to overcook, otherwise the caramel would burn.?&#5- Pour the caramel in a baking pan (I am using an 8.5 inches rectangular pan) and make sure that the caramel covers all the bottom surface of the pan.?&#?&#Step 3: Baking the Flan?&#1- Using a spoon, remove the top foam (if any) that formed when blending the flan ingredients. Then stir the flan mixture just before pouring it into the baking pan.?&#2- It’s time to bake the flan. Make sure that your oven is preheated to 350 F / 180 C.?&#3- Place the baking pan containing the flan mixture into a larger baking pan. We going to pour boiling water in the larger baking pan and the boiling water will surround the pan containing the flan.?&#4- First place the large pan (containing the smaller flan pan) in the oven rack, then pour the boiling water until the water reaches half the height of the flan pan. It’s much easier to do it this way than moving the pans around when water is in.?&#5- Bake the flan for around 1 hour.?&#6- When ready, the flan will have a beautiful golden color at the top. The flan is still jiggly but if you insert a knife in the center, it comes out clean. That’s how you know the flan is ready.?&#7- Remove the flan pan from the water bath, place it in your counter for 1 hour to cool down.?&#8- Then place the flan pan in the fridge for at least 4 hours before serving the flan.?&#9- Once the flan is cold, run a sharp knife all around the edges, to make sure that the flan edges are not sticking to the pan.?&#10- Place a place on top of the pan, flip, then give it a shake.?&#11- Slowly remove the pan and you will have your flan beautifully displayed on your plate! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/239-tres-leches-mexican-flan/
4 easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 264 – Traditional Garlic Shrimp https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_264.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound (450 grams) large shrimp?&#6 garlic cloves (thinly sliced)?&#Chili pepper flakes?&#Salt and pepper to taste?&#Extra virgin olive oil?&#Chopped parsley?&#Lemon wedges & sliced baguette Directions :?&#?&#1- Heat olive oil in a cazuela (clay cooking dish) or saute pan.?&#2- Add garlic and chili pepper. Cook for a minute.?&#3- Salt and pepper the shrimp.?&#4- Add the shrimp, cook 2 minutes each side until the shrimp becomes pink. Add salt and pepper to taste.?&#5- If cooked in a cazuela you can serve directly, otherwise, move to a serving dish.?&#6- Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedges and sliced baguette. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/traditional-garlic-shrimp/
4 Medium International Recipes Feb 25, 2015 323 – Turkish Stuffed Eggplant (Karniyarik) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_323.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#5 medium-sized eggplants?&#1 lb (450 grams) ground beef?&#1 small onion, diced?&#3 medium sized tomatoes, one sliced and the other two coarsely chopped?&#Spices for the meat: 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 2 teaspoons paprika, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper?&#Olive oil?&#1 can of plain tomato sauce?&#salt and pepper to taste?&#Parsley leaves (decoration) Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Finely chop the onions?&#2- Peel the tomatoes. Slice one and chop the other two.?&#3- Peel the eggplants using the ‘stripe’ technique (half peel skin, so you have one stripe of skin, and stripe peeled)?&#4- Place the eggplants in salty water (large bowl with a teaspoon of salt) and let them sit there while preparing the rest of ingredients – around 30 minutes.?&#5- Cut a slit in the center of the eggplants lengthwise, and scoop out the eggplant meat and seeds, to create a ‘boat’ shaped eggplant.?&#6- In a bowl, place the meat, add a little bit of olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well, cover and let it marinate in the fridge while frying the eggplants.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Ingredients?&#1- In a large pan, drizzle a little bit of olive oil and let it heat up on medium heat.?&#2- Once the oil is hot, place the eggplants in the pan and close with a lid. Fry on one side for 3 minutes, return to the other side, and cook for another 3 minutes.?&#3- Remove the eggplants from the pan and place them in a baking pan, cut face up (to fill it with the meat)?&#4- In the same frying pan, drizzle more olive oil, heat up on medium heat, and add the chopped onion. After a few minutes of cooking the onion, add the meat. Stir and cook until the meat changes color (to brown).?&#5- Add the chopped tomatoes to the meat and onions, a pinch of salt and 1/2 teaspoon paprika over the tomatoes, mix well and cook for 3 minutes.?&#?&#Step 3: Stuffing the Eggplants?&#1- Using a spoon, put the meat mixture in the carved space of each eggplant. Also dont forget to add the sauce from the meat!?&#2- Using a spoon, add the tomatoe sauce arround and in between the eggplants in the baking pan.?&#3- Add the rest of the meat mixture on top of the tomato sauce so nothing gets wasted.?&#4- Add the tomato slices on top of each eggplant (decoration).?&#5- Bake in a pre-heated oven 360 F / 180 C for 25-30 minutes?&#6- Serve immediatley from the oven and decorate with cilantro leaves.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/turkish-stuffed-eggplant-karniyarik/
4 Easy Desserts Feb 25, 2015 171 – Strawberry Tiramisu – Italian recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_171.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Strawberry Juice: 1 pound strawberries?&#Strawberry Juice: 1/2 cup water?&#Mascarpone Cream: 16 oz mascarpone cheese?&#Mascarpone Cream: 4 egg yolks?&#Mascarpone Cream: 4 oz white sugar?&#Lady Fingers cookies?&#1 pound strawberries (for filling and decoration) Directions :?&#?&#Making the Strawberry Juice:?&#1- Cut 1 pound of strawberries into small pieces.?&#2- Place the strawberries in a bowl, and add 1/2 cup of cold water.?&#3- Using a hand held mixer, mix the strawberries until you get a liquid texture.?&#?&#Making the Mascarpone Cream:?&#1- Using an egg beater, beat 4 egg yolks with 4 oz of white sugar until you ge ta whitish mixture.?&#2- Add 16 oz of mascarpone to the egg yolk mixture. Add the mascarpone little by little, beating small amounts of mascarpone into the egg yolk mixture before adding the rest.?&#?&#Putting together the Tiramisu:?&#1- Dip the lady fingers in the strawberries juice and place them in your tiramisu pan (you can use a glass baking pan).?&#2- Cover the layer of lady fingers with a layer of mascarpone cream.?&#3- You can add a layer of sliced strawberries on top of the mascarpone cream. (optional).?&#4- Add another layer of lady fingers dipped in strawberry juice and mascarpone cream until you finish all the ingredients.?&#5- End up with a mascarpone layer and decorate with strawberries.?&#?&#Final Steps:?&#1- Place the tiramisu in the fridge for 3-4 hours so that the cookies soad up the strawberry juice. You can remove the tiramisu from the fridge 15 mintues before serving. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/strawberry-tiramisu-cookingwithalia-international-edition/
4 Very easy International Recipes Feb 25, 2015 175 – Saleeg Recipe – Saudi Rice Dish https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_175.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Two 1 1/2 pounds chicken, cut in half lengthwise (total 3 pounds of chicken)?&#10 whole peppercorns?&#4 whole cardamom pods?&#1 small onion, peeled?&#Butter?&#Clarified butter (ghee)?&#Sea salt + Ground Pepper (to taste)?&#2 cups rice (1 cup American rice, 1 cup Egyptian rice)?&#2 cups milk?&#100 grams butter?&#1/2 tablespoon ajinomoto (optional)?&#2 tablespoons rock sea salt Directions :?&#?&#Cooking the Chicken:?&#1- Place the chicken in a pot and cover with with boiling water. Add the peppercorns, cardamom pods, and peeled onion (whole).?&#2- Cover the pot and cook on high heat for 30 minutes or until the chicken is done.?&#3- Remove the chicken from the water (do not discard the water), and place on a baking dish. Brush with soften butter and sprinkle with rock sea salt and freshly ground pepper. Remove the onion from the water (pot) and discard.?&#4- Let the chicken sit on the counter while you are cooking the rice. Just before serving the dish, pop the chicken in the oven and broil it until it become crispy.?&#?&#Cooking the Rice:?&#1- Soak the rice in cold water for 30 minutes before using it in this recipe.?&#2- Once you remove the chicken and onion from the boiling water, strain the rice and add it to the pot.?&#3- Cover the pot, and cook the rice on medium-high / high heat for 30 minutes. Stir from time to time so that the rice does not stick to the bottom of the pan. Also, add water if necessary the rice should always be in a sauce like a thick soup.?&#4- After 30 minutes, the rice should be done. Add the milk, 100 grams of butter, ajimoto, and 2 tablespoons of rock sea salt. Mix. Uncover, and let cook for another 10 minutes.?&#5- now your rice is done. It should have a creamy thick consistency.?&#?&#Last Steps:?&#1- Use a large dish that is flat and not too deep.?&#2- Pour the rice mixture in the dish. Broil the chicken, then place it in the center of the rice. Since the dish is not too deep, the chicken does not sink into the rice. Whatever litte melted butter left in the baking pan, pour it over the chicken. Also, brush the chicken with a little ghee (clarified butter) to give it a unique flavor.?&#3- Serve hot, immediately. Eat with a spoon!?&#Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/saleeg-saudi-rice-dish/
4 Very easy Indian Feb 25, 2015 237 – Chettinad Chicken – Indian Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_237.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 large cinnamon stick, 2 cloves, and 3 cardamom pods?&#2 medium sized onions (peeled and finely chopped)?&#1 pound (450 grams) of chicken breast (cut into cubes)?&#1/2 cup plain yogurt?&#1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger?&#2 tablespoons crushed garlic?&#2 medium sized tomatoes (unpeeled and chopped)?&#1 green chile (sliced)?&#Spices: 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 tsp ground turmeric, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 2 teaspoon ground coriander?&#5 curry leaves (optional)?&#1 tablespoon chopped cilantro?&#1 teaspoon ground pepper?&#A squeeze of fresh lime?&#Cooked basmati rice for serving Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Marinating the Chicken?&#1- The first step is to marinate the chicken with plain yogurt. Mix both in a large bowl and let it sit for aroud 30 minutes.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Chicken?&#1- The next step is to cook the onions.?&#2- On medium heat, add the vegetable oil, cinnamon stick, whole cloves, and cardamom pods in your pot. Let the oil infuse the spices for about 30 seconds until you start smelling the aromas.?&#3- Add the chopped onions to the oil. Cook the onions, uncovered, for about 15-20 minutes while stirring occasionally, until they turn into a nice golden brown. If the onions start sticking to your pot, you can a little bit of water and mix well.?&#4- When the onions’ color turns into a beautiful golden brown, add freshly grated ginger and crushed garlic. Mix all the ingredients and cook for 5 minutes.?&#5- Add the chopped tomatoes and fresh chile.?&#6- Add the spices: salt, turmeric powder, red chile powder, and green coriander powder. Cook the mixture uncovered for 15 minutes, stirring from time to time.?&#7- Add the marinated chicken with the yogurt. Mix well. Continue cooking for another 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is done.?&#8- You know the chicken is done when the oil splits from the sauce and the chicken is soft.?&#9- Add the curry leaves (optional), freshly ground black pepper, chopped cilantro, and squeeze of fresh lime juice. Mix well.?&#?&#Step 3: Serving the Chicken?&#Serve the chicken along with cooked basmati rice.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/237-chettinad-chicken-indian-recipe/
6 Medium Fish Feb 25, 2015 243 – Sushi: California Roll – Japanese Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_243.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Sushi Rice (refer to recipe on how to make it)?&#1 avocado (peeled and sliced)?&#6 cooked shrimp (or crab sticks)?&#1/3 red bell pepper (thinly sliced)?&#Cream cheese?&#Roasted seaweed sheets for sushi?&#Soy sauce for serving Directions :?&#?&#1- We are going to learn how to make a California roll.?&#2- We will need roasted seaweed. There is a smooth side and a rough side in the seaweed sheet. Place the rough part on top (facing you) and soft part at the bottom facing the sushi mat.?&#3- Spread the rice on the seaweed. Use a wooden spoon, not your hands, or the rice would stick to your fingers. Make sure to leave 1 inch/2 cm around the edges of the seaweed sheet without rice.?&#4- Place the avocado slices in the center of the seaweed sheet (on top of the rice).?&#5- Add the red bell pepper slices.?&#6- Add the cooked shrip slices on top of the avocados and bell pepper.?&#7- Spread some cream cheese on top of the shrimp slices.?&#8- Gently roll the sushi mat around the seaweed, while trying to keep the ingredients in the center. The mat should stay “outside” and the seaweed is rolling around the rice. Gently press the mat over the rolled seaweed to shape it.?&#9- Let the roll rest ofr 5 minutes before cutting it, so that the ingredients stick together with the rice.?&#10- To cut the sushi, you will need a sharp knife and a wet towel.?&#11- Cut the first slice of the sushi roll, and wipe the knife with the wet towel before using it again to make another sushi slice. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/243-sushi-california-roll-japanese-recipe/
6 Medium Fish Feb 25, 2015 248 – Salted Codfish with Cream – Portuguese Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_248.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound (450 grams) of frozen salted cod fish (or fresh white fish)?&#6 medium sized potatoes?&#2 medium sized onions?&#Olive oil?&#?&#Bechamel:?&#?&#4 oz (113 grams) butter?&#1/2 cup (64 grams) of all purpose white flour?&#salt, pepper, ground nutmeg (to taste)?&#3 cups (700 ml) milk Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- The first step is to get the fish ready. Take the salted cod away from the fish, you can find in the frozen section in specialty stores. Place the salted cod in a large bowl full of water for at least 24 hours before using it. Make sure to change the water 2-3 times to get rid of the salt.?&#2- While we are cooking the fish, we will separately cook potatoes and onions. To prepare them, peel the potatoes and cut them into small cubes and thinly slice the onions. Place the potatoe pieces in a large bowl of water until you are ready to use them this way they do not turn brown.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Fish, Potatoes, and Onions (Separately)?&#1- Drain the salted cod from the water where it has been sitting. Place the fish in a large pot full of water, cover the pot, and boil (on high heat) for around 30 minutes or until it gets soft. If you are using fresh fish, you would just need 10-15 minutes to cook it.?&#2- In a large pan, drizzle the olive oil and heat it up on medium-high heat. Add the potatoes. Stir from time to time until the potatoes are cooked. You know the potatoes are cooked when they become soft and you can split a piece with a fork. Place the potatoes in a bowl and keep for later use.?&#3- In the same pan (or different pan) where you cooked the potatoes, drizzle olive oil again (not too much this time) and add the onions to the pan. Cook the onions on medium heat until they become soft and golden. Once the onions are done, add them to the bowl that contains the potatoes.?&#4- Check on the fish, at this point it should be ready. Remove the fish from the water and place it in a bowl.?&#?&#Step 3: Making the Bechamel Sauce?&#1- The next step is to prepare the Bechamel sauce. It can be tricky, so if you want you can just use the one from the store (already made).?&#2- In a saucepan, on medium heat, melt the butter.?&#Once the butter melts, add the flour and whisk it well.?&#3- After a few minutes, add the milk, a bit of salt, pepper, and nutmeg.?&#4- As soon as the milk starts boiling start whisking. As the Bechamel thickens, continue whisking until you get a creamy consistency. Make sure not to overcook it or the sauce becomes hard!?&#?&#Step 4: Putting All the Ingredients Together?&#1- Now that we have all the ingredients we need, we are going to put them together.?&#2- First, shread the cooked cod into small pieces. Make sure it cools down before you do so to avoid burning yourself.?&#3- In a baking pan mix the potatoes, onions, and fish pieces. Notice that we did not put salt in potatoes and onions, because the cod fish is already salty. So be aware of the salt!?&#4- Pour the bechamel sauce on top of the ingredients.?&#5- Place the baking pan in the oven and broil it for a few minutes for the top to become deep golden brown. Serve immediately.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/248-salted-codfish-with-cream-portuguese-recipe/
4 very easy International Recipes Feb 25, 2015 300 – Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo Mexican Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_300.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 tablespoons chorizo?&#2 eggs?&#Olive oil Directions :?&#?&#1- Drizzle some olive oil on a pan, and heat on medium-heat.?&#2- Add the chorizo (Note: check out my recipe on how to prepare Chorizo at home!)?&#3- Cook the chorizo for around 10 minutes or until the meat is done (the time will depend if you are using pieces of meat or ground meat in your chorizo)?&#4- Once the meat is one, add the eggs (lightely beaten). No need to add spices, the chorizo has strong flavors.?&#5- Cook for a few minutes until the eggs are ready?&#6- Serve with bread or Mexican tortilla for a delicious breakfast!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/scrambled-eggs-with-chorizo-recipe/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 133 – M’Batten Recipe – Fried Potato Pockets with Meat (Recipe from Libya) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_133.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound of ground lamb (or beef)?&#1 onion, grated?&#¼ cup of finely chopped cilantro?&#¼ cup of finely chopped parsley?&#6 scallions, chopped, only the white part?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/3 teaspoon of red chile pepper?&#¼ teaspoon of cinnamon powder?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#½ teaspoon of turmeric powder?&#3 garlic cloves?&#1 egg?&#1 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#Large white potatoes?&#Flour egg and vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Meat?&#1. Mix the egg, spices, garlic and tomato paste with ground meat.?&#2. Over medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in your pan.?&#3. Add the grated onion and cook for a few minutes.?&#4. After a few minute of cooking the inions, add the meat.?&#5. Cook the meat until done.?&#6. Once the meat is cooked, about 10 minutes, taste the meat and cook the spices accordingly.?&#7. Place the meat in a large bowl.?&#8. Add the cilantro, parsley and scallions to the cooked meat.?&#9. Let the mixture cool down.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Potatoes?&#1. Peel the potatoes?&#2. Slice the potatoes – the goal is to get pieces that look like a potato sandwich to fill with the meat.?&#3. Slice about ¾ of the way through the potato then make the next slice all the way down the potato.?&#?&#Step 3: Assembling and Frying the M’Batten?&#1. Take a potato sandwich and fill it with the meat then dip it in the egg and the flour.?&#2. The last step is to fry the M’Batten.?&#3. Heat the oil until it becomes very hot, then fry the M’Batten until they become golden brown.?&#4. Lace the fried M’Batten on paper towels to drain excess oil then sprinkle salt on top.?&#5. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mbatten-fried-potato-pockets-with-meat-recipe-from-libya/
2 Easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 238 – Mango Strawberry Lassi (Yogurt Beverage) – Indian Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_238.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/2 mango (peeled and diced)?&#1/2 cup sliced strawberries?&#1/2 cup plain yogurt?&#sugar (to taste)?&#water (to reach desired consistency) Directions :?&#?&#1- In a blender, place the fresh strawberries, the freshly cut mango, and some sugar to taste. Add plain yogurt (preferably whole milk yogurt).?&#2- Blend all the ingredients!?&#3- This is a super easy recipe! if you would like to make the consistency of the lassi thinner add a bit of water.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/238-mango-strawberry-lassi-yogurt-beverage-indian-recipe/
4 Easy International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 299 – Mexican Beef Chorizo Homemade Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_299_-_chorizo.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Ingredients for the Meat:?&#?&#1 pound (500 grams) of beef (or other types of meat: lamb, chicken, etc.)?&#Apple vinegar (or other type of vinegar)?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt?&#?&#Ingredients for the Marinade:?&#?&#3 large ancho chilis (dried poblano peppers or other dried red peppers)?&#4-5 garlic cloves (chopped)?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon dried oregano?&#3 whole cloves?&#Apple vinegar (or other type of vinegar) Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Steps for preparing the marinade:?&#1. Remove the seads from the ancho chilis and boil them in water for 20-30 minutes until the skin of the peppers detaches.?&#Note: you do not have ancho chilis you can use any type of dried red peppers. Otherwise, instead of a paste, you can make a spice mixture using 1 tablespoon of paprika, 1/4 teaspoon of hot chili pepper, and the rest of the marinade ingredients (garlic, salt, cumin, and ground cloves).?&#2. Once the chilis are ready, place them in a food processor. Add the spices (salt, cumin, and whole cloves) and sliced garlic cloves.?&#3. Add a little bit of apple vinegar and start mixing until you get a smooth paste. You may have to add a little more of the apple vinegar to get the mixture going. Scrape the sides of the food processor from time to time, to make sure that all the ingredients are well mixed and continue blending until you get a smooth paste.?&#?&#THE NIGHT BEFORE – preparing the meat:?&#Note: You have to do this step the night before.?&#1. Cut the meat into small cube (1 inch x 1 inch). You should use meat with no bones and no fat, the best choice is the leg. You can also use ground meat.?&#2. Place the meat in a bowl and cover it with the apple vinegar and 1 teaspoon of salt.?&#3. Wrap the bowl with a plastic wrap, place in the fridge, and let the meat sit in the vinegar overnight. The next day you will notice that the meat became brown.?&#?&#Combining the Chorizo:?&#1. Take out the meat from the fridge (after it marinated overnight in vinegar) and strain it from all the vinegar (as much as possible).?&#2. Mix it with the chili paste. Use your hands to make sure that all the ingredients are well itnegrated.?&#3. Wrap the chorizo in individual portions using a zip-lock, food plastic bags, or other type of meat wrappings and place in the freezer. You just have to remove from the freezer a couple of hours before you want to use the chorizo and you are set!?&#?&#Note: you can use this chorizo in any recipes that call for chorizo. Check out the next recipe on how to make Eggs with Chorizo!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/299-mexican-beef-chorizo-homemade-recipe/
4 Easy Breads Feb 24, 2015 311 – Homemade Mexican Tortillas Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_311.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 cups (1/2 kg) all-purpose white flour?&#1/4 cup (63 ml) vegetable oil?&#1/2 cup (125 ml) sour cream or heavy cream?&#1/2 cup (125 ml) milk?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1/4 teaspoon baking powder Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Dough:?&#1- Combine the flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix well.?&#2- Add the vegetable oil and mix in well with the flour. Keep rubbing the flour between your palms until the oil is well integrated and you get a sandy texture.?&#3- Add the sour cream (or heavy cream) to the flour mixture. Mix well.?&#4- Add the milk little by little, while mixing the flour.?&#5- Mix the ingredients together with your hands until you can start forming a ball of dough. Knead lightly by pushing the dough with your palms until the dough become smooth.?&#6- Roll the dough into a ball and place it in a plastic bag.?&#7- Let the dough rest for 30 minutes – 1 hour.?&#?&#Step 2 – Shaping the Tortilla:?&#1- Once the dough rest, you’ll notice it becomes softer. Take a bit of the dough to form small balls the size of a gold ball.?&#2- Roll the balls by pushing the dough into the center until you get dough balls with a smooth surface.?&#3- Sprinkle flour in your working station.?&#4- Using a rolling pin, roll the balls into flat round shaped tortillas (6-7 inches diameter).?&#5- Hand the flat tortillas around the corners of a bowl. Do not stack them on top of each other!?&#?&#Step 3 – Cooking the Tortilla:?&#1- Heat your pan on medium-high heat until it’s hot.?&#2- Place one flat tortilla in the hot pan.?&#3- Cook one side for 10-15 seconds (you will see small bumbs forming. Once the first side is cooked (you will see the dough changing color). Flip the tortilla.?&#4- Cook the second side for another 10-15 seconds. once the second side is cooked, flip again to the first side.?&#5- Cook for another 5 seconds, you will se the tortilla inflating (like a balloon). It’s ready! remove the tortilla from the pan and place in a plate. The tortilla will deflate – it’s normal.?&#6- Continue cooking all the tortillas! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mexican-flour-tortillas-recipe/
4 Easy Breads Feb 24, 2015 312 – Mexican Tacos Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_312.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Salsa: 3 tomatoes + 6 chiles (serrano, jalapeño, or something similar)?&#Shrimp + salt, pepper, lemon, olive oil?&#Chicken + salt?&#Avocado Guacamole?&#Sour cream?&#Chopped tomatoes, onions, cilantro, etc. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Salsa:?&#1- Place the tomatoes (whole) and the chiles in a pot to boil in water for around 15 minutes (or until the skin of the tomatoes starts peeling off)?&#2- Once read, remove the tomato tips and place them whole with the chile in a food processor.?&#3- Add salt to taste. Blen well until you get a smooth salsa.?&#?&#Step 2 – Shaping the Chicken:?&#1- Place the chicken breasts in water in a pot.?&#2- Add salt and pepper.?&#3- Boil for 20 minutes or until the chicken becomes tender.?&#4- Drain from water and shred the chicken. Add more salt if necessary.?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Shrimp:?&#1- Drizzle olive oil in a pan. Add the shrimp and cook on medium heat.?&#2- Sprinkle salt and pepper and a squeeze of lemon juice.?&#3- Cook for 5 minutes or until the shrimp changes colors and becomes opaque.?&#?&#Step 4 – Final Steps:?&#1- Watch my video on how to make homemade avocado Guacamole.?&#2- Chop onions, tomatoes, cilantro, or any other ingredients you like (cheese, etc.)?&#3- Take a tortilla (watch video on how to make tortillas), fill it with guacamole and the ingredients of your choice, fold, and bite!!!!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mexican-tacos-recipe/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 265 – Lamb Meatballs https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_265.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound (450 grams) ground lamb?&#1 egg?&#1/3 cup bread crumbs?&#16 spanish olives (Manzanilla) chopped?&#2 tablespoons Marcona almonds (or roasted almonds) chopped?&#1 tablespoon fresh oregano or mint (chopped)?&#1 cup yellow onion (diced)?&#1 tablespoon chopped garlic?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon sweet paprika?&#1 teaspoon smoked paprika (optional – replace with sweet paprika)?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#A pinch of cayenne pepper?&#1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper Directions :?&#?&#Note: Recipe courtsey of Chef Sandra Cordero?&#?&#1- Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to a large saute pan over medium heat.?&#2- Add chopped onion and cook until golden brown.?&#3- Add chopped garlic and cook for about 1 minute.?&#4- Remove the onion and garlic from heat. Add to a bowl along with lamb, egg, breadcrumbs, chopped olives, chopped almonds, chopped mint, spices, salt and pepper.?&#5- Mix thoroughly and form into small meatballs.?&#6- Heat remaining oil in a large saute pan over medium heat.?&#7- Brown meatballs until golden.?&#?&#Serve as is or with aioli sauce. Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/lamb-meatballs/
4 easy International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 339 – French Lentil Apple Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_339.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 1/4 cups (250 grams) uncooked lentils?&#2-3 apples?&#4 tablespoons (or to taste) of apple vinegar (or regular vinegar)?&#4 tablespoons (or to taste) of olive oil?&#Fresh tarragon (estragon) or crushed fennel seeds (to taste)?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#Water for cooking (3 times the volume of lentils) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Lentils?&#IMPORTANT: we are using the Lentils of Puy, which are softer and easier to cook. If you are using brown or green lentils, you may have to put them in water for a couple of hours before cooking them.?&#1- Place the lentils in a large bowl and wash them with cold water.?&#2- Once well washed, drain the lentils from the water.?&#3- Place the lentils in a measuring cup and check out the volume measure. You should cook the lentils in 3 times their volume in water.?&#4-Place the lentils along with the cold water in a large pot. Cover and cook the lentils on high heat until the water reaches a boiling water.?&#5- Once the water starts boiling, reduce the heat to medium, uncover the pot and let the lentils cook for 20 minutes or until they become soft.?&#6- Once the lentils are cooked, drain them from the water and place them in a large bowl.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Salad?&#1- We need to season the lentils when they are still hot.?&#2- Add the apple vinegar to the lentils – we are using apple vinegar, you can use regular vinegar. Adjust vinegar to taste.?&#3- Add olive oil – to taste.?&#4- Add salt and pepper to your taste.?&#5- Let the lentils cool down.?&#6- Once the lentils cool down – taste them again and adjust the seasoning (vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper).?&#7- Peel the apples and cut them into pieces. Add them to the lentils.?&#8- Add fresh or dried tarragon (estragon) – if you do not have it, you can replace it with crushed fennel seeds.?&#9- Mix well. Place in the fridge for an hour or so, and serve cold!?&#?&#Bon Appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/lentil-apple-salad/
4 Easy International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 319 – Korean Bulgogi – Marinated Beef https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_319.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#0.7 pound (300 grams) beef meat thinly sliced (tenderloin or any soft meat cut)?&#A little bit of vegetable oil?&#1/4 cup of onion puree (1 small onion very thinly grated or processed)?&#1/2 medium sized onion thinly sliced?&#1/2 a kiwi (pureed)?&#4 garlic cloves (minced)?&#1 tablespoon ground ginger?&#2 tablespoons brown sugar?&#Pinch of salt + pinch of ground black pepper?&#1 tablespoon sesame oil (or Argan oil or olive oil)?&#1 green onion (thinly sliced lengthwise)?&#1 carrot (grated)?&#1 bunch of shiitake mushrooms (or any mushrooms of your choice)?&#1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- The meat has to be very thinly sliced – you can ask your butcher to cut it for you. Otherwise, you can just freeze deboned meat cut (sirloin or tenderloin), then cut it with a sharp knife. It is much easier to slice when it is frozen.?&#2- Peel the carrot and grate it using the large holes of the grater.?&#3- To make onion puree, take a small onion a grate it with the smallest holes in the grator or puree it in a food processor.?&#4- Cut the kiwi in half and remove the skin. Place half a kiwi in a sieve and push it through with a spoon to get a smooth kiwi puree. Discard the kiwi skin and seeds left in the sieve.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Marinade?&#1- In a large bowl, mix the kiwi pulpe, brown sugar, soy sauce, minced garlic, and sesame oil.?&#2- Add the onion puree, the ground ginger, salt, and pepper.?&#3- Whisk all the ingredients together.?&#?&#Step 3: Marinating the Meat and Vegetables?&#1- Add the vegetables to the large bowl containing the marinade. We have the sliced onions, the grated carrot, the sliced green onion, and shitaake mushrooms. Mix well together.?&#2- Add the meat as well. Mix all the ingredients using your hands to make sure that they are well coated.?&#3- Cover the bowl with foil or plastic wrap and place in the fridge. Let the meat marinate between 30 minutes to a full night, depending on when you would like to cook it.?&#Note: you can also freeze the meat and use it later on.?&#?&#Step 4: Cooking the Meat and Vegetables?&#1- Heat up your skillet on high heat.?&#2- Add vegetable oil and place the meat in the skillet. The skillet has to be hot, so you will hear the meat sizzling. The meat cooks very fast (around 3 minutes), so keep stirring until done.?&#Note: make sure you do NOT overcook the meat – you have to have some juices left with the meat, so it is not dry.?&#3- Serve immediately with rice and / or lettuce leaf. Put some of the meat in lettuce, add hot sauce, and wrap. YUM!?&#?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/korean-bulgogi-marinated-beef/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 133 – M’Batten Recipe – Fried Potato Pockets with Meat (Recipe from Libya) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_133.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound of ground lamb (or beef)?&#1 onion, grated?&#¼ cup of finely chopped cilantro?&#¼ cup of finely chopped parsley?&#6 scallions, chopped, only the white part?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/3 teaspoon of red chile pepper?&#¼ teaspoon of cinnamon powder?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#½ teaspoon of turmeric powder?&#3 garlic cloves?&#1 egg?&#1 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#Large white potatoes?&#Flour egg and vegetable oil for frying Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Meat?&#1. Mix the egg, spices, garlic and tomato paste with ground meat.?&#2. Over medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in your pan.?&#3. Add the grated onion and cook for a few minutes.?&#4. After a few minute of cooking the inions, add the meat.?&#5. Cook the meat until done.?&#6. Once the meat is cooked, about 10 minutes, taste the meat and cook the spices accordingly.?&#7. Place the meat in a large bowl.?&#8. Add the cilantro, parsley and scallions to the cooked meat.?&#9. Let the mixture cool down.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Potatoes?&#1. Peel the potatoes?&#2. Slice the potatoes – the goal is to get pieces that look like a potato sandwich to fill with the meat.?&#3. Slice about ¾ of the way through the potato then make the next slice all the way down the potato.?&#?&#Step 3: Assembling and Frying the M’Batten?&#1. Take a potato sandwich and fill it with the meat then dip it in the egg and the flour.?&#2. The last step is to fry the M’Batten.?&#3. Heat the oil until it becomes very hot, then fry the M’Batten until they become golden brown.?&#4. Lace the fried M’Batten on paper towels to drain excess oil then sprinkle salt on top.?&#5. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mbatten-fried-potato-pockets-with-meat-recipe-from-libya/
2 Easy Beverages Feb 24, 2015 238 – Mango Strawberry Lassi (Yogurt Beverage) – Indian Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_238.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/2 mango (peeled and diced)?&#1/2 cup sliced strawberries?&#1/2 cup plain yogurt?&#sugar (to taste)?&#water (to reach desired consistency) Directions :?&#?&#1- In a blender, place the fresh strawberries, the freshly cut mango, and some sugar to taste. Add plain yogurt (preferably whole milk yogurt).?&#2- Blend all the ingredients!?&#3- This is a super easy recipe! if you would like to make the consistency of the lassi thinner add a bit of water.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/238-mango-strawberry-lassi-yogurt-beverage-indian-recipe/
4 Easy International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 299 – Mexican Beef Chorizo Homemade Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_299_-_chorizo.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Ingredients for the Meat:?&#?&#1 pound (500 grams) of beef (or other types of meat: lamb, chicken, etc.)?&#Apple vinegar (or other type of vinegar)?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt?&#?&#Ingredients for the Marinade:?&#?&#3 large ancho chilis (dried poblano peppers or other dried red peppers)?&#4-5 garlic cloves (chopped)?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon dried oregano?&#3 whole cloves?&#Apple vinegar (or other type of vinegar) Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Steps for preparing the marinade:?&#1. Remove the seads from the ancho chilis and boil them in water for 20-30 minutes until the skin of the peppers detaches.?&#Note: you do not have ancho chilis you can use any type of dried red peppers. Otherwise, instead of a paste, you can make a spice mixture using 1 tablespoon of paprika, 1/4 teaspoon of hot chili pepper, and the rest of the marinade ingredients (garlic, salt, cumin, and ground cloves).?&#2. Once the chilis are ready, place them in a food processor. Add the spices (salt, cumin, and whole cloves) and sliced garlic cloves.?&#3. Add a little bit of apple vinegar and start mixing until you get a smooth paste. You may have to add a little more of the apple vinegar to get the mixture going. Scrape the sides of the food processor from time to time, to make sure that all the ingredients are well mixed and continue blending until you get a smooth paste.?&#?&#THE NIGHT BEFORE – preparing the meat:?&#Note: You have to do this step the night before.?&#1. Cut the meat into small cube (1 inch x 1 inch). You should use meat with no bones and no fat, the best choice is the leg. You can also use ground meat.?&#2. Place the meat in a bowl and cover it with the apple vinegar and 1 teaspoon of salt.?&#3. Wrap the bowl with a plastic wrap, place in the fridge, and let the meat sit in the vinegar overnight. The next day you will notice that the meat became brown.?&#?&#Combining the Chorizo:?&#1. Take out the meat from the fridge (after it marinated overnight in vinegar) and strain it from all the vinegar (as much as possible).?&#2. Mix it with the chili paste. Use your hands to make sure that all the ingredients are well itnegrated.?&#3. Wrap the chorizo in individual portions using a zip-lock, food plastic bags, or other type of meat wrappings and place in the freezer. You just have to remove from the freezer a couple of hours before you want to use the chorizo and you are set!?&#?&#Note: you can use this chorizo in any recipes that call for chorizo. Check out the next recipe on how to make Eggs with Chorizo!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/299-mexican-beef-chorizo-homemade-recipe/
4 Easy Breads Feb 24, 2015 311 – Homemade Mexican Tortillas Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_311.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 cups (1/2 kg) all-purpose white flour?&#1/4 cup (63 ml) vegetable oil?&#1/2 cup (125 ml) sour cream or heavy cream?&#1/2 cup (125 ml) milk?&#1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1/4 teaspoon baking powder Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Dough:?&#1- Combine the flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix well.?&#2- Add the vegetable oil and mix in well with the flour. Keep rubbing the flour between your palms until the oil is well integrated and you get a sandy texture.?&#3- Add the sour cream (or heavy cream) to the flour mixture. Mix well.?&#4- Add the milk little by little, while mixing the flour.?&#5- Mix the ingredients together with your hands until you can start forming a ball of dough. Knead lightly by pushing the dough with your palms until the dough become smooth.?&#6- Roll the dough into a ball and place it in a plastic bag.?&#7- Let the dough rest for 30 minutes – 1 hour.?&#?&#Step 2 – Shaping the Tortilla:?&#1- Once the dough rest, you’ll notice it becomes softer. Take a bit of the dough to form small balls the size of a gold ball.?&#2- Roll the balls by pushing the dough into the center until you get dough balls with a smooth surface.?&#3- Sprinkle flour in your working station.?&#4- Using a rolling pin, roll the balls into flat round shaped tortillas (6-7 inches diameter).?&#5- Hand the flat tortillas around the corners of a bowl. Do not stack them on top of each other!?&#?&#Step 3 – Cooking the Tortilla:?&#1- Heat your pan on medium-high heat until it’s hot.?&#2- Place one flat tortilla in the hot pan.?&#3- Cook one side for 10-15 seconds (you will see small bumbs forming. Once the first side is cooked (you will see the dough changing color). Flip the tortilla.?&#4- Cook the second side for another 10-15 seconds. once the second side is cooked, flip again to the first side.?&#5- Cook for another 5 seconds, you will se the tortilla inflating (like a balloon). It’s ready! remove the tortilla from the pan and place in a plate. The tortilla will deflate – it’s normal.?&#6- Continue cooking all the tortillas! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mexican-flour-tortillas-recipe/
4 Easy Breads Feb 24, 2015 312 – Mexican Tacos Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_312.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Salsa: 3 tomatoes + 6 chiles (serrano, jalapeño, or something similar)?&#Shrimp + salt, pepper, lemon, olive oil?&#Chicken + salt?&#Avocado Guacamole?&#Sour cream?&#Chopped tomatoes, onions, cilantro, etc. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Preparing the Salsa:?&#1- Place the tomatoes (whole) and the chiles in a pot to boil in water for around 15 minutes (or until the skin of the tomatoes starts peeling off)?&#2- Once read, remove the tomato tips and place them whole with the chile in a food processor.?&#3- Add salt to taste. Blen well until you get a smooth salsa.?&#?&#Step 2 – Shaping the Chicken:?&#1- Place the chicken breasts in water in a pot.?&#2- Add salt and pepper.?&#3- Boil for 20 minutes or until the chicken becomes tender.?&#4- Drain from water and shred the chicken. Add more salt if necessary.?&#?&#Step 3 – Preparing the Shrimp:?&#1- Drizzle olive oil in a pan. Add the shrimp and cook on medium heat.?&#2- Sprinkle salt and pepper and a squeeze of lemon juice.?&#3- Cook for 5 minutes or until the shrimp changes colors and becomes opaque.?&#?&#Step 4 – Final Steps:?&#1- Watch my video on how to make homemade avocado Guacamole.?&#2- Chop onions, tomatoes, cilantro, or any other ingredients you like (cheese, etc.)?&#3- Take a tortilla (watch video on how to make tortillas), fill it with guacamole and the ingredients of your choice, fold, and bite!!!!?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/mexican-tacos-recipe/
