Easy Salads Jun 9, 2020 803- Orange Salad with cinnamon & Nuts https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/CWA-OrangeSalad-06.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 oranges?&#Juice of 1 orange?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#2 tablespoons orange blossom water?&#50 grams (1.7 oz) roasted walnuts, roughly chopped?&#50 grams (1.7 oz) roasted almond flakes?&#2 tablespoons raisin?&#1 tablespoon ground cinnamon?&#150 grams (1 cup) unsweetened coconut cream (or the solid and creamy portion of the coconut milk) Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, add the orange juice, honey, orange blossom water, and mix all together using a whisk until well combined. Place in the refrigerator before ready to use.?&#?&#2- Peel the oranges and cut them into medium slices.?&#?&#3- Put the orange slices in a serving plate and pour over it the reserved cold juice.?&#4- Garnish the orange slices with roasted walnuts and almond flakes, raisin, and finally sprinkle with cinnamon.?&#5- Top the orange salad with cinnamon and nuts with coconut cream and serve fresh. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/803-orange-salad-with-cinnamon-nuts/
20 minutes 4 Easy Salads Jun 8, 2020 802- Beetroot & Mango Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/435-CWA-BeetMangoSalad-10.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams (17.6 oz) beetroots, cleaned?&#?&#2 large mangoes?&#?&#300 grams (10.5 oz) spring mix (lettuce, spinach…)?&#?&#1 medium white onion?&#?&#65 milliliters (1/2 cup) rice vinegar?&#?&#30 milliliters (1/4 cup) olive oil?&#?&#1 teaspoon granulated sugar?&#?&#1 tablespoon chopped chive?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the salad?&#?&#1- Place a piece of parchment paper on top of similar sized piece of foil, then place the beetroots in the center.?&#?&#2- Drizzle the Beetroots with olive oil, add salt and pepper, then fold the papers over them.?&#?&#3- Place the beetroots on a baking sheet and roast them in a preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for about 1 hour. Make sure to check if they are completely cooked.?&#?&#4- Remove the beetroots from the oven, allow them to cool for 15 minutes, then take off the skin.?&#?&#5- Cut the beetroots in medium quarters and put them in a bowl.?&#?&#6- Peel and cut the mangoes into slices and place them in a separated bowl.?&#?&#7- Peel and finely chop the onion, put it in a bowl and set aside.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the vinegar sauce?&#?&#8- In a medium bowl, add the rice vinegar, olive oil, sugar, chopped chive, salt, and pepper. Whisk all the ingredients until an homogeneous sauce is obtained.?&#?&#9- On a serving plate, place the spring mix, the beetroot, mango, the onion slices, and pour the sauce over the salad. Make sure to not mixing the beetroots with the mangoes or all the salad will turn red.?&#?&#10- Garnish the beetroots and mango salad with extra chopped chives if desired and serve. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/802-beetroot-mango-salad/ 1 hour
10 minutes 4 Easy Salads May 13, 2020 793- Watermelon and Mozzarella Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/CWA-WatermelonSalad-edited-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the salad:?&#?&#400 grams (14.1 oz) spring mix?&#?&#300 grams (10.5 oz) watermelon?&#?&#200 grams (7 oz) yellow cherry tomatoes?&#?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) red cherry tomatoes?&#?&#1 small red onion, cut into thin rings?&#?&#200 grams (7 oz) mozzarella cheese, cut into medium cubes?&#?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) roasted walnuts, roughly chopped?&#?&# ?&#?&#For the sauce:?&#?&#3 tablespoons lemon juice?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 tablespoon light brown sugar?&#?&#1 1/2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar?&#?&#1 teaspoon mustard?&#?&#1 tablespoon freshly chopped parsley?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon black pepper Directions :?&#?&#1- Remove the seeds from the watermelon using the tip of a knife, and cut it into medium cubes.?&#?&#2- In a large bowl, add all the salad ingredients and mix to combine.?&#?&#3- In a small bowl, add the lemon juice, olive oil, light brown sugar, balsamic vinegar, mustard, parsley, black pepper, and mix all the ingredients together using a whisk until well combined.?&#?&#4- Pour the vinegar sauce over the watermelon salad just before serving.?&#?&#5- Mix the salad with two large spoons until it is completely coated with the vinegar sauce. Serve with steak, chicken or fish. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/793-watermelon-and-mozzarella-salad/
1 hour 10 Medium Appetizers Dec 23, 2019 761- Royal Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/435-DSC03315.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Artichokes With Cream Cheese:?&#200 grams (7 oz) cream cheese?&#4 artichokes heart, boiled?&#1 teaspoon garlic powder?&#1 tablespoon chopped chives?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Rice With Vegetables:?&#245 grams (1 cup) plain yogurt?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#400 grams (2 cups) cooked rice?&#1 cup boiled green peas?&#1 cup boiled carrots, cut into small cubes?&#1/2 cup small cubes of red bell pepper?&#?&#Avocado With Shrimp:?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) peeled shrimp?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#2 avocados?&#1 lemon, for lemon juice and zest?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#A handful of chopped chives?&#?&#Fruit Salad In Pineapple Halves:?&#Pineapple?&#Different fruits to make a fruit salad?&#?&#Other:?&#Slices of smoked meat, turkey, etc.?&#Chive branches?&#Cherry tomatoes?&#Small mozarella balls?&#Lettuce?&#Cubes of cheese?&#Cooked crayfish or full prawns?&#Marinated anchovies Directions :?&#?&#Artichokes With Cream Cheese?&#1- In a bowl, place the cream cheese and work it with a spatula until it becomes creamy.?&#2- Add salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chives. Mix.?&#3- Pipe the cream cheese mixture in the center of the cooked artichoke hearts.?&#?&#Rice With Vegetables?&#1- To make the sauce, in a bowl, place the plain yogurt. Add the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Mix and adjust to taste.?&#2- In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, green peas, carrots, and red bell pepper. Mix with a spoon.?&#3- Add the sauce to the rice mixture and mix well.?&#?&#Avocado And Shrimp?&#1- Cut the avocados in half and remove the pits. Squeeze some fresh lemon on the avocado so it does not darken. Season with salt and pepper.?&#2- On medium heat, in a pan, heat some olive oil. Cook the shrimp. Season with salt and pepper. Add some lemon zest for more flavor.?&#3- Scoop the cooked shrimp in the center of each avocado half. Top with chopped chives.?&#?&#Fruit Salad In Pineapple Halves?&#1- Cut the pineapple in half and empty the center of each half.?&#2- Make fruits salad with different fruits (grapes, pomegranate, persimmon, pineapple, raspberries, etc.). Fill the pineapple halves with the fruit salad.?&#?&#Other?&#1- Roll smoked meat slices like a carpet and tie chive around in the center.?&#2- Make mini-skewers alternating cherry tomatoes and small mozzarella balls.?&#?&#Assembly?&#1- In a large plate, place all the lettuce leaves.?&#2- In the center, place a circle and fill it with the rice salad. Remove the circle.?&#3- On each side of the plate, place the pineapple halves filled with the fruit salad.?&#4- Place around the edges the artichoke hearts and avocado halves.?&#5- Decorate with the mozzarella skewers, smoked meat, cheese cubes, crayfish, anchovies, etc. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/761-royal-salad/
20 minutes 2 people Easy Salads Nov 16, 2019 753- Pear Pomgrenare Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/2019-11-CWA-PearSalad-008-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the vinaigrette:?&#1/2 cup (120 ml) olive oil?&#1/4 cup (60 ml) white vinegar?&#2 tablespoons sesame oil?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#1 tablespoon Dijon mustard?&#Salt and pepper to taste?&#?&#For the salad:?&#7 oz (200 grams)fresh spring mix?&#3.5 oz (100 grams) baby spinach?&#1 cup (100 grams) pomegranate seeds?&#1 sliced pear?&#2 oz (50 grams) grated parmesan?&#1 cup (100 grams) roasted unsalted almonds Directions :?&#?&#Preparing the vinaigrette:?&#1- Using a blender, mix together the olive oil, sesame oil, and white vinegar for 1 minute until the mixture becomes whitish.?&#2- Add the honey, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Mix well until the vinaigrette is well combined.?&#3- Pour the vinaigrette in a jar, close it, and place it in the fridge for 30 minutes so that all the flavors are well combined.?&#note: You can store the vinaigrette in the fridge for up to 3 days.?&#?&#Preparing the salad:?&#4- In a large bowl, mix together all the ingredients of the salad: spring mix, baby spinach, pomegranate seeds, pear slices, Parmesan, and almonds.?&#5- Add some of the vinaigrette to the salad and mix well until well combined. Serve the salad immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/753-pear-pomgrenare-salad/
Salads Nov 1, 2020 826- Spicy Persimmon Pomegranate Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/￼CWA-PersimmonSalad-08.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 large ripe persimmon?&#100 grams (1 cup) pomegranate seeds?&#1 small white onion, finely chopped?&#1/2 cucumber, peeled and cut into medium cubes?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley?&#2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice?&#1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger?&#1/4 teaspoon chilli flakes?&#Salt and Pepper, to taste?&#3 tablespoons toasted hazelnuts, chopped Directions :?&#?&#1- On a cutting board, peel the persimmon and cut it into medium cubes.?&#2- In a large bowl, add the persimmon cubes, pomegranate seeds, onion, cucumber, and mix all together until well combined.?&#3- To make the dressing, in a small bowl, add the lemon juice, fresh ginger, chilli flakes, salt and pepper. Mix all together until well combined.?&#4- Pour the sauce over the persimmon salad and gently mix with a spatula until completely coated. Top with toasted hazelnuts and serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/826-spicy-persimmon-pomegranate-salad-%d8%b3%d9%84%d8%b7%d8%a9-%d8%ad%d8%a7%d8%b1%d8%a9-%d8%a8%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%83%d8%a7%d9%83%d9%8a-%d9%88%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%b1%d9%85%d8%a7%d9%86/
20 minutes 4 Easy Panzani Aug 20, 2020 814- Thaï Pasta Salad with Peanut Butter Sauce https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/435-Thai-Pasta-Salad-with-Peanut-Butter-Sauce8228.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the Salad:?&#250 grams (8.8 oz)Panzani Fusilli Tricolore pasta?&#1/4 small red cabbage, chopped?&#2 medium carrots?&#4 medium leeks, sliced?&#150 grams (5.2 oz) lettuce, roughly chopped?&#?&#For the sauce:?&#60 milliliters (1/2 cup) orange juice?&#1 tablespoon peanut butter?&#2 tablespoons rice vinegar?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#1 garlic clove, grated (optional)?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper?&#?&#For decoration:?&#3 tablespoons roasted and salted peanuts, roughly chopped?&#2 tablespoons chopped green leek?&#Cilantro leaves Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the pasta?&#1- In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the Panzani Fusilli Tricolore pasta for about 8 to 10 minutes. Once ready, drain and rinse it with cold water. Set aside.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the sauce?&#2- In a large bowl, add the orange juice, peanut butter, rice vinegar, honey, grated garlic, and pepper.?&#3- Whisk all the ingredients together with a fork until the sauce becomes homogeneous. Set aside.?&#?&#Step 3: Assembling the salad?&#4- Using a sharp knife, peel and cut the carrots into thin strips.?&#5- In a large bowl, add the lettuce, chopped red cabbage, carrots strips, and leeks.?&#6- Add the fusilli tri-colore pasta to the vegetables and pour over it the peanut butter sauce.?&#7- Gently mix all the ingredients together using tongs until the salad is completely coated and well combined. Season to taste with pepper if desired.?&#8- Garnish the thaï pasta salad with roasted and peanut chunks and chopped green leek, and cilantro leaves. Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/814-thai-pasta-salad-with-peanut-butter-sauce/ 15 minutes
10 minutes
Easy Salads Jun 24, 2020 806- Roasted Figs & Goat Cheese Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/CWA-Figs-10.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#8 ripe figs, washed?&#60 grams (2 oz) goat cheese?&#30 grams (1/4 cup) roasted walnuts, roughly chopped?&#50 milliliters (1/2 cup) Honey Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the figs on a cutting board and remove the top using a knife.?&#?&#2- Cut a deep “X” on top of the figs.?&#?&#3- Cut the goat cheese into slices or pieces and stuff the figs with.?&#?&#4- Place the figs on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, and roast them in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F°) for 5 minutes or until the goat cheese starts to melt and turns golden brown.?&#?&#5- Remove the figs from the oven and top with roasted walnuts.?&#?&#6- Drizzle the roasted figs with honey and serve warm. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/806-roasted-figs-goat-cheese-salad/ 5 minutes
10 minutes
Easy Salads Jun 9, 2020 803- Orange Salad with cinnamon & Nuts https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/CWA-OrangeSalad-06.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 oranges?&#Juice of 1 orange?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#2 tablespoons orange blossom water?&#50 grams (1.7 oz) roasted walnuts, roughly chopped?&#50 grams (1.7 oz) roasted almond flakes?&#2 tablespoons raisin?&#1 tablespoon ground cinnamon?&#150 grams (1 cup) unsweetened coconut cream (or the solid and creamy portion of the coconut milk) Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large bowl, add the orange juice, honey, orange blossom water, and mix all together using a whisk until well combined. Place in the refrigerator before ready to use.?&#?&#2- Peel the oranges and cut them into medium slices.?&#?&#3- Put the orange slices in a serving plate and pour over it the reserved cold juice.?&#4- Garnish the orange slices with roasted walnuts and almond flakes, raisin, and finally sprinkle with cinnamon.?&#5- Top the orange salad with cinnamon and nuts with coconut cream and serve fresh. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/803-orange-salad-with-cinnamon-nuts/
20 minutes 4 Easy Salads Jun 8, 2020 802- Beetroot & Mango Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/435-CWA-BeetMangoSalad-10.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 grams (17.6 oz) beetroots, cleaned?&#?&#2 large mangoes?&#?&#300 grams (10.5 oz) spring mix (lettuce, spinach…)?&#?&#1 medium white onion?&#?&#65 milliliters (1/2 cup) rice vinegar?&#?&#30 milliliters (1/4 cup) olive oil?&#?&#1 teaspoon granulated sugar?&#?&#1 tablespoon chopped chive?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the salad?&#?&#1- Place a piece of parchment paper on top of similar sized piece of foil, then place the beetroots in the center.?&#?&#2- Drizzle the Beetroots with olive oil, add salt and pepper, then fold the papers over them.?&#?&#3- Place the beetroots on a baking sheet and roast them in a preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for about 1 hour. Make sure to check if they are completely cooked.?&#?&#4- Remove the beetroots from the oven, allow them to cool for 15 minutes, then take off the skin.?&#?&#5- Cut the beetroots in medium quarters and put them in a bowl.?&#?&#6- Peel and cut the mangoes into slices and place them in a separated bowl.?&#?&#7- Peel and finely chop the onion, put it in a bowl and set aside.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the vinegar sauce?&#?&#8- In a medium bowl, add the rice vinegar, olive oil, sugar, chopped chive, salt, and pepper. Whisk all the ingredients until an homogeneous sauce is obtained.?&#?&#9- On a serving plate, place the spring mix, the beetroot, mango, the onion slices, and pour the sauce over the salad. Make sure to not mixing the beetroots with the mangoes or all the salad will turn red.?&#?&#10- Garnish the beetroots and mango salad with extra chopped chives if desired and serve. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/802-beetroot-mango-salad/ 1 hour

20 minutes 2 Buddha Bowls Easy Salads Oct 10, 2019 749- Shrimp Buddha Bowl https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/435-2019-10-CWA-ShrimpBowl-005.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Bowl Ingredients:?&#1/2 cup cooked quinoa (tricolor)?&#1 small tomato, cubed?&#80 grams (2.8 oz.) black beans can, rinsed and drained?&#1 large corn, boiled?&#2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, finely chopped?&#?&#Shrimp Ingredients:?&#500 grams (1 pound) shrimp, peeled and deveined?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon lemon juice?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon paprika?&#Salt and pepper?&#?&#Dressing Ingredients:?&#1/2 avocado?&#1 cup plain yogurt?&#1/4 cup fresh cilantro?&#1 tablespoon lemon juice?&#Salt and pepper Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making The Dressing?&#1- In a bowl, scrape the avocado using a spoon to get a smooth texture.?&#2- Add the yogurt progressively till you get the desired consistency.?&#3- Mix in lemon juice, salt and pepper then add fresh cilantro and stir until all ingredients are well combined. Place in the fridge until ready to serve.?&#?&#Step 2: Making The Buddha Bowl?&#1- In a bowl, place the shrimp and mix in the ground cumin, paprika, garlic, lemon juice, honey, oil, salt and pepper.?&#2- Let the shrimp marinate for at least 30 minutes in the fridge.?&#3- In a large skillet over medium-high heat, place the shrimp and marinade and cook for 2-3 minutes per side or until shrimp is cooked through.?&#4- In the same skillet, sauté the canned black beans while stirring using a spatula. Set aside.?&#5- In a large bowl (or take away box for an office lunch), first place the cooked quinoa. Top the quinoa with the tomatoes, black beans, boiled corn, shrimps.?&#6- When ready to eat, add the sauce and the fresh cilantro, mix, and enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/749-shrimp-buddha-bowl/ 40 minutes
20 minutes 2 Buddha Bowls Easy Appetizers Oct 6, 2019 748- Chicken Buddha Bowl https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/435-2019-10-CWA-ChickenBowl-011.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Bowl Ingredients:?&#1/2 cup cooked rice?&#1 bundle of spinach, roughly chopped?&#1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced?&#1 chicken breast, roasted and sliced?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 small sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Chickpeas Ingredients:?&#240 grams (8.5 oz.) chickpeas can, drained?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon chili powder?&#3/4 teaspoon garlic powder?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Dressing Ingredients:?&#1 cup plain yogurt?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/4 teaspoon chili powder?&#3/4 teaspoon garlic powder?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making The Dressing?&#1- Combine all the ingredients of the dressing in a bowl. Using a fork, mix well until all ingredients are well combined. Place in the fridge until ready to serve.?&#?&#Step 2: Making The Chickpeas?&#1- In a medium bowl, place the drained canned chickpeas and toss with the seasoning and olive oil.?&#2- Heat a large skillet over medium heat and sauté the chickpeas for 5 minutes while stirring frequently.?&#3- Once the chickpeas are browned and fragrant, remove from heat and set aside.?&#?&#Step 3: Making The Buddah Bowl?&#1- In a large skillet on medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add the red onion and sauté for about 2 minutes, until it becomes tender. Set aside.?&#2- In the same skillet, add the spinach. Cook on medium heat for 3 minutes until they are completely wilted.?&#3- Arrange the sweet potatoes in an oven pan covered with parchment paper. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil.?&#4- Bake the sweet potatoes for 30 minutes in a preheated oven to 180 C / 356 F then set aside.?&#5- In a large bowl (or take away box for an office lunch), first place the cooked rice. Top the rice with the chicken breast, spinach, onions, chickpeas, and sweet potatoes.?&#6- When ready to eat, add the sauce, mix, and enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/748-chicken-buddha-bowl/ 40 minutes
20 minutes 2 Buddha bowls Easy Salads Oct 4, 2019 747- Vegetarian Buddha Bowl https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/435-2019-10-CWA-VeggiBowl-009.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Bowl Ingredients:?&#1/2 cup pre-cooked wheat?&#1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved?&#1 small carrot, peeled and cut into matchsticks?&#1 small cucumber, peeled and sliced thinly lengthwise?&#1/2 cup pumpkin, chopped into cubes and roasted?&#1/2 cup shredded cabbage?&#2 tablespoons pumpkin seeds?&#1 teaspoon sesame seeds?&#?&#Dressing Ingredients:?&#2 tablespoons sesame oil?&#3 tablespoons soy sauce?&#2 tablespoons lemon vinegar?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#1 teaspoon fresh ginger, peeled and grated?&#1 garlic cloves, grated?&#2 tablespoons cilantro, chopped?&#1 tablespoon sesame seeds, toasted Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making The Dressing?&#1- Combine all the ingredients of the dressing in a glass jar. Close the jar and shake well until all ingredients well combine. Place in the fridge until ready to serve.?&#?&#Step 2: Making The Buddha Bowl?&#1- Prepare the pre-cooked wheat following the instructions on the box. You can replace wheat with rice or other grains.?&#2- In a large bowl (or take away box for an office lunch), first place the cooked wheat. Top the wheat with the vegetables: cherry tomatoes, carrot, cucumber, pumpkin, and shredded cabbage.?&#3- Decorate with the pumpkin seeds and sesame seeds.?&#4- When ready to eat, add the sauce, mix, and enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/747-vegetarian-buddha-bowl/
5 minutes 2 Easy Panzani Sep 4, 2019 743- Tuna Pasta Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/435-StoryOfViluska-00676.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (9 oz) Fusilli Tricolore Panzani Pasta?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) tuna?&#20 cherry tomatoes?&#1/2 red onion?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) green peas, cooked?&#2 celery stick?&#?&#For the dressing:?&#4 tablespoons plain yogurt?&#2 teaspoons olive oil?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- Prepare the dressing: mix the yogurt with the olive oil until you obtain a homogenous texture. Add the salt and pepper and mix. Reserve in the fridge for at least 15 minutes before serving.?&#2- In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the pasta for about 8 to 10 minute. Rinse under cold water and drain.?&#3- Cut the cherry tomatoes into halves.?&#4- Cut the red onion into slices.?&#5- Finely chop the celery sticks.?&#6- In a salad bowl, combine the pasta, celery, green peas, cherry tomatoes, and tuna.?&#7- Serve the salad with the dressing. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/743-tuna-pasta-salad/ 10 minutes
10 minutes 2 Easy Panzani Aug 30, 2019 742- Chicken Caesar Pasta Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/435-StoryOfViluska-00577.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) Penne Panzani?&#8 to 10 medium-sized lettuce leaves?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) chicken breast, sliced?&#Salt and pepper?&#1 teaspoon lemon juice?&#10 cherry tomatoes?&#Parmesan cheese, sliced?&#?&#For bread croutons:?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) white toast bread?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#1 garlic clove?&#1 teaspoon herbs of Provence?&#?&#For dressing:?&#2 tablespoons mustard?&#4 tablespoons heavy cream?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#4 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#2 tablespoons parmesan cheese, shredded?&#Pepper to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1:?&#?&#1- In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta for about 8 to 10 minute. Rinse under cold water and drain.?&#?&#Step 2- Prepare the chicken:?&#2- Mix the chicken slices with the lemon juice, salt, and pepper.?&#3- Cook the chicken in a grilling pan over medium heat for about 10 minutes until they become brown.?&#?&#Step 3- Prepare the croutons:?&#4- Using a knife, gently cut the white toast bread into cubes and place in a bowl.?&#5- Add the garlic, olive oil, and herbs of Provence.?&#6- Cover the bowl with a plate and toss until everything is combined.?&#7- Bake in a preheated oven of 180°C for 10 to 15 min until they become brown and crispy.?&#?&#Step 4- Prepare the dressing:?&#8- In a medium bowl, place the mustard, heavy cream, and lemon juice. Using a whisk, mix well until everything is combined.?&#9- Add the vegetable oil and olive oil little by little while whisking until you obtain a smooth creamy texture.?&#10- Add the pepper and parmesan cheese and mix.?&#?&#Step 5- Serving:?&#11- In a large salad bowl, combine the pasta, cooked chicken, lettuce leaves, croutons, and parmesan slices.?&#12- Drizzle 4 to 6 tbsp of the dressing, mix well then serve! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/742-chicken-caesar-pasta-salad/ 10 minutes
5 minutes 2 Easy Panzani Aug 22, 2019 741- Tuscan Pasta Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/435-Panzani-Pasta-Salad_34.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (9 oz) Farfalle Panzani Pasta?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) dried tomato?&#2 red bell pepper?&#80 grams (2.8 oz) black olives, cut into slices?&#60 grams (2.1 oz) parmesan cheese, grated?&#80 grams (2.8 oz) fresh spinach and basil?&#?&#For the dressing:?&#350 milliliters olive oil?&#4 tablespoons white vinegar?&#4 tablespoons water?&#2 teaspoons dried thyme?&#2 teaspoons dried basil?&#2 garlic cloves, finely grated?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the dressing?&#1- In a bowl, whisk the water, white vinegar, salt, and pepper until well combined.?&#2- Add the grated garlic, then add the olive oil little by little while whisking until you obtain a homogenous mixture.?&#3- Add the dried thyme and basil and mix well.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the salad?&#1- In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta for about 8 to 10 minute. Rinse under cold water and drain.?&#2- Cut the red bell pepper into cubes.?&#3- Cut the dried tomato into medium chunks.?&#4- In a salad bowl, combine the pasta with the dried tomato, red bell pepper, black olives, fresh spinach and basil, and parmesan cheese.?&#5- Give the dressing a quick mix then pour it over salad. Toss and serve! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/741-tuscan-pasta-salad/ 10 minutes

Fill in each jar in this order from bottom to top: 3 tablespoons of the dressing and half the rest of the ingredients of: chickpeas, carrots, cherry tomatoes, green olives, lettuce. ?&#?&#3- Garnish each jar with arugula and parmesan shavings. Serve immediately or cover to serve later.?&#?&#4- To serve, turn the jar over into a plate or bowl to empty out the ingredients and let the dressing flow on top of the salad. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/734-salad-jar-italian-twist/

Set aside to cool down.?&#?&#2- In a bowl, combine all the ingredients of the dressing and mix well. Set aside.?&#?&#3- You will need medium jars (25 cl) to assemble the salad. To fill each jar, start by placing 6 tablespoons of the dressing then place half of salad ingredients, in the following order from bottom to top: carrot, cucumber, red bell pepper, chicken, cabbage, spinach, cilantro leaves. Goûtez et rajoutez éventuellement les épices ou le miel si nécessaire.?&#3- Quand la citrouille est caramélisée et epicée a votre goût, ajoutez la fleur d’oranger, mixez et laissez cuire 30 secondes.?&#4- Versez dans un plat et déposez des noix dessus. Easy Salads Apr 27, 2017 491- Homemade Pumpkin Puree https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/1-IMG_1089-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients is English:?&#?&#1 whole small pumpkin (e.g. Kabocha) or large pumpkin slices?&#Water?&#?&#——————————————————————–?&#?&#Ingrédients en français:?&#?&#1 petite citrouille (par exemple Kabocha) ou des tranches d’une grande citrouille?&#Eau Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepping the Pumpkin?&#1- Preheat the oven to 190C / 375F.?&#2- Cut the small pumpkin in half. If the pumpkin is too large quarter it.?&#3- Remove the pumpkin seeds with a spoon.?&#?&#4- Place the pumpkin slices or halves (shallow side down) on a baking pan covered with parchment paper.?&#?&#5- Bake for 50 minutes or until the pumpkin becomes soft and tender.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Puree?&#1- Once the pumpkin is ready, remove from the oven, and let it cool a bit until you are able to handle it.?&#2- Scoop the pumpkin flesh and discard the skin.?&#?&#3- Place the pumpkin flesh in a food processor and mix. Add a little bit of water to moisten the mixture and make it smooth.?&#?&#4- Place the pumpkin puree in an airtight container. It can be stored in the fridge for up to 1 week and in the freezer for up to 6 months.?&#————————————————————————————————————?&#?&#Directions en français:?&#?&#Etape 1: Preparer La Citrouille?&#1- Préchauffez le four à 190C.?&#2- Coupez la petite citrouille en deux ou si elle est moyenne, en quatre.?&#3- Retirez les graines de citrouille avec une cuillère.?&#4- Placez les morceaux de citrouille sur une plaque de cuisson recouverte de papier sulfurisé.?&#5- Mettez au four pendant 50 minutes ou jusqu’à ce que la citrouille devienne tendre.?&#?&#Etape 2: Preparer La Purée?&#1- Une fois la citrouille est prête, retirez du four et laissez refroidir un peu.?&#2- Enlevez la pulpe de citrouille avec une cuillere et jetez la peau.?&#3- Placez la pulpe de citrouille dans un robot culinaire et mixez. Ajoutez un peu d’eau pour humidifier le mélange et le rendre lisse .?&#4- Placez la purée de citrouille dans un contenaire hermétique. Elle peut être conservée au réfrigérateur pendant une semaine et dans le congélateur pendant jusqu’à 6 mois . https://www.cookingwithalia.com/491-homemade-pumpkin-puree/ 50 Minutes

Add a pinch of salt, cover the saucepan, and cook on medium heat until the carrots are crisp-tender.?&#3- Add the golden raisins, sugar, ground cinnamon, and vanilla sugar (optional). Continue cooking uncovered, for around 15 minutes, or until the water has completely evaporated and the carrots are soaking in a syrupy sauce.?&#4- Finally, mix in the vegetable oil and lemon juice.?&#5- Place the carrot salad in a bowl, cover, and chill in the refrigerator.?&#?&#Serve cool. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/435-carrot-and-golden-raisin-salad/
2 Meduim Couscous Apr 10, 2016 426 – Couscous Shrimp Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/rsz_couscousshrimpsalad-cropped.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Veggies Ingredients:?&#?&#1 celery stick?&#1/2 cucumber?&#1/2 red bell pepper?&#1/2 yellow bell pepper?&#6-7 cherry tomatoes?&#A handful of finely chopped cilantro?&#1/4 preserved lemon (skin only)?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#?&#Shrimp ingredients:?&#?&#10 large shrimp?&#Zest of 1 lemon?&#6 hole garlic cloves?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#Red chili flakes (to taste)?&#1/4 cup olive oil?&#?&#Other:?&#?&#2 cups cold cooked couscous (amount to your taste) Directions :?&#?&#A – Prepare the Veggies?&#1- Trim the leafy part of the celery stick, slice the celery stick lengthwise, and dice into small pieces.?&#2- Cut the cucumber lengthwise, slice into thin sticks, and dice into small pieces.?&#3- Slice off the top of the red pepper, pull out the seeds, cut the peppers in half and remove the white inner strips. 4- Slice the pepper half into thin strips and chop into small pieces.?&#5- Do the same with the yellow bell pepper.?&#6- Chop the cherry tomatoes into quarters.?&#7- Finely chop the cilantro.?&#8- Remove the pulp of the preserved lemon, we are only using the skin. Chop it finely.?&#9- Here are all our ingredients: cucumber, red pepper, celery, cherry tomatoes, cilantro, yellow pepper, and preserved lemon.?&#10- Mix all the vegies together.?&#11- Add olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix.?&#?&#B – Cook the Shrimp?&#1- On medium heat, heat the olive oil in a cazuela or skillet.?&#2- Add the garlic cloves and cook for a few minutes so all the garlic flavors infuse the oil.?&#3- Add the shrimp to the cazuela. Sprinkle salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest. Mix and cook for a few minutes until the shrimp changes color and becomes opaque.?&#4- Once done, remove the shrimp from the oil and reserve.?&#?&#C – Mix It All?&#1- In a large plate, mix the veggies with cold cooked couscous. Click the link on the screen to learn how to cook couscous.?&#2- Add the shrimp and continue mixing.?&#And that’s it – plate in a large glass, decorate with a whole shrimp and cilantro, and serve right away.?&#Hmmm…. So yummy! Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/426-couscous-shrimp-salad/
easy Salads Jan 30, 2016 416 – Apple Walnut Salad & Argan Dressing https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/rsz_episode_416_-_apple_walnut_salad_.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#The dressing:?&#?&#1/2 cup fresh orange juice?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#1/2 tablespoon Argan oil?&#2 tablespoons sugar?&#Pinch of salt?&#?&#The salad:?&#?&#1 apple?&#1 lettuce & other greens?&#1/2 cup of raw unsalted walnuts Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – the dressing:?&#1- Roll the lemon, slice, and juice, Filter the lemon juice to get rid of the pulp.?&#2- Do the same with the oranges, to get fresh orange juice.?&#3- In a large bowl, combine the orange juice, the lemon juice, argan oil, sugar and salt. Whisk.?&#4- Pour the dressing in a bottle, and keep it in the fridge until you are ready to serve the salad.?&#?&#Step 2 – the salad:?&#Note: 20 minutes before serving the dinner, make the salad.?&#1- Chop your lettuce and greens into bite size chunks, and place in a large plate.?&#2- Peel the apple, cut and remove the core. Slice the apple into bite size chunks. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the apple slices so they don’t turn brown. You want them to look fresh!?&#3- Cut the creamy cheese into bite-size chunks, and place the cheese in a baking plate covered with parchment paper. Bake for 5 minutes in a hot oven!?&#?&#Final steps:?&#1- Add the dressing to the greens, and toss.?&#2- Top the greens with the apple slices, and add a bit of dressing to cover them.?&#3- Make your salad crunchy and sexy with some walnuts!?&#4- For the finale, top everything with the warm creamy cheese.?&#Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/416-apple-walnut-salad-argan-dressing/
Easy Salads Jan 18, 2016 047 – Zaalouk – Moroccan Eggplant Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/zaalouk_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 large eggplant (1 pound)?&#3 tomatoes peeled and diced (1 pound)?&#1/4 cup of chopped parsley?&#1/4 cup of chopped cilantro?&#1 teaspoon of vinegar?&#1 – 2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 teaspoon of crushed garlic?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon of salt (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#Steps to prepare the eggplant:?&#1- Peel and dice the eggplant. You can either peel all the eggplant skin of leave half of it, depending on your taste.?&#2- Boil the eggplant cubes in salted water for 20 – 30 minutes.?&#3- Drain the eggplant cubes from the water and press them with a spoon until all excess water is released.?&#?&#Steps to prepare the Zaalouk:?&#1- On medium heat, add the tomatoes, eggplant, olive oil, garlic and spices to your pan and cook them for 30 minutes.?&#2- Crush the eggplant and tomatoes with a wooden spoon while they are cooking until you end up with a puree.?&#3- In the last 5 minutes, add the vinegar to the eggplant and tomatoes puree.?&#?&#Serving:?&#Zaalouk is served either hot or cold, with bread. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/zaalouk-moroccan-eggplant-salad-episode-47/
Easy Salads Jan 18, 2016 036 – Moroccan Salad of Sweet Potatoes and Raisins – Thanksgiving Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/salad_of_sweet_potatoes_and_raisins_78343040dd93d1125aede16a43311e8b.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound of sweet potatoes (or pumpkin)?&#5 Oz of raisins (soaked in water)?&#2-3 Tablespoons of cooking oil?&#1 Tablespoon of honey?&#A pinch of saffron?&#A pinch of turmeric powder?&#1/4 teaspoon of salt (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon (to taste)?&#water Directions :?&#?&#Peel the potatoes and dice them in small cubes.?&#On medium heat, drizzle the oil in your saucepan.?&#Add the potatoes and all the spices. Mix well.?&#Cover the potatoes with water. Cover the pan and let the potatoes cook for the next 20 minutes.?&#After 20 minutes, drain the raisins from their water and add them to the potatoes. Add the honey.?&#Add a little more water to the potatoes and raisins. Taste the sauce and adjust the salt, pepper, and cinnamon to taste.?&#Cover the pan and let the potatoes and raisins cook for the next 10 minutes.?&#Note: This salad can be served either hot or cold with bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-salad-of-sweet-potatoes-and-raisins-thanksgiving-recipe-episode-36/
4 Medium Appetizers Jan 4, 2016 401 – Moroccan Potato Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/rsz_401_-_moroccan_potato_salad.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500 g of potatoes?&#1/4 preserved lemon – just the skin (chopped)?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley?&#2 garlic cloves?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 tablespoon ground paprika?&#1/2 tablespoon ground cumin?&#Chili pepper (to taste)?&#2 tablespoons lemon juice?&#Salt (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#1- First, peel the potatoes and cut them into evenly bite-size cubes. ?&#2- Place the potatoes in a pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and cook the potatoes until tender. you should be able to easily slice through with a fork. Don’t overcook them! ?&#3- Drain the potatoes from the water and keep on the side. ?&#4- Now let’s prepare the rest of the ingredients. ?&#5- Quarter a preserved lemon. Remove the pulp from a quarter, and chop the skin into small pieces. ?&#6- Grate the garlic cloves. Chop some fresh cilantro and some fresh parsley.?&#7- In a flat pan, on low heat, drizzle the olive oil, add the grated garlic and the spices: paprika, ground cumin, and chili pepper. Mix and cook for 1 minute. ?&#8- Add some fresh lemon juice… then place the potatoes in this sauce. Gently mix in the potatoes so that every piece is coated with yumminess. ?&#9- Add the chopped cilantro and parsley. Mix and cook for 2 minutes.?&#Now add the preserved lemon pieces. Mix. ?&#Taste first and finally add salt – remember preserved lemons are very salty. Cook for another minute and serve immediately. ?&#10- Yes, you can add more fresh cilantro on top! Hot, Warm, or Cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/401-moroccan-potato-salad/
1 Very easy Salads Jan 4, 2016 399 – Moroccan Spicy Orange Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/rsz_399.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2-3 oranges (Navel)?&#Handful of black olives?&#2 garlic cloves (grated)?&#Juice of 1/2 a lemon?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cumin?&#Hot chili pepper (to taste)?&#Salt (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#1- The first step is to peel and section the oranges.?&#Using a sharp knife, cut the ends of each orange. Slice the peel off the sides.?&#2- With a gentle sawing motion, remove the orange segments in between 2 membranes. Then cut into pieces. ?&#3- Squeeze the remaining membranes to get all the excess juice in a separate bowl, keep on the side we will use it later.?&#4- Next, slice the black olives. They pair up surprisingly well with the oranges. You’ll see! ?&#5- Let’s prepare the vinaigrette. Grate the garlic cloves.?&#6- In a bowl combine orange juice, lemon juice, olive oil, grated garlic, paprika, ground cumin, hot chili pepper for a kick, and salt. Mix.?&#7- For the final step, place the orange pieces in a large bowl, add the olive slices, and mix in the spicy vinaigrette.?&#8- Serve cold. Sprinkle some more chili pepper on top if you like it spicy.?&#Hmmm… bon appetite https://www.cookingwithalia.com/399-moroccan-spicy-orange-salad/
1 Easy Desserts Jan 4, 2016 400 – Moroccan Carrot Orange Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/rsz_400_-_carrot_orange_salad.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&# 2 oranges ?&# 2 carrots (grated)?&# Pinch of salt?&# 1 tbsp orange blossom water?&# 1 tbsp white sugar (to taste)?&# Juice of 1 lemon?&# Ground cinnamon (optional) Directions :?&#?&#1- First, prepare some fresh orange juice. ?&#2- Peel the carrots and grate them into very fine or medium strands – whatever you prefer?&#3- In a large bowl, place the grated carrots; add the orange juice, freshly squeezed lemon juice, orange blossom water, pinch of salt, and sugar. Mix.?&#4- Taste and adjust ingredients as desired. ?&#5- Refrigerate the salad for 30 minutes before serving. ?&#6- Don’t forget to sprinkle a bit of ground cinnamon before enjoying it?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/400-moroccan-carrot-orange-salad/
2 Easy Salads Jun 5, 2016 435- Carrot and Golden Raisin Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/rsz_carottes_et_raisins_img_1097tif.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#4 medium-sized carrots?&#1/4 cup golden raisins?&#2 tablespoons white granulated sugar?&#¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#¼ teaspoon vanilla sugar (optional)?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice?&#A pinch of salt?&#Boiling water Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel the carrots, trim off the top, cut in half lengthwise, and remove the hard core. Slice each half in two, then cut into 0.5 cm (1/4-inch) dice.?&#2- Place the carrots in a saucepan and cover with boiling water. Add a pinch of salt, cover the saucepan, and cook on medium heat until the carrots are crisp-tender.?&#3- Add the golden raisins, sugar, ground cinnamon, and vanilla sugar (optional). Continue cooking uncovered, for around 15 minutes, or until the water has completely evaporated and the carrots are soaking in a syrupy sauce.?&#4- Finally, mix in the vegetable oil and lemon juice.?&#5- Place the carrot salad in a bowl, cover, and chill in the refrigerator.?&#?&#Serve cool. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/435-carrot-and-golden-raisin-salad/
