Easy Appetizers Feb 25, 2015 125 – Taktouka – Cooked Salad with Tomatoes and Roasted Green Peppers https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_125.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#(5) medium-sized tomatoes (grated). (basically cut each tomato in ½ and grate pulp and discard skin)?&#(2) large – green peppers?&#(1/4) cup – finely chopped cilantro?&#(1/4) cup – finely chopped parsley?&#(1) tsp – paprika?&#(1) tsp – cumin?&#(1/4) tsp – pepper?&#(1) tsp – salt?&#(2) TBL spoons – olive oil?&#(1) TBL spoon – tomato paste?&#(3) garlic cloves (crushed) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1 – Roasting the Green Peppers?&#1- Grill green peppers (insert wood sticks in peppers and place directly on burner). Goal is to grill peppers on high heat until skin turns black. Cracking noise is a good sign; it means skin is cracking and pepper is roasting?&#2- Keep monitoring pepper and turn around until all sides become black. If you find it difficult to use wooden sticks, use tongs to turn pepper?&#3- Once peppers are roasted, place in a bowl with a plastic wrap for 15-20 minutes. This will steam the peppers and aide in removing the skin?&#?&#Step 2 – Cooking the Tomatoes?&#1- While peppers are steaming, gently cook tomatoes with spices, olive oil, tomato paste and garlic in a sauce pan on medium heat?&#2- Cook tomato mixture for 15 minutes on medium heat?&#Stir from time-to-time?&#3- Once cooked on medium heat for 15 minutes, reduce heat to low and then start to get peppers ready?&#?&#Step 3 – Combining the Tomatoes and the Peppers?&#1- Clean Peppers by removing burnt skin, cutting top of pepper and removing seeds?&#2- After cleaning peppers, slice and dice into small cubes?&#3- Add pepper cubes and chopped parsley and cilantro to tomato mixture?&#4- Cook tomatoes and peppers on medium heat for another 15-20 minutes?&#?&#Step 4 – Serving this delicious Cooked Salad?&#1- Salad is ready when it becomes dry and thick.?&#2- If you have preserved lemons, you can use them for decoration. First wash preserved lemon in water to remove some of the salt, then cut lemon and remove pulp so you can use the skin for decoration?&#Serve salad with Moroccan bread or French baguette as an appetizer?&#Eat warm or cold https://www.cookingwithalia.com/taktouka-cooked-salad-with-tomatoes-and-roasted-green-peppers/
4 Very easy Salads Feb 25, 2015 105 – Moroccan Rice Tuna Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_105.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#(Salad) 1 tomato?&#(Salad) 1/2 red pepper?&#(Salad) 1/2 green pepper?&#(Salad) 3 cups of cooked rice?&#(Salad) 10 oz of canned tuna?&#(Salad) 3/4 cup of corn?&#(Salad) 1/2 cup of Mozarella cheese cut into small cubes?&#(Salad) 4-5 black olives cut into small pieces?&#(Salad) 1 tablespoon of finely chopped parseley?&#(Sauce) 4 tablespoons of olive oil?&#(Sauce) 2 teaspoons of Dijon mustard?&#(Sauce) 2 tablespoons of Mayonnaise?&#(Sauce) Juice from 1 lemon?&#(Sauce) Salt and pepper Directions :?&#?&#1. Cut the peppers into small pieces. After removing the seeds, cut the tomato into small pieces as well.?&#2. In a large bowl, mix together all the ingredients of the salad.?&#3. To make the sauce, mix all the ingreident of the sauce together and season to taste (salt and pepper).?&#4. Incorporate the sauce into the salad mixture. Mix well.?&#5. Serving: Serve the salad cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/rice-tuna-salad/
1 Easy Salads Feb 25, 2015 159 – Persimmon Salad with Moroccan Sweet Vinaigrette Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_159.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#vinaigrette:?&#?&#1/2 cup olive oil?&#1/4 cup white vinegar?&#2 tablespoons argan oil (optional)?&#1 tablespoon honey?&#1 tablespoon dijon mustard?&#salt & pepper to taste?&#?&#salad:?&#?&#fresh spring mix?&#baby spinach?&#1 cup pomegranate seeds?&#1 fuyu persimmon (make sure you are picking a non-astringent persimmon)?&#Grated parmesan?&#1 cup roasted unsalted almonds Directions :?&#?&#Making the Vinaigrette:?&#1- Using a hand-held mixer (or regular blender) mix the olive oil, argan oil, and white vinegar together for 1 minute until you get a whitish mixture.?&#2- Add the honey, dijon mustard, and season with salt and pepper. Mix well with the hand-held mixer.?&#3- Pour the vinaigrette in a jar, close it, and place it in the fridge for 30 minutes so that all the flavors rest and the aromas are released.?&#note: you can store the vinaigrette in the fridge for up to 3 days.?&#?&#Making the Salad:?&#1- In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients of the salad together: spring mix, baby spinach, persimmon (thinly sliced using the slicing section of a grater), pomegrate seeds, grated parmesan, and roasted almonds.?&#2- Add some of the vinaigrette to the salald. Mix well using a large spoon and fork.?&#Serve the salad immediately! Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/persimmon-salad-with-moroccan-sweet-vinaigrette/
Easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 054 – Moroccan Cabbage Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/cabbage_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cabbage (approximately 2 pounds)?&#1/4 cup of chopped cilantro?&#1/4 cup of chopped parsley?&#1 tablespoon of cooking oil?&#1 teaspoon of crushed garlic?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#1 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of salt (to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper (to taste)?&#1 teaspoon of vinegar (or lemon juice) Directions :?&#?&#Put the cabbage in boiling water for 20 minutes.?&#After 20 minutes, drain the water from the cabbage and reserve.?&#On medium heat, drizzle the oil in your pan and add the cabbage. Mash the cabbage for few minutes with a wooden fork.?&#After all the spices to the cabbage and continue mashing it for 10 minutes.?&#Add the parsley and cilantro to the cabbage, and continue mash it for 15-20 minutes until you get a smooth consistency.?&#Taste the cabbage and adjust the spices according to your taste. Add the vinegar (or the lemon juice). Mix well and serve.?&#Serving:?&#The cabbage salad is served hot with bread. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-cabbage-salad/
Very easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 061 – Moroccan Orange Carrot Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/orange_carrot_resized.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 cups of finely grated carrots?&#1 cup of orange juice?&#1 teaspoon of orange blossom water?&#1/2 tablespoon of sugar?&#A pinch of cinnamon powder?&#Note: Feel free to adjust the measurements to your taste Directions :?&#?&#1.Peel the carrots.?&#?&#2.Finely grate the carrots.?&#?&#3.Mix all the ingredients together.?&#?&#4.Serving: Serve this salad cold. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-orange-carrot-salad/
Very easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 002 – Moroccan Salad (Taktouka) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-salad-taktouka/ Ingredients :?&#?&#1 green pepper?&#3 tomatoes?&#1 large onion?&#2 teaspoons of minced garlic?&#1 teaspoon of pepper (or to taste)?&#2 teaspoons of salt (or to taste)?&#1 teaspoon of paprika?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1/2 cup of water Directions :?&#?&#1- Dice the onion, tomatoes and green pepper.?&#2- On medium heat, in a cooking pan add the olive oil, onions, garlic and all the spices.?&#3- Stir the onions for 5 minutes.?&#4- Cover the pan and let the onions cook for another 5 minutes. During this time check on the onions from time to time to avoid burning them.?&#5- Add the tomatoes to the pan and stir with the onions.?&#6- Cover the pan for another 10 minutes and let the onions and tomatoes cook.?&#7- Add the green pepper to the pan, stir and let it cook for 20 minutes. During this time keep stirring from time to time to avoid burning the vegetables.?&#8- The Taktouka is ready when the mixture is dry and the pepper is cooked.?&#Note: If the mixture is dry but the pepper is not cooked, add some water and let it cook longer. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-salad-taktouka/
2 Very easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 107 – Moroccan Cucumber Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_107.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#The Salty Version?&#?&#(1) cucumber?&#Juice of a ½ a lemon?&#Fresh thyme?&#(1) tsp – olive oil?&#Salt and Pepper?&#?&#The Sweet Version?&#?&#(1) cucumber?&#(1/4) cup – orange juice?&#Sugar to taste?&#(1/4) tsp – orange blossom water Directions :?&#?&#Recipe 1 – The Salty Version?&#1. Peel cucumber?&#2. Grate using medium sized grater?&#3. Add rest of ingredients to grated cucumber (lemon juice, fresh thyme, olive oil, salt and pepper)?&#4. Remove leaves from thyme branch?&#5. Add salt and pepper?&#6. Serve Cold?&#Note: you can adjust all the ingredients to your taste.?&#?&#Recipe 2 – The Sweet Version?&#1. Peel cucumber?&#2. Grate cucumber?&#3. Mix rest of ingredients with grated cucumber (orange juice, sugar, orange blossom water)?&#4. If you would like to add more texture to the salad, you can add chopped iceberg lettuce to the cucumber?&#5. Serve Cucumber Salad cold https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-cucumber-salad/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 149 – Moroccan Fava Beans with Charmoula Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_149.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound fresh fava beans (weighed with the skin)?&#1 tomato (grated)?&#1/3 cup finely chopped cilantro?&#1/3 cup olive oil?&#3 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#½ teaspoon of salt?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1 teaspoon cumin?&#water Directions :?&#?&#1. Peel all the fava beans and discard the skins. If you find large fava beans, slice the head with a pairing knife so that it can absorb the spices when cooked.?&#2. In a saucepan, mix the 1/3 cup olive oil with 1/4 cup water. Mix well and let the oil and water cook on medium heat until they start bubbling.?&#3. Add the fava beans to the oil / water mixture. Also, add the rest of the ingredients (garlic, cilantro, and spices). Mix well.?&#4. Add water to the saucepan until all the fava beans are covered with water. Cover the pan and let the fava beans cook for 50 minutes on medium heat. Stir the fava beans from time to time.?&#5. Cut the tomtato in half and grate it. Discard the skin.?&#6. Once the fava beans are cooked, add the grated tomato to the saucepan with the fava beans. Then let the fava beans and tomato cook for 3-4 minutes uncovered.?&#7. Serve the fava beans hot with Moroccan or French bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-fava-beans-with-charmoula/
4 Easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 154 – Moroccan Beetroot Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_154.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 beets – approximately 2 pounds?&#1 small onion grated?&#⅓ cup of finely chopped parsley?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of vinegar (or lemon juice)?&#Salt, pepper, cumin to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- Fill a pot with water, and place the beets in the water with 1 lemon sliced in half (to enhance color and flavor). Set the heat to medium-high, and let the beets cook in boiling water for 45-60 minutes depending on how large the beetroots are (the larger, the longer time it will take to cook). The skin should come off easily, and you should be able to pierce them with a fork.?&#2- Once done, drain the beetroots from the boiling water and place them in a bowl of cold water to cool off.?&#3- Peel the beetroots, remove the two ends, then slice and dice them. Place the diced beetroots in a large bowl.?&#4- In a small bowl, mix the onion, parsley, olive oil, vinegar (or lemon juice), and season to taste.?&#5- Mix the onion mixture with the diced beetroots. Taste the beetroot salad and season to taste (salt, pepper, cumin).?&#6- Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap, and place the beetroot salad in the fridge for 1-2 hours.?&#7- Serve the beetroot salad cold. It can be eaten alone, with bread, or tossed in a garden salad.?&#Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-beetroot-salad/
4 Easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 208 – Moroccan Tomato Cucumber Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_208.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#0.6 pound (300 grams) fresh tomatoes?&#1 cucumber?&#1 small sweet yellow onion?&#2 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#Juice of 1 lemon (to taste)?&#Peel of 1 quarter preserved lemon (optional)?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Spices: 1/2 teaspoon slat, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- The secret of the salad is how small you can chop the tomatoes, cucumber, and onion. When they are chopped into small pieces, then you get all of them in a bit and it makes a huge difference!?&#2- Chop the tomatoes (with the skin), the cucumber, and yellow onion into very small pieces.?&#3- Chop the preserved lemon peel (not the pulp) into very small pieces. If you dont have preserved lemon you can just skip it.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the Ingredients?&#1- In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients together: tomatoes, cucumber, onion, preserved lemon peel, lemon juice, chopped cilantro, olive oil, and spices. Mix well. Taste and adjust the spices accordingly.?&#?&#Step 3: Serving the Salad?&#1- You can serve the salad in a bowl along with French baguette or Moroccan bread.?&#2- You can make it look fancy by plating it using a large cookie cutter that you put on a plate, fill it with the salad, pack, then slowly remove the cookie cutter. The salad will be shaped nicely.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/moroccan-tomato-cucumber-salad/
4 Easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 230 – Moroccan Spinach Salad Recipe (Bakkoula style) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_230.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 cup of mixed cured green olives and red olives?&#1 pound (450 grams) Spinach (or mallow)?&#3/4 cup of mixed finely chopped cilantro and flat-leaf parsley?&#4 garlic cloves?&#salt (to taste)?&#1/2 tsp paprika?&#1/2 tsp ground cumin?&#A pinch of cayenne pepper?&#3 tbsp olive oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Slice the cured olives into small pieces. We are using green and red olives in this recipe, but feel free to use either one, or no olives at all if you dont like them. These are cured olives, which means they are salty. Therefore we are going to place the green olives in boiling water for a few minutes to remove some of their saltiness and acidity (the red ones dont require this step).?&#2- Usually, in Morocco we use Mallow or what we call Bakkoula for this kind of recipe, but today we are making it with Spinach! Place the spinach in water for 10 minutes to soften then wash it well. Drain the spinach and roughly chop. If using mallow, you’ll have to steam it first before cooking it.?&#3- Now finely chop the parsley and cilantro.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Spinach?&#1- Crush the garlic and place it in your cooking pan. Add salt, paprika, cumin, and cayenne pepper. Of course adjust the spices to your taste. Add olive oil and the rest of the ingredients: the chopped olives, cilantro, parsley, and spinach.?&#2- Cover the pan and cook all the ingredient on medium heat. Mix the ingredients often to avoid burning.?&#3- Cook for around 10-15 minutes or until all the liquid has evaporated.?&#Serve warm or at room temperature along with crusty bread and decorate with slices of preserved lemons.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/230-moroccan-spinach-salad-recipe-bakkoula-style/
4 easy International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 339 – French Lentil Apple Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_339.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 1/4 cups (250 grams) uncooked lentils?&#2-3 apples?&#4 tablespoons (or to taste) of apple vinegar (or regular vinegar)?&#4 tablespoons (or to taste) of olive oil?&#Fresh tarragon (estragon) or crushed fennel seeds (to taste)?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#Water for cooking (3 times the volume of lentils) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Lentils?&#IMPORTANT: we are using the Lentils of Puy, which are softer and easier to cook. If you are using brown or green lentils, you may have to put them in water for a couple of hours before cooking them.?&#1- Place the lentils in a large bowl and wash them with cold water.?&#2- Once well washed, drain the lentils from the water.?&#3- Place the lentils in a measuring cup and check out the volume measure. You should cook the lentils in 3 times their volume in water.?&#4-Place the lentils along with the cold water in a large pot. Cover and cook the lentils on high heat until the water reaches a boiling water.?&#5- Once the water starts boiling, reduce the heat to medium, uncover the pot and let the lentils cook for 20 minutes or until they become soft.?&#6- Once the lentils are cooked, drain them from the water and place them in a large bowl.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Salad?&#1- We need to season the lentils when they are still hot.?&#2- Add the apple vinegar to the lentils – we are using apple vinegar, you can use regular vinegar. Adjust vinegar to taste.?&#3- Add olive oil – to taste.?&#4- Add salt and pepper to your taste.?&#5- Let the lentils cool down.?&#6- Once the lentils cool down – taste them again and adjust the seasoning (vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper).?&#7- Peel the apples and cut them into pieces. Add them to the lentils.?&#8- Add fresh or dried tarragon (estragon) – if you do not have it, you can replace it with crushed fennel seeds.?&#9- Mix well. Place in the fridge for an hour or so, and serve cold!?&#?&#Bon Appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/lentil-apple-salad/
6 Medium International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 335 – Itch – Armenian Bulgur Salad https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_335.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 1/2 cups bulgur (coarse if possible)?&#1 1/2 cups warm water?&#2 onions (chopped)?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 small green pepper (diced)?&#A bunch of fresh parsley (finely chopped)?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#1 tablespoon of tomato paste?&#1/2 cup tomato sauce?&#1/2 tablespoon of dried mint or fresh mint (chopped) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Place the bulgur in a bowl and add the warm water to it. Let the bulgur soak in the water for 15-30 minutes before using it.?&#2- Chop the onion. Dice the green pepper. Finely chop the parsley.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking with Bulgur?&#1- On medium heat, drizzle some olive oil in a flat pan.?&#2- Heat the oil for 1 minute then add the chopped onions, diced green pepper, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix well.?&#3- Cook for 5 minutes on medium heat.?&#4- While the onions are cooking, drain the bulgur from the water.?&#5- Add the bulgur to the pan and mix with the chopped onions and pepper.?&#6- Add the tomato paste and tomato sauce to the bulgur. Mix well.?&#7- Add a little bit of water to the bulgur and ingredients, just to make sure it’s moist.?&#8- Add the dried (or fresh) mint to the bulgur. Mix well.?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Keep cooking the ingredient on medium heat and stirring from time to time. Add a little bit of water if necessary to keep the bulgur mixture moist.?&#2- You will notice that the bulgur will start swelling and getting bigger, which means that it’s getting ready.?&#3- From the time you added the bulgur, it would take around 10-15 minutes, for it to become soft and chewy, and the liquid of the mixture to evaporate. At this point, turn off the heat, cover the pan with a lid, and let the bulgur sit for 10 minutes. You will see that it will swell up a little more and become softer!?&#4- Taste and season with salt and pepper.?&#5- The Itch is ready. You can serve it hot or cold!?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/itch-armenian-bulgur-salad/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 24, 2015 266 – Green Bean Salad with Shallot Mint Vinaigrette Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_266.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/2 pound (225 grams) green haricot vert (or mixed colors if available)?&#4 oz (113 grams) green peas?&#4 oz (113 grams) Fava beans (shelled) or Soybeans?&#1 bunch purselane?&#1 shallot (finely diced)?&#4 mint sprigs?&#1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil?&#1 tablespoon Jerez vinegar or white vinegar?&#1/2 lemon?&#Salt and pepper to taste Directions :?&#?&#Note: Recipe courtsey of Chef Sandra Cordero?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- In a large pot, pour water, add salt, and bring to a boiling point on high heat.?&#2- Blanche the fava beans, green beans, and peas. This means that you put them in the boiling water for 2-3 minutes.?&#3- Then remove them from the boiling water with a strainer and shock the vegetables in an ice bath (a large bowl of water with ice cubes) to stop the cooking. The vegetables will stay crispy.?&#4- Place all the beans in a large bowl.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Vinaigrette?&#1- Thinly dice the shallots and chop the mint leaves. Place in a bowl.?&#2- Squeeze the lemon to get lemon juice and add to the bowl.?&#3- Add the vinegar, olive oil, and mix all the ingredients until well incorporated.?&#4- Add salt and pepper to taste.?&#?&#Step 3: Final Steps?&#1- Pour the vinaigrette on top of the beans mixture.?&#2- Add a few leaves of purselane (optional).?&#3- Mix all the ingredients. Serve in a nice plate.?&#?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/green-bean-salad-with-shallot-mint-vinaigrette/
2 Very easy Poultry Feb 24, 2015 351 – Grilled Chicken Moroccan Style Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_351.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#2 chicken breasts (without bones)?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro?&#10 mint leaves?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 tablespoon lemon juice?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/2 teaspoon turmeric?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper?&#Salt to taste?&#1 teaspoon fennel seeds?&#1/2 preserved lemon (just the skin)?&#2-3 garlic?&#2 tablespoons of water?&#Salad, rice, or other side dishes Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Finely chop fresh cilantro. Get a few mint leaves and chop them too! This is going to add a nice minty taste?&#2- Cut, smash, and finely chop fresh garlic!!! We are going fresh all the way?&#3- Here is my secret ingredient: preserved lemons! I am going to use ½ a lemon. Remove the pulp, keep for later use in a tagine for example – then finely slice and chop the skin. That’s what is going to add a delicious citrusy flavor to our marinade.?&#?&#Step 2: Preparing the Marinade?&#1- In a large bowl, mix in the olive oil, lemon juice, chopped cilantro and mint, chopped garlic, chopped preserved lemon skin, and spices. Here we have ground ginger, ground turmeric, black pepper, and fennel seeds! Mix well. Add a little bit of water to dilute the marinade.?&#2- Taste the marinade and add salt as needed –remember preserved lemon is salty to begin with, so you’ll have to rely on your taste!?&#3- Cut the chicken breast into slices, and place them in the bowl. Make sure that the chicken is well mixed with the marinade?&#4- Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap and let the chicken marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour. Overnight if you want – you can have it for dinner the next day!?&#?&#Step 3: Grilling the Chicken?&#1- You can bbq the chicken, or even better and easier, use an awesome non-stick grilling plate for an instantaneous indoor bbq! Just place the plate on your stove, let it heat up, and place the chicken…. Can you hear the sizzle! That’s what I am talking about!?&#2- Grill the chicken for a few minutes on both sides, and press well with your spatula, to get these nice grilling marks on the chicken!?&#3- Serve the chicken right away, I like to add it as topping to my salad… you just need some lettuce, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and chopped preserved lemon skin. Add your favorite dressing and here you have a healthy chicken salad Moroccan style!?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/grilled-chicken-moroccan-style-2/
2 Easy Salads Feb 24, 2015 236 – Endive Salad Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_236.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 endives?&#1/4 cup of cheese cut into cubes (e.g. gruyere, havarti, etc.)?&#1 small apple?&#1/2 cup of walnut halves?&#1 vinaigrette portion – around 1/4 cup (check Alia’s Tips: Homemade Vinaigrette) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- To properly cut an endive, you want to first chop the bottom of the endive. Then chop 1 inch of the top, where the green leaves are, because that’s where the bitterness resides.?&#2- Slice the endive lenghtwise and remove a couple of outside leaves.?&#3- Using a pairing knife, cut a V-shape to remove the core of each of the endive halves. The core is the white portion in the center of the endive that is white and hard.?&#3- Some people use the endive halves and fill them with other ingredients. For this recipe, we are going to chop the endives.?&#4- To bring a soft texture to the salad to balance the crunchiness of the endives we are going to add cheese (example: havarti, gruyere, etc.). Cube the cheese.?&#5- Cut and cube the apples. You can peel it or just keep the skin for an extra touch of color.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the Ingredients?&#1- Place all the chopped ingredients in a large bowl.?&#2- Add the walnut halves to the rest of the ingredients. Walnuts work so well with endives.?&#3- Add one portion of the vinaigrette (around 1/4 cup) – check my video on how to make homemade vinaigrette! Mix well.?&#4- The salad is ready! because the salad is pale, use a colorful plate to present it!?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/236-endive-salad-recipe/
Easy Salads Feb 23, 2015 014 – Carrot Macharmal (spiced carrot salad) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/salade_de_carotte_e6e85faade53e7411a57e78301049bbb.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#5 medium size carrots?&#3 garlic cloves?&#1/4 cup of chopped parsley?&#3 tablespoon of olive oil?&#1/2 – 3/4 teaspoon of salt (or to taste)?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper (or to taste)?&#1/2 teaspoon of cumin?&#1 teaspoon of paprika Directions :?&#?&#1.Peel the carrots, cut each carrot in the middle and remove the core. Cut the carrots in little cubes.?&#?&#2.In boiling water, add the carrots and the 3 garlic cloves. Let them cook for 15-20 minutes.?&#?&#3.Drain the carrots and garlic from the water.?&#?&#4.In a cooking pan, drizzle the olive oil, add the carrots with the garlic, the parsley and the spices.?&#?&#5.Stir constently. Mash the carrots while they are cooking. This will take 15-20 minutes.?&#?&#6.Serve the salad with bread.?&#?&#7.Note: This salad can be served warm or cold depending on the season. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/carrot-macharmal-spiced-carrot-salad/
2 Very easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 316 – Chickpea Salad Moroccan Style https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_316.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 can (400 grams weighed with liquid) of chickpeas?&#A small bunch of cilantro?&#1 teaspoon lemon juice?&#2 teaspoons paprika?&#1 teaspoon cumin?&#salt and pepper to taste?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 garlic clove (crushed) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Steaming the canned chickpeas?&#1- We are using canned chickpeas… no overnight soaking, boiling, or extra work needed.?&#2- Just drain the canned chickpeas from their juices and place them, in a sieve, over boiling water… basically, we are steaming the chickpeas for 5 minutes just to heat them up.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the spices?&#1- In the meantime, finely chop the cilantro – you can also use parsley if you want. You don’t have any herbs in hand? no worries – keep going. This recipe is risk free! It will still be good!?&#2- Let’s make our spice mix – we need olive oil, a little bit of lemon juice, crushed garlic, ground cumin, paprika, pepper, and salt!!! Of course, you can adjust these spices to your taste!?&#3- Add a bit of the chopped cilantro – mix well, and you’re done!?&#?&#Step 3: Serve!?&#1- Place the hot chickpeas in a large bowl, add your spice mix, and give it a nice toss!?&#2- Serve in a plate, top with chopped cilantro, and eat right away!!!?&#?&#Bon appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/chickpea-salad-moroccan-style-2/
4 Medium International Recipes Feb 23, 2015 297 – Banana Blossom Salad – Vietnamese Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_297.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#300 g young banana blossom (you can also use white cabbage, red cabbage, green papaya), shredded in thin slides?&#1 carrot, cut or shredded in thin sticks?&#1 onion thinly chopped?&#1 small bunch of “rau răm” (you can also use mint leaves instead)?&#1 small bunch of cilantro (finely chopped)?&#1 small star fruit ( you can replace it by green mango or any fruit naturally sour and sweet, for example some slides of pineapple )?&#Crushed peanuts?&#Marinade Ingredients:?&#3 teaspoons fresh lime juice?&#3 teaspoons white granulated sugar?&#3 teaspoons of fish sauce?&#2 garlic cloves chopped?&#A few pieces of chopped red chili pepper Directions :?&#?&# ?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients of the Salad?&#1- Place the layers of the banana blossom (or the cabbage leaves) on top of each other and roll them tight together.?&#2- Slice them very thin and place them in a bowl of ice water and lime for about 20 minutes.?&#3- Before using, squeeze the banana blossom until dry and set aside.?&#4- Chop the rest of the ingredients (vegetables and herbs of your choice).?&#Tip: once chopped, place the onions in warm water so that they become less ‘spicy’.?&#?&#Step 2: Making the Marinade?&#1- Add all the ingredients of the marinade in a small bowl and stir around until dissolved.?&#?&#Step 3: Combining all the Ingredients?&#1- Combine banana blossom, onion, carrot, green pepper, coriander, marinade and peanuts in a large bowl and toss until well blended (Add peanuts before serving to avoid peanuts softened).?&#2- Arrange the salad on a serving platter (or on a thick part of the banana or cabbage leaf).?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/297-banana-blossom-salad-vietnamese-recipe/
4 Easy Salads Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: How to Make a Fancy Rice Salad! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_how_to_make_a_fancy_rice_salad.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 small peppers (one green and one red)?&#1 small tomato?&#1 small onion?&#Salt and Pepper?&#1 tablespoon of vegetable oil?&#3 cups of cooked rice?&#1 small can of tune?&#1 small can of corn?&#1/4 cup of finely shredded cheese (Parmesan or Mozzarella)?&#Bread Crumbs?&#Lettuce, cherry tomatoes, corn, etc. for decoration Directions :?&#?&#1. First, here is an easy rice salad recipe.?&#Slice and dice 2 small peppers, one red and one green. Slice and dice a small tomato, you don’t have to remove the skin. And thinly dice a small onion.?&#Place the peppers, tomato, and onion in you cooking pan, add one teaspoon of salt and ¼ teaspoon of pepper (adjust to your taste) and 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.?&#Cook uncovered on medium-high heat for 10 to 15 minutes.?&#2. You will also need 3 cups of cooked rice. Add a small can of tuna, a small can of corn, a ¼ cup of grated cheese like parmesan or mozzarella, and the cooked vegetables. Mix well.?&#3. Take a baking pan and brush it with vegetable oil, then cover it with bread crumbs. Tap gently the pan to remove any excess bread crumbs.?&#Tightly pack the rice salad in the baking pan and place it in a hot oven, preheated at 350 degrees F, for 10 minutes.?&#4. Once you remove your baking pan from the oven, put a plate over it and flip it. Gently remove the baking pan and… here you go! A perfect rice cake. Decorate with lettuce leaves, cherry tomatoes, and some corn and let your table shine!?&#Bonne appétit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-how-to-make-a-fancy-rice-salad/
4 Easy Appetizers Feb 23, 2015 209 – Avocado Shrimp Appetizer Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_209.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 large avocado?&#1 small apple?&#2 cornichons?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro?&#100 grams pre-cooked shrimps?&#1 lemon?&#Mayo (fat-free)?&#Spices: salt and pepper Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Cut the shrimp into small pieces.?&#2- Clice and cut the cornichons into small pieces.?&#3- Cut the apple into small pieces.?&#4- Slice the avocado, remove the inside of the avocado without piercing the skin. Slice and cut the avocado pulp into small pieces. Keep the avocado skin to use them later as cups to serve the mixture. Using a spoon, scrape the inside of the avocado skin to make it smooth.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing the Ingredients?&#1- In a large bowl, mix shrimp, cilantro, cornichons, apple pieces, and avocado pieces together.?&#2- Squeeze some lemon juice on the mixture to make sure that the apple pieces and avocado pieces do not turn brown.?&#3- Add mayo to the mixture to get a creamy texture.?&#4- Season with salt and pepper to your taste.?&#?&#Step 3: Serving the appetizer?&#1- Place the mixture in the avocado skins (as if they were bowls). Decorate with a cilantro leaf and a whole shrimp.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/avocado-shrimp-appetizer/
1 Easy Salads Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: Homemade Vinaigrette Recipe! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_homemade_vinaigrette.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#1 tablespoon vinaigre?&#1 teaspoon dijon mustard?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#Salt and pepper to taste?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#1 ملعقة كبيرة من الخل?&#1 ملعقة صغيرة من خردل الديجون?&#2 ملعقة كبيرة من زيت الزيتون?&#الملح والفلفل حسب الذوق?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] Directions :?&#?&#[alia_english]Step 1: Making the Vinaigrette?&#Quick tip for today: how to make homemade vinaigrette. No need to buy from the store anymore because after this video you will know how to make it yourself!?&#1. In a bowl, add the white vinaigre and the dijon mustard.?&#2. Add salt an pepper. Remember that the vinaigrette needs to be well seasoned because that’s what will give the taste to the unseasoned salad ingredients.?&#3. Wisk all the ingredients.?&#4. Add the olive oil, little by little, while whisking. Your vinaigrette is ready!!!?&#Always make sure you have 1/3 of vinaigre to 2/3 oil (example 1 tablespoon vinaigre and 2 tablespoons oil). you can use different vinaigres, different oils, and add other ingredients like chopped cilantro, parsley, etc. I just showed you the base, but be creative and make it your own![/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#الخطوة الأولى: عمل صلصة الخل?&#?&#نصيحة سريعة لهذا اليوم: كيفية عمل صلصة الخل فى المنزل. لاحاجة لشرائها من المتجر بعد الآن لأنه بعد هذا الفيديو سوف تعرف كيفة صنعها بنفسك!?&#احضر وعاء و أضف اليه الخل الأبيض وخردل الديجون.?&#ثم يضاف الملح والفلفل. وتذكر يجب أن يكون الخل متبل جيدا بالملح والفلفل لأن هذا ما سيعطي طعم لمكونات السلطة متبلة.?&#واخفق واضرب جميع المكونات جيدا باستخدام المضرب اليدوى.?&#وقم بإضافة زيت الزيتون، شيئا فشيئا، بينما تستمر فى الخفق وضرب كل المكونات.ولقد اصبحت صلصة الخل جاهزة!!!?&#ودائما تأكد من أنه لديك 1/3 من الخل الابيض على ل2/3 من زيت الزيتون (على سبيل المثال 1 ملعقة كبيرة من الخل الابيض على 2 ملعقتين زيت الزيتون). يمكنك أيضا استخدام خل مختلف، وزيت مختلف وتستطع إضافة مكونات أخرى مثل الكزبرة والبقدونس المقطعين وما إلى ذلك، أنا فقط أوضح لكم قاعدة، ولكن كن مبدعا وأضف عليه من ذوقك!!?&#?&#شهية طيبة!?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-homemade-vinaigrette-recipe/
35 minutes 4 Easy Soups Oct 6, 2020 822- Chicken and Brown Rice Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/CWA-Rice-Soup-09.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 medium onion, chopped?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#2 carrots, peeled and cut into medium cubes?&#2 tablespoons freshly chopped parsley?&#1 teaspoon dried thyme?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1 bay leaf?&#500 milliliters (2 cups) chicken broth?&#240 milliliters (1 cup) water?&#120 grams (4.2 oz) brown rice, uncooked?&#200 grams (7 oz) cooked chicken, cut into cubes?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot over medium heat, add the olive oil, onion, grated garlic, carrots, parsely, dried thyme, ground ginger, and bay leaf.?&#2- Cook and stir the mixture for about 6 minutes, until the vegetables become soft. Make sure they are not browned.?&#?&#3- Pour in the chicken broth, water, and bring to a boil.4- Add the brown rice, chicken cubes, and season with salt and pepper as desired.?&#?&#5- Cover the pot, and cook the soup on low heat for 25 minutes until the rice is tender.?&#6- Top the chicken and brown rice soup with some fresh parsely leaves. Serve immediately! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/822-chicken-and-brown-rice-soup-%d8%b4%d8%b1%d8%a8%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%af%d8%ac%d8%a7%d8%ac-%d9%88%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%a3%d8%b1%d8%b2-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%a8%d9%86%d9%8a/ 25 minutes
20 minutes 4 Easy Soups May 4, 2020 790- Split Pea Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/PeaSoup-17.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 medium onions, finely chopped?&#?&#3 garlic cloves, grated?&#?&#1 medium potato, peeled and cut into cubes?&#?&#250 grams (8.8 oz) split pea, soaked overnight?&#?&#500 milliliters (2 cups) chicken broth?&#?&#1 small bunch fresh coriander?&#?&#1/2 tablespoon coriander powder?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#2 tablespoons cream cheese?&#?&#1 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro for topping Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the chopped onions, garlic, and cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, or until the onions become tender.?&#?&#2- Add the potato cubes, the split peas, and cover with the chicken broth.?&#?&#3- Add the bunch of fresh coriander, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. Cover the pot and cook for 30 minutes over high heat until the water boils. ?&#?&#4- Reduce the fire to medium and simmer for 40 minutes or until the split pea and potato are fully cooked. ?&#?&#5- Check the cooking of the split pea and potato by tasting them, the texture should be tender in the mouth. Add water if necessary.?&#?&#6- Remove the coriander bunch from the pot and drain the split pea mixture. Reserve the water in a large bowl and allow it to cool a little bit.?&#?&#7- Pour the split pea mixture in an electric mixer, add the cream cheese, and mix all together by adding the reserved water little by little until the desired consistency is obtained.?&#?&#8- Put the soup back into the pot over medium-low heat, add a little more of water if needed to adjust the soup consistency and mix well with a wooden spoon. ?&#?&#9- Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary and simmer for 5 minutes.?&#?&#10- Serve the split pea soup immediately in individual bowls. Garnish with chopped fresh coriander. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/790-split-pea-soup-%d8%b4%d9%88%d8%b1%d8%a8%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%a8%d8%a7%d8%b2%d9%84%d8%a7%d8%a1-%d8%ac%d9%84%d8%a8%d8%a7%d9%86%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%8a%d8%a7%d8%a8%d8%b3%d8%a9/ 1 hour 30 minutes
10 minutes 4 Easy Soups May 2, 2020 789- Cauliflower and Potato Veloute https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Veloute-16.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#For the veloute:?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 medium onion, chopped ?&#?&#3 cloves garlic, grated?&#?&#2 sprigs fresh rosemary leaves?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#1 litre (4 cups) chicken broth?&#?&#400 grams (14.1 oz) potatoes, cut into large cubes ?&#?&#400 grams ( 14.1 oz) cauliflower, cut into large cubes ?&#?&#Juice of 1/2 lemon?&#?&#60 milliliters (1/2 cup) milk?&#?&# ?&#?&#For topping:?&#?&#Bread croutons?&#?&#Fresh rosemary leaves?&#?&#Olive oil Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes stirring using a wooden spoon from time to time until soft. ?&#?&#2- Stir in the grated garlic, rosemary, salt, pepper, and continue cooking for 1 minute.?&#?&#3- Add the chicken broth into the pot, the potatoes, cauliflower, and stir to combine all the ingredients. Increase the heat and bring to a boil.?&#?&#4- Simmer the soup mixture for 30 minutes, or until the vegetables become tender. ?&#?&#5- Remove the pot from the heat, add the lemon juice, milk, and allow to cool for a few minutes before mixing.?&#?&#6- In a food processor, add the cauliflower mixture and mix until the texture becomes creamy and smooth. You can add more water to adjust the veloute consistency if needed.?&#?&#7- Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Return the veloute to the pot over medium heat, and simmer for 5 minutes.?&#?&#8- Divide the cauliflower and potato veloute among 4 serving plates, top with bread croutons, rosemary fresh leaves, and olive oil. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/789-cauliflower-and-potato-veloute-%d8%b4%d8%b1%d8%a8%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%b4%d9%8a%d9%81%d9%84%d9%88%d8%b1-%d9%88%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%a8%d8%b7%d8%a7%d8%b7%d8%b3/ 30 minutes
10 minutes 1 liter Easy Soups May 2, 2020 788- Chicken Broth https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Broth-007.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Chicken carcass ?&#?&#1 large carrot, peeled and cut into slices?&#?&#1 small onion, quartered?&#?&#1 red pepper, cut in half?&#?&#1 medium zucchini, cut in half?&#?&#3 garlic cloves, peeled?&#?&#2 tablespoons freshly chopped parsley ?&#?&#2 sprigs fresh rosemary leaves?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#1 1/2 liters (5 cups) water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot over medium heat, combine all the ingredients together. Add water to generously cover the chicken carcass.?&#?&#2- Cover the pot and cook on high heat for 1 hour.?&#?&#3- Strain the chicken broth into a large bowl, add more salt as desired, and allow to cool completely.?&#?&#4- Put the chicken broth in a tight-fitting glass container and store for up to 4 days in the refrigerator, or freeze for up to 1 month. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/788-chicken-broth-%d9%85%d8%b1%d9%82-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%af%d8%ac%d8%a7%d8%ac/ 1 hour
30 minutes
Easy Fish Feb 20, 2020 770- Thai Soup Simplified https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/435-2020-02-CWA-Soup-011.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 grams (3.5 oz.) whole wheat asian noodles?&#250 grams (8.8 oz.) chicken breast?&#250 grams (8.8 oz.) peeled shrimps?&#200 grams (7 oz.) canned mushrooms, drained?&#200 mililiters (1 cup) coconut milk?&#50 grams (1/4 cups) butter?&#1 onion, finely chopped?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#2 tablespoon soy sauce?&#1 tablespoon fish sauce (Nuoc Mam)?&#Juice of half lemon?&#1.5 liter (6 cups) fish stock (or water mixed with a fish bouillon cube)?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro and parsley mixed?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro Directions :?&#?&#1- Over medium heat, melt the butter in a large non-stick pan. Add the chopped onion and salt. Cook for two minutes.?&#2- Add the chicken and the canned mushrooms to the pan and cook for 15 minutes until the chicken is almost cooked.?&#3- Add the shrimp and continue cooking for a couple of minutes.?&#4- Add 1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro and parsley mixed, continue cooking for a minute, and set aside.?&#5- On medium heat, bring the fish stock to a boil. Place the noodles and cook for a few minutes (per package instructions).?&#6- Add the chicken and shrimp mixture. Season with salt and pepper, add the soy sauce, the fish sauce, and the coconut milk. Mix and cook for 5 minutes.?&#7- Finish off with 1 tablespoon of finely chopped cilantro and a bit of lemon juice. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/770-thai-soup-simplified/ 20 minutes
15 minutes 4 persons Easy Carrefour Maroc May 21, 2019 722- Pumpkin Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2019-04-pumpkinSoup-014.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#400 grams (14 oz.) pumpkin?&#?&#4 leek sticks?&#?&#2 medium carrots?&#?&#1 medium onion, roughly chopped?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon fresh ginger, grated?&#?&#4 cilantro branches?&#?&#4 tablespoons cream cheese?&#?&#A pinch of coriander powder?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a saucepan, over high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and garlic and saute for 5 minutes while stirring from time to time. Add the ginger and cook for an additional 5 minutes?&#?&#2- Cut the green parts of the leek off. Only use the white part?&#?&#3- Cut the carrots, pumpkin, and leek to medium size cubes?&#?&#4- Add the vegetables to the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes. Add a pinch of coriander powder, salt and pepper and stir?&#?&#5- Add the cilantro branches. Cover the vegetables with hot water. Cover the saucepan and cook for 20 minutes or until the carrot becomes soft when poked with a fork?&#?&#6- Once the vegetables are cooked, set the pan aside and let it cool down for a few minutes before blending?&#?&#7- Remove the cilantro branches. Pour everything in the blender. Add the cream cheese and blend until you get a smooth and creamy texture. Add hot water if necessary to get the desired consistency. Taste and adjust the seasoning?&#?&#8- Pour the soup back into the saucepan and bring it to a boiling point?&#?&#9- Take the soup off the heat and serve immediately https://www.cookingwithalia.com/722-pumpkin-soup/ 30 minutes
15 minutes 8 people Medium Soups Jan 5, 2019 702- Harira https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/Harira_Top_Styling-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 grams beef meat, cut into small cubes?&#2 tomatoes?&#1 onion, finely chopped?&#50 grams chickpeas (1.8 oz.)?&#50 grams lentils (1.8 oz.)?&#30 grams rice (1 oz.)?&#2 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro?&#2 tablespoon finely chopped fresh celery leaves?&#2 tablespoons tomato paste?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper, to taste?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#5 tablespoons flour?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the ingredients?&#1- Place the dried chickpeas in a bowl and cover them with water. Let them soak overnight.?&#2- Remove the soaked chickpeas from water and use your fingers to pinch the chickpeas and remove the peel.?&#3- Cut the tomatoes in half and remove the seeds. Using a medium hole grater, grate the tomatoes, then discard the skin.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the Harira?&#4- In a large pot over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the finely chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add the meat cubes and cook for another 2 minutes until they get slightly brown.?&#5- Add 2 tablespoons of water, ground ginger, ground turmeric, pepper, salt, grated tomatoes, half of the finely chopped parsley, cilantro, and celery leaves.?&#6- Mix all the ingredients, and cook for a few minutes.?&#7- Add 1 liter of water, cover the pot, and bring the water to a boiling point.?&#8- Add the chickpeas, cover the pot, and cook them for 20 minutes.?&#9- Add the lentils, cover the pot, and continue cooking for another 15 minutes.?&#10- In a bowl, place the tomato paste, add some water and mix to dilute the paste.?&#11- Add the diluted tomato paste to the pot along with 1 liter of water and continue cooking for 5 minutes.?&#12- To thicken the soup, combine the flour and water in a bowl, this mixture is called “Tedouira”. Whisk until the flour is completely dissolved and set aside.?&#13- Add the remaining chopped parsley, cilantro, celery leaves, rice, and half of the flour mixture (Tedouira) in the Harira pot. Stir until all the ingredients are well combined.?&#14- Cover the pot, cook on high-heat for 15 minutes while stirring regularly. You will notice the soup getting thicker. You can control the thickness of the soup depending to your taste by adding more or less of the Tedouira mixture. Serve the Harira hot with a wedge of lemon, dates, and Chebakia. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/702-harira/ 1 hour
5 minutes 4 bowls Easy Soups Oct 4, 2018 690- White Hessoua (Oats or Barley Milk Soup) https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/WhiteSoup_Front_Styling_435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 grams (1 cup) steel-cut oats or barley?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#Salt, to taste?&#500 ml (2 cups) water?&#250 ml (1 cup) milk?&#Dried thyme for decoration and flavor Directions :?&#?&#1- On medium high heat, in a large saucepan, add water, salt, and olive oil. Once the water is hot, add the oats or the barley.?&#2- Bring the mixture to a boil and continue cooking for 15 minutes or so until the soup becomes thick.?&#3- Add the milk.?&#4- Reduce the heat to medium-low and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, for around 10 minutes.?&#5- Serve the soup hot and for more flavor crush some dried thyme on top! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/690-white-hessoua-oats-milk-soup/ 40 minutes

15 minutes 4 persons Easy Carrefour Maroc May 21, 2019 722- Pumpkin Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/2019-04-pumpkinSoup-014.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#400 grams (14 oz.) pumpkin?&#?&#4 leek sticks?&#?&#2 medium carrots?&#?&#1 medium onion, roughly chopped?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon fresh ginger, grated?&#?&#4 cilantro branches?&#?&#4 tablespoons cream cheese?&#?&#A pinch of coriander powder?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a saucepan, over high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and garlic and saute for 5 minutes while stirring from time to time. Add the ginger and cook for an additional 5 minutes?&#?&#2- Cut the green parts of the leek off. Only use the white part?&#?&#3- Cut the carrots, pumpkin, and leek to medium size cubes?&#?&#4- Add the vegetables to the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes. Add a pinch of coriander powder, salt and pepper and stir?&#?&#5- Add the cilantro branches. Cover the vegetables with hot water. Cover the saucepan and cook for 20 minutes or until the carrot becomes soft when poked with a fork?&#?&#6- Once the vegetables are cooked, set the pan aside and let it cool down for a few minutes before blending?&#?&#7- Remove the cilantro branches. Pour everything in the blender. Add the cream cheese and blend until you get a smooth and creamy texture. Add hot water if necessary to get the desired consistency. Taste and adjust the seasoning?&#?&#8- Pour the soup back into the saucepan and bring it to a boiling point?&#?&#9- Take the soup off the heat and serve immediately https://www.cookingwithalia.com/722-pumpkin-soup/ 30 minutes
15 minutes 8 people Medium Soups Jan 5, 2019 702- Harira https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/Harira_Top_Styling-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#100 grams beef meat, cut into small cubes?&#2 tomatoes?&#1 onion, finely chopped?&#50 grams chickpeas (1.8 oz.)?&#50 grams lentils (1.8 oz.)?&#30 grams rice (1 oz.)?&#2 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro?&#2 tablespoon finely chopped fresh celery leaves?&#2 tablespoons tomato paste?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper, to taste?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#5 tablespoons flour?&#4 tablespoons olive oil?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the ingredients?&#1- Place the dried chickpeas in a bowl and cover them with water. Let them soak overnight.?&#2- Remove the soaked chickpeas from water and use your fingers to pinch the chickpeas and remove the peel.?&#3- Cut the tomatoes in half and remove the seeds. Using a medium hole grater, grate the tomatoes, then discard the skin.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the Harira?&#4- In a large pot over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the finely chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add the meat cubes and cook for another 2 minutes until they get slightly brown.?&#5- Add 2 tablespoons of water, ground ginger, ground turmeric, pepper, salt, grated tomatoes, half of the finely chopped parsley, cilantro, and celery leaves.?&#6- Mix all the ingredients, and cook for a few minutes.?&#7- Add 1 liter of water, cover the pot, and bring the water to a boiling point.?&#8- Add the chickpeas, cover the pot, and cook them for 20 minutes.?&#9- Add the lentils, cover the pot, and continue cooking for another 15 minutes.?&#10- In a bowl, place the tomato paste, add some water and mix to dilute the paste.?&#11- Add the diluted tomato paste to the pot along with 1 liter of water and continue cooking for 5 minutes.?&#12- To thicken the soup, combine the flour and water in a bowl, this mixture is called “Tedouira”. Whisk until the flour is completely dissolved and set aside.?&#13- Add the remaining chopped parsley, cilantro, celery leaves, rice, and half of the flour mixture (Tedouira) in the Harira pot. Stir until all the ingredients are well combined.?&#14- Cover the pot, cook on high-heat for 15 minutes while stirring regularly. You will notice the soup getting thicker. You can control the thickness of the soup depending to your taste by adding more or less of the Tedouira mixture. Serve the Harira hot with a wedge of lemon, dates, and Chebakia. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/702-harira/ 1 hour

Once the water is hot, add the oats or the barley.?&#2- Bring the mixture to a boil and continue cooking for 15 minutes or so until the soup becomes thick.?&#3- Add the milk.?&#4- Reduce the heat to medium-low and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, for around 10 minutes.?&#5- Serve the soup hot and for more flavor crush some dried thyme on top! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/690-white-hessoua-oats-milk-soup/ 40 minutes
15 minutes 4 bowls Medium Kiri Maroc Feb 6, 2018 641- Algerian White Chorba https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/435-DSC_5357.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#3 Kiri cheese portions?&#150 grams (5.3 oz) chicken breast, cut into small pieces?&#1 onion, chopped?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon butter?&#1 cinnamon stick?&#1 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#1/2 teaspoon of pepper, to taste?&#100 grams (3.5 oz) chickpeas, soaked the day before in water?&#40 grams (1.4 oz) of vermicelli?&#1 egg yolk?&#2 tablespoons chopped parsley?&#Juice of 1 lemon?&#750 milliliters (3 cups) water Directions :?&#?&#1– In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil and melt the butter, then saute the onion with salt and pepper for 3 minutes while stirring regularly.?&#2- Add the chicken pieces with the cinnamon stick and continue cooking for 5 minutes while stirring regularly.?&#3- Add the chickpeas and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover the pan and cook for 30 minutes.?&#4- Add the vermicelli and water if necessary to the pan, then cover it again and continue cooking for about 10 minutes until the chickpeas cook and become tender and the vermicelli cooked.?&#5- Place the Kiri cheese portions in a bowl and mix with a spoon until you have a smooth texture.?&#6- Add the yolk, parsley and lemon juice to the Kiri cheese and mix until you have a homogeneous mixture.?&#7- Take 3 tablespoons of cooking water from the pan and mix with the Kiri cheese mixture.?&#8- Pour the Kiri mixture into the saucepan, mix and cook for 1 minute.?&#9- Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/641-algerian-white-chorba/ 35 minutes

Mix, bring the water to a boil and cook for 15 minutes until the potato pieces are tender.?&#5- Remove the bay leaves, drain the vegetables and keep the cooking water, place them in a bowl, add the portions of Kiri cheese and mix with a plunging blender leaving a few pieces of unmixed potato and corn .?&#6- Add the cooking water little by little while mixing with a wooden spatula until you obtain the desired consistency.?&#7- Put back in the saucepan, add the cut mussels, and bring to a boil for 2 minutes. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/638-american-mussel-soup/ 30 minutes

45 minutes 6 bowls Easy Soups Jun 6, 2017 513- Grilled Eggplant Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Eggplant-Soup-Final-Picture-1-e1497790941774.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 large eggplants?&#2 medium carrots?&#1 medium potato?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil + a little bit to brush the eggplants?&#1 tablespoon of butter?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/2 teaspoon of pepper?&#1 clove of garlic?&#750ml of water?&#1 jar of natural yogurt Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel the eggplant, carrots, and potato. Cut the eggplant into slices and the carrots and potato into small cubes.?&#2- Place the eggplant slices in a baking pan covered with parchment paper, brush with olive oil and bake at 200 °C / 392°F for 20 minutes.?&#?&#3- In a soup pot over medium heat, place the cut carrots and potato, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, butter, salt and pepper. Peel the garlic, chop it and add it.?&#4- Cover with 750 ml of water and cook for 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.?&#?&#5- Remove from the pot, drain the vegetables while preserving the cooking water.?&#?&#6- Place in a large bowl the pieces of carrots and potatoes, the grilled eggplant rounds and the yogurt. Mix using a hand mixer until you have a smooth puree and no lumps. Add the cooking water gradually while continuing to mix until you get the desired consistency. If you no longer have cooking water and do not have the desired consistency, add water.?&#?&#7- Pour the soup back into the pot and bring it to a boil for 2 minutes.?&#?&#Serve hot. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/513-grilled-eggplant-soup/
1 hour 8 bowls Medium Soups Jun 5, 2017 512- Harira Soup with Vegetables https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Harira-Final-Pictures-1-e1497790182638.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#INGREDIENTS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#1 medium carrot?&#1 medium potato?&#1 small onion?&#1/4 white cabbage?&#70 grams (2,5 oz) of chickpeas, soaked in water overnight?&#50 grams (1,8 oz) of beef, cubed?&#2 teaspoons of pepper?&#2 teaspoons of salt (to be adjusted according to taste)?&#2 teaspoons of ground ginger?&#1/2 teaspoon of ground turmeric?&#2 tablespoons of butter?&#1 bunch of coriander?&#3 celery sticks?&#1.5 liters of water?&#50 grams (1,8 oz) of lentils?&#2 medium tomatoes?&#2 tablespoons of chopped parsley?&#50 grams (1,8 oz) of vermicelli?&#2 tablespoons of tomato concentrate?&#?&#——————————————————————————————–?&#?&#INGRÉDIENTS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#1 carotte moyenne?&#1 pomme de terre moyenne?&#1 petit oignon?&#1/4 chou blanc?&#70 grammes de pois chiches, placés dans de l’eau toute une nuit?&#50 grammes de viande de boeuf, coupée en cubes?&#2 cuillères à café de poivre?&#2 cuillères à café de sel (à ajuster selon le goût)?&#2 cuillères à café de gingembre en poudre?&#1/2 cuillère curcuma en poudre?&#2 cuillères à soupe de beurre?&#1 bouquet de coriandre?&#3 branches de céleri?&#1,5 litre d’eau?&#50 grammes de lentille?&#2 tomates moyennes?&#2 cuillères à soupe de persil haché?&#50 grammes de vermicelle?&#2 cuillères à soupe de concentré de tomate Directions :?&#?&#DIRECTIONS IN ENGLISH:?&#?&#1- Peel the carrot, the potato, and the onion. Cut the carrot and the potato into small cubes, the onion in 4, and the white cabbage into strips.?&#2- In a soup pot over medium heat, place the chickpeas, the meat, 1/2 teaspoon of pepper, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of ground ginger, 1/4 teaspoon of ground turmeric and 1 tablespoon of butter. Mix.?&#?&#3- Place the cut vegetables, the coriander bunch, and the celery in a steaming basket. Put it in the soup pot on the chickpeas and the meat.?&#?&#4- Cover with 1 liter of water, close the soup pot and cook for 20 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and well cooked.?&#5- Open the soup pot, remove the steaming basket, then add the lentils to the pot. Close it again and let it cook for 15 minutes.?&#6- Place the vegetables and herbs in a bowl and mix them with a hand blender until you get a smooth puree.?&#?&#7- Cut the tomatoes in half widthwise, remove the seeds and grate them.?&#8- In a large pot, place the grated tomatoes, 1 teaspoon of pepper, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, 1/4 teaspoon of ground turmeric, 1 teaspoon of butter and the chopped parsley. Cover with 0.5 liter of water. Place the pot over medium heat.?&#?&#9- Bring to a boil, then add the vermicelli. Mix and cook for 10 minutes until the vermicelli is cooked.?&#?&#10- Add the vegetables puree and the chickpeas, meat, and lentils mixture. Mix and cook together for 5 minutes.?&#?&#Serve hot!?&#?&#————————————————————————————————————-?&#?&#DIRECTIONS EN FRANÇAIS:?&#?&#1- Epluchez la carotte, la pomme de terre et l’oignon. Coupez la carotte et la pomme de terre en petits cubes, l’oignon en 4, et le chou blanc en lamelles.?&#2- Dans une cocotte sur feu moyen, placez les pois chiches, la viande, 1/2 cuillère à café de poivre, 1/2 cuillère à café de sel, 1/2 cuillère à café de gingembre en poudre, 1/4 cuillère à café curcuma en poudre et 1 cuillère à soupe de beurre. Mélangez.?&#3- Déposez les légumes coupés ainsi que le bouquet de coriandre et les branches de céleri dans une grille de cuisson. Placez-la dans la cocotte sur les pois chiches et la viande.?&#4- Couvrez avec 1 litre d’eau, fermez la cocotte et laissez cuire 20 minutes, jusqu’à ce que les légumes soient tendres et bien cuits.?&#5- Ouvrez la cocotte, retirez la grille de cuisson, puis ajoutez les lentilles à la cocotte. Fermez-la de nouveau et laissez cuire 15 minutes.?&#6- Placez les légumes et les herbes dans un bol et mixez-les à l’aide d’un mixeur plongeant jusqu’à ce que vous obteniez une purée lisse.?&#7- Coupez les tomates en deux dans le sens de la largeur, retirez leurs les pépins et râpez-les?&#8- Dans une marmite, placez les tomates râpées, 1 cuillère à café de poivre, 1 cuillère à café de sel, 1 cuillère à café de gingembre moulu, 1/4 cuillère à café curcuma en poudre, 1 cuillère à café de beurre et le persil haché. Couvrez avec 0,5 l d’eau. Placez la marmite sur feu moyen.?&#9- Portez à ébullition, puis ajoutez-y la vermicelle. Mélangez et laissez cuire 10 minutes le temps que la vermicelle soit cuite.?&#10- Ajoutez la purée de fruits et le mélange pois chiches, viande et lentilles. Mélangez et cuisez ensemble 5 minutes.?&#Servez chaud! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/512-harira-vegetables/
10 minutes 2 Easy Soups May 26, 2017 500- Barley Tomato Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Hssoua-Final-Picture-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#250 grams (1 1/4 cups) barley?&#2 tablespoon olive oil?&#1 small onion, grated?&#2 small tomatoes, grated and skin discarded?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped parsley?&#2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#1 tablespoon tomato paste?&#700 ml (3 cups) water Directions :?&#?&#1- In a large pot, combine the olive oil, onion, tomatoes, parsley, cilantro, turmeric, salt, and pepper.?&#?&#2- Mix the ingredients and cook over medium heat, for around 5 minutes or until the onion becomes soft.?&#?&#3- Add the water.?&#4- Add the barley and tomato paste.?&#?&#5- Mix all the ingredients, cover the pot, and bring the mixture to a boil.?&#6- Then lower the heat and allow the soup to simmer gently for around 50 minutes, while stirring frequently, until the barley becomes tender and the mixture thickens.?&#Serve hot! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/500-barley-tomato-soup/ 1 hour

Then lower the heat and allow the soup to simmer gently for around 20 minutes, while stirring frequently, until the semolina becomes tender and the mixture thickens.?&#?&#4- Add the milk.?&#?&#5- Continue cooking on medium heat, for about 10 minutes, while stirring constantly until the soup reaches desired consistency. 30 minutes 4 Medium Soups May 25, 2017 497- Harira Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/IMG_1218-001.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Ingredients for the soup base:?&#150 grams (5 oz.) lamb meat, cut into small cubes?&#A handful of dried chickpeas, soaked overnight and peeled?&#A handful of dried lentils?&#4 medium tomatoes, peeled and pureed?&#1 medium onion, grated?&#1 tablespoon very finely chopped flat-leaf parsley?&#1 tablespoon very finely chopped cilantro ?&#1 tablespoon very finely chopped celery leaves?&#1 teaspoon turmeric?&#1 teaspoon pepper?&#2 teaspoon salt?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1 teaspoon smen (optional)?&#1 liter (4 cups) water?&#?&#Additional ingredients:?&#3 tablespoons tomato paste?&#2 tablespoons very finely chopped flat-leaf parsley and cilantro, mixed?&#500 ml (2 cups) water?&#1/4 cup uncooked broken vermicelli?&#?&#Ingredients for tedouira:?&#110 grams (1/2 cup) all-purpose white flour?&#500 ml (2 cups) lukewarm water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Ahead of time?&#1- The night before, soak the dried chickpeas in water.?&#2- Once the chickpeas become soft, peel them. To save time, soak and peel a large amount of chickpeas, then place them in an airtight container and freeze them!?&#Note: You can use canned chickpeas drained from their water; however, don’t add them to the soup until the end along with the vermicelli.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the soup base?&#3- Place all the ingredients of the soup base except water (lamb, chickpeas, lentils, tomato, onion, herbs, spices, and smen) in a pressure cooker or a large pot.?&#?&#4- Over medium heat, cook, uncovered, for 5 minutes stirring from time to time.?&#?&#5- Add 1 liter (4 cups) of water to the thick mixture, cover the pot, and cook over high heat until pressure is achieved. Then reduce the heat to medium and continue cooking for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and release the pressure.?&#Note: if you are using a regular pot instead of a pressure cooker, you may have to cook the soup for longer.?&#?&#6- Now, add the tomato paste and extra chopped parsley and cilantro. Add 500 ml (2 cups) of water and mix. Cover the pot and continue cooking for another 15 minutes. ?&#?&#Step 3: Thickening the soup?&#7- To make the soup thickener (tedouira), combine the flour and 500 ml of lukewarm water in a bowl. Whisk until the flour is completely dissolved and set aside.?&#?&#8- Back to the harira pot. Reduce the heat to medium, release the pressure, and open the pressure cooker. Check on the harira, the meat and chickpeas should be cooked. If so, on medium heat, slowly add the tedouira little by little while constantly stirring. You will notice the soup getting thicker. You can control the thickness of the soup depending to your taste by adding more or less of the tedouira.?&#?&#Step 4: Final steps?&#9- About 10 minutes before serving, heat the harira over medium heat. Once the soup starts simmering, add the broken vermicelli to the soup and cook about 5 minutes until the noodles become soft.?&#?&#10- Serve harira hot with a wedge of lemon and along with dates and chebakiya. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/497-harira/ 1 Hour
15 minutes 4 Easy Soups Dec 27, 2016 463- Pumpkin Apple Pear Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/rsz_pumpkinsoup.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#500g pumpkin, cut in chunks?&#?&#1 large apple?&#?&#1 large pea?&#?&#1 small onion?&#?&#2 garlic cloves?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#2 tablespoon olive oil?&#?&#850ml water?&#?&#1 small chicken cube?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste Directions :?&#?&#1- Cut the pumpkin in half, remove the seeds, and peel the skin. Chop the pumpkin meat into cubes.?&#2- Peel the apple and pear. Cut in chunks.?&#3- Grate the garlic cloves.?&#4- On medium heat, drizzle the olive oil in a deep pot, on medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.?&#5- Add the pumpkin chunks, apple and pear.?&#6- Add the spices: ground cinnamon, ground ginger, salt, and pepper.?&#7- Mix and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.?&#8- Add the water to the pot and crush the chicken cube into it. Cover the pot, increase the heat to medium-high, and cook for 20 minutes or until the pumpkin becomes soft.?&#9- Drain the pumpkin, apple, and pear from the water and place in a food processor. Add a little bit of the cookin water and mix until you get a smooth mixture. Adjust the texture of the soup by adding more cooking water.?&#10- Reheat the mixed soup and add salt and pepper to your taste. Serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/463-pumpkin-apple-pear-soup/ 30 minutes

Once hot, add the chopped onion, grated tomato, and lentils. Mix.?&#2- Add the chopped parsley and continue mixing.?&#3- Add the spices: paprika, salt, and pepper.?&#4- Mix and cook on medium heat for around 10 minutes.?&#5- Add boiling water to the lentils, cover the pan, and cook for 30 minutes. Very easy Soups Feb 27, 2015 069 – Harira – Traditional Moroccan Soup https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/691.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 large tomatoes – peeled and pureed?&#1 onion – chopped?&#1/3 cup of finely chopped cilantro?&#1/3 cup of finely chopped parsley?&#1 celery stick – chopped?&#2 tablespoons of tomato paste?&#2 tablespoons of butter?&#3 teaspoons of salt?&#1/2 teaspoon of pepper?&#1 teaspoon of ginger powder?&#1 can of chickpeas (or 1 cup of dry chickpeas soaked in water over night)?&#1/2 cup of lentils (soaked in water for 1 hour)?&#1/3 cup of vermicelli?&#1/3 cup of flour?&#2 liters of water Directions :?&#?&#Add the tomatoes, onion, cilantro, parsley, celery, butter, salt, pepper, ginger powder, lentils, and water in your cooking pan. Cover the cooking pan and let all the ingredients cook for 45 minutes on medium heat. Stir from time to time. Note: If you are using dry chickpeas, add them to the other ingredients in step 1. Otherwise, if you are using canned chickpeas, add them towards the end. Also, if you would like to add meat to the harira, add 1 cup of meat cubes to the other ingredients in step 1.?&#After 45 minutes, add the canned chickpeas and the tomato paste.?&#Dilute the flour with some water. Slowly pour the flour mixture to the harira while stirring.?&#Add the vermicelli. Cover and let the harira cook for another 10 minutes.?&#?&#Serving: You can serve the harira with dates. Enjoy! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/harira-traditional-moroccan-soup/

You can adjust the texture of the soup based on the amount of vegetable broth you use to puree the vegetables.?&#Bring back the soup to the pan, add the cream, salt, and pepper and cook for another 5 minutes without covering the pan.?&#?&#Serving:?&#?&#Serve the soup hot.
