4 Very easy Desserts Feb 24, 2015 281 – Homemade pumpkin puree recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_281.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&# ?&#?&#1 small sugar pumpkin or buttercup squash?&#microwavable plate and plastic wrap Directions :?&#?&#Preparing the Ingredients?&#1- Make sure that you have a sharp knife. Trace the small pumpkin with the knife all around, then get deeper and deeper, until you are able to cut the pumpkin in half.?&#2- Using a spoon, scoop all the seeds and fibers from the center of the pumpkin. You could make roasted pumpkin seeds by cleaning the seeds, drying them, then roasting them in the oven. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/homemade-pumpkin-puree-recipe/
4 Very easy Fish Feb 24, 2015 Homemade Fish Stock https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_easy_fish_stock.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#10 black peppercorns?&#2 garlic cloves (whole)?&#3 bay leaves?&#4 spring onions?&#2 leeks?&#1 large carrot (roughly chopped)?&#1 pound (500 grams) fish head?&#4-5 prawn heads?&#A bunch of fresh parsley?&#1/4 teaspoon salt?&#8 cups (2 liters) water?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#2 ملعقة كبيرة من زيت الزيتون?&#10 من حبوب الفلفل الأسود?&#2 من فصوص الثوم (كامل)?&#3 أوراق الغار?&#4 البصل الأخضر?&#2 الكرات?&#جزرة كبيرة (مقطعة تقريبا)?&#1 بوند (500 جرام) رأس السمك?&#4-5 رؤوس الجمبري?&#حزمه بقدونس طازجة?&#1/4 ملعقة صغيرة من الملح?&#8 أكواب (2 لتر) ماء?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] Directions :?&#?&#[alia_english]1- Heat large pot over medium heat. Add olive oil, peppercorns, garlic, and bay leaves. Saute for a few minutes.?&#2- Add spring onions and leeks. Saute for a few minutes.?&#3- Add the carrot (roughly chopped), fish head, and prawn heads. Continue to saute for 5 minutes.?&#4- Add fresh parsley and water. Cover the pot and cook on medium-high heat until the water start boiling.?&#5- Once the water reaches a boiling point, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer for 10 minutes.?&#6- Strain the broth (so you only get the liquid. you can discard the rest of the ingredients.)?&#7- Use immediately or refrigerate for 2-3 days.[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#تحضير الوصفة:?&#?&#احضر وعاء كبير وضعه على نار متوسطة الحرارة. ثم قم بإضافة زيت الزيتون، حبوب الفلفل الاسود، الثوم، وأوراق الغار. واتركهم حتى يقلى لبضع دقائق.?&#ثم قم بإضافة البصل والكرات الأخضر. وقم بقليهم لبضع دقائق.?&#وبعد ذلك قم بإضافة جزرة (مقطعة تقريبا)، و رؤوس السمك، ورؤوس الجمبري. نواصل قلي المكونات لمدة 5 دقائق.?&#و قم بإضافة البقدونس الطازج والماء. ثم قم بتغطية الوعاء ودعه يطهى على نار أعلى من المتوسطة حتى يبدأ الماء فى الغليان.?&#بمجرد أن يصل الماء إلى درجة الغليان،قم بتقليل الحرارة إلى متوسطة، واترك المكونات على نار خفيفة لمدة 10 دقائق.?&#ثم قم بتصفية المرقة (بحيث تحصل فقط على السائل.و يتم التخلص من بقية المكونات.)?&#يستخدم الحساءعلى الفور أو يمكنك وضعه في الثلاجة لمدة 2-3 أيام.?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] https://www.cookingwithalia.com/homemade-fish-stock/
1 very easy Tips Feb 24, 2015 How to blanch almonds! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_how_to_blanch_almonds.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#Whole raw almonds?&#water?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#اللوز الطرى بالكامل?&#ماء?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] Directions :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#Step 1: Blanching Almonds?&#1- In a saucepan, boil some water.?&#2- Place your raw almonds into the boiling water, reduce the heat to low, and let them boil for 1-2 minutes… just 1-2 minutes if any longer, the almonds will start to soften.?&#3- Drain the almonds from the water and place them on a kitchen towel?&#4- Rub the almonds with the kitchen towel and you will see that the skin magically gets removed from the almonds. You can also use your fingers to gently squeeze the almonds and loosen the skin from them. But the kitchen towel is more efficient for a batch of almonds!?&#5- And that’s it! The almonds are blanched and ready to use in your recipe!?&#?&#Step 2: Frying Almonds?&#1- Many Moroccan recipes call for fried almonds. All you have to do is heat some vegetable oil in a frying pan on medium heat.?&#2- After the oil is hot, drop the blanched almonds in the pan. You can test if the oil is ready by dropping one almond; if you see tiny bubbles rise around it then the oil is good to go!?&#3- Fry the almonds stirring constantly until they get a beautiful golden brown color.?&#4- As soon as the almonds are colored transfer them into a plate covered with paper towel to absorb excess oil. The almonds are very hot and will continue to darken a bit – that’s why you want to remove them from the oil as soon as they get colored or they would burn!?&#5- And that’s it! Let the fried almonds cool down before using them!?&#?&#Bon Appetit!?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#الخطوة الأولى: تقشير اللوز?&#?&#في إناء قم بوضع بعض الماء واتركه حتى يغلى.?&#ضع اللوز الخام في الماء المغلي، ثم قلل النار واجعل الحرارة منخفضة، واترك اللوز يغلي لمدة 1-2 دقائق … 1-2 دقائق فقط، إن ترك لفترة أطول، وسوف يبدأ اللوز يليين.?&#ثم قم بتصفية اللوز من الماء ووضعه على منشفة المطبخ?&#ثم قم بفرك اللوز بمنشفة المطبخ وسوف ترى أن الجلد يتم إزالته من اللوز. يمكنك أيضا استخدام أصابعك للضغط بلطف على اللوز ذلك للتخلص من جلده . ولكن منشفة المطبخ هى أكثر كفاءة لمجموعة من اللوز!?&#وهذا كل شيء! ويصبح اللوز ابيض ويصبح جاهز للاستخدام في وصفتك!?&#?&#الخطوة الثانية: قلي اللوز?&#?&#العديد من الوصفات المغربية تحتاج الى اللوز المقلي. كل ما عليك القيام به هو تسخين بعض الزيت النباتي في مقلاة على نار متوسطة الحرارة.?&#بعد ان يصبح الزيت ساخن، قم إسقاط اللوز المقشر في المقلاة. يمكنك اختبار إذا كان الزيت جاهز وذلك من خلال إسقاط لوزة واحدة فى الزيت إذا رأيت ارتفاع فقاعات صغيرة من حوله إذا الزيت اصبح جاهز!?&#يقلى اللوز مع التقليب باستمرار حتى يحصل على اللون البني الذهبي الجميل.?&#حالما يحصل اللوز على لونه يجب نقله إلى طبق مغطى بمنشفة ورقية لامتصاص الزيت الزائد. اللوز أصبح ساخن جدا، وسوف يستمر فى التغميق قليلا – لهذا السبب يجب إزالته من الزيت بأسرع وقت عندما يحصل على لونه أو أنه سوف يحترق!?&#وهذا كل شيء! دع اللوز المقلي يبرد قبل استخدامها!?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] https://www.cookingwithalia.com/how-to-blanch-almonds/
4 Easy Breads Feb 24, 2015 Alia’s Tips: Easy No-Knead Pizza Dough https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_no-knead_pizza_dough.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#3 3/4 cups (500 grams) all-purpose white flour?&#1/4 teaspoon active dry yeast?&#1 1/2 teaspoon salt?&#1 1/2 cup warm water?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#3 3/4 كوب (500 غراما) من الدقيق الأبيض لجميع الأغراض?&#1/4 ملعقة صغيرة من الخميرة الجافة النشطة?&#1 1/2 ملعقة صغيرة ملح?&#1 1/2 كوب ماء دافئ?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] Directions :?&#?&#[alia_english]1- In a bowl, place the flour, add the dry yeast, and salt.?&#2- Gradually add the water. The water has to be lukewarm, if it’s cold, it would kill the yeast!?&#3- Mix the flour and water with your fingers until you get a sticky dough. You do NOT have to knead it!!!?&#4- Cover the bowl, and let the dough rise at room temperature for 12 to 18 hours, basically overnight. The dough will double in size… see how fluffy it became!?&#5- Generously flour your kitchen counter, and transfer the dough on top of the flour. Divide the dough into 2 or 3 portions, cover with flour, and roll into a ball.?&#6- Let the dough rest for 1 hour before using it! You can wrap it and refrigerate for 3 days or freeze for up to 1 month.[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#احضر وعاء ثم ضع به الدقيق، و إضف إليه الخميرة الجافة، والملح.?&#و تدريجيا قم بإضافة الماء الدافئ. يجب أن يكون الماء فاترا، لانه اذا كان بارد، فإنه يقتل الخميرة تصبح عديمة الفائدة!?&#قم بخلط الدقيق والماء بأصابعك حتى تحصل على عجينة لزجة.ويجب الا تقوم بعجن العجينة !!!?&#ثم قم بتغطية الوعاء، واتركه حتى يخمر وذلك بارتفاع العجين في درجة حرارة الغرفة لمدة 12 إلى 18 ساعة، في الأساس بين عشية وضحاها. سيتم تضاعف حجم العجين … ترى كيف أصبح زغبي!?&#ثم قم برش الدقيق بسخاء (كمية كبيرة) على طاولة المطبخ وثم انقل العجين فوق الدقيق. وقم بتقسيم وتقطيع العجينة إلى 2 أو 3 أجزاء، و قم بتغطية قطع العجين بالدقيق، ثم لف كل قطعة وتحويلها إلي كرة.?&#و اترك العجين يستريح لمدة 1 ساعة على الاقل قبل استخدامه! أو يمكنك تغليفه و وضعه في الثلاجة لمدة 3 أيام أو تجميدها وذلك بوضعها فى الفريزرلمدة تصل إلى 1 شهر.?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] https://www.cookingwithalia.com/easy-no-knead-pizza-dough/
4 Easy International Recipes Feb 24, 2015 213 – Doenjang JJigae (Soup) – Korean Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_213.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1/3 cup Asian soy bean paste / miso paste?&#4-5 dried anchovies?&#1/4 cup clams (you can use frozen clams)?&#100 grams (4 oz) sliced mushrooms?&#100 grams (4 oz) firm tofu?&#2 green onions (thinly sliced)?&#1/4 white onion (cubed)?&#1 small potato (peeled and cubed)?&#4 cups (1 liter) water?&#Soy sauce (to taste) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Making the Broth?&#1- Pour the water in a sauce pan.?&#2- Add the red bean paste to the saucepan and dilute it in the water.?&#3- Add the dried anchovies, the clams, and the potatoes to the saucepan.?&#4- Cook on medium-high heat until it reaches a boiling point. Boil for around 5 minutes.?&#5- Remove the dried anchovies from the broth and discard.?&#6- Using a spoon, remove the foam from the surface to keep a clear broth.?&#?&#Step 2: Adding the Rest of Ingredients?&#1- Add the mushrooms, the tofu, and onion cubes to the broth. Continue cooking on medium-high heat for another 10 minutes.?&#2- Add the chopped green onions and cook for another 2-4 minutes.?&#3- Serve immediately – still hot.?&#Bon Appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/doenjang-jjigae-korean-soup-2/
4 Very easy Desserts Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: Crème Fraîche Homemade Recipe https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-crme-frache-homemade-recipe/ Ingredients :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#1 tablespoon buttermilk (or plain yogurt)?&#1 cup (236 ml) heavy cream?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#1 ملعقة كبيرة من زبدة اللبن (أو الزبادي العادي)?&#1 كوب (236 مل) من الكريما الثقيلة?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] Directions :?&#?&#[alia_english]1- Add the 1 tablespoon of buttermilk to 1 cup of heavy cream. Mix with a spoon.?&#2- Cover with a plastic wrap.?&#3- Let the mixture sit on a warm place (kitchen counter, turned-off oven, etc.) for around 12-24 hours until it thickens up and becomes creme fraiche!?&#4- You can put the creme fraiche in a jar and store it in the fridge for up to 1 week. Also, another tip, if you dont have buttermilk you can just use plain yogurt.[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#تحضير الوصفة?&#?&#قم بإضافة1 ملعقة كبيرة من زبدة اللبن إلى 1 كوب من الكريما الثقيلة. واخلطهم جيدا بملعقة.?&#ثم قم بتغطية الخليط بغطاء من البلاستيك.?&#واترك الخليط يستريح في مكان دافئ (على طاولة المطبخ، و فى داخل فرن مطفى، الخ) لحوالي 12-24 ساعة حتى تثخن (تتكاثف) و تصبح الكريما الفريش (القشدة الطرية)!?&#يمكنك وضع الكريما الفريش في برطمان وتخزينها في الثلاجة لمدة تصل إلى 1 الاسبوع. وأيضا نصيحة آخرى، إذا لم يكن لديك زبدة اللبن يمكنك استخدام الزبادي العادي فقط.?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-crme-frache-homemade-recipe/
4 Easy Couscous Feb 23, 2015 Couscous in 10 minutes! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_couscous_in_10_minutes.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Uncooked couscous (500 ml) — Raw coucous, NOT half-cooked?&#Boiling water (same volume as the couscous – 500 ml)?&#Olive oil (2 tablespoons)?&#Salt (1/4 teaspoon) Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the Lentils?&#1- First, you need to measure the volume of the uncooked couscous. Here I have around 500 ml. This is an important step so do not skip it!?&#2- Place the couscous in a bowl and add olive oil. Mix well with your hands, until you feel that all the couscous grains are well coated.?&#3- Now, in the same container where you measured the couscous, put a large pinch of salt, and add boiling water until you have the exact volume as the couscous. So in my case it’s 500 ml. Remember, it’s a 1 to 1 volume ratio for couscous and water.?&#4- Add the boiling water to the couscous and immediately cover the bowl with a plate – we want to keep the steam inside!?&#5- And that’s it. Wait for 10 minutes. Then break apart and fluff the cooked couscous with a fork! The couscous is done!?&#?&#Bon Appetite https://www.cookingwithalia.com/couscous-in-10-minutes/
4 Easy Tips Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: How to Present Ice Cream Like a Chef! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_present_ice_cream_like_a_chef.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Graham crackers?&#Oreo cookies?&#Ice Cream: coffee, chocolate, and strawberry flavors?&#Mini marshmallows?&#1-2 Fresh strawberries?&#Caramel Sauce?&#Chocolate Sauce Directions :?&#?&#1- Mix the graham crackers until you get a fine powder?&#2- Remove the cream from the Oreos cookies and mix them as well.?&#3- Combine softened chocolate ice cream with mini-marshmallows.?&#4- Place the ice cream in a small cup and put it in the freezer until ready to serve.?&#5- In a cup, alternate caramel sauce with coffee ice cream.?&#6- Put the ice cream in the freezer until ready to serve.?&#7- Cut a fresh strawberry in very small pieces?&#8- And mix them with strawberry ice cream?&#9- Put the ice cream in the freezer until ready to serve.?&#10- Drizzle chocolate sauce on a white plate?&#11- Decorate with the powder of oreo cookies and graham crackers?&#12- Then place the ice cream cups?&#13- Cover the coffee ice cream and chocolate ice cream with oreo cookie powder?&#14- And cover the strawberry ice cream with graham cracker powder?&#15- Decorate with a strawberry and gummy worms.?&#That’s it! Bonne appetite! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-how-to-present-ice-cream-like-a-chef/
4 Easy Tips Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: How to Make “Fromage Blanc” https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_fromage_blanc.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 box of low fat buttermilk Directions :?&#?&#1- Place the buttermilk box in the freezer overnight. The next day, take it out from the freezer and cut the box using scissors. You will end up with a block of frozen buttermilk!?&#2- Cut off the buttermlik box and using a sharp knife, slice the frozen buttermilk into large chunks.?&#3- Place a large sieve over a bowl and place the frozen buttermilk chunks in the sieve. Cover with plastic wrap and let the frozen buttermilk melt overnight on the kitchen counter. The next day, you will find the magical “Fromage Blanc” in the sieve, while the liquid from the buttermilk dripped into the bowl.?&#4- Place the “Fromage Blanc” in an airtight container. It can be preserves in the fridge for up to 1 week.?&#5- You can eat Fromage Blanc as a dessert: by adding some sugar or honey, and serve it with fresh fruit. Or you can serve it as a savory appetizers with crackers, by mixing it with salt and drizzling some olive oil on top. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-how-to-make-fromage-blanc/
4 Easy Tips Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: How to Make Caramel Sauce! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_how_to_make_caramel_sauce.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 stick of butter (8 tablespoons)?&#1/2 cup of brown sugar?&#1/2 cup of honey?&#1 can of condensed milk (14 oz)?&#Flavoring of your choice: cinnamon, cardamom, chai mix, vanilla extract & sea salt, etc. Directions :?&#?&#Step 1:?&#1- On medium heat, place 1 stick of butter (which is 8 tablespoons), in a saucepan.?&#2- Add ½ a cup of brown sugar – notice how it is packed into the measuring cup. That’s the way you need to measure brown sugar.?&#3- Then add ½ a cup of honey.?&#4- Mix well and let the butter, sugar, and honey cook on medium heat until they start boiling.?&#5- Once the mixture start boiling, stir constantly, and let it boil for 2 minutes.?&#?&#Step 2:?&#1- Reduce the heat to low-medium, and add 1 can, which is 14 ounces, of condensed milk. I am using fat free condensed milk as we are already using butter!?&#2- Now the fun part! Flavor your caramel with the spice of your choice: Cardamom, Chai mix, or vanilla and sea salt!?&#3- Let the caramel cook on low-medium heat for 3 minutes while stirring constantly. Do not let it boil.?&#?&#Step 3:?&#1- And that’s it! Pour your caramel in a jar and store it in the fridge. If you need warm caramel, just microwave the amount you need before using it. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-how-to-make-caramel-sauce/
4 Easy Tips Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: How to Cut a Pomegranate https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_how_to_cut_a_pomegranate.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Pomegranates Directions :?&#?&#How can we choose a good pomegranate??&#1- The fruit should be as brightly colored as possible, it has to have a ‘healthy look’. Also, choose a pomegranate that is large, which mean it has a higher portion of pulp.?&#2- The pomegranate should also be heavy, which means that it will have more juice.?&#3- Finally, look at the skin and make sure that it is hard, red, and shiny, with no cracks.?&#4- Now we are going to cut the pomegranate without making a mess.?&#5- First, using a sharp knife, quarter the pomegranate.?&#6- Place the pomegranate quarters in a large bowl of water. Using your hand, start getting the pomegranate seeds, out from their skin – under water of course, so you avoid juice staining.?&#7- You will notice that the pomegranate seeds will sink to the bottom, while the white membrane will be floating to the top.?&#8- Skim off the white membrane with your hand.?&#?&#Step 2:?&#1- Now all you have to do is drain the water from the pomegranate seeds using a sieve.?&#2- Serve the pomegranate as is, in a juice, in a salad, or in many other recipes.?&#And That’s it – until next time! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-how-to-cut-a-pomegranate/
4 Easy Tips Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: How to Make Palmiers or Elephant Ears Cookies! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_how_to_make_palmiers_or_elephant_ears_cookies.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Puff Pastry Sheet?&#White sugar?&#Ground cinnamon (or another sweet spice of your choice such as cardamom or vanilla sugar) Directions :?&#?&#1- First you need Puff Pastry – you can find it in the frozen section of your supermarket. I always leave a pack or 2 in my freezer just in case I need to make a quick snack.?&#2- Roll out the puff pastry. If you bought frozen puff pastry you have to thaw it before using it but it should still be cold otherwise it will become sticky.?&#3- Using a sharp knife, cut the sides of the puff pastry to get an even rectangle.?&#4- Sprinkle sugar all over the puff pastry. You can also dust cinnamon or another spice of your choice like cardamom or vanilla sugar.?&#5- Roll the bottom side of the puff pastry towards the center, then roll the upper side. Roll again both sides until they meet in the center.?&#6- To make an egg wash, just mix 1 egg yolk with some water. Brush the top of the pastry with the egg wash. Fold lengthwise one side of the pastry on the other and press with the palm of your hand.?&#7- Chill the pastry roll in the freezer for 15 minutes.?&#8- Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.?&#9- Once the pastry roll has firmed up, use a sharp knife and cut slices about 1/3 inch in thickness.?&#10- Roll each slice in sugar, place it on a baking pan, split the ends, and gently flatten the cookie with your thumb.?&#11- Make sure to keep some space between the cookies as they are going to expand when baking.?&#12- Bake the cookies in the oven.?&#13- Watch the cookies as the ones at the back of the oven cook faster. When the bottom side becomes golden brown, flip the cookies to the other side. Each side will take around 7 minutes to cook.?&#14- Once the cookies become golden brown on both sides, place them on a grid and let them cool down to room temperature before serving.?&#15- You can store the cookies for a few days in an airtight container – but I doubt there would be any left to store!?&#Bonne Appétit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-how-to-make-palmiers-or-elephant-ears-cookies/
1 Easy Tips Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: Mashed Sweet Potatoes Express! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_mashed_sweet_potatoes_express.jpg Ingredients : Directions :?&#?&#1. To make an express mashed sweet potatoes dish, first double wrap the sweet potato in a plastic wrap – You can also use a regular plastic bag.?&#Microwave the sweet potato for 5 minutes. Check if the sweet potato is soft – if not, you can continue microwaving it for another couple of minutes. The cooking time will depend on the size and the quantity of the sweet potatoes you are using.?&#2. Slice the sweet potato in half – be careful, the steam is really hot.?&#Scoop the flesh from the sweet potato and place it in a pan. If you prefer, you can just dice the potato and use it with the skin.?&#On medium heat, mash the potato with some milk. You can use whole milk or fat free milk – whatever you prefer. Just use enough milk to get a creamy consistency. You can also use a little bit of butter for more goodness.?&#Season with salt and pepper… and if you like, a pinch of ground cinnamon. Mix and serve immediately.?&#Hmmmm… this is definitely my favorite snack after a long day of work. Soooo yummy…. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-mashed-sweet-potatoes-express/
1 Easy Salads Feb 23, 2015 Alia’s Tips: Homemade Vinaigrette Recipe! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rsz_homemade_vinaigrette.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#[alia_english]?&#?&#1 tablespoon vinaigre?&#1 teaspoon dijon mustard?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#Salt and pepper to taste?&#?&#[/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#1 ملعقة كبيرة من الخل?&#1 ملعقة صغيرة من خردل الديجون?&#2 ملعقة كبيرة من زيت الزيتون?&#الملح والفلفل حسب الذوق?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] Directions :?&#?&#[alia_english]Step 1: Making the Vinaigrette?&#Quick tip for today: how to make homemade vinaigrette. No need to buy from the store anymore because after this video you will know how to make it yourself!?&#1. In a bowl, add the white vinaigre and the dijon mustard.?&#2. Add salt an pepper. Remember that the vinaigrette needs to be well seasoned because that’s what will give the taste to the unseasoned salad ingredients.?&#3. Wisk all the ingredients.?&#4. Add the olive oil, little by little, while whisking. Your vinaigrette is ready!!!?&#Always make sure you have 1/3 of vinaigre to 2/3 oil (example 1 tablespoon vinaigre and 2 tablespoons oil). you can use different vinaigres, different oils, and add other ingredients like chopped cilantro, parsley, etc. I just showed you the base, but be creative and make it your own![/alia_english]?&#?&#[alia_arabic]?&#?&#الخطوة الأولى: عمل صلصة الخل?&#?&#نصيحة سريعة لهذا اليوم: كيفية عمل صلصة الخل فى المنزل. لاحاجة لشرائها من المتجر بعد الآن لأنه بعد هذا الفيديو سوف تعرف كيفة صنعها بنفسك!?&#احضر وعاء و أضف اليه الخل الأبيض وخردل الديجون.?&#ثم يضاف الملح والفلفل. وتذكر يجب أن يكون الخل متبل جيدا بالملح والفلفل لأن هذا ما سيعطي طعم لمكونات السلطة متبلة.?&#واخفق واضرب جميع المكونات جيدا باستخدام المضرب اليدوى.?&#وقم بإضافة زيت الزيتون، شيئا فشيئا، بينما تستمر فى الخفق وضرب كل المكونات.ولقد اصبحت صلصة الخل جاهزة!!!?&#ودائما تأكد من أنه لديك 1/3 من الخل الابيض على ل2/3 من زيت الزيتون (على سبيل المثال 1 ملعقة كبيرة من الخل الابيض على 2 ملعقتين زيت الزيتون). يمكنك أيضا استخدام خل مختلف، وزيت مختلف وتستطع إضافة مكونات أخرى مثل الكزبرة والبقدونس المقطعين وما إلى ذلك، أنا فقط أوضح لكم قاعدة، ولكن كن مبدعا وأضف عليه من ذوقك!!?&#?&#شهية طيبة!?&#?&#[/alia_arabic] https://www.cookingwithalia.com/alias-tips-homemade-vinaigrette-recipe/
2 people Easy Meat Aug 11, 2019 739- Lamb Testicles Tajine https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/435-TESTICLES.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 beef testicles or 4 lamb testicles?&#1 medium onion, cut into small cubes?&#3 large onions, thinly sliced?&#1 garlic clove, grated?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1/2 teaspoon coriander powder?&#A pinch of saffron threads?&#1/2 teaspoon pepper?&#Pinch of salt?&#40 ml water?&#100 grams raisins?&#1 tablespoon honey Directions :?&#?&#1- Thoroughly clean the lamb testicles. Cut the testicles in half lengthwise then gently peel the outer skin?&#2- Heat the vegetable oil in a pot, over medium-low heat. Add the onion cubes, garlic, and pinch of salt. Stir for 4 minutes then add olive oil.?&#3- Add the testicles and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Handle gently so they don’t break.?&#4- Add the spices: turmeric, ginger, cinnamon, coriander, saffron thread, and pepper. Gently stir. Let cook for 5 minutes and flip the testicles from time to time so that all sides are cooked.?&#5- Add the water, cover the pot, and bring to a boil.?&#6- Once the liquid in the pan starts bubbling, add the finely sliced onions. Place the testicles on top of the finely chopped onions.?&#7- Add honey, cover the pot, and cook for 10 minutes.?&#8- Drain the raisins from the water and add them to the pot. Add the honey and a pinch of cinnamon. Gently stir, cover, and cook for 30-45 minutes until the onions caramelized. While cooking, flip the testicles from time to time, so that all sides are cooked evenly.?&#9- Plate in a serving dish and decorate with toasted sesame seeds. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/739-lamb-testicles-tajine/ 1 hour
10 minutes
Easy Fish Feb 15, 2019 712- Calamari Tagine https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/calamari-tagine-Edited-435.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 pound (500 grams) of calamari (squid), cut into rings?&#2 tomatoes, peeled and grated?&#1/2 onion, chopped?&#4 tablespoon of finely chopped parsley?&#1 (8 oz or 225 grams) can of tomato sauce?&#2 tablespoons of olive oil?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/4 teaspoon of pepper?&#2 teaspoons of paprika Directions :?&#?&#1- To make the sauce, cut the tomatoes in half and grate them using the large holes of the grater. Discard the skin.?&#2- Finely chop the parsley.?&#3- Cut the onion in half, and finely chop it.?&#4- On medium heat, heat up the olive oil for 1 minute. Use the best quality olive oil in this dish because it really affects the taste. Add the chopped onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add the grated tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes.?&#5- Add the tomato sauce, salt, pepper, paprika, and half of the finely chopped parsley. Mix well.?&#6- Cover the pan and let the sauce cook for 5 minutes.?&#7- Add the fresh calamari rings to the sauce. Cover the pan and cook on medium heat for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Check on the calamari from time to time and stir.?&#8- When about 40 minutes of the cooking time has passed add the rest of the chopped parsley and continue cooking until the calamari is done and the sauce becomes thick.?&#9- Serve immediately with crusty bread! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/712-calamari-with-tomato-sauce/ 1 hour
15 4 Easy Meat Aug 17, 2018 685- Caramelized Peaches Tagine https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Tajine_compressed.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Chicken Ingredients:?&#1 kilo (2 pounds) chicken, cut into pieces?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#2 onions, finely chopped?&#2 garlic cloves, grated?&#2 cinnamon sticks?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#Pinch of saffron threads?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro water?&#?&#Peach Ingredients:?&#4 peaches?&#1 cup chicken broth?&#4 tablespoons honey?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#2 tablespoons orange blossom water Directions :?&#?&#Step 1- Cooking the Chicken?&#1- On medium heat, in a large pot, drizzle the vegetable oil and add the butter.?&#2- Once the oil heats up, add the chopped onions, garlic, salt and pepper and let it cook for 2 minutes.?&#3- Add the chicken pieces to the pot and mix. Cover the pot and let the chicken cook for around 5 minutes with the onions until all sides change color.?&#4- After 5 minutes, add saffron, ground ginger, ground turmeric, and the cinnamon sticks, mix and cover the pot for 5 minutes. Then add fresh cilantro, and water to half cover the chicken. Raise the heat to high, cover the pot, and let it cook until the chicken is ready.?&#?&#Step 2- Preparing the Peaches?&#1- Slice the peaches into medium size slices.?&#2- Pour around 1 cup of the chicken sauce in a separate saucepan and place on medium heat.?&#3- Add the honey and ground cinnamon. Mix and simmer for 10 minutes.?&#4- Add the peaches skin-up. Cook them on one side for a few minutes then gently remove them.?&#5-Add the orange blossom water, cook for 1 minute and return back the peaches to the sauce?&#6- Remove the cilantro and cinnamon sticks from the pot, place the chicken in a plate, add the tagine sauce on top and around, then top with the caramelized peaches and decorate with sesame seeds and serve immediately. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/685-caramelized-peaches-tagine/ 35
5 minutes 4 to 7 servings Easy Poultry Feb 23, 2018 643- Chicken Tagine With Caramelized Onions https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/resized_picked-4-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 chicken, cut into pieces?&#2 large onions?&#150 grams (½ cup) raisins, soaked in hot water for 1 hour?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#½ teaspoon pepper?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#½ teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#¼ teaspoon ground turmeric?&#2 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#2 tablespoon honey Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Preparing the ingredients?&#1- Peel the onions and slice them into thin slices.?&#2- Drain the raisins from their soaking water.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking?&#1- Prepare the marinade: in a medium bowl, combine the salt, pepper, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, and ground turmeric. Add a little bit of water and mix well.?&#2- Pour the marinade on the chicken pieces, and rub well until every chicken piece is fully coated.?&#3- Place half of the onion rings in the bottom of the tagine, put the chicken pieces on top, then cover with the rest of the onion rings. Drizzle some vegetable oil and scatter the drained raisins over the chicken.?&#4- Cover the tagine and let it cook on medium-low heat for 1 hour.?&#5- From time to time, pour some of the sauce on top of the chicken. Add a bit of water if necessary.?&#6- When the sauce thickens and the chicken is almost cooked, add the honey. Gently mix the raisins within the sauce. Cover and continue cooking for another 15 minutes.?&#7- Serve hot! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/643-chicken-tagine-caramelized-onions/ 1 hour 15 minutes
20 minutes 4
Meat Oct 15, 2017 596- Tajine of Lamb with Dates https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/IMG_3061_F-002.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 pieces of lamb meat (neck or shoulder)?&#2 onions?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1/2 teaspoon salt, to taste?&#1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste?&#Some saffron threads?&#50 grams butter?&#A bunch of parsley and fresh cilantro?&#250 grams dates?&#125 grams blanched and fried almonds?&#Water Directions :?&#?&#1- Peel the onions and chop them finely.?&#2– In a pan over medium heat, place the olive oil, butter, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, saffron threads, salt and pepper. Add the meat and mix to coat it with the spices.?&#3– Add the onions, parsley, and cilantro and let it simmer while stirring occasionally until the onions become translucent.?&#?&#4- Add the water to the meat, cover and cook for about 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes until the meat is almost cooked.?&#5– 15 minutes before the end of cooking, wash the dates and add them to the pan. Cook for 10 minutes then add the honey, stir gently and cook for 5 minutes until the sauce becomes syrupy and the meat is tender.?&#?&#6- Place the meat on a plate, cover with the sauce, place the dates all around and decorate with the almonds. Serve hot! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/596-tajine-lamb-dates/ 1 hour 30 minutes
10 minutes 2 people Medium Poultry Sep 15, 2017 571- Chicken Tajine with Dried Apricots https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Tagine-Poulet-abricot_IMG_1980.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 to 3 chicken thighs (about 250 grams)?&#1 medium onion, chopped?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of vegetable oil?&#1 teaspoon of smen?&#¼ teaspoon of ground ginger?&#¼ teaspoon of ground turmeric?&#¼ teaspoon of ground cinnamon?&#¼ teaspoon of Ras el hanout?&#¼ teaspoon of salt?&#¼ teaspoon of pepper?&#1 small bunch of parsley and coriander?&#60 ml (2 oz) of water?&#?&#Apricot topping:?&#15 to 20 dried apricots?&#3 tablespoons of powdered sugar?&#1 teaspoon of unsalted butter?&#1 cinnamon stick?&#100 ml (3,4 oz) of water?&#?&#1 tablespoon of toasted sesame seeds or sliced almond Directions :?&#?&#1- In a tajine (or a thick-bottomed frying pan), place the chopped onion, the chicken thighs, the olive oil, the vegetable oil, the smen, the ginger, the turmeric, the cinnamon, Ras El hanout, salt and pepper.?&#?&#2 – Mix together, then add the parsley and coriander bunch.?&#?&#3- Cover the tajine and cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes until the chicken changes color.?&#4- Add 60 ml of water, cover the tajine and continue cooking for about 20 minutes, until the chicken is well cooked. Check the tajine regularly and add water if necessary, there should always be enough liquid for the chicken to cook completely.?&#5- Meanwhile, place the apricots, the sugar, the butter and the cinnamon stick in a saucepan, cover with 100 ml of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes, until the liquid has reduced and thickened.?&#?&#6- Once the chicken is cooked, remove the bunch of herbs from the tajine and garnish it with the caramelized apricots then sprinkle it with the sesame seeds (or slivered almonds). https://www.cookingwithalia.com/571-chicken-tajine-dried-abricots/ 30 minutes
30 minutes 4 Medium Meat Aug 15, 2017 555- Tagine of Meat and Oranges https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Tajine-meat-and-orange.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Meat ingredients:?&#1 kilogram (35.2oz.) of beef or lamb meat?&#1/2 big onion?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#4 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/2 teaspoon ground pepper?&#1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/2 teaspoon ras el hanout?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 cinnamon stick?&#Few saffron threads (optional)?&#2 tablespoons orange juice?&#1 tablespoon sugar (optional)?&#80 ml water?&#?&#Orange ingredients:?&#3 big oranges?&#4 cloves?&#1 Cinnamon stick?&#250 g white granulated sugar?&#water?&#?&#For decoration :?&#25 g toasted sesame seeds Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Cook the Meat:?&#1- Finely chop the onion.?&#2- Heat a tagine over medium heat then add the chopped onion, the meat, and the vegetable oil.?&#3- Sprinkle the meat with salt, ground pepper, ras el hanout, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, turmeric, then add the cinnamon sticks and saffron threads.?&#4- Add the butter and orange juice, then mix well. Cook for few minutes until the onion start caramelizing.?&#5- Add the water and cover the tagine. Let the meat cook.?&#6- Ounce cook, add the sugar.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the oranges:?&#6- Zest 2 oranges and cut each into four pieces, then remove some of the core.?&#7- Put the orange pieces in a pan and cover with cold water, bring the water to a boiling point and let the oranges cook for 15 minutes.?&#8- Drain the oranges from water, then add the cinnamon stick, cloves, and sugar.?&#9- Cover with 250ml water and let it simmer again for about 1 hour to 1 hour and a half, until the oranges have caramelized.?&#10- Turn off the heat and let the cooked oranges cool down.?&#11- Meanwhile, peel a fresh orange and cut it nicely between the membranes, then remove the orange segment.?&#12- Pour the orange syrup from the caramelized oranges over the orange slices.?&#?&#Step 3: Serve the Tajine?&#13- To serve the tagine, first plate the meat, add to it the caramelized oranges, the fresh orange segments, and finish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds on top of the oranges.?&#Serve immediately with crusty bread. Hmmm… delicious.?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/555-tagine-meat-oranges/ 1.5 hour
4 Medium International Recipes Apr 4, 2017 479 – Chicken Tagine with Caramelized Mango https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/rsz_chickentagine1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Chicken Ingredients:?&#?&#1 kg chicken, cut in half?&#?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#?&#2 onions, grated?&#?&#2 garlic cloves?&#?&#2 cinnamon sticks?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#Pinch of saffron threads?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro?&#?&#Mangos Ingredients:?&#?&#2 mangos?&#?&#1/3 cup honey?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#?&#1 teaspoon orange blossom water?&#?&#For Serving:?&#?&#Crusty bread Directions :?&#?&#Step 1- Preparing the ingredients?&#1- First, peel the onions, cut in half and grate them using the large holes of the grater. Finely chop the leftover onion pieces.?&#2- Finely chop the garlic cloves.?&#3- Cut the chicken in half and remove the excess fat.?&#?&#Step 2- Cooking the Chicken?&#4- On medium heat, in a large pot, drizzle the vegetable oil and add the butter.?&#5- Once the oil heats up, add the grated onions, chopped garlic, pinch of saffron and the spices: ground ginger, ground turmeric, pepper, salt, and a cinnamon stick. Mix and cook for a few minutes.?&#6- Add the chicken pieces to the pot and mix.?&#7- Cover the pot and let the chicken cook for around 5 minutes with the onions and spices until all sides change color. This way the spices and flavors are locked in the meat.?&#8- After 5 minutes, add the fresh cilantro, add water to half cover the chicken. Raise the heat to high, cover the pot, and bring to a boil.?&#9- After 15 minutes of cooking the chicken, lower the heat to medium-high and keep cooking for another 20 minutes or so until the chicken is tender.?&#?&#Step 3- Preparing the Mangos?&#10- Peel and slice the mangos into big slices.?&#11- Pour around 1 cup of the chicken sauce in a separate saucepan and place on medium heat, .?&#12- Add the honey and ground cinnamon. Mix and simmer for 10 minutes.?&#13- Add the mango pieces.?&#14- Cook the mango pieces on one side for a few minutes then gently turn them over and cook the other side for a few minutes untill both sides are caramelized.?&#15- Finish with a teaspoon of Orange Blossom Water. Cook for a few minutes then turn of the heat.?&#?&#Step 4- Serve the Tagine:?&#16- Check that the chicken tagine is ready, the chicken should be tender. Taste the sauce and adjust the spices accordingly.?&#17- To serve this tagine, first place the chicken in a plate, add the tagine sauce, then top with the caramelized mangoes. And of course, don’t forget to add some of that delicious honey mango sauce. Decorate with a little bit of sesame seeds, and serve immediately with crusty bread.?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/479-chicken-tagine-caramelized-mango/

10 minutes 2 people Medium Poultry Sep 15, 2017 571- Chicken Tajine with Dried Apricots https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Tagine-Poulet-abricot_IMG_1980.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 to 3 chicken thighs (about 250 grams)?&#1 medium onion, chopped?&#1 tablespoon of olive oil?&#1 tablespoon of vegetable oil?&#1 teaspoon of smen?&#¼ teaspoon of ground ginger?&#¼ teaspoon of ground turmeric?&#¼ teaspoon of ground cinnamon?&#¼ teaspoon of Ras el hanout?&#¼ teaspoon of salt?&#¼ teaspoon of pepper?&#1 small bunch of parsley and coriander?&#60 ml (2 oz) of water?&#?&#Apricot topping:?&#15 to 20 dried apricots?&#3 tablespoons of powdered sugar?&#1 teaspoon of unsalted butter?&#1 cinnamon stick?&#100 ml (3,4 oz) of water?&#?&#1 tablespoon of toasted sesame seeds or sliced almond Directions :?&#?&#1- In a tajine (or a thick-bottomed frying pan), place the chopped onion, the chicken thighs, the olive oil, the vegetable oil, the smen, the ginger, the turmeric, the cinnamon, Ras El hanout, salt and pepper.?&#?&#2 – Mix together, then add the parsley and coriander bunch.?&#?&#3- Cover the tajine and cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes until the chicken changes color.?&#4- Add 60 ml of water, cover the tajine and continue cooking for about 20 minutes, until the chicken is well cooked. Check the tajine regularly and add water if necessary, there should always be enough liquid for the chicken to cook completely.?&#5- Meanwhile, place the apricots, the sugar, the butter and the cinnamon stick in a saucepan, cover with 100 ml of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes, until the liquid has reduced and thickened.?&#?&#6- Once the chicken is cooked, remove the bunch of herbs from the tajine and garnish it with the caramelized apricots then sprinkle it with the sesame seeds (or slivered almonds). https://www.cookingwithalia.com/571-chicken-tajine-dried-abricots/ 30 minutes
30 minutes 4 Medium Meat Aug 15, 2017 555- Tagine of Meat and Oranges https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Tajine-meat-and-orange.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Meat ingredients:?&#1 kilogram (35.2oz.) of beef or lamb meat?&#1/2 big onion?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#4 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#1 teaspoon of salt?&#1/2 teaspoon ground pepper?&#1/2 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/2 teaspoon ras el hanout?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 cinnamon stick?&#Few saffron threads (optional)?&#2 tablespoons orange juice?&#1 tablespoon sugar (optional)?&#80 ml water?&#?&#Orange ingredients:?&#3 big oranges?&#4 cloves?&#1 Cinnamon stick?&#250 g white granulated sugar?&#water?&#?&#For decoration :?&#25 g toasted sesame seeds Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Cook the Meat:?&#1- Finely chop the onion.?&#2- Heat a tagine over medium heat then add the chopped onion, the meat, and the vegetable oil.?&#3- Sprinkle the meat with salt, ground pepper, ras el hanout, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, turmeric, then add the cinnamon sticks and saffron threads.?&#4- Add the butter and orange juice, then mix well. Cook for few minutes until the onion start caramelizing.?&#5- Add the water and cover the tagine. Let the meat cook.?&#6- Ounce cook, add the sugar.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the oranges:?&#6- Zest 2 oranges and cut each into four pieces, then remove some of the core.?&#7- Put the orange pieces in a pan and cover with cold water, bring the water to a boiling point and let the oranges cook for 15 minutes.?&#8- Drain the oranges from water, then add the cinnamon stick, cloves, and sugar.?&#9- Cover with 250ml water and let it simmer again for about 1 hour to 1 hour and a half, until the oranges have caramelized.?&#10- Turn off the heat and let the cooked oranges cool down.?&#11- Meanwhile, peel a fresh orange and cut it nicely between the membranes, then remove the orange segment.?&#12- Pour the orange syrup from the caramelized oranges over the orange slices.?&#?&#Step 3: Serve the Tajine?&#13- To serve the tagine, first plate the meat, add to it the caramelized oranges, the fresh orange segments, and finish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds on top of the oranges.?&#Serve immediately with crusty bread. Hmmm… delicious.?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/555-tagine-meat-oranges/ 1.5 hour
4 Medium International Recipes Apr 4, 2017 479 – Chicken Tagine with Caramelized Mango https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/rsz_chickentagine1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Chicken Ingredients:?&#?&#1 kg chicken, cut in half?&#?&#2 tablespoons vegetable oil?&#?&#1 tablespoon butter?&#?&#2 onions, grated?&#?&#2 garlic cloves?&#?&#2 cinnamon sticks?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#Pinch of saffron threads?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#A small bunch of fresh cilantro?&#?&#Mangos Ingredients:?&#?&#2 mangos?&#?&#1/3 cup honey?&#?&#1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#?&#1 teaspoon orange blossom water?&#?&#For Serving:?&#?&#Crusty bread Directions :?&#?&#Step 1- Preparing the ingredients?&#1- First, peel the onions, cut in half and grate them using the large holes of the grater. Finely chop the leftover onion pieces.?&#2- Finely chop the garlic cloves.?&#3- Cut the chicken in half and remove the excess fat.?&#?&#Step 2- Cooking the Chicken?&#4- On medium heat, in a large pot, drizzle the vegetable oil and add the butter.?&#5- Once the oil heats up, add the grated onions, chopped garlic, pinch of saffron and the spices: ground ginger, ground turmeric, pepper, salt, and a cinnamon stick. Mix and cook for a few minutes.?&#6- Add the chicken pieces to the pot and mix.?&#7- Cover the pot and let the chicken cook for around 5 minutes with the onions and spices until all sides change color. This way the spices and flavors are locked in the meat.?&#8- After 5 minutes, add the fresh cilantro, add water to half cover the chicken. Raise the heat to high, cover the pot, and bring to a boil.?&#9- After 15 minutes of cooking the chicken, lower the heat to medium-high and keep cooking for another 20 minutes or so until the chicken is tender.?&#?&#Step 3- Preparing the Mangos?&#10- Peel and slice the mangos into big slices.?&#11- Pour around 1 cup of the chicken sauce in a separate saucepan and place on medium heat, .?&#12- Add the honey and ground cinnamon. Mix and simmer for 10 minutes.?&#13- Add the mango pieces.?&#14- Cook the mango pieces on one side for a few minutes then gently turn them over and cook the other side for a few minutes untill both sides are caramelized.?&#15- Finish with a teaspoon of Orange Blossom Water. Cook for a few minutes then turn of the heat.?&#?&#Step 4- Serve the Tagine:?&#16- Check that the chicken tagine is ready, the chicken should be tender. Taste the sauce and adjust the spices accordingly.?&#17- To serve this tagine, first place the chicken in a plate, add the tagine sauce, then top with the caramelized mangoes. And of course, don’t forget to add some of that delicious honey mango sauce. Decorate with a little bit of sesame seeds, and serve immediately with crusty bread.?&#Bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/479-chicken-tagine-caramelized-mango/
4 Meduim Meat Dec 31, 2016 464 – Okra Beef Tagine https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/rsz_okratagine.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#350 grams okra (lady fingers)?&#?&#500 grams chuck tender beef?&#?&#1 large tomato, grated?&#?&#1 medium sized onion?&#?&#1 garlic clove?&#?&#A medium bunch of parsley?&#?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#?&#1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#?&#A pinch of saffron threads (optional)?&#?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#?&#1 tablespoon tomato paste?&#?&#3 tablespoons olive oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#– Finely chop the onion, grate the garlic clove, grate the tomato, and finely chop the parsley.?&#?&#Step 2: Cooking the Meat?&#1- On medium heat, in a large pot, add the olive oil. Once hot, add the chopped onion and garlic. Mix and cook for two minutes.?&#2- Add the spices: ground ginger, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Mix and continue cooking for another 3 minutes.?&#3- Place the meat pieces in the pot and mix with the onions. Cook the meat from both sides, for around 5 minutes.?&#4- Add the grated tomato and the chopped parsley. Mix.?&#5- Cover the pot and continue cooking the meat for another 5 minutes so it absorbs all the flavors.?&#6- Now cover the meat with water, increase the heat to medium high, cover the pot, and cook the meat for about 1 hour and 15 minutes.?&#7- Check on the meat from time to time, stir, and add water if necessary until the meat is almost cooked and becomes tender.?&#8- When the meat is almost done, add the tomato paste to the sauce. Mix and cook for another 10 minutes until the meat is done.?&#?&#Step 3: Preparing the Okra?&#1- Clean the okra, Cut the small tip from top and carefully remove the sides without making any cuts, then with a knife scrape the tiny hairs from the okra skin.?&#2- Wash the okra in water.?&#3- Add the okra to the pot. Cover the pot and let the okra cook with the meat and the sauce for around 10 minutes or until the okra becomes soft.?&#4- Serve this tagine immediately with some chopped parsley on top for extra flavor.?&#bon appetit! https://www.cookingwithalia.com/464-okra-beef-tagine/ 2 hours
Tajines Aug 16, 2016 450 – blog – Top 10 Moroccan tagines https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/rsz_1tagine_plates.jpg Ingredients : Directions :?&#?&#Top 10 Moroccan tagines:?&#?&#Moroccan cuisine is known for its numerous tagine dishes. Tagine is the name of the clay pot where the food, usually a protein (chicken, meat, fish) and a vegetable or fruit topping (potatoes, carrots, dried prunes, dried apricots, etc.), is slow-cooked in a flavorful sauce.?&#?&#Below are my favorite Moroccan tagines! Make sure to try them when you visit Morocco, or follow my step-by-step video recipes and make them at home!?&#?&# ?&#?&#1- Beef Tagine with Prunes?&#?&#Beef Tagine with Prunes is a classic Moroccan dish of meat topped with dried prunes cooked in a honey sauce. Sweet and savoury flavors are highly appreciated in Moroccan cuisine and this dish is the best representation of it. It is usually served in special occasions like weddings but is also often prepared at home especially when you have family and friends over.?&#?&#2- Chicken Tagine with Preserved Lemons?&#?&#Preserved lemons are a staple Moroccan ingredient; they are usually used in salads or tagines… Chicken tagine with preserved lemons is one of the most delicious tagines in Moroccan cuisine and it really showcases the unique flavor of this condiment. This tagine is sometimes topped with french fries… the perfect topping!?&#?&#3- Tagine of Meatballs and Eggs?&#?&#Meatballs and eggs tagine is a must on a Moroccan sunday brunch! It’s one of the quickest and easiest tagines to make, that’s maybe the reason why this tagine is mostly prepared by single men in Morocco! It’s the bachelor’s tagine!!?&#?&#4- Mrouzia?&#?&#M’rouzia is a sweet lamb tagine that is usually prepared the second day of Eid Al-Adha (lamb feast). The rich flavors of the sweet and savory are enhanced with Ras-El-hanout, the Moroccan spice mix that contains more than 20 spices!?&#?&#5- Fish Tagine With Vegetables?&#?&#This is a wonderful classic Moroccan fish recipe that is easy, yummy, and healthy! The fish and vegetables are first marinated in ‘Charmoula’, the famous Moroccan marinade, then slow-cooked. So delicious!?&#?&#6 – Beef Tagine with Green Peas?&#?&#This tagine is often prepared during winter when green peas are in season. It is also paired with fresh artichoke hearts when available. Moroccans often prepare this dish at home for regular lunches and dinner!?&#?&#7- Tagine Sardine Kefta?&#?&#Sardines are the main fish in Morocco and are highly appreciated grilled, fried, or in kefta (ground meat) format! Moroccans love this tagine, especially during the hot summer days, as it is easy to make and you can not beat the taste of sardine kefta balls with flavorful tomato sauce!?&#?&#8 – Berber Vegetable Tagine?&#?&#People do not think of tagines as a vegetarian meal option, but the Berber Vegetable Tagine is a Moroccan staple dish. Not everyone can afford to purchase meat; however, this does not stop them from making a delicious tagine with available vegetables and charmoula sauce. The colors and flavors of this tagine will make you want to become vegetarian!?&#?&#9 – Chicken Tagine with Apricots?&#?&#This tagine is the chicken version of the Meat with Prunes tagine. Moroccan prepare to pair the delicate sweet dried apricot taste with chicken. Another successful showcase of the sweet and savory characteristic of Moroccan cuisine!?&#?&#10- And you, what is YOUR FAVORITE tagine that is not in this list? https://www.cookingwithalia.com/450-blog-top-10-moroccan-tagines/
20 minutes 4 Medium Fish Jul 28, 2016 448 – Fish Tagine with Onions and Raisins https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/rsz_1img_7170cr2.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#1 kilo white fish chunks (for example, Conger)?&#3 large onions?&#1/2 cup raisins?&#2 teaspoons ground ginger?&#1 teaspoon ground turmeric?&#1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1/2 teaspoon smen (or butter)?&#Large pinch of saffron threads?&#2 cinnamon stick?&#Small fresh cilantro bunch?&#2 tablespoons olive oil?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients?&#1- Peel the onions. Cut in half and slice thinly.?&#2- Let the saffron threads soak in a bit of warm water.?&#?&#Step 2: Mixing and Cooking?&#1- In a large bowl, place the white fish. Add the saffron water and saffron threads soaking in it, ground turmeric, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, salt, smen (or butter), cinnamon sticks, vegetable oil, olive oil, the sliced onions, and raisins. Mix all the ingredients together.?&#2- In a deep saucepan, place the onions first then place the fish slices on top of the onion bed. Add the cilantro bunch.?&#3- Cover and cook on medium heat for 40 minutes or until the onions are soft and the fish is done.?&#4- Serve hot with crusty bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/448-fish-tagine-onions-raisins/ 40 minutes
30 minutes 4 Medium Fish Jul 21, 2016 447 – Tagine Sardine Kefta https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/rsz_taginesardine-1.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Sardine Kefta Ingredients:?&#?&#1 kilo sardine kefta?&#2 garlic cloves, crushed?&#1 teaspoon ground paprika?&#1 teaspoon ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon red chilli pepper powder (to taste)?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#?&#Ingredients for the Tomato Base:?&#?&#3 tomatoes, grated?&#3 garlic cloves, crushed?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro?&#2 tablespoons canned tomato paste?&#2 teaspoons ground paprika?&#2 teaspoons ground cumin?&#1/2 teaspoon red chilli pepper powder (to taste)?&#Salt and pepper (to taste)?&#3 tablespoons olive oil?&#?&#For decoration :?&#?&#1/2 preserved lemon?&#A handful of green olives Directions :?&#?&#Step 1: Prepare the Sardine Kefta?&#1- In a large bowl combine the sardine kefta (ground sardines), pepper, salt, ground paprika, ground cumin, chili pepper powder, crushed garlic, lemon juice, finely chopped parsley, and finely chopped cilantro. Mix all the ingredients together.?&#?&#Step 2: Prepare the Tomato Sauce?&#1- Cut the tomatoes in half, and grate the pulp using the large holes of the grater. Discard the skin.?&#2- In a large bowl, combine the grated tomato pulp, pepper, salt, ground paprika, ground cumin, red chili pepper powder, crushed garlic, tomato paste, finely chopped parsley, finely chopped cilantro, and olive oil. Mix all the ingredients.?&#?&#Step 3: Prepare the Tagine?&#1- Slice the onion into thin slices.?&#2- Place the onion slices in the tagine plate over medium heat.?&#3- Cover the onions slices with half of the tomato sauce.?&#4- Roll the sardine kefta into balls the size of a walnut and place them on top of the tomato sauce.?&#5- Gently, using a spoon, pour the rest of the tomato sauce over the sardine balls.?&#6- Cover the tagine and cook, on medium-low heat, for around 30-40 minutes or until the sardine balls are done.?&#?&#Step 4: Final Touches?&#1- Cut the preserved lemon into thin slices.?&#2- Once the tagine is cooked and the sardine balls are done, top them with the preserved lemon slices and add the green olives to the sauce.?&#3- Cover the tagine and continue cooking for another 3 minutes for the citrus flavors to combine with the sauce.?&#4- Serve the tagine immediately, hot, with crusty bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/447-tagine-sardine-kefta/ 30 minutes
2 Meduim Tajines Jun 29, 2016 442 – Berber Vegetable Tagine https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/rsz_1tagine_berbereimg_1949tif.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#Vegetables:?&#?&#½ onion?&#1 medium red-ripe tomato?&#1 small carrot?&#1 small turnip?&#1 small zucchini?&#1 small potato?&#½ red bell pepper?&#100 grams (3.5 oz.) green beans?&#2 small cauliflower florets?&#A handful of green peas, shelled?&#?&#Marinade:?&#?&#1 teaspoon paprika?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#½ teaspoon ground turmeric?&#¼ teaspoon ground cumin?&#Salt and pepper, to taste?&#1 tablespoon finely chopped flat-leaf parsley?&#1 garlic clove, crushed?&#1 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#1 tablespoon olive oil?&#4 tablespoons water Directions :?&#?&#1- Prepare the vegetables:?&#Onion: finely chop?&#Tomato: peel, seed, and finely chop?&#Carrot: peel, cut in half, slice each half lengthwise, remove and discard the core, then slice each quarter into medium strips?&#Turnip: peel, slice in half lengthwise, then slice into medium strips?&#Potato: peel and cut into quarters?&#Zucchini: trim ends and cut into quarters?&#Red bell pepper: trim ends, seed, and slice into medium strips?&#Green beans: trim ends and cut into medium strips?&#2- To make the spice marinade, combine all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and mix well.?&#3- Place the chopped onion and tomato in the tagine plate. Add 2 tablespoons of the spice marinade, mix, cover the tagine and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes until the onion and tomato melt into a thick sauce.?&#4- Nicely display the vegetables in the tagine, starting with the vegetables that take the longest to cook (carrot, turnip, potato) then leaving at the top the ones that take less time to cook (zucchini, cauliflower, red bell pepper, green beans, and green peas).?&#5- Pour the spice marinade all over the vegetables.?&#6- Cover the tagine and cook on medium heat for 45 minutes. From time to time check on the vegetables to make sure that there is enough liquid in the tagine. Add water if necessary, but only small amounts at a time. Also, occasionally, take some of the sauce in the tagine and baste it over the vegetables so that those placed on top absorb the marinade flavors.?&#7- Serve hot with crusty bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/442-berber-vegetable-tagine/

Note that there is no salt in this recipe due to the saltiness of the preserved lemon pulp.?&#2- Cover the tagine and cook on medium heat for a few minutes until the chicken changes color.?&#3- Add 1/4 cup (60 ml) of boiling water, cover the tagine, and continue cooking for around 20 minutes or until the chicken is done. Check on the tagine from time to time and add water if necessary; there should always be enough liquid for the chicken to fully cook.?&#4- Once the chicken is done, add the green olives to the sauce and top the chicken with the preserved lemon rind. Cover and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.?&#5- Serve immediately with crusty bread. https://www.cookingwithalia.com/441-tagine-chicken-w-preserved-lemon/

Medium Meat Apr 4, 2016 420 – Meat Base For Sweet Tagines https://www.cookingwithalia.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/rsz_413_-_tagine_meat_prunes.jpg Ingredients :?&#?&#2 pounds (1 kilo) tender beef or lamb?&#2 tablespoon vegetable oil?&#2 onions (grated)?&#2 garlic cloves (crushed)?&#1 teaspoon ground ginger?&#1/2 teaspoon ground Turmeric?&#1 teaspoon salt?&#1/2 teaspoon black pepper?&#1 cinnamon stick?&#A pinch of ras el hanout (optional)?&#1 tablespoon saffron water (large pinch of saffron + 1/4 cup water) Directions :?&#?&#A- Preparing the ingredients?&#1- First, soak the saffron threads in some warm water for 10 minutes.?&#2- Grate the garlic cloves?&#3- Cut the onions in half and grate them using the large holes of the grater. Chop the leftover onion pieces.?&#?&#B- Cooking the Meat?&#4- On low heat, in a large pot, drizzle the vegetable oil.?&#5- Add the onions, garlic, ground ginger, turmeric, pepper, salt, a pinch of Ras El Hanout, and a cinnamon stick.
